Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one end-January LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the southern province of Rayong. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Australia overtakes Qatar as world’s top LNG exporter in 2021
Description: Australia exported slightly more LNG in 2021 than a year earlier, enabling it to overtake Qatar as the world’s largest LNG exporter despite planned maintenance and production issues at several of its plants during the year.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one end-January to second-half February LNG cargo
Description: Angola LNG is offering one cargo for delivery between end-January and the second half of February from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant through a tender that closes on Jan. 12. Bids are expected to remain valid until a day after the tender closes.
Author: CK

Title: Australian LNG plants offer late February-early March cargoes
Description: The Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory will issue a tender tomorrow to offer one LNG cargo that will load at the terminal on Feb. 12-17 and can be delivered within northeast Asia on Feb. 19-29. The tender will close on Jan. 13,
Author: CK

Title: PNG LNG offers one second-half February LNG cargo
Description: PNG LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo for delivery to northeast Asia between Feb. 17 and 22 from the ExxonMobil-operated 8.3 mtpa plant in Papua New Guinea. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: China’s ENN and Zhejiang Energy agree to buy LNG term supply from Novatek’s Arctic LNG 2
Description: Chinese energy firms ENN and Zhejiang Energy have signed term supply agreements with Novatek to buy LNG from the Russian independent firm’s Arctic LNG 2 project in the Gydan peninsula
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC offers one March cargo from North West Shelf LNG
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on March 3-5 from the Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf (NWS) LNG plant in Western Australia. The tender closes on Jan. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Japanese LNG buyers face a few cargo cancellations from delays to first gas from Pegaga
Description: A few Japanese buyers could seek replacement LNG cargoes for cancelled term deliveries from the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility this month and in March, following delays to the installation of a temporary mercury removal unit at the Pegaga gas field offshore Sarawak and a push back in the production of gas that will feed Bintulu.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more January-February LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy four more LNG cargoes for delivery across January and February to its 11.5 mtpa Map ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong province. The tender closes on Jan. 14.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron to shut Gorgon Train 2 for maintenance and piping repairs
Description: Chevron will take offline the second train of its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant on Barrow Island, Western Australia this week to conduct maintenance and undertake piping repairs.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks two February LNG cargoes
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. (RPGCL) is seeking two cargoes, with one each for delivery on Feb 13-14 and Feb. 20. The cargoes are for delivery to either of the country’s two LNG import terminals, the 3.8 mtpa Summit LNG floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) or the 3.8 mtpa Moheshkhali LNG FSRU. RPGCL’s tender closes on Jan. 23.
Author: CK

Title: Europe to import first Oman LNG cargo in Jan since 2015 after first Indonesia LNG receipt
Description: The 147,000m3 Salalah LNG tanker is making its way towards Europe to deliver the first LNG cargo from Oman’s 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG plant in seven years, contributing to the highest number of imports in January that Europe will receive in a month.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers second LNG cargo loading in February
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell a second cargo that will load in February at the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port. The tender closes on Jan. 19, with bid validity until a day later.
Author: CK

Title: BHP offers one cargo loading in 2H March from North West Shelf LNG
Description: UK-Australian resources firm BHP is offering one cargo that will load on March 16-18 at the Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf (NWS) LNG plant in Australia through a tender that closes on Jan. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Sinopec offers up to 45 February to October LNG cargoes
Description: China’s state-owned Sinopec has issued a tender to sell up to 45 LNG cargoes for delivery between February and October. The tender closes on Jan. 21.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs initial supply deal with Commonwealth LNG for 2 mtpa over 20 years
Description: The Singapore trading arm of Australia’s Woodside Energy has signed an initial non-binding agreement with Commonwealth LNG to buy 2 mtpa over 20 years from the proposed 8.4 mtpa Commonwealth LNG export facility in the US. Supply from the plant in Cameron, Louisiana, is scheduled to begin from the second quarter of 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Japan LNG mid-January stocks fall to lowest levels since end-November
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities fell in mid-January to their lowest level since the end of November but continued to hold above the four-year average for each month between November and January.
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC issues tender to sell May to November LNG cargoes
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC is offering an unspecified number of cargoes for delivery between May and November through a tender closing on Jan. 21, making it the second Chinese LNG importer to offer cargoes in as many days.
Author: CK

Title: Gorgon Train 2 to restart later than expected as maintenance work continues
Description: Chevron expects to restart the second train of its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant on Barrow Island in Western Australia “in the coming weeks” as it continues maintenance work on the train.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen to issue tender for five-year LNG term supply between 2023-2027
Description: Philippines’ power generation firm First Gen is planning to issue a tender soon to secure LNG term supply from 2023-2027 ahead of the scheduled start of its 5.26 mtpa Batangas LNG import terminal later this year.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy February to April LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy an unspecified number of cargoes for delivery across February to April to its 11.5 mtpa May Ta Phut LNG terminal in Thailand’s southern Rayong province, The tender closes on Jan. 26.
Author: CK

Title: China's Sinopec may offer LNG cargoes unsold from recent tender
Description: China’s state-owned Sinopec may enter into bilateral discussions to sell the unsold cargoes from its recently closed tender for up to 45 LNG cargoes for delivery between February and October.
Author: CK

Title: Asian buyers hope for LNG term supply security amid rising geopolitical tensions in Europe
Description: A steep rise in European gas and Asian LNG prices Monday driven by heightening tensions between Russia and Ukraine has led to fervent hopes among Asian LNG buyers that their long-term contracts and production within Asia-Pacific will meet their needs.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG loadings seen rising to their highest level this week; more shipments to Asia
Description:
LNG loadings at the six LNG liquefaction plants in the US are poised to climb to their highest level this week, surpassing their previous high five weeks earlier as elevated European gas prices continue to draw cargoes to Europe.
But, this is the first time in 10 weeks that scheduled weekly shipments from the US to Asia could outpace those to Europe, Kpler data show.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks fall further as colder weather increases consumption
Description: Weekly LNG stock levels held by Japanese power utilities fell further as colder weather increased LNG consumption. But they remained above the four-year average for January and January 2021.
Author: CK

Title: Two LNG tankers head to Kaliningrad as Russia-Ukraine tensions mount
Description: The 174,100 m3 Marshal Vasilevskiy and the 174,300 m3 Energy Integrity LNG tankers have signalled their arrival at the 1.89 mtpa LNG receiving terminal in the Russian province of Kaliningrad between the end of January and early February as tensions between Russia and Ukraine have intensified in recent days.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Foran Energy signs five-year pipeline gas supply deal with CNOOC
Description: Chinese gas distributor Foran Energy has agreed a deal with state-owned CNOOC to buy pipeline gas over a five-year term from 2022 to 2026 to diversify its gas supply sources and enhance its supply security.
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC signs five-year LNG term supply deal with 12 Guangdong gas firms
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC has signed a five-year term deal to supply a total of 10 mt, or 2 mtpa, of LNG to 12 Guangdong gas firms starting this year.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s end-January LNG stocks dip to a six-week low, at four-year average levels
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities at the end of January dipped from a week earlier to a six-week low, falling to the same level as the four year-average for January, according to data released by Japan’s Agency for Natural Resources and Energy.
Author: CK

Title: Kaliningrad receives one LNG cargo
Description: The Gazprom-owned 174,100 m3 Marshal Vasilevskiy LNG tanker has discharged its cargo at the 1.89 mtpa Kaliningrad LNG receiving facility after eight days of circling in the Baltic Sea outside Kaliningrad.
Author: CK

Title: Komipo issues tender to buy one mid-March LNG cargo
Description: Korean power generation firm Korean Midland Power, or Komipo, has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Mar. 14-17. The tender closes on Feb. 9.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports reach an all-time high in January, Europe is main beneficiary
Description: US LNG exports reached an all-time high in January, with Europe the main beneficiary of the country's increased shipments for the third consecutive month.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom, CNPC sign deal for more Russian pipeline gas supplies to China
Description: Gazprom has signed a deal with state-owned China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) to supply 10 bn m3 a year of gas from Russia’s far east to China, adding to an existing long-term supply agreement for gas deliveries through the Power of Siberia 1 (PoS1) pipeline.
Author: CK

Title: Gorgon’s Train 2 resumes LNG production following maintenance
Description: The second train of the Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant on Barrow Island in Western Australia has restarted production after a shutdown around mid-January for maintenance and to undertake piping repairs.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT, India’s Gail seek March LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT and India’s state-owned Gail are seeking cargoes for delivery in March through separate tenders closing on Feb. 8
Author: CK

Title: LNG cargo loadings at Sabine Pass set to rise as Train 6 gets export approval
Description: Cargo loadings at the Cheniere-operated Sabine Pass LNG plant in Louisiana in the US are expected to rise this week to match their recent highest levels, following regulatory authorization for the plant’s newest sixth train to begin exports.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass awaits approval to load first LNG commissioning cargo by Feb. 9
Description: The Venture Global-operated 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant looks poised to export its first LNG cargo this week, with it seeking written authorization from the energy regulator before Feb. 9 to load its first LNG commissioning cargo on or after that date.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship Yiannis docks at Calcasieu Pass to load first commissioning cargo for export
Description: The 174,000 m3 Yiannis LNG tanker has docked at Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG export plant in Louisiana, in the US, to load the new plant’s first commissioning cargo for export.
Author: CK

Title: Train 6 at Sabine Pass completes commissioning; control handed over to Cheniere
Description: The sixth train of US LNG producer Cheniere’s Sabine Pass LNG export facility in Louisiana has completed its commissioning process, with control handed over from engineering partner Bechtel to Cheniere.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas issues tender to buy February-March LNG cargoes
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas has issued a tender to buy an unspecified number of cargoes for delivery across the second-half of February and the first-half of March to its LNG receiving terminals in Korea. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC seeks one first-half March LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum is seeking one cargo for delivery on Mar. 1-10 to its 5 mtpa Mundra LNG receiving terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass gets regulatory nod to commission Trains 7 and 8
Description: US project developer Venture Global has received authorization from the energy regulator to begin commissioning the block 4 liquefaction modules of its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant that comprise the seventh and eight LNG trains.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks dip further on colder weather, LNG production issues
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities fell further at the end of the first week of February as colder weather fuelled an increase in LNG consumption, while recent LNG production issues at various LNG plants may have reduced term deliveries to the country.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers 11 cargoes for delivery between August 2022 and December 2023
Description: Angola LNG is offering 11 cargoes for delivery between August this year and December 2023 from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG facility through a tender closing on Mar. 7.
Author: CK

Title: Tangguh’s LNG loadings seen falling in February as planned maintenance cuts exports
Description: LNG cargo loadings at the BP-operated 7.6 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s West Papua province look set to fall this month due to a 33-day planned maintenance on the first of the plant’s two LNG trains.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s offer of LNG supply support to Europe draws concern amid falling stock levels
Description: Japan’s agreement to supply Europe with LNG cargoes to help alleviate any supply shortages that might arise as tensions escalate between Russia and Ukraine has drawn concern among Japanese buyers as the country’s LNG stock levels have fallen to their lowest levels this winter.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks six April-September LNG cargoes for India as part of a location-swap tender
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail has issued a tender to buy six cargoes for delivery between April and September to India, while offering to sell the same number of cargoes on a free-on-board (FOB) basis that will load in the same months from the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG plant in the US. The tender closes on Feb. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Kaliningrad to receive second LNG cargo this month amid escalating Russia-Ukraine conflict
Description: The Gazprom-chartered 174,300 m3 Energy Integrity LNG tanker is due to arrive at Kaliningrad’s 1.89 mtpa LNG receiving facility today to deliver the Russian province’s second LNG cargo this month, nine days after the Gazprom-owned 174,100 m3 Marshal Vasilevskiy LNG tanker arrived at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks more February-March LNG cargoes
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas is seeking an unspecified number of cargoes for delivery across Feb. 20 to Mar. 10 to its LNG receiving terminals in Korea through a tender closing on Feb. 16. The tender comes swiftly after Kogas closed an earlier tender to buy an unspecified number of cargoes across the same delivery dates.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG issues tender to sell one April LNG cargo
Description: Oman LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo for delivery in April from its 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG export facility through a tender that closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Loading still underway at Calcasieu Pass following export approval for LNG commissioning cargoes
Description: Loading of the first LNG commissioning cargo at the Venture Global-operated 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG terminal in the US is still underway, following  export approval from the energy regulator
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC issues tender to buy one first-half March LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum (GSPC) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Mar. 1-15 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers one LNG cargo loading in late March
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Mar. 22 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG facility at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port. The tender closes on Feb. 17.
Author: CK

Title: APLNG offers March LNG cargo; seeks ship for DES cargo sale option
Description: Australia Pacific LNG (APLNG) is offering one cargo on a free-on-board (FOB) or delivered ex-ship (DES) basis that will load on Mar. 29-30 at its 9 mtpa plant in Queensland  through a tender closing on Feb. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT, Taiwan’s CPC seek April LNG cargoes as April spot supplies emerge
Description: Taiwan’s state-owned CPC and Thailand’s state-owned PTT are both seeking April cargoes through tenders closing today and on Feb. 17, respectively.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks rise to a four-week high despite colder weather
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities bounced to a four-week high despite colder-than-normal weather last week, after dipping for six consecutive weeks.
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC reissues tender to buy first-half March LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum (GSPC) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Mar. 1-15 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat that closes tomorrow. This is a reissuance of a tender that GSPC closed yesterday without awarding
Author: CK

Title: Korea’s energy supply adequate for short-term; worsening Russia-Ukraine conflict eyed
Description: Korea’s ministry of trade, industry and energy (MOTIE) says the country has secured sufficient short-term supplies of energy through long-term contracts amid elevated international energy prices, as part of its preparations to mitigate risks related to a continued escalation in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks one first-half March LNG cargo
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. (RPGCL) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Mar. 12-13 to either of the country’s two LNG receiving terminals, the 3.8 mtpa Summit LNG floating storage and regasification unit or the 3.8 mtpa Moheshkhali FSRU. The tender closes on Feb. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan seeks two first-half March LNG through first tender for the year
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy two cargoes for delivery on Mar. 2-3 and 10-11 to its Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim. The tender closes on Feb. 22 and is the firm’s first for the year since it closed its last tender on Nov. 5.
Author: CK

Title: Angola, Bontang offer March-April LNG cargoes
Description: Angola LNG and Indonesia’s state-owned Pertamina are each offering cargoes for delivery across March and April through tenders closing on Feb. 23.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas issues third tender seeking March LNG cargoes
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas has issued a tender to buy an unspecified number of cargoes for delivery across Mar. 1-31, making this the third tender in around two weeks that the firm has issued to buy March cargoes. The new tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Two LNG trains not under unplanned maintenance: Qatargas
Description: Qatargas says that two of its 14 LNG trains at the 77 mtpa Ras Laffan export facility are not offline due to unplanned maintenance, clarifying media reports that had suggested this.
Author: CK

Title: One LNG ship heads to Kaliningrad while another circles outside the terminal
Description: The 170,200 m3 Velikiy Novgorod LNG tanker is expected to head towards Kaliningrad to deliver what could be the Russian exclave’s third LNG cargo this year, even as another LNG tanker has circled for over two weeks in the Baltic Sea waiting to berth at the 1.89 mtpa Kaliningrad terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Inpex seeks one end-March LNG cargo
Description:
Japanese upstream firm Inpex is seeking one cargo for delivery to Japan through a tender closing today.
The delivery window for the cargo is Mar. 27-31.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks edge higher for second consecutive week
Description: LNG stocks held by Japanese power utilities rose against week-earlier levels for a second consecutive week to a five-week high but stayed below the average level for February over the last four years and levels at the end of February last year.
Author: CK

Title: Germany says no to certification of key Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline
Description: Germany has halted the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline project that will deliver Russian gas directly to Germany, following Russia’s recognition of two separatist territories in the Ukraine, Luhansk and Donetsk as independent and its deployment of troops to those regions.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stockpile sufficient to last 2-3 weeks: METI
Description: Japan does not expect the Russia-Ukraine conflict to immediately disrupt domestic supplies of energy. Nevertheless, the country has sufficient stockpiles of LNG to last two to three weeks and oil stocks that will last 240 days, according to the country’s Agency for Natural Resources and Energy.
Author: CK

Title: Asian LNG buyers not scrambling to stock up, await clarity on sanctions against Russia
Description: Asian LNG buyers are awaiting more clarity on the sanctions that the US and its allies will impose on Russia for its military attacks on Ukraine today and what repercussions they might have on term LNG imports from Russia and LNG supplies globally before deciding on what steps they should take to ensure stable and adequate supplies.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere expects revised gas deal with EOG to advance Corpus Christi stage 3 project
Description: US LNG producer Cheniere has signed a deal to extend the term and volume of gas supply under an existing agreement with upstream producer EOG Resources, which wil also triple the volume of LNG associated with the increased supply.
Author: CK

Title: Shell will do what it can to supply market with LNG amid sanctions against Russia
Description: Shell is closely monitoring the situation concerning sanctions against Russia and will do what it can to manage any disruptions to LNG supplies as a result of sanctions imposed against Russia in the wake of its unprovoked invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Germany has sufficient gas stocks to get through winter; preparing for next winter: Minister
Description: Germany has secured sufficient volumes of gas for the current winter season and sees gas supply within the European Union as secure, even in the event of a complete halt in Russian gas supplies, Federal Minister of Economics Robert Habeck said.
Author: CK

Title: Germany to expedite LNG terminal construction in Brunsbüttel and Wilhelmshaven: Scholz
Description: Germany has decided to expedite the construction of LNG terminals in Brunsbüttel and Wilhelmshaven as part of a policy to secure energy supply for the country, German chancellor Olaf Scholz said.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks six April LNG cargoes through tender
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued its third tender in as many weeks to buy LNG cargoes for delivery in April to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving facility in the country’s Rayong province. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: UK bans ships with Russian associations from entering its ports
Description: The UK has blocked the entry of any vessels owned, operated or chartered by any person connected with Russia, as it prepares to impose further restrictive economic sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Shell to divest stake in Sakhalin LNG as it exits all joint ventures with Gazprom
Description: Shell intends to exit its joint ventures with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom, including the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant that delivers LNG to key LNG buyers in northeast Asia, in response to Russia’s military aggression in Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass ships its maiden LNG cargo three weeks after receiving first ship at terminal
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG export plant in Louisiana has shipped its first commissioning cargo on the 147,000 m3 Yiannis LNG tanker, three weeks after the vessel arrived at the terminal for loading.
Author: CK

Title: One Russian LNG vessel diverted from the UK as it bars port access to Russia-connected ships
Description: Russia’s Sovcomflot-owned 172,600 m3 Christophe de Margerie ice-class LNG carrier has diverted away from the UK and is sailing to France’s 8 mtpa Montoir LNG receiving facility, following the UK’s decision to ban ships with Russian connections entry to its ports.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin LNG offtakers unfazed by Shell’s decision to exit the project
Description: LNG offtakers at the Sakhalin Energy-operated 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant on Russia’s Sakhalin Island expect LNG exports from the plant to continue without interruption despite Shell’s intention to divest its stake in Sakhalin Energy and exit from its other joint ventures with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies to withdraw capital for new projects in Russia
Description: TotalEnergies will continue its activities in Russia but will no longer provide capital for new projects in Russia, in response to Russia’s military aggression against Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Another Yamal LNG-chartered ship looks poised to divert from UK due to entry ban
Description: The Yamal LNG-chartered 172,000 m3 Fedor Litke LNG tanker is likely to be the second LNG ship with Russian connections to divert from the UK after it announced a ban yesterday on Russian ships entering its ports as part of fresh sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS issues tender to sell two March LNG cargoes from Damietta
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering two cargoes loading in the second half of this month at its 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s end-February LNG stocks dip against year-earlier levels
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities edged slightly lower after rising for two consecutive weeks as colder-than-average weather encouraged higher consumption of LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Yamal LNG vessels destined for European ports await orders; diversions eyed
Description: A few laden Yamal LNG-chartered vessels that were earlier signalling their arrival at ports in France and Spain are waiting for orders to sail to new destinations suggesting a pre-emptive move by Yamal LNG ahead of a possible ban by the EU on Russian ships entering its ports.
Author: CK

Title: KfW, Gasunie and RWE sign MOU to build Brunsbüttel LNG terminal
Description: Germany's development bank KfW and energy firm RWE have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) together with Netherland’s state-owned Gasunie to build an 8 bn m3 LNG import terminal at Brunsbüttel in northern Germany, paving the way for the country to reduce its reliance on Russian piped gas following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and also reach its climate goals.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global signs 20-year LNG supply deal with Shell for 2 mtpa from Plaquemines
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has signed a 20-year deal with Shell to sell 2 mtpa from its planned 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Calcasieu Pass LNG terminal prepares to export second cargo
Description: Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant is preparing to export its second commissioning cargo, with the 174,000 m3 Vivirt City LNG tanker currently berthed at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: H-Energy continues to seek LNG supply for Jaigarh LNG terminal ahead of commissioning
Description: India’s H-Energy is still seeking short-term LNG supplies for its 4 mtpa Jaigarh floating LNG import terminal in Maharashtra, with it expecting to begin the commissioning process for the facility in the coming weeks.
Author: CK

Title: Lithuania continues to receive Russian piped gas; suspends LNG imports from Novatek
Description: Lithuania continues to receive pipeline gas from Russia even though it has decided to no longer accept LNG cargoes from Russia’s Novatek at its 2.9 mtpa Klaipeda LNG receiving terminal as of Mar. 3.
Author: CK

Title: Russia threatens cutting gas from Nord Stream 1 to Europe
Description: Russia has threatened to cut gas supplies to Europe through its 55 bn m3 Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline in response to the severe sanctions placed on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, but has not yet made such a decision.
Author: CK

Title: Shell to quit all involvement in Russian oil and gas, starting with spot crude purchases
Description: Shell said today that it intends to withdraw its involvement in all Russian hydrocarbons, including crude oil, petroleum products gas and LNG, in a phased manner, in line with new government guidance.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy to offer a late April LNG cargo; Japanese buyers wary of Russian spot cargoes
Description: Sakhalin Energy is expected to issue a tender tomorrow to sell one cargo that will load on Apr. 22 at the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant on Russia’s Sakhalin Island. But, it is unclear who will take the cargo as many buyers grow wary of buying Russian LNG amid the sanctions placed on Russia for its unprovoked invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: FID for Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project expected in summer: Cheniere
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has signed a deal with Bechtel for a turnkey engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract for the Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project and also directed the firm to begin work at the site under a limited notice to proceed (LNTP). The agreement paves the way for a final investment decision on the project this summer.
Author: CK

Title: UK to explore reducing Russian gas imports further, phases out Russian oil imports
Description: The UK will look into reducing already-low imports of Russian gas as part of a long-term strategy to increase energy supply security in terms of renewables, domestic oil and gas supplies as it seeks to phase out imports of Russian oil this year.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks fall to their lowest winter levels in early March
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities have fallen for the second consecutive week and plummeted to their lowest levels this winter, according to data released today by the Ministry of Energy, Trade and Industry.
Author: CK

Title: EU seeks to reduce demand for Russian gas by two-thirds before year-end
Description: The European Commission has outlined plans to reduce its imports of Russian oil and gas and expects European demand for Russian gas can decrease by two-thirds before the year-end.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers one LNG cargo loading in second-half April
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell one LNG cargo that will load on Apr. 22 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port. The tender will close on Mar. 11, with bids expected to remain valid until a day later.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy seeks LNG ship for five-month charter as buyers shun Russian cargoes
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to secure one LNG ship for a five-month time charter period, starting in April, with offers expected on Mar. 18. The tender emerges amid a growing caution among LNG buyers around purchasing Russian LNG cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy expected to issue tender to sell second Sakhalin cargo loading in April
Description: Sakhalin Energy is expected to issue another tender tomorrow to sell a cargo loading on Apr. 25 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG facility at Prigorodnoye port in Russia, just days after it sold a cargo with a similar loading date from the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks bounce following a drop to this winter’s lowest level in early March
Description: Japan’s LNG stocks held by the country’s power utility firms have recovered slightly following a drop to their lowest levels this winter, according to data released today by the Ministry of Energy, Trade and Industry (METI).
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global signs two 20-year LNG term deals with New Fortress Energy
Description: US project developer Venture Global has signed two 20-year term supply agreements with gas-to-power developer New Fortress Energy, with one contract each for 1 mtpa from the 20 mtpa Plaquemines and 20 mtpa CP2 LNG projects that Venture Global is developing.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks April LNG cargoes through a fourth tender
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued its fourth tender to buy April LNG cargoes for delivery to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving facility in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers second cargo loading in second-half April
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell a cargo that will load at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Progorodnoye port on Apr. 25. The tender closes on Mar. 18, with bids expected to remain valid until the following day.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers three April LNG cargoes from Damietta
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell three cargoes that will load across April at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant. The tender closes on Mar. 21.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG seeks two April-May LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy two cargoes for delivery across April and May to the Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim. The tender closes on Mar. 25.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks early April LNG cargo
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Apr. 4-5, with delivery to either of the country’s two LNG receiving terminals, the Summit LNG floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) or the Moheshkhali FSRU. The tender closes on Mar. 20, with bids expected to be valid until Mar. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Offline Bintulu LNG train expected to resume production by month-end: Petronas
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas expects a currently offline LNG train at its 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG plant in Malaysia to restart production by the end of this month.
Author: CK

Title: No restart date yet for Shell’s shuttered Prelude FLNG: Regulator
Description: A restart date for Shell’s shuttered 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility in the Browse basin offshore Western Australia is still unavailable as Australia’s safety regulator for the offshore oil and gas industry, Nopsema, has yet to complete its review of Shell’s plan of action to prevent a repeat of the events that led to the facility’s shutdown in December.
Author: CK

Title: Shell prepares for Prelude restart following regulator’s approval
Description: Shell is preparing for the restart of its shuttered 3.6 mtpa Prelude LNG floating facility offshore Western Australia’s Browse Basin, following an approval by the safety regulator for the offshore oil and gas industry. Nopsema.
Author: CK

Title: Soaring gas prices, energy security fears drive demand for LNG storage and import capacity
Description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and the threat of a halt in Russian gas flows to Europe has focused global attention on energy security, with more countries seeking ways to increase LNG import and storage capacity amid soaring energy costs.
Author: CK

Title: Sketchy Sakhalin Energy tender results reflect continued caution over Russian cargoes
Description: Sakhalin Energy closed a tender to sell a cargo loading at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal in Russia on Mar. 18, but sketchy tender results suggest that participants in the tender may be trying to keep a low profile amid sanctions on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Germany advances long-term LNG supply talks with Qatar in shift away from Russian gas
Description: Germany and Qatar have agreed to advance discussions on long-term LNG supply as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has fuelled fears over energy security and increased the short-term importance of facilitating LNG imports to reduce reliance on Russian piped gas.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s IEASA seeks nine May-June LNG cargoes for Bahia Blanca, Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA is seeking a total of nine cargoes for delivery across May and June to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar and 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminals through a tender that closes on Mar. 29. IEASA will announce the tender results the following day.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stock levels dip again in March, recent power supply crunch in focus
Description: LNG stock levels held by Japan’s power utilities fell again after rebounding a week earlier as consumption rose on the back of an earthquake in Japan last week that resulted in the suspension of operations at several power plants.
Author: CK

Title: APLNG offers one LNG cargo loading in May, Tohoku Electric seeks April-May cargoes
Description: The Australia Pacific LNG (APLNG) project is offering one cargo loading at its 9 mtpa plant of the same name on 6-7 May through a tender closing on May 24.
Author: CK

Title: Shell signs initial deal for long-term capacity at Brunsbüttel with German LNG Terminal
Description: Shell has signed an initial agreement with German LNG Terminal to book long-term capacity at the planned Brunsbüttel LNG import terminal, paving the way for Shell to become the terminal’s first customer.
Author: CK

Title: Indonesia’s Tangguh LNG plant offers two LNG project vessels for multi-month charters
Description: The BP-operated 7.6 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s West Papua province is offering two of its LNG project ships for multi-month charters, sparking some concerns among LNG buyers that the offer to lease shipping capacity over an extensive period could signal a cut in production and exports at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas, EGAS offer April-May LNG cargoes
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas is offering one LNG cargo that will load on May 8-9 at its PFLNG 1 floating LNG terminal through a tender that closes tomorrow, while Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering two cargoes loading on Apr. 1-2 and 16-17 from its 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG through a tender that closes today.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Guangdong Energy agrees 1.5 mtpa LNG term deal with Next Decade
Description: Chinese utility firm Guangdong Energy Group has signed a binding initial agreement for the supply of 1.5 mtpa of LNG with US project developer Next Decade from its yet-to-start Rio Grande LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports to reach new high in March; trend of higher exports to Europe continues
Description: US LNG exports are poised to reach a new record high this month, thanks to the start of exports of commissioning cargoes from the 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass plant and a ramp up in shipments at the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass export project.
Author: CK

Title: US and partners will aim to supply 15 bn m3 more of gas to Europe this year
Description: The US, together with its international partners, will aim to supply the European Union with at least 15 bn m3 more of LNG this year as part of an effort to help Europe reduce its dependence on Russian fossil fuels and strengthen European energy security as Russia continues to wage its war on Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Calcasieu Pass ships fourth LNG cargo as loading pace quickens
Description: US project developer Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant has shipped its fourth LNG cargo since exports of the plants commissioning cargoes began on Mar. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Uniper, RWE secure three FSRUs for Germany, advancing the shift away from Russian gas
Description: German energy firms Uniper and RWE have secured three floating LNG import terminals, or floating storage regasification units ( FSRU) for Germany on behalf of the federal government, which is working to expedite plans to bring two LNG import projects online as it strives to cut its dependence on Russian piped gas imports.
Author: CK

Title: Tellurian begins construction on Driftwood LNG project
Description: US LNG project developer Tellurian has begun construction on its 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG export project near Lake Charles in Louisiana, having issued Benchtel Energy with a limited notice to proceed with the work under its engineering, procurement and construction contract.
Author: CK

Title: Vitol, PetroChina submit lowest offers for April-May cargoes in Pakistan LNG tender
Description: Global energy trader Vitol and China’s state-owned PetroChina have submitted the lowest offers in state-owned Pakistan LNG’s (PLL) recently closed tender to buy a total of two cargoes for delivery in April and May to its Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy to offer one LNG cargo loading in early May from Sakhalin LNG
Description: Sakhalin Energy is expected to offer one LNG cargo loading on May 7 at the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant at Russia’s Prigorodnoye plant through a tender to be issued by or on Mar. 30, according to term offtakers.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s SLNG secures a second FSRU to enhance the country’s energy security
Description: Singapore terminal operator Singapore LNG (SLNG) has secured a second floating storage unit (FSU) unit to bolster the country’s LNG storage capabilities as it seeks to enhance the country’s energy security, according to industry participants.
Author: CK

Title: G7 energy ministers reject Russia’s demand for gas payments in rubles
Description: Energy ministers of the Group of Seven (G7) countries have agreed to reject Russia’s demand for gas payments to be made only in rubles as it is “a unilateral and clear breach of the treaties.”
Author: CK

Title: Germany issues early warning for gas supplies amid threat of halt in Russian gas supplies
Description: Germany has issued an early warning for gas supplies for precautionary purposes to prepare the country with adequate supplies in the event that Russia halts gas flows.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks slip below four-year average for March
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities slipped for a second consecutive week, dragging the average stock levels for March well below the average for the month over the last four years.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL, India’s Gail seek second-half April LNG cargoes
Description: Bangladesh’ state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. (RPGCL)and India’s state-owned Gail have issued tenders to buy one cargo each for delivery in late April.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy issues tender to sell early May LNG cargo
Description: Sakhalin Energy is offering one cargo that will load on May 7 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port through a tender that will close on Apr. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Planned Stade LNG import terminal in Germany gets municipal backing
Description: The planned LNG import terminal in the Hanseatic city of Stade in Germany’s Lower Saxony region has received approval from municipal authorities, paving the way for another LNG import terminal to come online in Germany.
Author: CK

Title: China’s ENN agrees 20-year term deals with Energy Transfer for Lake Charles LNG
Description: Chinese independent firm ENN Natural Gas (ENN NG) and its subsidiary ENN Energy have agreed to buy a combined 2.7 mtpa of LNG over a 20-year term from US pipeline midstream operator Energy Transfer’s planned Lake Charles LNG project in Louisiana in the US.
Author: CK

Title: European buyers can continue to pay for Russian gas in euros
Description: European buyers can continue to make payment for Russian gas supplies in euros, despite Russian President Vladimir Putin’s demand that Russia would accept payment only in rubles from Apr. 1.
Author: CK

Title: North West Shelf begins processing Pluto gas, boost in LNG output eyed
Description: The Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf (NWS) LNG project in Western Australia has begun processing gas from the Pluto fields at its Karratha gas plant (KGP), enabling the NWS plant to produce and export more LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy seeks second LNG ship; Charter period for 12 months
Description: Sakhalin Energy is seeking an LNG ship to charter for a 12-month period, leading market participants to suggest that the firm requires a ship to store excess LNG as buyers increasingly shun Russian spot cargoes. The deadline for offer submissions is today.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s EnBW to buy LNG from planned Stade LNG import terminal
Description: German energy firm EnBW has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Hanseatic Energy Hub to buy at least 3 bn m3 of gas from its planned Stade LNG import terminal in northern Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks interest in 2H May LNG cargo from Prelude
Description: Kogas International (KI)  is seeking expressions of interest (EOI) to buy one cargo for delivery on May 25-30 from the 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG (FLNG) export facility in Western Australia before selling it through a tender planned for Apr. 11. The EOI deadline is Apr. 8
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC seeks one second-half May LNG delivery to Dahej
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum Corp. (GSPC) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on May 25-27 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat. The tender closes on Apr. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude restarts LNG operations, ships first cargo after December shutdown
Description: The Shell-operated 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG (FLNG) facility in Western Australia’s Browse Basin has restarted operations, shipping its first LNG cargo yesterday after a forced shutdown in December.
Author: CK

Title: Pertamina offers one LNG cargo loading in 2H May at Bontang
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned Pertamina is offering one LNG cargo that will load on May 26-28 at the 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG export plant in Indonesia through a tender that closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Kuwait’s KPC seeks two June-July LNG cargoes for delivery to Al-Zour
Description: Kuwait’s state-owned energy firm KPC is seeking two LNG cargo for delivery across June and July to its 11 mtpa Al-Zour LNG receiving terminal through a tender that closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: First LNG reload cargo from Korea heads to Europe
Description: The 149,172 m3 Fuji LNG tanker is making its way towards the Suez Canal to deliver what is likely to be the first re-exported LNG cargo from Korea to Europe, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail seeks one cargo for delivery in June to Dahej
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on June 21-23 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in the western state of Gujarat. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG and Petronas offer cargoes loading in second-half May
Description: Oman LNG and Malaysia's state-owned Petronas have issued tenders to sell one cargo each loading in the second half of May. Oman LNG’s tender closes today while Petronas’ tender closes on Apr. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stock levels show little change as LNG imports weaken
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities have remained stable over the last four weeks, staying well below their average levels for the end of February, March and April last year and over the past four years.
Author: CK

Title: Eni, EGAS agree to lift Egypt’s gas output; increased LNG exports target Europe
Description: Italy’s Eni and Egypt’s state-owned EGAS have agreed to maximize gas production and LNG exports from Egypt, with this aimed at increasing exports to Europe, including Italy,  specifically.
Author: CK

Title: China’s first-quarter LNG imports slide as high prices inhibit spot purchases
Description: A sustained elevation in LNG prices has deterred China’s LNG importers from making spot LNG purchases, dragging down LNG imports progressively over the first quarter of this year compared to a year earlier.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG seeks six LNG cargoes for delivery in May and June
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy a total of six cargoes for delivery in May and June to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort receiving terminal in Port Qasim. The tender closes on Apr. 21, with offers expected to be valid up to that date.
Author: CK

Title: Pertamina offers one Bontang LNG cargo loading in first-half June
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned Pertamina is offering one cargo that will load at the 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG plant in Kalimantan from June 4-9 through a tender closing on Apr. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks a first-half May LNG cargo
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. (RPGCL) is seeking one cargo for delivery on May 11-12 to either the 3.8 mtpa Summit LNG or Moheshkhali LNG import terminals in Bangladesh through a tender closing on Apr.24.
Author: CK

Title: India’s IOC seeks second-half May LNG delivery to Dahej
Description: India’s state-owned IndianOil (IOC) has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on May 20, with the discharge volume to be split equally between the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat and the 5 mtpa Ennore LNG import terminal in Chennai. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Tangguh LNG’s Train 2 is offline for unplanned maintenance; restart expected this week: BP
Description: BP has taken offline the second liquefaction train of its 7.6 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s West Papua province for unplanned maintenance due to “irregularities in the gas heater,” regional president, Asia Pacific, Nader Zaki said.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan seeks another May cargo, adding to its May LNG requirements
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy one May LNG cargo, adding to its requirements for three cargoes to be delivered in May as part of a six-cargo May-June tender. Both tenders close tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks rebound slightly as consumption dips on warmer weather
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities rebounded slightly this week as warmer weather has reduced consumption and weekly LNG receipts have continued to edge higher.
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC issues tender to buy a first-half June LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum Corp. (GSPC) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on June 6-15 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers four LNG cargoes loading in May
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell four cargoes that will load in May at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant. The tender closes on Apr. 26.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s IEASA seeks 12 June-July LNG cargoes for Bahia Blanca, Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA is seeking a total of 12 LNG cargoes for delivery in June and July to its two LNG receiving terminals the 6.1 mtpa Escobar and the 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca through a tender closing on Apr. 27.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks four May LNG cargoes through tender
Description: Thailand’s state-owned utility the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT) has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery in May to the PTT-operated 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern province of Rayong. The tender closes on Apr. 26 and offers are expected to remain valid until two days later.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG receives offers for six out of seven May-June LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) received a total of 12 offers for six out of the seven May-June LNG cargoes that it sought through a tender that closed yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Eni, Congo agree to lift gas output and export, accelerating Congo LNG project start
Description: Italy’s Eni and the Republic of Congo have signed a letter of intent to increase gas production and export, with this helping to accelerate the development and startup of an LNG plant in the country in 2023.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one LNG cargo for delivery between 1H May and 1H July
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG facility for delivery between the first halves of May and July on a delivered ex-ship (DES) basis through a tender that closes on Apr. 27.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers a fifth LNG cargo loading in May through a second tender
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering one cargo loading on May 3-4 at its 7.2  mtpa Idku LNG plant through a tender closing tomorrow. The tender will be the firm’s second tender to sell cargoes loading in May and will bring the total number of May cargoes offered to five.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks multiple May LNG cargoes, mirroring EGAT’s requirements
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy multiple LNG cargoes for delivery in May to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes on Apr.27.
Author: CK

Title: Australia’s LNG exports dip in April on maintenance, also seen falling in May
Description: Australia’s LNG exports are expected to dip this month compared to March and a year earlier as a result of planned maintenance at the Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone, the Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf (NWS) and the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG plants.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG issues tender to buy one second-half May LNG cargo
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on May 17-18 to the Pakistan GasPort LNG import terminal in Port Qasim. The tender closes on Apr. 29.
Author: CK

Title: Concerns over further halts to Russian gas exports may fuel Asian LNG purchases, but not immediately
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom’s moves to halt gas exports to Poland and Bulgaria from today have created fears among Asia’s LNG importers that Russia may also halt gas supplies to its other European buyers, leading to competition for LNG cargoes and even higher LNG prices.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom to stop gas exports to Poland, Bulgaria
Description: Russia’s state-owned energy firm Gazprom has told Poland and Bulgaria it will stop flows of Russian gas to both countries from today, making it the first time that Russia will stop gas flows to its European buyers since its invasion of Ukraine on Feb. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s end-April LNG stock levels climb to 14-week high
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities at the end of April rose to their highest levels since mid-January as warmer weather in the weeks since the end of winter likely led to a reduction in LNG consumption.
Author: CK

Title: Tangguh LNG’s second train restarts after an 11-day shutdown
Description: The second train of the BP-operated 7.6 mtpa Tangguh LNG train in Indonesia’s West Papua province has resumed operations today, following a shutdown on Apr. 17 due to irregularities in the train’s gas heater.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Torrent Power seeks one May LNG cargo for delivery to Dahej
Description: India’s Gujarat-based utility Torrent Power has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery either on May 11 or 27 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tanker’s scheduled arrival at Snohvit next week indicates imminent plant restart
Description: The 140,000 m3 Arctic Voyager LNG tanker is scheduled to arrive at the 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG terminal in Norway on May 9, indicating an imminent restart of the plant that has been offline since September 2020.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG, India’s Gail seek end May to June LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) is seeking one cargo each for delivery on June 1-2 and 16-17 to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim through a tender closing on May 11, while India’s state-owned Gail is seeking one cargo for delivery between May 30 and June 1 to the Petronet-operated 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG import terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat through a tender that closes on May 5.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh LNG signs two 10-year FSRU contracts with Germany, operations to start by year-end
Description: LNG infrastructure and floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) provider Hoegh LNG has agreed to charter out two FSRUs from its fleet to Germany for 10 years.
Author: CK

Title: Europe’s LNG receipts rise to second-highest level in April but fall short of January high
Description: Europe’s monthly LNG receipts rose to their second-highest level in April. But, they fell short of their all-time high in January as the US shipped less in the month despite continuing to account for the majority of the region’s imports.
Author: CK

Title: A second LNG tanker heads for Snohvit ahead of targeted restart date
Description: A second LNG tanker is making its way towards the Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant in Norway ahead of its targeted restart date of May 17.
Author: CK

Title: Uniper charters two FSRUs from Dynagas for Germany; Wilhelmshaven to be first LNG import site
Description: German energy firm Uniper has chartered two floating storage and regasification units (FSRU) from shipping firm Dynagas on behalf of the German government for the import of LNG to reduce the country’s reliance on Russian gas and strengthen its gas supply security.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one June-July LNG cargo
Description: Angola LNG is offering one cargo from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant that is deliverable between June 2 and July 14 through a tender closing on May 11.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks two June LNG cargoes through two tenders
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. (RPGCL) has issued two tenders seeking one cargo each for delivery on June 4-5 and 11-12 to either the Moheshkhali LNG or Summit LNG import terminals in Chittagong.
Author: CK

Title: ExxonMobil agrees to buy 2 mtpa of LNG from Venture Global’s CP2 and Plaquemines projects
Description: US project developer Venture Global has signed two long-term sales agreements with ExxonMobil LNG Asia Pacific for a total of 2 mtpa of LNG from its Plaquemines and CP2 LNG project in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: China’s LNG imports edge lower in April; Australia and Qatar ship less
Description: China’s LNG imports edged lower in April as elevated LNG prices and the impact of Covid restrictions particularly in eastern China weighed on demand and extended a decline in LNG receipts since February.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS, ADNOC offer May-June LNG cargoes; Gail, Hokkaido Electric seek cargoes
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering one cargo that will load on May 24-25 at its 5 mtpa Damietta LNG terminal through a tender closing tomorrow, while Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC LNG  has issued a tender closing on May 12 to sell a cargo loading on June 17-21 at its 5.8 mtpa LNG export facility on Das Island.
Author: CK

Title: Pertamina offers one LNG cargo loading in June at Bontang
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned Pertamina is offering one cargo that will load on either June 6-10 or 17-18 at its 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG export plant through a tender closing tomorrow. Bids are expected to remain valid until May 31.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global agrees 20-year 1 mtpa LNG supply deal with Petronas from Plaquemines
Description: US project developer Venture Global has signed a deal to sell 1 mtpa of LNG from its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG project in Louisiana over a 20-year term to Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stock levels in early May rise, edging above year-earlier end-May levels
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities climbed above the 2 mt mark at the end of the first week of May, edging above end-May levels last year and the average for end-May between 2017 and 2020
Author: CK

Title: Kuwait to receive first Russian LNG cargo since 2018 as LNG imports surge before summer
Description: Kuwait is scheduled to receive its first LNG cargo from Russia this month, making it the first cargo imported from the country  since September 2018.
Author: CK

Title: PetroChina submits lowest offers for Pakistan LNG’s two-cargo June tender
Description: State-owned PetroChina submitted the lowest offers for two June cargoes that Pakistan LNG (PLL) sought through a tender that closed on May 11.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P expects Philippines LNG import terminal to start in August-September
Description: LNG terminal developer AG&P expects its 5 mtpa Philippines LNG import project in the Batangas Bay to start commercial operations between August and September, which will make it the first LNG receiving terminal to come online in the Philippines.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks nine July 2022 to March 2023 LNG cargoes through tender
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas has issued a tender to buy nine cargoes for delivery to Korea from July 1 to March 31 next year on either a free-on-board (FOB) or delivered ex-ship (DES) basis through a tender that closes on May 18.
Author: CK

Title: EU, Japan to cooperate on ensuring secure supply of LNG as Europe cuts reliance on Russia
Description: The European Union and Japan have agreed to collaborate on ensuring each other’s security of supply of LNG and reduce Europe’s reliance on Russian energy imports by diversifying energy supply sources.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT and EGAT issue tenders to buy June LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned firms PTT and the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT) have each issued tenders to buy cargoes for delivery in June to the 11.5 mtpa LNG import terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. Both tenders close on May 16.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s IEASA seeks 13 July LNG cargoes for delivery to Escobar, Bahia Blanca
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA has issued a tender to buy 13 LNG cargoes for delivery in July to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar and 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG import terminals. The tender closes on May 23.
Author: CK

Title: PGNiG signs initial agreement with Sempra for 3 mtpa of US LNG over 20 years
Description: Poland’s state-owned utility PGNiG has signed a heads of agreement (HOA) to buy a total of 3 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board (FOB) basis over 20 years from US energy firm Sempra’s proposed Cameron LNG Phase 2 and Port Arthur LNG projects in the US.
Author: CK

Title: Snohvit LNG’s restart pushed back by a week due to compressor fault
Description: Norway’s state-owned Equinor has pushed back the targeted restart of its shuttered 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant by a week from today due to a “minor fault” on a compressor, the firm said.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks edge higher in mid-May
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities edged higher for the second consecutive month, with mid-May levels staying above the 2 mn mt level.
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC, IOC issue tenders to buy July LNG cargoes
Description: India’s state-owned energy firm Gujarat State Petroleum Corp.(GSPC) is seeking one cargo for delivery across Jul. 16 to 30 to the 5 mtpa Mundra LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat, while fellow state-owned oil firm Indian Oil (IOC) is seeking a cargo to be delivered on July 2 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminals. The tenders close tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s Gasum expects possible halt to Russian gas imports by end of the week
Description: Finland’s state-owned energy firm Gasum expects that its imports of gas from Russia under a long-term gas supply contract with Russia’s Gazprom Export could end by the end of this week because of its refusal to make payments in rubles instead of euros.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG, Angola LNG issue tenders to sell June-July cargoes
Description: Oman LNG is offering one cargo that will load on June 26-27 at its 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG export facility, while Angola LNG is offering one cargo from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant that can be delivered between June 8 and July 24. Oman LNG’s tender closes tomorrow, while Angola LNG’s tender closes on May 24.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Tohoku Electric, Colombia’s Calamari LNG seek June LNG deliveries
Description: Japanese utility Tohoku Electric has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on June 20-30, while Colombia’s Calamari LNG is seeking 30,000 m3 of LNG for delivery between June 1 and 15. Tohoku Electric’s tender closes tomorrow, while Calamari LNG’s tender closes on May 24.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s energy authority plans to appoint up to two more LNG importers by end-September
Description: Singapore’s energy industry regulator the Energy Market Authority (EMA) is looking to appoint up to two additional LNG importers for the country by end September to enhance the competition among LNG suppliers in the domestic market and offer more options for gas buyers amid growing concerns globally over energy supply security.
Author: CK

Title: Snohvit LNG’s restart delayed further to later this week; three ships wait outside terminal
Description: Norway’s Equinor has pushed back the restart of its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant yet again, with the firm now expecting the shuttered export facility to resume operations a few days later than planned on May 27.
Author: CK

Title: Indian buyers seek June LNG cargoes; Oman LNG offers one cargo loading in June
Description: India’s state-owned firms BPCL and Gail are seeking a total of three cargoes for delivery in June through two separate tenders closing tomorrow, while Oman LNG is offering a cargo that will load on June 14-16 at its 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG. Oman LNG’s tender closes on May 26.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies agrees 0.6 mtpa 15-year term LNG deal with Korea’s Hanwha Energy
Description: TotalEnergies has agreed to supply Korea’s Hanwha Energy with 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 15 years, starting in 2024. The supply will come from TotalEnergies’ global LNG supply portfolio and will be delivered to state-owned Kogas’ 19.5 mtpa Tongyeong LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas plans to buy more term LNG to mitigate impact of higher prices, market volatility
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas, one of the world’s largest LNG importers, is planning to buy more LNG on both a long- and short-term basis to mitigate its exposure to high LNG prices and price volatility from spot LNG cargo purchases
Author: CK

Title: Price-sensitive Asian LNG buyers likely to emerge for winter supply in 3Q 2022: Woodside
Description: Elevated LNG prices have kept some price-sensitive Asian buyers out of the spot market, but cargo requirements for winter are likely to force them into the market from the third-quarter of the year, Woodside’s chief executive Meg O’ Neill expects.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere agrees 20-year US LNG term supply deal for 0.4 mtpa with Korea’s Posco
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has signed a 20-year LNG supply deal for 0.4 mtpa with Korea’s Posco International, with deliveries to start from late 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global approves investment to build Plaquemines LNG project
Description: US project developer Venture Global has made a final investment decision (FID) to proceed with construction of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant, making it the first US LNG project to reach a financial close since Venture Global’s FID on its first LNG plant the 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass in August 2019.
Author: CK

Title: Supply concerns, high prices push Asian LNG buyers to seek more long-term LNG
Description: Concerns over persisting supply tightness and high LNG prices over the next few years have pushed Asian LNG buyers to sign more long-term contracts, with this increasing the momentum for new liquefaction projects to be sanctioned.
Author: CK

Title: RWE signs initial deal for 15-year term supply with Sempra for 2.25 mtpa from Port Arthur
Description: Germany’s energy firm RWE has signed a heads of agreement to buy 2.25 mtpa of LNG over a 15-year term from US infrastructure developer Sempra’s proposed Port Arthur LNG project in  Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Gail issues swap tender to buy and sell July-September LNG cargoes
Description: India’s state-owed Gail has issued a swap tender to buy three cargoes for delivery from July to September to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat and sell the same number of cargoes that will load in the same months from the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass and 5.25 mtpa Cove Point LNG export terminals in the US. The tender closes on May 31.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore may need a second LNG terminal as demand grows: EMA
Description: Energy regulatory agency the Energy Market Authority (EMA) of Singapore says the country may eventually need a second LNG import terminal to meet LNG demand as it grows beyond the existing LNG terminal’s operating capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Poland’s LNG receipts set to reach all-time high in May after halt in Russian gas imports
Description: Poland’s LNG receipts are set to reach their highest level in May, following the complete halt IN Russian gas exports to the country about a month ago.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor’s Snohvit LNG is poised to load first cargo this week as plant restarts
Description: Equinor’s 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant is poised to load its first cargo this week as the plant resumes operations, after a fire forced a complete shutdown of the plant on Sep. 28, 2020.
Author: CK

Title: India’s GSPC issues November-February LNG tender, Pakistan seeks one July LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum (GSPC) has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery between the first halves of November and February. The tender, which closes on June 3, is the first requirement for the coming winter season that an Indian buyer has floated.
Author: CK

Title: Russia halts more gas exports to Europe as Netherland’s GasTerra rejects ruble payment demand
Description: Dutch gas supplier GasTerra has become the latest European firm to have its gas contract with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom terminated because of its refusal to pay for its gas supplies in rubles.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom will stop gas supplies to Denmark’s Orsted today
Description: Danish energy firm Orsted said its gas supplies from Russia’s state-owned Gazprom will stop today because it has refused to comply with Gazprom’s requirements for gas supplies to be paid in rubles instead of in euros.
Author: CK

Title: China’s LNG imports rebound in May despite weak spot demand
Description: LNG imports into China recovered slightly in May, after four consecutive months of decline due to elevated spot LNG prices and weakened demand as a result of Covid-19 restrictions in parts of the country.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s IEASA seeks 13 second-half July and August LNG cargoes
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA is seeking 13 LNG cargoes for delivery between Jul. 20 and Aug. 28 to the 6.62 mtpa Bahia Blanca and 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG import terminals through a tender that closes on June 8.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas issues tender to buy 39 LNG cargoes for October 2022-September 2025
Description: Turkey’s state-owned oil and gas firm Botas has issued a tender to buy a total of 39 LNG cargoes for delivery between October and September 2025, with four of the cargoes for delivery this year, 13 cargoes each for delivery in 2023 and 2024 and nine cargoes to be delivered in 2025. The tender closes on June 7.
Author: CK

Title: Queensland’s gas producers respond to supply shortfall amid soaring wholesale prices: AEMO
Description: Queensland’s gas producers have increased flows to Australia’s southern states after the energy market operator activated the country’s gas supply guarantee mechanism yesterday to ensure more gas is available to meet a supply crunch.
Author: CK

Title: Queensland sends more gas to Australia’s southeastern states, easing supply crunch
Description: Strong gas flows from Queensland have helped to bolster supplies in Australia’s southeastern states, where a cold snap this week increased the call on already-tight supplies of gas, causing wholesale gas prices to soar and forcing the Australia Energy Market Operator to impose price caps in several markets.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor’s shuttered Snohvit plant restarts LNG production; storage tank refilling underway
Description: Equinor’s shuttered 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant has restarted LNG production and the plant’s storage tanks are being filled ahead of the resumption of cargo loadings. The start of production comes 20 months after a fire forced the plant to stop operations
Author: CK

Title: Norway’s Snohvit LNG set to ship its first LNG cargo today following restart
Description: The Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant in Norway is poised to ship its first cargo on the 140,000 m3 Arctic Voyager LNG tanker today, following the plant’s restart last week after a 20-month shutdown due to a fire. The Arctic Voyager shipped Snohvit’s last cargo on Sep. 10. 2020.
Author: CK

Title: Energy Transfer signs 25-year LNG term deal with China Gas for Lake Charles supply
Description: US project developer Energy Transfer has signed a 25-year term deal to supply 0.7 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis to Chinese gas services supplier China Gas from its proposed 16.45 mtpa Lake Charles LNG project in Louisiana, starting from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone, Darwin LNG cargoes add to spot supply for June-July
Description: Kuwait’s state-owned Kufpec has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Jul. 19-24 at the Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plant in Australia, while Santos is offering one cargo that will load at its 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG terminal between June 30 and Jul. 2 through another tender. Kufpec’s tender closes tomorrow, while Santos’ tender closes on June 8.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks three July-September LNG cargoes as part of a swap tender
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy three cargoes for delivery between July and September to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat. It is also looking to sell three cargoes that will load at the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG plant in the US between July and September 2023. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC LNG offers 12 LNG cargoes for delivery in 2023-24
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC LNG is seeking expressions of interest in its offer of 12 LNG cargoes that will load at its 5.8 mtpa das Island LNG export plant in 2023 and 2024. Submissions of interest are due on June 9, following which ADNOC LNG will issue a tender.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG reissues tender to buy one early July LNG cargo
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has re-issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on July 3-4 to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim after not awarding its original tender that closed on June 3. The new tender closes on June 10.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s early June LNG stock levels rise to highest levels since January
Description: LNG stock levels held by Japan’s power utilities climbed in the first week of June to their highest level since early January.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG plant forced to shut due to fire; force majeure declared on liquefaction
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island in Texas has halted operations following an explosion due to a fire earlier today that has led it to declare force majeure (FM) on liquefaction at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere and Equinor agree 15-year deal for 1.75 mtpa of LNG from 2026
Description: Equinor has agreed to buy 1.75 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from US LNG producer Cheniere over 15 years, starting from the second half of 2026. Deliveries will reach the full contracted volume in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT, Singapore’s SLNG seek Jul-Aug LNG cargoes amid supply disruptions
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy five LNG cargoes for delivery in July, while Singapore’s SLNG is seeking one cargo that can be delivered to the SLNG terminal between Jul. 1 and Aug. 31. PTT’s tender closes on June 13, while SLNG’s tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Three LNG vessels divert away from shuttered Freeport terminal in the US
Description: Three LNG vessels scheduled to load at the shuttered 15 mtpa Freeport LNG terminal in Texas in the next two to 12 days have changed course, while six other vessels continue to signal their arrival at the terminal this month despite expectations of an outage that is expected to last at least three weeks.
Author: CK

Title: Qatar picks TotalEnergies as first partner in North Field expansion project
Description: QatarEnergy has picked TotalEnergies as its first international partner in the 32 mtpa North Field East (NFE) LNG project that will boost Qatar’s LNG export capacity to around 110 mtpa from an existing 77 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks LNG cargoes again for delivery from July to March 2023
Description: Korea’s state-owned Kogas is seeking LNG cargoes for delivery between July and March next year through a tender, after closing an earlier tender about a month ago to buy up to 20 cargoes over the same period. The new tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC LNG issues tender to sell 12 cargoes loading in 2023-24
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC LNG has issued a tender to sell 12 LNG cargoes that will load at its 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG plant in 2023 and 2024, following the deadline on June 9 for expressions of interest to buy the cargoes. The tender closes on June 24.
Author: CK

Title: Full restart at Freeport LNG “not expected until late 2022,” partial restart in 90 days targeted
