Description: Freeport LNG expects its shuttered 15 mtpa LNG export facility of the same name in Texas will likely remain offline until later this year, which significantly extends the shutdown period of the plant beyond the earlier guidance of “a minimum of three weeks.”
Author: CK

Title: Kogas and TotalEnergies sign initial deal to cooperate on LNG trading and optimisation
Description: Korea’ state-owned Kogas and TotalEnergies have signed a memorandum of understanding to create a framework for long-term cooperation in such areas as LNG trading and optimization.
Author: CK

Title: Supply disruptions force Asian LNG market participants to reassess demand
Description: Asian LNG market participants are reassessing their positions in the wake of an extended shutdown at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in the US and reductions in Russian gas flows to Europe through the key Nord Stream 1 pipeline as prices soar on concerns over supply shortages
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG, India’s Petronet seek July LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery in July to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim, after little success in buying one cargo for delivery in early July through two earlier tenders. The tender closes on June 23.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom cuts Nord Stream 1 gas flows further, constricting supplies to Europe
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom has reduced gas flows further through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline that delivers gas to Europe through Germany after an initial cut on Tuesday.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG outage increases spot vessel availability, depressing Atlantic spot charter rates
Description: An unplanned shutdown of the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in the US due to a fire last week has led to a sharp increase in spot vessel availability in the Atlantic, dragging down Atlantic spot LNG charter rates for July below the $100,000 a day mark around a week after crossing this threshold four months earlier than in previous years.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy picks Eni as its second partner in North Field East LNG expansion project
Description: QatarEnergy has selected Eni as its second partner in the North Field East LNG expansion project, which is expected to boost Qatar’s LNG export capacity by 32  mtpa to around 110 mtpa from 77 mtpa currently. The project is expected to begin production before the end of 2025,
Author: CK

Title: Germany outlines plans to reduce gas consumption as Russia cuts gas supplies
Description: Germany has outlined plans to reduce its gas-fired power generation and industrial consumption of gas amid a sharp reduction in Russian gas flows from the Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline to ensure the country has adequate storage this winter.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail seeks mid-July LNG delivery to Hazira
Description: India’s Gail has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on July 15-17 to the 5 mtpa Hazira LNG import terminal in Gujarat. The tender closes on June 21.
Author: CK

Title: Yamal LNG ships first post-winter cargo to Asia through Northern Sea Route
Description: Russia has shipped its first post-winter LNG cargo for the year to Asia from the 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant in Sabetta through the Northern Sea Route (NSR), marking the opening of the route through the Bering Strait that cuts sailing time to Asia.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips joins QatarEnergy’s North Field East LNG project as third partner
Description: QatarEnergy has selected ConocoPhillips as its third partner in its North Field East LNG expansion project in Qatar that will increase existing production capacity in the country by around 42% to 110 mtpa in 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global, EnBW agree LNG term deals for 1.5 mtpa from Plaquemines, CP2
Description: US project developer Venture Global and German energy firm EnBW have agreed on a LNG supply deal for a total of 1.5 mtpa over a 20 year term, starting from 2026. Half of the supply will from the 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG project, while the other half will come from the 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: ExxonMobil picked as fourth partner in Qatar’s North Field East LNG project
Description: QatarEnergy has selected ExxonMobil as the fourth partner in its North Field East (NFE) LNG expansion project, following partnership agreements with TotalEnergies, Eni and ConocoPhillips.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one cargo for delivery between 2H July and 1H August
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo for delivery between Jul. 24 and Aug. 12 from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant. The cargo will be loaded on the 160,000 m3 Sonangol Sambizanga and can be delivered to most destinations except northeast Asia. The tender closes on June 28.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere gives go-ahead to Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has made a final investment decision (FID) on the 10 mtpa Corpus Christi LIquefaction Stage 3 LNG project in Texas and issued a full notice to proceed to Bechtel Energy to continue construction.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere signs two LNG term supply deals with Chevron for 2 mtpa
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has agreed to supply Chevron with a combined 2 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board (FOB) basis through two contracts for 1 mtpa each with its subsidiaries Sabine Pass Liquefaction and Cheniere Marketing.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global signs two term deals for 2 mtpa with Chevron from Plaquemines, CP2
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has agreed to supply Chevron with 2 mtpa of LNG through two 20-year contracts with supplies to come from its planned 20 mtpa Plaquemines and 20 mtpa CP2 LNG projects.
Author: CK

Title: Germany raises the alarm amid continued disruption in Russian gas supplies
Description: Germany has raised the alarm on the ‘tense’ gas situation in the country as gas supplies from Russia through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline have been curtailed since June 14 and gas prices remain very high.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail issues tender to buy one late July LNG cargo
Description: India’s state-owned Gail is seeking one LNG cargo for delivery on Jul. 28 or 30 to the 5 mtpa Hazira LNG terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat through a tender that closes on June 27.
Author: CK

Title: Ineos signs initial 20-year deal with Sempra for 1.4 mtpa of LNG from Cameron, Port Arthur
Description: Britain-based petrochemicals firm Ineos has signed a non-binding agreement with Sempra Infrastructure to potentially buy 1.4 mtpa of LNG over 20 years, signalling the firm’s entry into the global LNG market.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG’s four-cargo July LNG tender attracts only one offer
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) has received only one offer for a single cargo for its four-cargo July LNG tender that closed today.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ships displaced by Freeport LNG outage suppress charter rates as they await orders
Description: Only three of the nine vessels that signalled their arrival at the shuttered 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in the US this month have been diverted to other US LNG plants to load cargoes, while the remaining vessels that have yet to find employment continue to weigh on spot charter rates.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks 12 LNG cargoes for delivery to India from November to October 2023 as part of a swap
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy 12 LNG cargoes for delivery between November and October next year to the 5 mtpa Dabhol LNG receiving terminal in Maharashtra and the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat as part of a swap tender through which it also intends to sell 12 LNG cargoes from the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG plant in the US. The tender closes on Jul. 5.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand's Nong Fab LNG terminal begins commissioning with first cargo from Qatar
Description: Commissioning operations at the 7.5 mtpa Nong Fab LNG receiving terminal in Thailand have begun, with the recent unloading of the first LNG commissioning cargo on board the 210,000 m3 Al Oraiq LNG tanker from Qatar
Author: CK

Title: Second Yamal LNG cargo takes the Northern Sea Route to Asia
Description: Russia's 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant has shipped its second cargo to Asia through the Northern Sea Route (NSR), a week after its first shipment marked the opening of the route that allows ships to sail from Russia to Asia through the melted icy Arctic waters between May and November.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas offers two second-half August LNG cargoes from PFLNG 2
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas is offering two LNG cargoes for delivery in August from its 1.5 mtpa PFLNG 2 floating LNG facility near the Rotan gas field that is offshore Sabah. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG seeks interest in term LNG supply from Qalhat from 2025
Description: State-owned Oman LNG has called for expressions of interest to secure supply from its 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG facility for a term of up to 10 years, starting from 2025. Submissions are due tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: LNG supply disruptions expected at Prelude until “at least mid-July”: Shell
Description: Shell has warned customers at its 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG (FLNG) facility offshore Broome in Western Australia of disruptions to LNG supplies until at least mid-July as workers at the facility continue a strike to push for higher pay and better conditions
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks one second-half September LNG through a swap tender
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on Sep. 21 or 27 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat, while also selling a cargo that will load on Sep. 27 at the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG terminal in the US. The tender closes on Jul. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Hotter weather forecasts for Japan, Korea point to increased LNG consumption
Description: Forecasts for hotter weather in Japan and Korea up to early August are expected to drive increased consumption and purchases of LNG, with the latest forecasts indicating a probability of above-normal temperatures at 70%-80% in both countries until around the middle of July.
Author: CK

Title: Russia moves to transfer ownership of Sakhalin 2 to a new Russian firm
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a transfer of all assets and interests in the Sakhalin Energy consortium that operates the Sakhalin 2 oil and gas project in Russia to a new Russian firm, creating uncertainty over the involvement of its foreign shareholders.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers five August to October Sakhalin LNG cargoes
Description: The Gazprom-led Sakhalin Energy consortium has issued a tender to sell up to five LNG cargoes on either a free-on-board (FOB) or delivered ex-ship (DES) basis that will load at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant between August and October. The tender will close on Jul. 5.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG pushes back partial restart target date to early October
Description: Freeport LNG has pushed back the timing for a partial resumption of liquefaction operations at its shuttered 15 mtpa plant on Quintana Island in Texas to early October, with it still targeting a return to full production by year-end.
Author: CK

Title: US plants export less LNG in June on Freeport outage, but 1H exports higher on-year
Description: US LNG exports fell in June to their lowest level in three months as a complete halt to operations at the shuttered 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas since early last month pared shipments. But, exports for the first six months of the year surpassed year-earlier levels as high LNG prices have incentivised the country’s liquefaction plants to ramp up exports.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS issues tender to sell one Damietta LNG cargo loading in mid-July
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Jul. 14-15 at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG seeks 10 LNG cargoes for delivery across July to September
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has issued a tender to buy ten LNG cargoes for delivery between July and September to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim, after not securing any cargoes through its recent tenders for July cargoes. The tender closes on Jul. 7.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy selects Shell as fifth partner in North Field East LNG project
Description: QatarEnergy has selected Shell as its fifth and latest partner in the North Field East LNG expansion project that will boost existing production capacity in Qatar to around 110 mtpa from 77 mtpa currently.
Author: CK

Title: PTT cancels tender for August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has cancelled its tender to buy up to five LNG cargoes for delivery in August to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal after having issued it earlier today.
Author: CK

Title: China Gas and Next Decade sign 20-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from Rio Grande
Description: China’s integrated energy supplier China Gas Hongda has agreed to buy 1 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from US project developer Next Decade’s proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project in Texas over a 20-year term.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy up to five August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy up to five cargoes for delivery in August to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern province of Rayong. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s IEASA seeks four LNG cargoes in August for Bahia Blanca, Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA has issued a tender to buy a total of four cargoes for delivery in August to the country’s  6.62 mtpa Bahia Blanca and 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminals. The tender closes on Jul. 12.
Author: CK

Title: Germany approves early start for Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal, targeting winter launch date
Description: Germany is targeting the commissioning and start-up of its first LNG import terminal at Wilhelmshaven during the coming winter season, following approval from the State Trade Supervisory Authority Oldenburg.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS offers one Damietta LNG cargo loading in second-half July
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Jul. 19 at its 5 mtpa Damietta LNG terminal. The tender closes tomorrow, which is two days after EGAS closed its last tender to sell a Damietta LNG cargo that will load in mid-July.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one end-July to mid-August LNG cargo
Description: Angola LNG is offering one cargo for delivery between Jul. 28 and Aug. 17 from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG facility through a tender that will close on Jul. 11.
Author: CK

Title: Guangdong Energy, NextDecade finalize 20-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from Rio Grande
Description: Chinese utility firm Guangdong Energy Group has finalized a deal to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from US project developer Next Decade’s proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG receives no offers for 10-cargo July-September LNG tender
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has received no offers for its tender that closed today for 10 LNG cargoes for delivery between Jul. 25 and Sep. 20 to the 5 mtpa Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand approves PTT’s proposed purchase of 1 mtpa of long-term LNG supply
Description: Thailand’s National Energy Policy Council has given state-owned energy firm PTT the go-ahead to procure up to 1 mt of LNG on a term contract basis, with supplies expected to begin from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy issues tender to sell one mid-August LNG cargo
Description: Sakhalin Energy is offering one cargo that will load on Aug. 15 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant at Prigorodnoye in Russia. The new tender closes tomorrow and comes two days after the firm closed a tender to sell five cargoes that will load at Sakhalin between Aug. 11 and Oct. 26.
Author: CK

Title: Pan Europe ships first LNG cargo from Prelude in a week amid industrial action
Description: Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia has shipped its first LNG cargo in about a week, following a decision to slow production due to the impact of industrial action by workers at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks early August LNG cargo for delivery to Dahej
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Aug. 1 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in the western state of Gujarat. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG to shut down until July 21 on extended industrial action
Description: Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia has shut down operations since late yesterday to forestall an overfilling of its LNG storage tanks as industrial action by workers at the facility has extended to Jul. 21.  Prelude is expected to remain shut until Jul. 21, in line with the notified period of industrial action by the workers’ unions.
Author: CK

Title: Shell signs 20-year deal with Mexico Pacific for 2.6 mtpa of LNG
Description: Shell has signed a 20-year deal with a unit of LNG project developer Mexico Pacific to buy 2.6 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from Mexico Pacific’s proposed 14.1 mtpa LNG plant in Puerto Libertad in Mexico’s Sonora state.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas secures 925 million euro loan from Deutsche Bank to fund LNG purchases
Description: Turkey’s state-owned oil and gas firm Botas has secured a three-year loan for 925 million euro from Germany’s Deutsche Bank to help finance its future LNG purchases amid soaring LNG prices and diversify its sources of natural gas imports.
Author: CK

Title: Vitol signs 15-year deal with Delfin Midstream to buy 0.5 mtpa of LNG
Description: The Americas-based unit of global trader Vitol has signed a deal to buy 0.5 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis over 15 years from US LNG project developer Delfin Midstream’s proposed Delfin Deepwater Port LNG export facility that is located off the coast of Louisiana. The deal is indexed to the US Henry Hub gas price and valued at around $3 bn over 15 years.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Regas, TotalEnergies sign deal for FSRU installation in Germany’s Lubmin port
Description: Germany’s Deutsche Regas has signed an agreement with Total Energies for the installation of a floating storage and regasification unit in the industrial port of Lubmin in Germany’s northeastern state of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania.
Author: CK

Title: PTT may issue a second tender for August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT is expected to issue another tender to buy two more August LNG cargoes next week, after awarding only half of the August cargoes it sought through an earlier tender that closed on Jul. 12.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips, Sempra sign initial deal on Port Arthur LNG supplies, stake
Description: ConocoPhillips has signed a framework agreement with Sempra Infrastructure, a unit of US energy firm, Sempra, that that includes taking a 30% stake in and liquefying 5 mtpa of gas over a 20-year period at the first phase of the proposed Port Arthur LNG project in Texas, as well as collaborating on the second phase of Energia Costa Azul LNG project in Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: PTT issues second tender for up to four more August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a second tender to buy up to four LNG cargoes for delivery in August, adding to its purchase of two August cargoes through a previous tender that closed earlier this week. The tender closes on Jul. 18.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail seeks one mid-August LNG cargo for Dahej
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Aug. 15-16 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in India. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: First Angola LNG shipment post-maintenance heads to Spain
Description: The first cargo to be loaded at Angola LNG’s 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant following its recently completed maintenance is heading to Spain, continuing a recent trend of increased shipments from the plant to Europe instead of Asia.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas seeks eight LNG cargoes for delivery between November and March 2023
Description: Turkey’s state-owned Botas has issued a tender to buy eight LNG cargoes for delivery between the second half of November and the first half of March 2023. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers one Damietta LNG cargo loading in second-half July
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant on Jul. 25. The tender closes today. EGAS has already sold three July cargoes from Damietta.
Author: CK

Title: Workers at Prelude FLNG extend industrial action until Aug. 4
Description: Workers at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility have extended their industrial action to Aug. 4, which could result in an extended shutdown at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks another August LNG cargo, GSPC seeks two September cargoes
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Aug. 25, 26 or 29 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal, while fellow state-owned firm Gujarat State Petroleum is seeking two cargoes for delivery in September through a tender closing today. Gail’s tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Germany to locate its three other planned LNG import terminals at Lubmin and Stade
Description: Germany has decided on Lubmin and Stade as the locations for three more floating LNG import terminals, after Wilhelmshaven and Brunsbüttel, as it strives to accelerate the development of LNG infrastructure to help the country wean itself off Russian pipeline gas.
Author: CK

Title: Pavilion Energy seeks one end-August to first-half September LNG cargo
Description: Singapore’s Pavilion Energy has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery to the Singapore LNG terminal between Aug. 28 and Sep. 15. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Jiaxing LNG import terminal starts up, following first cargo discharge
Description: China’s 1 mtpa Jiaxing LNG import terminal has begun operations, following the recent discharge of its first LNG cargo. The terminal’s start brings the number of operational LNG receiving terminals in the country’s eastern Zhejiang province to three.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh Giant no longer at Jaigarh; installation as FSRU in Germany eyed
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Giant LNG tanker is widely expected to be installed as a floating storage and regasification unit at an LNG import project in Germany, with it no longer expected to serve that function at H-Energy’s Jaigarh LNG import terminal in India’s western state of Maharashtra.
Author: CK

Title: PetroChina signs term supply deal with Cheniere for 1.8 mtpa of LNG up to 2050
Description: China’s state-owned PetroChina has signed a supply agreement to buy 1.8 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from the marketing arm of US LNG exporter Cheniere, starting from 2026 until 2050.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one cargo for delivery between mid-August and early September
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG facility for delivery to most locations except northeast Asia between Aug. 14 and Sep. 7. The tender closes on Jul. 27.
Author: CK

Title: EGAT's short-term LNG purchase plans hampered by tight supplies, high prices
Description:
Thailand’s Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand is urgently seeking LNG on a short-term basis to feed its new power plant.
But, tight supplies amid sky-high spot prices and concerns over energy supply security, have forced the utility firm to consider instead buying LNG on a spot basis, evaluating its affordability on a month-by-month basis.
Author: CK

Title: India’s IOC seeks second-half August LNG cargo for delivery to Dahej
Description: State-owned IndianOil has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Aug. 23 to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat that closes on Jul. 27.
Author: CK

Title: Shell cancels plan to lock out workers from shuttered Prelude FLNG facility
Description: Shell has cancelled its plan to lock workers out this week from its shuttered 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia as it requires critical work for the safety of the facility to be carried out.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS offers two end-July to early August LNG cargoes from Damietta
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering two LNG cargoes that will load on Jul. 31 and Aug. 4-6 at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG receiving facility through a tender that closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Industrial action at Prelude FLNG facility extended until Aug. 11
Description: Workers at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia have extended their industrial action by one week to Aug. 11 as they have yet to agree on a new enterprise agreement with Shell.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT signs 20-year contract with Cheniere for 1 mtpa of LNG
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has agreed to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from US LNG exporter Cheniere, starting from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Australian LNG exports poised to dip in July on plant shutdown, planned maintenance
Description: Australia’s LNG exports in July are poised to fall to their lowest level in 13 months as a result of an industrial action-led shutdown at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia and planned maintenance at the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Darwin and Shell’s 8.5 mtpa Queensland Curtis LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy up to five September LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy up to five LNG cargoes for delivery in September to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes on Aug. 1
Author: CK

Title: ExxonMobil signs 20-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from NextDecade’s Rio Grande project
Description: ExxonMobil LNG Asia Pacific, a unit of ExxonMobil, has signed a deal to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 year’s from US project developer NextDecade’s proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Kuwait’s Kufpec offers one Wheatstone LNG cargo loading in second-half September
Description: Kuwait’s state-owned Kufpec has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Sep. 18-23 at the Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plant in Western Australia. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one mid-August to mid-September LNG cargo
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo for delivery to most destinations between Aug. 14 and Sep. 15 from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant. The tender closes on Aug. 3.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks two September LNG cargoes for Dahej, offers two July 2023 US cargoes
Description: India’s state-owned Gail has issued a tender to buy two cargoes for delivery in September to the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG receiving facility while also offering two cargoes that will load in July next year at the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG terminal in the US. The tender closes on Wednesday.
Author: CK

Title: Pertamina offers one second-half August LNG cargo from Bontang
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned Pertamina has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on Aug. 17 at its 10.5 mtpa Bontang LNG export facility in East Kalimantan. The tender closes on Wednesday.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG imports rebound in July, leading Northeast Asian import gains
Description: Japan’s LNG imports rebounded in July as hotter weather and supply disruptions at a few LNG plants forced the country’s utility firms to buy more LNG on a spot basis.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Sakhalin LNG term buyers fear delivery delays as they await new supply contracts
Description: The impending takeover of the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG project in Russia by a new Russian firm and the lack of clarity over whether the terms of existing LNG supply contracts will remain unchanged has created concerns among the plant’s term buyers in Japan over potential delays to their contracted deliveries in the runup to winter.
Author: CK

Title: Shutdown at Prelude FLNG continues as workers’ strike extended
Description: Workers at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia have extended their protected industrial action to Aug. 18, with the plant expected to remain shut until that time.
Author: CK

Title: US safety regulator to allow early October partial restart for Freeport LNG
Description: US LNG exporter Freeport LNG has entered into a consent agreement with the US Pipeline Hazardous Materials Safety Administration to allow its shuttered 15 mtpa plant on Quintana Island in Texas to restart partial operations in early October and, thereafter, the full operation of all its liquefaction facilities.
Author: CK

Title: IEASA diverts two August LNG cargoes from Escobar to France, Dominican Republic
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm IEASA has diverted two LNG cargoes that were intended for delivery in the first half of August to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal to France and the Dominican Republic, suggesting that the country’s LNG demand may not be as strong as initially expected.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more August-September LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy up to three cargoes for delivery in the second half of August and the first half of September to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern province of Rayong. The cargoes can be delivered to Map Ta Phut on Aug. 17-18 and 30-31, as well as on Sep. 5-6.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one LNG cargo loading between 2H August and 2H September
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load on the 160,400 m3 Lobito LNG tanker at its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant and can be delivered between Aug. 21 and Sep. 23 The tender closes on Aug. 10.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG seeks 72 LNG cargoes over a six-year term through tender
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has issued a tender to buy 72 LNG cargoes, or one cargo a month, for delivery over a six-year period to the Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim through a tender that closes on Sep. 14.
Author: CK

Title: Jera issues tender to buy at least 17 LNG cargoes for November to March 2024
Description: Japan’s Jera has issued a tender to buy at least 17 LNG cargoes for delivery between November and March 2024 through a tender closing on Aug. 11, with some of these volumes expected to go towards its restocking ahead of winter.
Author: CK

Title: Korea to seek more LNG to avoid winter shortages
Description: The Korean government plans to secure more LNG in the coming months to boost stock levels so that it can meet rising demand ahead of winter and avert any supply shortages that might emerge.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG’s September planned maintenance postponed as workers’ strike continues
Description: Shell has postponed the scheduled maintenance in September on its 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia due to ongoing protected industrial action by workers at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin LNG poised to deliver first cargo to Indonesia’s Arun LNG regasification terminal
Description: The 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG export terminal in Russia’s Progorodnoye port is poised to deliver an LNG cargo to the 3 mtpa Arun LNG receiving and regasification terminal in Indonesia's Aceh province this week, making it only the third cargo that the plant has shipped to Southeast Asia since it began exports in 2009.
Author: CK

Title: Centrica signs initial deal with Delfin for 1 mtpa of LNG
Description: UK energy firm Centrica has signed a heads of agreement with US project developer Delfin Midstream to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 15 years on a free-on-board basis from its proposed Delfin Deepwater Port LNG export facility in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG seeks up to 72 LNG cargoes over 5-6years from January 2023
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG is seeking up to 72 LNG cargoes for delivery across two tranches to the Pakistan GasPort LNG receiving terminal in Port Qasim, with the first tranche for 12 cargoes to be delivered across one year, starting in January 2023. The second tranche is for 60 cargoes to be delivered over five years from January 2024 until December 2028. The tender closes on Sep. 14, with offers expected to remain valid until Oct. 6.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz seeks fourth-quarter 2022 LNG deliveries into Revithoussa
Description: Bulgaria’s Bulgargaz EAD has issued a tender to buy three LNG cargoes for delivery between October and December to Greece’s 5.1 mtpa Revithoussa LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on Aug. 16 at 12 pm Bulgarian time.
Author: DE

Title: Pertamina offers 10 Bontang LNG cargoes for delivery from 2024-2026
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned energy firm Pertamina has issued a tender to sell 10 cargoes that will load at the 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG plant in Indonesia between 2024 and 2026. The tender closes on Sep. 2.
Author: CK

Title: Commercial operations for Greece-Bulgaria pipeline gas interconnector to start by Oct.1
Description: Operator ICGB expects commercial operations for the 3 bn m3 Greece-Bulgaria pipeline gas interconnector, IGB, to start by Oct. 1, paving the way for Bulgaria to receive more diversified supplies of gas after its main gas supplier Russia’s state-owned Gazprom halted a supply contract for 2.5-3.5 bn m3 a year in April
Author: DE

Title: Mozambique’s Coral South FLNG looks set to begin LNG exports in September
Description: The Eni-operated 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG facility offshore Mozambique looks set to load its first LNG cargo next month, with the 173,400 m3 British Mentor LNG tanker signalling an arrival at the new export plant on Sep. 1.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC LNG offers one LNG cargo loading in second-half September
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo on a free-on-board basis that will load on Sep. 22-24 at its 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG plant. The tender closes on Aug.18.
Author: CK

Title: EU gas stocks could be 80% full by end-August
Description:
The European Union could refill its underground gas storage facilities to 80% of their capacity in two weeks if the current injection rate stays stable.
But this largely depends on the impact of the heatwave sweeping across Europe and how the situation affecting the availability of Russian pipeline supplies through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline evolves
Author: DE

Title: Chevron to take offline up to one Gorgon LNG train for planned maintenance in April-May 2023
Description: Plant operator Chevron intends to take up to one LNG train offline at its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia from Apr. 22 to May 28 next year for scheduled maintenance.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks 15-year LNG supply from 2026
Description: Thailand’s state-owned Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand has issued a tender to buy 1.2 mtpa of LNG for delivery over 15 years to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut and 7.5 mtpa Nong Fab LNG receiving terminals in Thailand’s Rayong province, starting from 2026. The tender closes on Sep. 22.
Author: CK

Title: A third LNG vessel diverts from Argentina, heads to France
Description: The 174,000 m3 Gunvor–chartered Flex Rainbow LNG tanker has changed its course and is sailing to France after initially heading to Argentina, making it the third vessel in under two weeks to be diverted from Argentina
Author: CK

Title: Russia's pipeline gas exports to China rise from January to mid-August
Description: Russian gas producer Gazprom increased its gas exports to China through the Power of Siberia 1 (PoS1) pipeline between Jan. 1-Aug. 15 compared to a year earlier, while its exports to non-CIS countries fell by 36.2% year on year to 78.5 bn m3 in the first seven and half months of the year
Author: DE

Title: Germany signs deals for LNG supply to Brunsbüttel, Wilhelmshaven import terminals
Description: Germany has signed agreements with its energy firms Uniper, RWE and EnBW for the supply of LNG to the planned floating LNG import terminals in Brunsbüttel and Wilhelmshaven, paving the way for the floating storage and regasification units at these sites to operate at full capacity as soon as they are commissioned during the coming winter season.
Author: CK

Title: Santos does not see east coast Australia gas supply shortfall, LNG export cutbacks for 2023
Description: Australian oil and gas producer Santos does not expect any gas supply shortages to occur next year that would lead to a cutback in LNG exports from Queensland, despite a recent forecast for a supply shortfall in the country’s east coast by the Australian Consumer and Competition Commission.
Author: CK

Title: Origin Energy expects little change in APLNG output in FY 2023
Description: Australian integrated energy firm Origin Energy expects output from the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG plant on the country’s east coast to show little change for the 2023 fiscal year that ends in June next year compared to a year earlier
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG to stay offline until Sep. 1 as strike continues; mediation to take place next week
Description: Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Australia will remain offline until Sep. 1 as an ongoing strike by its workers at the plant has been extended until that date.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one LNG cargo for delivery between 2H September and 2H October
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant that can be delivered to most destinations between Sep. 25 and Oct. 20. The tender closes on Aug. 24 and offers are expected to remain valid until a day later.
Author: CK

Title: Nord Stream 1 gas flows to halt for three days from end-Aug for compressor maintenance
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom will suspend gas flows through the 55 bn m3 Nord Stream 1 pipeline for three days from Aug.  31 while it takes the only operational gas compressor unit at the Portovaya compressor station offline for maintenance.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG workers’ strike to be extended to Sep. 8
Description: A strike by workers at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia is set to be extended to Sep. 8, likely prolonging the plant’s shutdown since early July and further constraining LNG supplies as Asian demand heats up ahead of the peak demand season in winter.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz awards one out of three Oct-Dec LNG cargoes to Cheniere through tender
Description: Bulgaria’s Bulgargaz EAD has awarded one October cargo for delivery to Turkey from its recent three-cargo October-December LNG tender, as available unloading slots at Greece’s 5.1 mtpa Revithoussa LNG receiving terminal where it planned to receive the cargoes are in tight supply.
Author: CK

Title: Congestion builds at Gate LNG terminal as terminal capacity nears full utilisation
Description: Four LNG tankers are circling outside the Netherlands’ 8.8 mtpa Gate LNG receiving terminal as waiting times to berth and discharge have lengthened with the terminal approaching full capacity
Author: DE

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers two cargoes loading in 2H August and 1H September
Description: Sakhalin Energy is offering two cargoes that will load from the 10.8 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal in Russia’s Prigorodnoye port on Aug. 24 and Sep. 12. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Nord Stream 1’s planned gas flow halt fuels supply disruption fears, additional LNG demand
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom’s plan to suspend gas flows for three days through the key 55 bn m3 Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline at the end of this month has fuelled fears that flows may be totally cut off after the planned disruption. And some EU shippers are seeking additional LNG cargoes to allay the impact of any potential supply disruptions
Author: CK

Title: Golar Igloo makes its way to EemsEnergy LNG terminal to set up as second FSRU
Description: The 170,000 m3 Golar Igloo LNG tanker is making its way to the new EemsEnergy LNG receiving terminal in Eemshaven port in the north of Netherlands, where it will be installed as the terminal’s second floating storage and regasification unit.
Author: CK

Title: Shell reaches agreement with Prelude FLNG workers’ unions, eyes end to work bans
Description: Shell has reached an agreement over pay and work conditions with the unions representing workers at its 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia, with this expected to end a prolonged strike and enable the restart of LNG production at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG’s partial restart delayed to mid-November, full restart expected in March 2023
Description: US LNG producer Freeport LNG has again pushed back the timing for a partial restart of its 15 mtpa plant on Quintana Island, Texas, with it now expecting to resume initial production in mid-November, around five months after the facility was forced to shut down due to a fire. It expects to operate at full capacity in March 2023.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers two LNG cargoes loading at Damietta in September
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell two LNG cargoes that will load on Sep. 1-2 and 7-8 at its 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgaria seeks gas for delivery in late September and October
Description: Bulgaria’s gas supplier Bulgargaz EAD is looking to buy 24 GWh a day of gas (2.2 m m3 in gaseous form) to be delivered between Sep. 26 and 28 and 9 GWh a day of gas  (0.8 m m3) to be delivered in October through auctions on the Balkan Gas Hub exchange market
Author: DE

Title: Additional LNG import capacity may not be a game changer for EU LNG supply
Description: Member states of the European Union are rushing to install floating storage regasification units that will boost the bloc’s LNG import capacity by at least a third to 40 mtpa (51 bn m3) by the end of next year.
Author: DE

Title: Shell signs 20-year deal with Energy Transfer for 2.1 mtpa of LNG from Lake Charles
Description: Shell has agreed on a 20-year deal with US LNG project developer Energy Transfer to buy 2.1 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 16.45 mtpa Lake Charles LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Exemplar FSRU sails to Spain for dry docking before supplying Baltic Sea region
Description: Excelerate Energy's Exemplar floating storage and regasification unit is heading to Spain for dry docking before it starts operations in Finland in December, helping to meet the country’s gas needs and replace lost Russian supplies
Author: DE

Title: New operator Sakhalin Energy LLC seeks new customers for Sakhalin LNG
Description: New Sakhalin LNG operator Sakhalin Energy LLC is looking to expand its customer profile by selling supplies from its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant into new markets, which would mean venturing outside of northeast Asia.
Author: CK

Title: LNG vessel British Mentor diverts from Coral South FLNG, suggesting startup delay
Description: The BP-chartered 173,400 m3 British Mentor LNG tanker is no longer heading to the Eni-operated 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG facility offshore Mozambique to load the facility’s first LNG cargo, suggesting that the start of production may be delayed.
Author: CK

Title: Shell prepares to resume LNG production at Prelude FLNG; industrial action notices lifted
Description: Shell is preparing to resume LNG production at its 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility after it reached an enterprise agreement with workers at the plant and their unions last week and unions subsequently lifted notices of protected industrial action that have prevented LNG production.
Author: CK

Title: Russian underground gas storage almost at capacity;  exports to Europe stay unchanged
Description: Russia has filled its underground gas storage facilities almost to capacity, but it has kept pipeline exports to the EU stable despite the high storage levels
Author: DE

Title: Gazprom to cut gas deliveries to Engie from Aug. 30 due to contract disagreements
Description: Russia’s state-owned gas producer Gazprom will cut gas deliveries to French energy and utility firm Engie starting today, due to a disagreement between the two firms on the application of some contracts.
Author: CK

Title: French nuclear outage extensions unlikely to change gas demand-supply picture
Description: French electricity producer EDF has extended outages of several nuclear reactors into the winter, but this is unlikely to increase the country’s call on gas significantly even as the European Union already faces a severe energy crunch this winter
Author: DE

Title: Coral South FLNG start-up going “as planned”: Eni
Description: The start-up of operator Eni’s 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG facility in the Rovuma basin offshore Mozambique is going according to plan, with the firm continuing to target the production of the first LNG cargo before year-end.
Author: CK

Title: Moscow approves Mitsui's 12.5% stake in new Sakhalin Energy firm
Description: Japanese trading firm Mitsui says it has received approval from the Russian government for a 12.5% share in the newly established operator of Russia’s Sakhalin 2 project, Sakhalin Energy LLC.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgaria plans to double gas offtake from Greece’s Alexandroupolis terminal
Description: Bulgaria will double the amount of natural gas it will import annually through Greece’s yet-to-be-completed 4.04 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG terminal from 500 m m3 per year to 1 bn m3 per year, as part of an effort to achieve gas supply diversification and supply security
Author: DE

Title: TotalEnergies retains Yamal LNG contract despite Russian gas field stake sale
Description: TotalEnergies will continue to honour its long-term contracts with the Novatek-operated 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant in Russia, despite it selling its 49% stake in Russia’s Termokarstovoye to Novatek
Author: DE

Title: First Poland-Slovakia gas pipeline interconnector begins operations
Description: Gas transmission operators Slovakia’s Eustream and Poland’s Gaz-System have completed construction of the first Poland-Slovakia bi-directional gas pipeline interconnector, with the connection of their gas grids seen helping the two countries achieve energy supply security
Author: DE

Title: Nord Stream 1 flows halted from today for three days as part of maintenance
Description: Russia’s state-controlled producer Gazprom has halted gas flows through Nord Stream 1, its only direct pipeline with the European Union. Flows will be suspended for three days as part of a broader 10-day maintenance for the pipeline’s compressor unit
Author: DE

Title: Bulgaria seeks gas for delivery in late September through auction
Description: Bulgaria’s gas supplier Bulgargaz EAD is looking to buy 23 GWh a day of gas (2.1 m m3) to be delivered on Sep. 26-27 through an auction on the Balkan Gas Hub exchange market on Sep. 5
Author: DE

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers nine September to December LNG cargoes from Sakhalin LNG
Description: New Russian firm Sakhalin Energy LLC has issued a tender to sell nine cargoes loading between September and December at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port, making it the second tender the firm has issued since taking over the plant's operations last month. The new tender closes on Sep. 6.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG begins maintenance on one train this month, offers two October cargoes
Description: Oman LNG has taken offline the first of its three LNG trains at the 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG plant for planned maintenance starting today. The duration of the maintenance is unclear. The firm has also issued a tender closing on Sep. 4 to sell two cargoes for delivery to the Middle East and Asia in October.
Author: CK

Title: Mitsubishi gets Russia’s nod for a share in Sakhalin Energy LLC
Description: Japanese trader Mitsubishi has received approval from the Russian government to buy a share in Sakhalin Energy LLC, which recently took over the operations of the Sakhalin 2 project that includes the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Germany charters its fifth FSRU for LNG imports; Wilhelmshaven to be installation site
Description: Germany has chartered its fifth floating storage and regasification unit for the import of LNG, underscoring its determination to quickly wean itself off Russian pipeline gas purchases and strengthening its plan to ensure energy supply security for the country.
Author: CK

Title: Shell will not take a stake in Sakhalin LNG LLC; assessing options regarding LNG contract
Description: Shell has decided that will not acquire a stake in Russia’s newly created Sakhalin Energy LLC, which has taken over the obligations and assets of Sakhalin Energy Investment Co. in which it was a shareholder.
Author: CK

Title: Gas flows through Nord Stream 1 to restart on Sep. 3 as planned after scheduled halt
Description: Russian gas supplies to the European Union through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline are set to resume as planned on Sep 3, following a three-day suspension that began on Aug. 31. The pipeline will deliver 1.3 m m3 of gas an hour, or around 32.2 m m3 a day, which is the level at which they stood before flows were halted, according to the Nord Stream website
Author: DE

Title: Budapest buys more Russian gas despite the European Commission's goal to cut ties with Moscow
Description: Hungary has secured additional Russian pipeline gas supplies from Russia’s state-controlled producer Gazprom to ensure supply security and avoid shortages this winter. The move highlights the lack of agreement among European Union member states on the European Commission’s plan to end the bloc’s dependence on Russian gas
Author: DE

Title: Russia halts Nord Stream 1 gas flows indefinitely after planned suspension
Description: Russia will not restore gas deliveries to the European Union through its single largest export pipeline to the bloc, the 55 bn m3 a year Nord Stream 1, indefinitely extending a complete cut-off of gas supplies through the pipeline after a three-day scheduled suspension that ended yesterday.
Author: DE

Title: One LNG ship heads to Prelude FLNG as Shell works on plant restart
Description: An LNG tanker is sailing towards Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility with an arrival scheduled for later this week, even as market participants suggest that the plant may have suffered an electrical trip in the last one to two days that could delay the plant’s restart.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs two 20-year LNG deals for 2.5 mtpa from Commonwealth LNG
Description: Australia’s Woodside Energy has signed two 20-year supply agreements with US project developer Commonwealth LNG for a total of up to 2.5 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 8.4 mtpa plant in Cameron Parish, Louisiana. Woodside had signed a non-binding agreement in January for 2 mtpa, with an option of increasing the volume by 500,000 t a year.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs LNG deal with Uniper for supply to Europe
Description: The Singapore unit of Australia’s Woodside Energy has signed a flexible long-term agreement to supply up to 12 LNG cargoes, or a little over 0.8 mtpa, a year, from its global portfolio to Germany’s Uniper for delivery to Europe, including Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand's PTT eyes more long-term LNG contracts amid soaring spot prices, market volatility
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT expects to increase the proportion of LNG it buys on a long-term basis as the current gas price and supply crisis facing buyers has driven it to focus on ensuring supply security. And an escalation in LNG prices to all-time high levels this year and severe market volatility has made it challenging to secure cargoes on a spot basis.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG revises 72-cargo tender based on supplier feedback
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has revised the terms of its tender to buy 72 cargoes of LNG for delivery between 2023 and 2028 based on supplier feedback and extended the deadline for offer submissions to Oct. 3 from Sep. 14. Offers are expected to be valid until Oct. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Italy pushes for gas price cap ahead of EU energy ministers’ meeting this week
Description: Italy will push for a ceiling on soaring gas prices during an extraordinary meeting of the European Union’s energy ministers this week, following the latest cut in Russia’s pipeline gas supplies to the bloc.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom’s production and exports fell by 49.1 bn m3 in January-August
Description: Russia’s state-controlled Gazprom decreased its production of gas and its gas exports to countries outside of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) by the same volume in the first eight months of the year, compared to the same period last year. Its non-CIS markets include countries in the European Union, its largest export market, Turkey and China, among others
Author: DE

Title: Eni will replace half of Italy's Russian gas imports this winter, all of it by 2025
Description: Italy’s Eni expects to replace 50% of Italy’s demand for Russian gas with gas and LNG from its own portfolio this winter, and it sees this proportion rising to 80% next winter and to 100% in 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom and CNPC agree on ruble, yuan payments for Russian gas deliveries
Description: Russia’s state-controlled Gazprom and China’s state-owned CNPC have agreed on a change in payment currency to rubles or Chinese yuan from US dollars for Russian gas deliveries through the Power of Siberia 1 (PoS1) pipeline.
Author: CK

Title: Second FSRU arrives at Eemshaven LNG ahead of first LNG delivery this week
Description: The 25,000 m3 Eemshaven LNG arrived in the Dutch port of Eemshaven on Sep. 6, making it the second of the two floating storage and regasification units (FSRU) that the Netherlands has chartered for Eemshaven to boost LNG import capacity and help mitigate the impact of Russian gas supply disruptions
Author: DE

Title: Idku LNG terminal resumes operations after planned shutdown: Petronas
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Egyptian LNG, or Idku, plant in Egypt has returned to operations following a suspension of operations since late June.
Author: CK

Title: High LNG prices favour increased coal use in emerging countries; a decarbonization setback
Description: The inexorable rise in gas and LNG prices this year has posed a threat to gas consumption in developing countries, encouraging increased use of coal that could set back progress towards achieving decarbonization.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria says technical, security issues restrict LNG exports to Europe this winter
Description: Ongoing technical and national security issues that have weighed on Nigeria’s LNG exports this year will prevent the country from shipping more to Europe this winter, despite the region’s urgent need for alternative gas supply sources to replace Russian pipeline gas
Author: DE

Title: Germany hopes to replace four-fifths of Nord Stream 1’s capacity by 2024
Description: Germany hopes to replace most of the 55bn m3 Nord Stream 1 pipeline capacity by 2024 with 40 bn m3 of alternative gas supplies including imports coming via pipeline interconnections with its European Union neighbours, with this improving the country’s gas supply prospects
Author: DE

Title: EU ministers to explore gas price caps next week, no consensus yet on scope
Description: Energy ministers of the European Union on Friday gave a mandate to the European Commission to present a strategy to tackle the current energy crisis and unprecedented highs in gas prices that the bloc is facing
Author: DE

Title: Oil and gas industry executives call for a more consistent, long-term energy policy
Description: Oil and gas industry executives are calling on governments to adopt a stable and long-term approach to energy security to avoid reversing policy decisions that are detrimental to the environment and business objectives
Author: DE

Title: Eni strengthens its Algerian gas supply position with purchase of BP’s upstream business
Description: Italy’s Eni has acquired BP’s upstream business in Algeria, including stakes in the country’s two largest gas fields, which increases its gas assets in the country and will contribute to meeting Europe's growing demand for gas amid Russian supply curtailments
Author: CK

Title: Novatek's Arctic LNG 2 to start commercial operations in December 2023
Description: Russian independent producer Novatek's Arctic LNG 2 liquefaction plant is set to start in December 2023. This is the largest LNG export project expected to come online next year
Author: DE

Title: US Cheniere eyes long-term export capacity increase to 90 mtpa
Description: US leading LNG producer and exporter Cheniere has identified opportunities to increase exports from its Sabine Pass and Corpus Christi LNG plants to around 90 mtpa in the long term, without giving details on the timeline
Author: DE

Title: Finland’s FSRU will start commercial operations in January with two slots
Description: Finland’s Gasgrid has indicated the capacity that will be offered after the commissioning of its FSRU. The vessel is set to start commercial operations with two slots in January 2023. Finland has turned to LNG to replace some of the lost Russian pipeline volumes
Author: DE

Title: Nigeria's new NNPC Ltd. ready for partnership with the EU on gas supply
Description: The Nigerian gas and oil producer wants to offer the European Union (EU) alternative supplies to Russian pipeline gas. The EU has been trying to end its reliance on Russian pipeline gas by increasing imports from non-Russian supply sources and cutting its gas consumption. NNPC's recent change of legal structure means the company is more flexible with its strategy and it is looking for partners.
Author: DE

Title: French operators say stock levels is a key factor to meet peak winter demand
Description: French gas stocks must be preserved as long as possible and LNG terminals must have as much LNG as possible in their tanks to help face peak demand days this winter, French transmission system operators GRTgaz and Terega assessed in their winter outlook
Author: DE

Title: Germany’s Uniper looks for more LNG supplies to fill FSRUs starting in 2023
Description: German Uniper is looking for more LNG supplies for two of the future German FSRUs. The firm is turning to LNG to replace some of the lost Russian pipeline supplies
Author: DE

Title: EU energy market intervention does not include gas price cap
Description: A cap on the price of gas in the European Union’s internal gas market was not part of the European Commission’s proposed emergency market intervention. On top of the measures announced, the commission is considering establishing an EU price index for LNG because it considers that the current EU benchmark for gas, the Dutch TTF, is not up to the current market situation
Author: DE

Title: Gazprom's production and exports dropped by over 50 bn m3 between January and mid-September
Description: Russia’s state-controlled Gazprom decreased its production of gas and its gas exports to countries outside of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) by over 50 bn m3 in the first eight and a half months of the year, compared to the same period last year. Its non-CIS markets include countries in the European Union, its largest export market, Turkey and China, among others
Author: DE

Title: Gazprom's Portovaya LNG plant could receive a second vessel
Description: A second LNG vessel could potentially come to load a cargo at Gazprom’s 1.5 mtpa Portovaya LNG export plant which started operations a week ago. The plant was launched amid a severe energy crisis in the nearby European Union where gas prices are soaring. Yet the plant's first export cargo picked up a week ago looks to be heading for Asia
Author: DE

Title: Russia to connect second gas field to Russia-China gas pipeline this winter
Description: On Oct. 25, gas from the east-Siberian Kovyktinskoye gas field will be sent into the Kovykta-Chayanda pipeline which then connects to the Russia-China Power of Siberia pipeline. Kovyktinskoye will be put into operation in the second half of December, thus increasing the resource base in eastern Siberia for exports to China. Russia's increasing its resource base for exports to China comes as Moscow drastically reduced piped exports to the EU, its historically main export market
Author: DE

Title: New Greece-Bulgaria gas pipeline to start commercial operations on Oct. 1
Description: The new 3 bn m3 gas pipeline is key to increasing Bulgaria's diversity and security of supply as it will give it greater access to Azeri piped gas and global LNG supplies reaching Greece. Bulgaria recently doubled its capacity bookings at Greece's future Alexandroupolis LNG terminal to further increase diversity and security of supply
Author: DE

Title: French TotalEnergies approved FID on Argentina’s Fenix gas field starting operations in 2025
Description: The French oil and gas giant TotalEnergies has approved the final investment decision (FID) for the Fenix gas field in southern Argentina. Production from the field is planned to start in early 2025 with 10 m m3 per day. The Argentinian FID comes as the French firm is divesting some of its Russian assets
Author: DE

Title: New Dutch Eemshaven floating terminal started sending gas into the grid
Description: The Netherlands’ new Eeemshaven floating LNG terminal started sending gas into the Dutch national grid, the terminal’s operator EeemsEnergyTerminal announced on Sep. 19. The terminal was commissioned to help the Netherlands diversify away from Russia and replace some of the lost Russian pipeline volumes
Author: DE

Title: Germany nationalises Uniper
Description: The German government will take over 99% of German gas supplier Uniper as part of a rescue package. Uniper, which is Germany's largest importer of Russian gas, and Germany, which is the EU's largest importer of Russian gas, have been greatly affected by the cuts in Russian pipeline supplies via the Russia-Germany Nord Stream 1 pipeline
Author: DE

Title: Bulgaria’s Bulgargaz announced tenders for delivery in November, December, 2023 and 2024-2034
Description: Bulgarian national gas supplier Bulgargaz is seeking 1.5 TWh for November, 2 TWh for December, 16 TWh for 2023 and 10.6 TWh per year in 2024-2034, and announced tenders for these periods. Bulgaria has increasingly relied on LNG since April when Russia, its historically main supplier, stopped delivering pipeline gas
Author: DE

Title: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas started building the Lubmin FSRU
Description: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas started the construction of the 4.5 bn m3 Lubmin floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) on Sep. 20. This is one of the five FSRUs under development in Germany. The country is trying to replace lost Russian pipeline volumes, which used to represent most of the German gas supply before the current energy crisis
Author: DE

Title: Market participants advise against a potential price cap on all EU gas imports
Description: It will be difficult and unadvisable to implement a price cap on Russian pipeline gas but also on all gases coming into the European Union, market participants told Kpler. They warned that price caps risk further reducing gas supplies to the bloc including global LNG which could find more attractive markets with higher prices
Author: DE

Title: The UK lifted its moratorium on shale gas production in England
Description: On Sep. 22, the UK’s government lifted the moratorium on shale gas production in England to bolster the country’s energy security amid a severe energy crisis facing Europe. Over 100 new licenses for shale gas and oil exploration including for new blocs of the UK's continental shelf are expected to emerge as part of this effort
Author: DE

Title: Typhoons delay several LNG deliveries in Southeast Asia
Description: Seven vessels scheduled to deliver a total of 1 m m3 of LNG in Japan and South Korea have been delayed by the Nanmadol and other typhoons this week. Two more tropical storms are active near the coasts of Japan and the Philippines, with a dozen vessels either sailing in their forecast trajectory or waiting nearby, indicating more deliveries could potentially be affected
Author: DE

Title: Norway’s largest LNG export plant is back to pre-shutdown export levels
Description: Exports from the 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG export plant are back to the levels they were before the plant was forced to shut down in September 2020
Author: DE

Title: TotalEnergies partners QatarEnergy in North Field South LNG expansion project
Description: QatarEnergy has selected TotalEnergies as its first international partner in the North Field South project, its second LNG expansion project that will boost Qatar’s LNG production capacity to 126 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Norway and Poland agree on 10-year pipeline gas supply from January 2023
Description: Norwegian oil and gas firm Equinor will supply around 2.4 bn m3 to Poland’s PGNiG for ten years through the planned Baltic Pipe gas pipeline that will start operations in January 2023
Author: DE

Title: Deutsche ReGas plans to lift Lubmin FSRU capacity to 13.5 bn m3 per year
Description: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas plans to increase the capacity of the 4.5 bn m3 per year floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) it intends to install at its planned LNG import terminal in Lubmin to 13.5 bn m3 as part of a second phase of the project
Author: DE

Title: Construction to begin on planned Stade LNG import terminal; commissioning in end-2023
Description: Construction will begin on an LNG jetty and other infrastructure at the energy port in Germany’s Hanseatic city of Stade, which will facilitate the installation of a floating storage and regasification unit and the start of LNG receipts and delivery of regasified LNG to the German grid from the end of 2023.
Author: CK

Title: Pipeline leak cuts feed gas supplies to Bonny LNG, paring LNG output
Description: A leak on a gas pipeline in Nigeria's Bayelsa state has cut feed gas supply to the country's 22.2 mtpa Bonny LNG plant, with this, in turn, reducing the plant's LNG exports that have mainly headed to Europe this year
Author: DE

Title: Germany to receive its first LNG cargo in late December at Brunsbüttel from ADNOC
Description: Germany is expected to begin LNG imports in late December, thanks to a deal signed between German energy firm RWE and Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC for the delivery of one LNG cargo at the Brunsbüttel LNG import terminal from ADNOC.
Author: CK

Title: Pressure drop at Nord Stream pipelines stokes fears of cuts to other pipeline flows to Europe
Description: A sharp drop in gas pressure since yesterday in Russia’s largest export pipelines to Europe, Nord Stream 1 and Nord Stream 2, is unlikely to change the gas supply picture for the European Union in the near future as both these 55 bn m3 a year pipelines are not in operation
Author: DE

Title: Sweden confirms “deliberate acts” caused Nord Stream pipeline gas leaks
Description: Sweden has called the leaks detected along the Nord Stream 1 and Nord Stream 2 gas pipelines earlier this week “deliberate attacks” and has launched a preliminary investigation into the possibility that they were a result of sabotage
Author: DE

Title: Europe will receive less Russian pipeline gas if Gazprom sanctions Naftogaz
Description: The risk of further cuts to Russian pipeline gas supplies to the European Union has increased since yesterday after Russia’s state-owned gas producer Gazprom warned that Russia could impose sanctions against Ukraine’s Naftogaz
Author: DE

Title: Deutsche ReGas aims to install a second FSRU to lift regasification capacity at Lubmin
Description: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas intends to bring a second floating storage and regasification unit online in December 2023 at its planned LNG import facility in Lubmin, in Germany, significantly boosting regasification capacity at the terminal
Author: DE

Title: TotalEnergies eyes a 40% LNG production increase by 2030 with non-Russian assets
Description: French oil and gas giant TotalEnergies plans to boost its LNG production with non-Russian assets by 40% by 2030 compared to 2021 levels. Following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in late February, the French firm has aimed to exit its Russian activities that are not essential to the security of supply of the European Union
Author: DE

Title: New Greece-Bulgaria gas pipeline receives licences to launch on 1 October
Description: The Greece-Bulgaria IGB pipeline received the final permits needed to start commercial operations on Oct. 1 as planned. The pipeline is poised to increase Bulgaria’s diversity and security of supply by giving it greater access to global LNG arriving at Greek terminals and Azeri piped gas arriving in Greece
Author: DE

Title: IEA chief expects Europe to get through the winter, sees a tight LNG market in 2023
Description: High gas storage levels, higher LNG imports and increased pipeline gas supplies from other sources may help to tide Europe over the coming winter despite Russian pipeline supply cuts, but the LNG market may be tighter in 2023 than this year as geopolitical frictions continue to pose a challenge to buyers, the International Energy Agency’s executive director Fatih Birol said.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s Gasgrid announces future FSRU’s available slots for Q1-Q3 2023
Description: Finnish grid operator Gasgrid announced its future LNG import terminal can receive two cargos in January 2023, and two to three cargos per month in February-September. The terminal is crucial to the Finnish diversity and security of supply as Finland received most of its gas from Russia until supplies stopped in May, and has since then relied on a single import pipeline with Estonia.
Author: DE

Title: First export cargo from Russia’s Portovaya liquefaction plant heads to Greece
Description: The first cargo coming from the Russian Portovaya LNG liquefaction plant is heading to Greece’s Revithoussa import terminal. The cargo had previously been heading towards the Suez canal indicating it was initially going to supply the Asian market. Asia has been the top destination of global LNG exports so far this year despite Europe's severe gas shortage driving European prices to unprecedented levels
Author: DE

Title: Russia could send gas to Europe via one of the two Nord Stream 2 lines
Description: Russia could send gas to the European Union (EU) via the Stream 2 pipeline if Germany authorised it. Last week, explosions generated leaks on three of the four lines composing the Nord Stream 1 and Nord Stream 2 export pipeline system between Russia and the EU, but one line could potentially operate safely
Author: DE

Title: UK leads rebound in Europe's September LNG imports; US shipments rise
Description: LNG imports into Europe rebounded slightly in September after four months of consecutive declines, as countries in the region try to secure more supplies before winter amid a gas crisis caused by significant cuts in pipeline gas supplies from Russia.
Author: CK

Title: LNG arrivals at Dunkerque overtake Gate’s ahead of French piped exports to Germany
Description: France’s Dunkerque LNG import terminal is on track to receive more cargoes than the Netherlands’ Gate terminal this month as France prepares to start sending pipeline gas to Germany from next week. Rising discounts of French piped gas prices to the Dutch and German equivalent products also reinforced Dunkerque’s attractiveness
Author: DE

Title: Russian pipeline gas supplies to Italy via Austria resume
Description: Russian pipeline gas deliveries to Italy via Austria resumed on Oct. 5 after the parties involved resolved issues arising from new legislation in Austria. Russian piped supplies represented a quarter of Italy’s gas consumption in 2017-2021, and gas provided over 40% of Italy’s energy in 2017-2020, underscoring the importance of Russian gas in Italy’s energy mix. Like the rest of the European Union, Italy has turned to global LNG to ensure security of supply from this year
Author: DE

Title: Exports from Nigeria's Bonny LNG plant rise above levels seen prior to sabotage on feeding pipeline
Description: Nigeria’s 22.2 mtpa Bonny LNG liquefaction plant had stopped exporting for several days at the end of September after a feeding pipeline had been hacksaw cut, but exports have now resumed slightly above what they were before the sabotage of the pipe. Spain is still the top destination of Bonny-originated cargos
Author: DE

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one second-half November LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Nov. 21-25 to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Bintulu LNG expected to lose up to three cargoes a month due to gas pipeline leak
Description: A leak at the Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline in Malaysia that supplies feed gas to the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Sarawak is expected to lead to losses of around three LNG cargoes a month, potentially straining an already tightly supplied market a month before winter begins.
Author: CK

Title: UK’s National Grid warns of blackouts this winter if there is not enough gas to run gas-fired plants
Description: Great Britain could face power blackouts this winter if it cannot import electricity from continental Europe and at the same time does not have enough gas to run gas-fired power plants. In this worst-case scenario, Great Britain’s reliance on LNG would increase significantly
Author: DE

Title: Germany’s EnBW secures more LNG from Venture Global’s Plaquemines, CP2 projects
Description: Germany’s EnBW has agreed to buy 0.5 mtpa more of LNG from US project developer Venture Global’s Plaquemines and CP2 LNG projects in Louisiana over a 20-year period, increasing the volume purchased from Venture Global in June to 2 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Three LNG vessels to call at Freeport by 2H Nov, signalling targeted November restart on track
Description: A few LNG vessels have signalled their arrival by the second half of November at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island in Texas, suggesting that the shuttered plant may be on course to restart next month.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas declares force majeure on gas supply to MLNG Dua at Bintulu; LNG deliveries impacted
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas has declared force majeure on gas supply to the MLNG Dua project that is part of the 29.3 mtpa nine-train Bintulu LNG export complex in Sarawak, Malaysia, due to a leak at the Sabah-Sarawak gas pipeline.
Author: CK

Title: EU replaced 84% of lost Russian gas supplies with LNG and non-Russian pipeline gas
Description: So far this year, the European Union (EU) has surpassed its target for non-Russian pipeline gas imports but has only met 60% of its LNG import target. The bloc’s supply gap resulting from the Russian supply cuts looks to grow significantly next year and will be more difficult to fill amid a lack of significant increase in global LNG supplies
Author: DE

Title: EU targets for gas consumption and extra LNG imports lag behind
Description: The combined gas consumption of European Union member states representing half of the bloc's normal consumption fell by 9.5% in August against the five-year average. This means EU countries will need to make more important cuts to their consumption to meet their 15% cut  target. Another target to ensure the bloc's security of supply is to boost its LNG imports by an extra 50 bn m3 this year, but the bloc is also lagging behind to meet this target
Author: DE

Title: More November LNG cargoes emerge amid partial LNG supply disruption at Bintulu
Description: LNG supplies for delivery to Asia in November are ample as tenders from projects in Australia and Egypt have expanded the spot supply pool, potentially mitigating any impact in the short term of reduced LNG exports from Malaysia’s 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility.
Author: CK

Title: Mytilineos and DEPA to supply Bulgaria via Revithoussa in November
Description: Bulgargaz selected Mytilineos SA and DEPA Commercial SA to supply LNG to Bulgaria in November via the Greek Revithoussa import terminal. Bulgaria has increasingly relied on LNG supplies since April when Russia, its historically main supplier, stopped delivering piped gas
Author: DE

Title: Coral South LNG export plant to receive its first vessel on Friday
Description: A BP-owned vessel will arrive at the Coral South liquefaction plant on Oct. 14, marking the start of operations at Mozambique’s sole export plant. The launch of Coral south adds Mozambique to the group of LNG exporters
Author: DE

Title: Finnish FSRU starting in January is central to Finland and Baltics’ supply
Description: The new FSRU starting in January at the port of Inkoo in south Finland will be central to Finland and the Baltics’ security and diversity of gas supply, potentially covering more than Finland and Estonia’s combined annual gas consumption
Author: DE

Title: SembCorp secures five-year LNG supply from TotalEnergies for Singapore, starting 2025
Description: Singapore’s SembCorp Energy has secured a five-year supply of LNG from TotalEnergies’ global LNG portfolio to supply Singapore, starting from 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Eemshaven operates at near-full capacity in its first month
Description: The new Dutch LNG terminal received just short of 1 m m3 of LNG in its first month of operations, meaning it is already working close to its design capacity. Since its launch, the terminal received only US-originated cargos, mostly from Shell who looks to remain the main supplier of cargos in October
Author: DE

Title: Eni delivers first of several additional LNG cargoes to Panigaglia, boosting Italy's winter stocks
Description: Eni has delivered the first of a series of LNG cargoes to the 2.5 mtpa Panigaglia LNG receiving terminal in the La Spezia province in Italy’s Liguria region, aimed at strengthening and diversifying gas supplies to Italy before the start of the coming winter season.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s Brunsbuttel LNG import terminal fully booked
Description: The initial potential capacity at Germany’s future Brunsbuttel LNG terminal is fully booked. Brunsbuttel is one of five LNG import terminals developed by the German government in cooperation with national suppliers RWE, Uniper, and EnBW to guarantee the country’s gas supply after its historically main supplier, Russia, slashed supplies earlier this year
Author: DE

Title: European Commission to present gas price index, joint gas purchase proposals next week
