The emergency legislation started applying in August 2022 to help the bloc refill its gas stocks and mitigate its unprecedented gas shortage following the Russian pipeline supply cuts.
Author: DE

Title: Excelsior LNG FSRU to operate as Germany's second Wilhelmshaven-based floating terminal
Description: Excelerate Energy's 138,000 m3 Excelsior LNG floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) will operate as Germany's second Wilhelmshaven-based floating terminal from the third quarter of the year, after being deployed in Argentina in June-August. The Excelsior is one of seven FSRUs being deployed in Germany between this winter and the next to help replace the lost Russian pipeline supplies as fast as possible.
Author: DE

Title: Chinese domestic gas prices shrug off planned maintenance on Power of Siberia 1 pipeline
Description: An eight-day scheduled maintenance on the 38 billion m3 a year Power of Siberia 1 gas pipeline that delivers gas from eastern Siberia in Russia to China has not impacted Chinese domestic LNG prices as downstream demand continues to be weak.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Dhamra LNG terminal to receive Qatari LNG commissioning cargo tomorrow
Description: The Adani Total-operated 5 mtpa Dhamra LNG terminal in India’s eastern state of Odisha is poised to receive an LNG cargo from Qatar tomorrow, with this seen kicking off the start of commissioning operations at the country’s newest LNG receiving facility.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global delays commercial operations start at Calcasieu Pass due to “extensive repairs”
Description: US LNG producer Venture Global has delayed the start of commercial operations at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana due to ‘extensive repairs’ needed on the plant’s heat recovery steam generators, indefinitely lengthening its term buyers’ wait to receive their contracted cargoes and potentially increasing their import costs if they seek alternative supplies in the meantime.
Author: CK

Title: France’s March LNG imports halved by strikes; but Europe's receipts rise
Description: France’s imports of LNG this month have fallen substantially against month- and year-earlier levels, thinned by almost four-week-long work stoppages at its four LNG receiving terminals due to industrial action.
Author: CK

Title: EU LNG imports in March set to rise by 5% from February amid increased FSRU utilisation
Description: LNG imports into the European Union are set to rise in March both compared to the previous month and the previous year, with increasing volumes delivered to the bloc’s new FSRUs as the facilities ramp up their utilisation. LNG remains the main replacement for the lost pipeline supplies from Russia which used to be the EU’s top supplier prior to last year.
Author: DE

Title: ACER launches daily EU LNG benchmark price
Description: The European Union's Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) launched a daily LNG benchmark price on Mar. 31. This is meant to help improve market transparency on the price of LNG imports into the bloc. The EU's reliance on LNG has increased as the union scrambles for gas supplies to replace the lost Russian pipeline deliveries.
Author: DE

Title: Angola LNG ramps up output as loading issues are resolved
Description: Operations at Angola LNG's 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant are normalising after problems with cargo loadings forced the plant to reduce its output and cancel issued tenders two weeks ago.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more May-September LNG cargoes to bolster domestic supplies
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT is seeking more cargoes to fill LNG import slots at its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong between May and September through a tender closing today.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG resumes tender issuances, offers one cargo for delivery in April
Description: Angola LNG has issued a new tender to sell one cargo that is deliverable from Apr. 12-28 from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant, resuming its tender issuances after withdrawing its offer of two cargoes due to loading issues at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports hit 12-month high in March as Freeport contributes to production ramp-up
Description: US LNG exports have risen to a 12-month high in March, with a ramp-up in output at the recently restarted 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas contributing to an overall increase in production.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P’s Philippines LNG terminal to begin commissioning upon arrival of ADNOC cargo in 1H April
Description: The AG&P-operated 5 mtpa Philippines LNG terminal in Batangas Bay is poised to begin commissioning operations in the first half of this month, following the arrival of a cargo from the 5.8 mtpa ADNOC LNG plant on Das Island in Abu Dhabi.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Inpex targets FID for Abadi LNG project in the late 2020s
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex aims to take a final investment decision on the 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project in Indonesia in the late 2020s, with LNG production to start in the early 2030s.
Author: CK

Title: Dunkerque LNG to reduce sendout for 24 hours from Thursday on strike action
Description: Dunkerque LNG will reduce send-out to 70 GWh a day from its 9.6 mtpa Dunkirk LNG receiving terminal for 24 hours from 6 am on Apr. 6 until 6 am on Apr. 7 due to strike action by its employees.
Author: CK

Title: Pavilion Energy ships first small-scale LNG cargo to Hangjiaxin; arrival this week
Description: Chinese city gas distributor Zhejiang Hangjiaxin Clean Energy is poised to receive its first small-scale LNG cargo from Singapore’s Pavilion Energy by the end of this week, with the cargo’s arrival marking the start of a 0.5 mtpa term supply agreement between the two firms.
Author: CK

Title: French LNG strikes deepen LNG discounts to TTF amid scarce import slots in Europe
Description: The discounts to the Dutch TTF gas hub price for LNG deliveries to Europe have deepened amid continuing strikes at France’s LNG receiving terminals as available import slots remain scarce with cargoes diverted from these terminals staying within the region.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P’s Philippines LNG terminal to receive first LNG cargo after ship-to-ship LNG transfer
Description: AG&P’s 5 mtpa Philippines LNG terminal in Batangas Bay is expected to receive a commissioning cargo in the coming days, following a ship-to-ship transfer of LNG currently taking place in Subic Bay between the 161,900 m3 Golar Glacier LNG tanker and the 137,540 m3 LNG carrier Ish.
Author: CK

Title: Hong Kong’s new LNG import terminal poised for startup with imminent arrival of FSRU
Description: The world’s largest floating storage regasification unit is scheduled to arrive in Hong Kong later this week, with its arrival marking the impending start of operations at Hong Kong’s first LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender for more May to September LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued another tender to buy cargoes for delivery between May and September to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong after buying only prompt deliveries through a recently closed tender. Its new tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy picks Sinopec as North Field East LNG project partner; first Asian shareholder
Description: QatarEnergy has selected China’s state-owned Sinopec as a shareholder in its 32 mtpa North Field East LNG project, making the Chinese firm the project’s first Asian shareholder.
Author: CK

Title: Vopak to take 50% stake in Gasunie’s EemsEnergy LNG terminal in the Netherlands
Description: Dutch infrastructure firm Vopak has signed an agreement with Gasunie to take a 50% stake in the EemsEnergy LNG terminal in the Netherlands. The transaction is expected to be completed by Oct. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Vopak scraps plan to invest in Hong Kong FSRU due to LNG terminal project delay
Description: Dutch infrastructure firm Vopak is no longer planning to invest in a firm that owns the 263,000 m3 Bauhinia Spirit floating storage regasification unit that will be installed at Hong Kong’s new LNG import terminal, attributing its decision to the project’s delay.
Author: CK

Title: Montoir, Fos Cavaou continue to keep more than half of France’s LNG import capacity offline
Description: The recent return to operations of France’s 1.2 mtpa Fos Tonkin LNG receiving terminal after a month-long strike-induced shutdown has contributed to the country’s LNG receipts this month. But, over half its import capacity is still offline with two terminals yet to receive cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks one second-half May cargo for Dhamra; terminal commissioning seen on track
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail is seeking one cargo for delivery in the second half of May to the Adani Total-operated 5 mtpa Dhamra LNG receiving terminal currently undergoing commissioning. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: PTT tender award reflects weak prompt LNG demand; low prompt price may create buying interest
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT may have netted the year’s lowest price for a spot LNG cargo this week, with this possibly creating some buying interest among other Asian LNG buyers.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s JBIC agrees to 80 billion yen loan to Chugoku Electric for LNG imports, energy security
Description: The Japan Bank for International Cooperation has agreed to loan 80 billion Japanese yen ($604 million) to Japanese utility Chugoku Electric Power to support its imports of LNG and contribute to stable power supply and energy security for the country.
Author: CK

Title: LNG cargo offers from Egypt and Australia add to spot supply availability for May and June
Description: State-owned firms Kufpec and EGAS have added to spot supply availability for May and June, with their tenders to sell one cargo each closing tomorrow and on Apr. 19, respectively.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina seeks June-August LNG cargoes for Bahia Blanca
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Enarsa has issued a tender to buy a total of eight LNG cargoes for delivery to its 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminal between June and August. The tender closes on Apr. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Montoir, Fos Cavaou receive first LNG ships in over a month; France’s terminals all online
Description: The Elengy-operated 8 mtpa Montoir and 6.8 mtpa Fos Cavaou LNG terminals received their first LNG vessels in over a month this weekend, marking the return to operations of the remaining half of France’s LNG receiving terminals since they halted operations due to industrial action in early March.
Author: CK

Title: Full transfer of LNG to AG&P’s Philippines LNG floating storage unit is underway
Description: The full transfer of LNG from the 161,900 m3 Golar Glacier LNG tanker to the 137,540 m3 Ish LNG tanker is underway in Subic Bay, paving the way for the start of operations of the Philippines’ first LNG import facility, AG&P’s 5 mtpa Philippines LNG terminal in Batangas Bay.
Author: CK

Title: Tecnicas Reunidas-led group wins contract to develop Stade; commissioning planned for 2027
Description: A consortium led by Spanish engineering firm Tecnicas Reunidas has won an engineering, procurement and construction contract to develop Hanseatic Energy Hub’s proposed 13.3 billion m3 a year land-based LNG import terminal in Stade, located in Germany’s northwest state of Lower Saxony.
Author: CK

Title: Darwin LNG offers one cargo loading from end-April to early May
Description: The Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory has issued a tender to sell one cargo that will load between Apr. 25 and May 4. The tender closes on Apr. 21.
Author: CK

Title: Brazil is poised to receive second LNG cargo for the year, first cargo for Bahia
Description: Brazil is poised to receive its first LNG cargo at the Petrobras-operated 5.6 mtpa Bahia LNG receiving terminal today, making it only the second cargo that the country will receive this year.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship carrying first cargo for Argentina’s Bahia Blanca alters course for the UK’s Grain
Description: An LNG vessel destined for arrival at Argentina’s 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminal in early May has signalled a change in direction and is heading towards the UK’s 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG import terminal even as Argentina’s state-owned Enarsa is due to close a tender today to buy more winter cargoes for delivery to Bahia Blanca.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG expected to recover from output dip by weekend
Description: Production at the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory has dipped this month, but term buyers expect a return to normal production levels by the end of the week.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail seeks second May LNG cargo after early May purchase this week
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail closes its second tender of the week for a May cargo today. The firm seeks one cargo to be delivered on May 19-21 to the 5 mtpa Hazira LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG’s April shipments poised to double from March, output near nameplate capacity
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas is poised to double its exports this month from a year earlier as it continues to ramp up exports after restarting production in February.
Author: CK

Title: Delfin agrees 20-year LNG supply deal for 0.6 mtpa with Hartree
Description: US project developer Delfin has agreed to supply commodities trader Hartree Partners with 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from its proposed Delfin Deepwater Port LNG export facility offshore Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: EnBW doubles long-term LNG import capacity booking at Germany’s Stade terminal
Description: EnBW has secured long-term capacity for an additional 3 bn m3 a year at the Hanseatic Energy Hub’s proposed Stade LNG receiving terminal in Germany’s northwest state of Lower Saxony, after already securing the rights to import 3 bn m3 a year of LNG at the terminal in December last year.
Author: CK

Title: Eni launches Congo LNG project, with supplies targeting Europe
Description: Eni has launched the Republic of Congo’s first LNG liquefaction project, with the output expected to contribute significantly to Europe’s energy supply security. Production is expected to begin later this year with the start of the project’s first 0.6 mtpa floating LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines LNG FSU docks at terminal to begin commissioning operations
Description: The 137,540 m3 Ish floating storage unit has arrived at AG&P’s 5 mtpa Phillippines LNG terminal in Ilijan in Batangas, where it is expected to begin commissioning the country’s first LNG import terminal. Commercial operations are expected to begin once the commissioning phase is completed.
Author: CK

Title: PetroChina agrees to buy 0.3 mtpa of LNG over five years for Haikou LNG from Petronas
Description: China’s state-owned PetroChina has concluded an LNG supply agreement with Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas to buy 0.3 mtpa of LNG over five years for delivery to the 0.6 mtpa Haikou LNG receiving terminal in Macun in Hainan’s Haikou port, according to industry participants.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers one May-June LNG cargo, boosting spot availability
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell one cargo for delivery to various locations across May 17 to June 6, adding to cargoes from Egypt, Australia and Papua New Guineas that will load in May and June. The tender closes on May 3.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s April LNG imports seen higher against year-earlier levels, more imports from Russia
Description: Turkey’s LNG imports in April are poised to halve from levels in March as the country’s demand typically softens after the winter season. But, they are set to edge higher against year-earlier levels, reflecting the recent start of the Saros LNG terminal and increased LNG receipts from Russia this year.
Author: CK

Title: Jera signs up for 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from Venture Global’s CP2 project
Description: Japan’s Jera has agreed to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from US LNG producer Venture Global’s proposed CP2 LNG project in Louisiana, adding more US LNG to its global supply portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies agrees three-year LNG supply deal with ADNOC Gas
Description: TotalEnergies has agreed a three-year LNG deal with ADNOC Gas to buy LNG, which it expects to deliver to various locations globally. The contract is valued at $1-1.2 billion under current market conditions, according to ADNOC Gas.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas seeks a June-July commissioning cargo for Thi Vai LNG terminal
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetrovietnamGas, or PV Gas, is seeking one LNG cargo for delivery in June or July to commission its 1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG Terminal in the southeastern province of Ba Rịa–Vung Tau. The tender closes on May 11.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more May to July LNG cargoes on low prices, high temperatures
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy more LNG cargoes for delivery between May and July to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal as LNG prices continue to soften and higher temperatures in the country raise demand for LNG-fired power generation and cooling purposes. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Piombino LNG set to receive first LNG cargo from Egypt, commissioning operations set to start
Description: Italy’s newest LNG receiving terminal, Piombino LNG, is poised to receive its first LNG cargo in the coming days, with commissioning operations starting thereafter to prepare the terminal to receive commercial LNG cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Hong Kong LNG terminal gears up for receipt of inaugural LNG cargo this week
Description: Hong Kong’s new LNG import terminal located east of the Soko Islands is gearing up to receive its inaugural LNG cargo this week, kicking off the final phase of commissioning operations at the offshore import facility. The terminal is the first LNG import facility in Hong Kong.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers two May LNG cargoes from Damietta
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has issued a tender to sell two cargoes loading in May at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG export facility. The tender closes on May 7.
Author: CK

Title: Eni delivers Damietta LNG cargo to commission Italy’s Piombino LNG terminal
Description: Italy’s Eni has delivered an LNG cargo from Egypt to the country’s new 5 billion m3 a year Piombino LNG receiving terminal, paving the way for the start of commissioning, followed by commercial, operations at the floating LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: EU LNG receipts hit all-time high in April, Spain leads the bloc’s imports gains
Description: LNG imports into the European Union reached a fresh high in April, with Spain leading the import gains for the second consecutive month.
Author: CK

Title: Bahia Blanca receives first LNG cargo for 2023 following arrival of FSRU
Description: Argentina’s 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminal has received its first cargo for the year to help bolster gas supplies for the country’s coming winter season. The cargo arrived just one day after the 138,000 m3 Excelsior floating storage and regasification unit berthed at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor’s Snohvit LNG plant to stay offline until May 19 due to compressor failure
Description: The Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest has shut for unplanned maintenance and is expected to return to operations on May 19.
Author: CK

Title: Output issues at Ichthys LNG lead to tender withdrawal, add to supply disruptions
Description: The Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in  Darwin has withdrawn a tender to sell one cargo for delivery in June -July because of production problems, limiting available spot supplies amid planned and unplanned maintenance at other LNG plants.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more July LNG cargoes as temperatures stay high
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has come to the market again seeking more cargoes for delivery in July amid a current heatwave in the country through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: US takes top LNG exporter spot in April, leapfrogging Australia and Qatar
Description: LNG exports from the US surged to a new high in April, putting the country in the top LNG exporter spot ahead of Australia and Qatar for only the second time since it began exporting LNG.
Author: CK

Title: EU's first international gas tender seeks offers for 11.6 bcm of pooled gas demand
Description: The European Union has launched its first international tender for joint gas purchases seeking about 11.6 billion m3 of gas, with pipeline gas demand accounting for 8.9 billion m3 and LNG demand accounting for the remaining 2.7 billion m3.
Author: CK

Title: Shell takes Prelude FLNG offline due to a trip, suspending production
Description: Shell has halted production at its 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility northeast of Broome in Western Australia due to a trip, with a restart date unclear.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor delays restart of Snohvit LNG project by two days to May 21
Description: Norway’s state-backed energy firm Equinor has pushed back the restart of its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest by two days to May 21, extending the plant’s shutdown until May 21.
Author: CK

Title: Shell restarts production at Prelude FLNG but exports have yet to resume
Description: Production at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility northeast of Broome in Western Australia has restarted after a shutdown two days ago, but exports have yet to resume.
Author: CK

Title: Jordan’s Nepco seeks one June to August LNG cargo after an almost year-long hiatus
Description: Jordan’s state-owned National Electric Power Company has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery between June 20 and Aug. 2 to its 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG import terminal. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS offers one LNG cargo loading in end-May to early June at Damietta
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering one LNG cargo that will load on May 31 to June 1 at the 5 mtpa Damietta LNG plant through a tender closing on May 18.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy’s July spot LNG cargo sales seen paring demand from China
Description: Operator Sakhalin Energy sold about four spot LNG cargoes that will load in July at its 10.8 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant in Russia last week to Chinese buyers, potentially paring spot demand that is starting to emerge from China, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Kospo signs long-term LNG deal with Cheniere for 0.4 mtpa from Sabine Pass expansion project
Description: Korean power generation firm Kospo has signed a deal with US LNG exporter Cheniere to buy 0.4 mtpa of LNG on a delivered ex-ship basis to Korea from 2027 to 2046 from the proposed Sabine Pass liquefaction expansion project, with it also including the purchase of a smaller quantity of LNG to be delivered from 2024.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy awards $10 billion engineering contract for North Field South LNG project
Description: QatarEnergy has awarded an engineering, procurement and construction contract valued at $10 billion for its planned 16 mtpa North Field South project to Tecnip Energies and Consolidated Contractors Company, marking another key milestone in the development of Qatar’s North Field expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: CORRECTION: Unplanned shutdown at Norway’s Snohvit LNG extended by one week
Description:
(Corrects the restart date to May 27 from May 28 in paragraph 1, the length of the shutdown time in paragraphs 2 and 4, and the estimated cargo losses  in paragraph 4.)

The restart of the 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest has been delayed further by about one week to May 27, prolonging the unavailability of LNG supply from the plant that has been offline since May 4 due to a compressor failure.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG offtakers await targeted restart of Train 2 by the weekend
Description: Term offtakers at the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Darwin, Australia, are eyeing a possible restart this weekend of the plant’s second train, which has been offline since early this month due to heat exchanger issues.
Author: CK

Title: Santos expects Darwin LNG could shut in up to two months; Bayu-Undan still producing
Description: The Bayu-Undan gas field in Timor-Leste continues to produce gas at a rate that allows Santos to operate its 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG export plant in Australia’s Northern Territory. But that rate is expected to fall in the next month or two to a level that no longer supports LNG production at Darwin LNG.
Author: CK

Title: South Korea’s Koen seeks five-year LNG supplies starting from 2027
Description: South Korean power utility firm Koen is seeking 0.65 mtpa of LNG to be delivered over five years from 2027 through a tender closing on June 20.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Dhamra LNG terminal receives its first commercial cargo
Description: The 165,000 m3 Seapeak Methane LNG tanker, chartered by Qatar Energy Trading, has arrived at the Adani Total 5 mtpa Dhamra LNG receiving terminal in Odisha today, marking the completion of commissioning operations and the start of commercial receipts at India’s first LNG terminal in eastern India. The cargo will also be state-owned gas distributor Gail’s first receipt at Dhamra.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Gail looks to buy 12 LNG cargoes for Dabhol through swap tender
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail has issued a tender to buy 12 cargoes for delivery to India next year while also selling the same number of cargoes from the 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG export terminal in the US. The tender closes on June 6.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s Gasum terminates piped gas agreement with Gazprom, retains LNG contract
Description: Finland’s state-owned energy firm Gasum has terminated its piped gas contract with Russia’s Gazprom Export, following negotiations between the two firms to resolve payment terms. But, its long-term LNG contract with Gazprom remains in place.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks four June-July LNG cargoes to add to earlier purchases
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery in June and July to its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in southern Thailand. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: FSRUs a preferred option to onshore LNG import terminals amid decarbonization pursuit
Description: Floating storage regasification units are increasingly likely to be the go-to choice for new LNG import projects, given their lower cost, quicker time to come online and flexibility instead of their costlier onshore alternatives as countries pursue their decarbonization goals, according to Yoshikazu Kondo, General Manager of Mitsui OSK Lines’ offshore technical division.
Author: CK

Title: Summit plans to develop a second FSRU project in Bangladesh by 2026
Description: LNG terminal operator Summit Asia Pacific plans to bring a second floating LNG import terminal online in Bangladesh in early 2026, with the new facility expected to boost the country’s LNG import capacity by 4 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: PV Gas' cargo purchase paves way for start of Vietnam's first LNG import terminal
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned gas distributor PV Gas’ recent purchase of an LNG cargo for its 1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal in Ba Ria Vung Tau province from Shell paves the way for the start of LNG imports into Vietnam’s first LNG receiving terminal by July.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria’s LNG exports seen stable in May; force majeure on upstream supplies still in place
Description: Nigeria LNG’s exports are expected to show little change in May against April and year-earlier levels, with this reflecting upstream gas supply constraints that continue to keep a force majeure on upstream supplies in place.
Author: CK

Title: Supply and price uncertainty may pose challenges to Asia’s proposed FSRU import projects
Description: A sharp drop in LNG prices this year has led to more interest in Asia for LNG import projects deploying floating storage regasification units. But, how many projects will actually come online in the next few years is unclear, with the supply and financing of FSRUs and uncertainty over LNG prices potentially posing challenges to their development.
Author: CK

Title: Norway’s Snohvit LNG plant loads first cargo after a three-week shutdown
Description: The Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant in Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest has resumed loading operations and is poised to ship its first cargo since its shutdown on May 4 due to compressor failure.
Author: CK

Title: Operations at Pluto LNG unaffected by explosion; planned maintenance underway
Description: An explosion at the Woodside-operated 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG site in Western Australia on May 26 has not impacted plant operations, with it continuing its planned maintenance at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Indonesia to shortlist potential developers of six LNG infrastructure clusters by June
Description: A unit of Indonesia’s state-owned power utility PLN expects to shortlist a handful of firms interested in developing six LNG infrastructure clusters in various locations across Indonesia by early June as part of its plan to reduce its carbon use and cost of power generation.
Author: CK

Title: Golar delays delivery of Gimi FLNG for Greater Tortue Ahmeyim project to 3Q 2023
Description: LNG midstream infrastructure firm Golar LNG has pushed back the delivery timing of its Gimi floating LNG vessel for BP’s 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim project in Senegal and Mauritania from the first half of this year to the third quarter, potentially delaying the start of LNG production at the floating plant.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor expects Snohvit LNG to resume operations on June 8
Description: Norway’s state-backed energy firm Equinor expects its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island near Hammerfest to remain offline until June 8 after halting operations on May 31 due to a gas leak.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy Trading and Petrobangla sign 15-year LNG supply deal for 1.8 mtpa
Description: QatarEnergy Trading, the LNG trading unit of state-owned energy firm QatarEnergy, has agreed to supply Bangladesh’s state-owned oil and gas firm, Petrobangla, with 1.8 mtpa of LNG over 15 years, starting from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Gas leak at Snohvit LNG stopped but LNG output remains halted
Description: Equinor has stopped a gas leak that occurred yesterday at its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest yesterday and halted LNG production. But, LNG output at the plant has yet to resume.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen seeks its first spot LNG cargo for delivery in August-September
Description: Philippines power producer First Gen will issue a tender today to buy its first spot LNG cargo for delivery to Subic Bay Freeport in the country’s Zambales province in August to September, indicating that the group’s floating storage regasification unit-based Batangas LNG receiving terminal will be gearing up to start operations soon. The tender closes on Jul. 6.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy gets Mexico export OK for Altamira LNG, eyes commercial start in August
Description: New Fortress Energy has received authorization for its 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG facility in Mexico’s Gulf Coast from the country’s energy ministry to export up to 7.8 mtpa until 2028 to Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: Enagas offers binding LNG import capacity at El Musel; second phase of open season begins
Description: Spain’s gas transmission operator Enagas is offering binding import capacity at its 5.1 mtpa El Musel LNG receiving terminal in Gijon as part of the second phase of its open season to enhance Europe’s energy supply security. The firm intends to allocate the offered capacity for logistics services on a long-term basis when the open season ends on June 30.
Author: CK

Title: Snohvit LNG to remain offline until June 7; restart brought forward by one day
Description: The 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island near Hammerfest in Norway is expected to stay offline until June 7, ending its shutdown a day earlier following a revision of its restart timeline by operator Norway’s state-backed energy firm Equinor.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG imports fall to a record low in May, continuing a declining trend
Description: Japan’s imports of LNG fell to their lowest levels in May, continuing their month-on-month downward trend since February due to soft demand and ample stocks.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor revises Snohvit LNG's restart again, delaying it by a week to June 14
Description: Norway’s state-back energy firm Equinor has pushed back the restart of its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island near Hammerfest by a week to June 14 just two days after bringing it forward by a day to June 7.
Author: CK

Title: Feed gas flows to Sabine Pass drop to two-year lows; limited impact seen on LNG exports
Description: Feed gas flows to the Cheniere-operated 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG plant in the US have fallen to a two-year low due to scheduled maintenance on a few trains and the Creole Trail gas pipeline, cutting LNG exports from the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks LNG cargoes for nine July to December import slots
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT is seeking cargoes to fill nine slots for delivery to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong between July and December amid a rise in prompt prices this week. The tender closes on June 14.
Author: CK

Title: TTF gains sideline some Asian LNG buyers as offers rise, while others look to lock in prices
Description: Gains in the Dutch TTF gas hub price have led to higher Asian LNG offers this week, scaring away some Asian buyers that were looking to take advantage of a further drop in Asian LNG prices last week to stock up on cargoes amid searing heat in some parts of the region.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s MOL to invest in Delfin Midstream, accelerating FID on first two Delfin FLNG vessels
Description: Japanese shipper Mitsui OSK Lines has agreed to make a strategic investment in US floating LNG project developer Delfin Midstream, with the investment expected to “accelerate” a final investment decision this year on two of the four FLNG vessels for the Delfin LNG project in the Gulf of Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG halts production due to unplanned shutdown
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG export plant in Lumut has halted operations due to an unplanned shutdown today,
Author: CK

Title: Darwin LNG loads fourth cargo of the year ahead of shutdown, defying expectations
Description: The Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant is poised to ship its fourth cargo this year, defying expectations that it would halt production between the end of last year and early this year to shut down and prepare for a restart in two years’ time.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan returns to spot market with two LNG tenders, seeks Oct-Feb cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has issued two tenders to buy a total of nine LNG cargoes for delivery between October and February 2024, marking a return to the spot market after an absence of almost a year.
Author: CK

Title: Higher Asian LNG offers on TTF gain may curb spot demand as buyers await a retreat
Description: A jump in the Dutch TTF gas hub price yesterday has extended its recent gains, pushing up offers further for spot cargo deliveries to Asia and potentially suppressing demand in the short term as buyers hope prices will retreat.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies agrees to buy 5.4 mtpa from Rio Grande LNG; FID for phase 1 by end-June
Description: TotalEnergies has agreed to buy 5.4 mtpa of LNG over 20 years on a free-on-board basis from the first phase of NextDecade’s proposed 27 mtpa five-train Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas, with this a prelude to an anticipated final investment decision on the project’s first phase, encompassing its first three LNG trains, by month-end.
Author: CK

Title: Yamal LNG ships first cargo for the year to Asia through the Northern Sea Route
Description: Novatek’s 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant in Sabetta, northwest Siberia, has shipped a cargo that is in the East Siberian Sea and heading towards the Chukchi Sea, signalling the start of shipments through the Northern Sea Route that significantly cuts the journey time from Yamal to Asia.
Author: CK

Title: PTT partially awards July-December LNG tender amid Asian LNG price rebound
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has partially awarded its tender to buy LNG cargoes to fill nine LNG import slots between July and December at its 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal, continuing a buying streak since the start of the year despite a recent rebound in Asian LNG prices.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tanker diverts to Freeport from Snohvit despite restart
Description: The 174,000 m3 LNG Enterprise LNG tanker has diverted from the Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island near Hammerfest, despite the Norwegian plant’s restart yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG restarts production, start-up activities to last until June 18
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG plant in Lumut has restarted operations two days after an unplanned shutdown forced it to halt production. The plant operator expects activities for a safe restart to continue until the weekend.
Author: CK

Title: Enagas seeks an end-June to early July cargo to commission El Musel LNG receiving terminal
Description: Spanish energy firm and gas transmission operator Enagas is seeking one cargo for delivery between June 30 and Jul. 6 to commission its 5.1 mtpa El Musel LNG receiving terminal in Gijon, indicating that the terminal is on track to start in July.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Regas offers binding capacity from February 2024 at planned Mukran terminal
Description: German private LNG terminal operator Deutsche Regas will offer binding long-term import capacity at the planned Mukran floating LNG receiving terminal from February 2024, ahead of the start of the second phase of operations of the Deutsche Ostsee terminal that will move from Lubmin to Mukran from December.
Author: CK

Title: Snohvit LNG ships first post-shutdown cargo today, five days after restart
Description: The Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island near Hammerfest in Norway has shipped its first cargo today, five days after restarting operations following a shutdown due to a gas leak on May 31.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan receives no offers for its six-cargo October-December LNG tender
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG closed its first tender of the year today to buy six cargoes for delivery between October and December to Port Qasim without awarding it as it received no offers.
Author: CK

Title: CNPC inks 27-year deal with QatarEnergy for North Field East LNG, follows Sinopec’s lead
Description: State-owned China National Petroleum Corp. has agreed to buy 4 mtpa of LNG from QatarEnergy for a 27-year term, making it the second Chinese state-owned energy firm after Sinopec to agree to a substantial offtake from Qatar’s planned North Field East LNG expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh agrees 10-year deal with OQ for additional long-term LNG supplies from Oman
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned energy firm Petrobangla has signed a deal with Oman’s state-owned OQ Trading to buy between 0.25 mtpa and 1.5 mtpa of LNG for 10 years from Oman, with supplies to start from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Coral South FLNG restarts production after planned maintenance, exports yet to resume
Description: The Eni-operated 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG facility offshore Mozambique has restarted production after shutting down for planned maintenance at the end of May. But, exports may take a while to resume.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Regas gears up for start of Mukran LNG terminal with charter of second FSRU
Description: German LNG import terminal developer Deutsche Regas has signed an agreement with the German federal government to sub-charter the 174,000 m3 Transgas Power LNG vessel as a second floating storage regasification unit for its Mukran LNG receiving terminal, paving the way for the start of terminal operations at the end of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL issues tender to buy three July-August LNG cargoes
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned gas firm Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. Ltd. has issued a tender to buy three cargoes for delivery in July and August to Moheshkhali. The tender closes on June 25.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor to take more LNG from Cheniere under new deal supporting Sabine Pass expansion
Description: Equinor has agreed to buy 1.75 mtpa of LNG from US LNG exporter Cheniere, doubling the volume that it will lift from the US LNG exporter’s liquefaction terminals and supporting the proposed Sabine Pass Liquefaction expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global signs 20-year deal with SEFE unit for 2.25 mtpa of LNG from CP2 LNG project
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has signed a deal with a Wingas, a unit of Germany’s state-owned Securing Energy for Europe, or SEFE, to buy 2.25 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project in Louisiana, with it contributing to the sale of almost half the project’s capacity.
Author: CK

Title: ENN agrees term deal with Cheniere for 1.8 mtpa of LNG, supporting Sabine Pass expansion
Description: Chinese private energy firm ENN has agreed to buy 1.8 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from US project developer Cheniere for a period of over 20 years, adding to an existing 13-year deal between the two firms for 0.9 mtpa of LNG that began in July last year. The deal supports the US firm’s Sabine Pass expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: LNG market still in tension, competition between Asia and Europe to continue: TotalEnergies
Description: The demand-supply balance in the LNG market remains delicate and competition for supplies between Europe and Asia will continue, pushing prices higher unless weather conditions this winter are favorable like last year, TotalEnergies’ president and chief executive Patrick Pouyanne said at the Energy Asia conference in Kuala Lumpur today.
Author: CK

Title: European Union launches second tender today for aggregated gas purchases
Description: The European Union launches its second tender to procure gas today, allowing European firms to submit their bids for supplies to be delivered between August 2023 and March 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas sees a “significant uptick” in Malaysia’s gas demand from 2026-2027
Description: Malaysia’s gas demand will increase in the next couple of years, possibly leading to more LNG imports, with few new domestic gas fields and a commitment by state-owned utility Tenaga Nasional Bhd. to halve its coal capacity in the coming years as part of its energy transition plan, Petronas' chief operating officer and executive vice president of its gas business Adnan Zainal Abidin said today at the Energy Asia conference in Kuala Lumpur.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa takes fewer LNG cargoes in May and June than purchased
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Enarsa has received three LNG cargoes fewer than it purchased for May and June, with a mild start to the southern hemisphere winter season probably weighing on the country’s gas demand.
Author: CK

Title: Mercuria secures export credit loan to supply more gas and LNG to Italy
Description: Mercuria Energy Trading has secured a EUR 500 million ($547.2 million) loan from Italy’s export credit agency SACE to supply more gas and LNG to Italy, supporting Italy’s industrial needs and the wider European gas market.
Author: CK

Title: Next Decade secures funding for Rio Grande LNG; targets FID in early July
Description: US project developer NextDecade has secured sufficient funding to support a positive final investment decision on the first phase of its proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas, which it now expects to sanction in early July instead of the end of June.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass LNG shipments drop to a 10-month low in June, weighing on US LNG exports
Description: LNG exports from Venture Global’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana fell to a 10-month low in June, with the drop in shipments likely due to extensive repairs needed on the plant’s heat recovery steam generators.
Author: CK

Title: Spain’s El Musel LNG terminal receives a commissioning cargo from Calcasieu Pass
Description: The 5.1 mtpa El Musel LNG receiving terminal in Gijon, Spain, has received a cargo to test and commission the facility and prepare for the start of commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: Croatia’s HEP seeks up to three LNG cargoes for delivery in December-February 2024
Description: Croatia’s state-owned utility Hrvatska Elektroprivreda (HEP) has issued a tender to buy up to three LNG cargoes for delivery between December and February 2024 to the 2.13 mtpa Krk LNG receiving terminal in Omisalj. The tender closes on Jul. 11 at 12 pm Central European Time, with offers expected to remain valid until Jul. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s Damietta, Idku LNG terminals poised to ship first cargoes since May
Description: Egypt’s 5 mtpa Damietta and 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG terminals are poised to ship their first cargoes after halting shipments in May amid high temperatures in the country and strong domestic demand for gas.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG offers 12 cargoes for delivery in 2024
Description: Angola LNG has issued a tender to sell 12 cargoes for delivery next year from its 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG export terminal. Bids for the cargoes are due during the week beginning Jul. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico Pacific agrees 1 mtpa LNG deal over 20 years with China’s Zhejiang Energy
Description: LNG project developer Mexico Pacific has signed a deal to sell 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from its proposed 14.1 mtpa Saguaro Energia LNG export plant in Mexico to China’s Zhejiang Energy. Zhejiang Energy will receive the supplies on a free-on-board basis.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s Thi Vai import terminal to receive LNG commissioning cargo on Jul. 10
Description: The Petrovietnam Gas-operated 1.08 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tau province is gearing up to receive its first LNG cargo on Jul. 10, which will be used to test and commission the terminal’s facilities and prepare it for commercial operations thereafter.
Author: CK

Title: EU firms seek 16 billion m3 of gas through second tender for aggregated purchases
Description: Gas buyers in the European Union seek offers to meet an aggregated demand of 16 billion m3 of gas for delivery between August 2023 and March 2023 through a second tender on the AggregateEU platform, with the quantity of gas sought about a third higher than during the first tender in May.
Author: CK

Title: LNG commissioning cargo arrives at Thi Vai terminal, marking Vietnam’s LNG import debut
Description: The Shell-controlled 170,000 m3 Maran Gas Achilles LNG tanker arrived at state-owned PetroVietnam Gas’s 1.08 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal today, delivering the terminal’s first cargo to kick off commissioning operations and marking the country’s debut as an LNG importer.
Author: CK

Title: Berkshire Hathaway lifts interest in Cove Point LNG with stake purchase from Dominion Energy
Description: Berkshire Hathaway Energy has agreed to buy Dominion Energy’s 50% limited partner interest in the 5.25 mtpa Cove Point LNG export plant in Maryland for $3.3 billion in cash, boosting its interest to 75% upon execution of the deal.
Author: CK

Title: Cargo arrivals at Hong Kong’s LNG terminal show commercial operations are underway
Description: The 4 mtpa Hong Kong offshore LNG receiving terminal is poised to receive its third LNG cargo or second post-commissioning cargo, indicating the completion of the terminal’s commissioning phase and that the start of commercial operations is well underway.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies, Sonatrach agree to extend deal for LNG supplies to France by a year
Description: TotalEnergies and Sonatrach have agreed to extend an existing agreement for 2 mtpa of LNG by one year, with the supplies delivered in 2024 to France’s Fos Cavaou LNG receiving terminal in the Bouches-du-Rhone region.
Author: CK

Title: Delfin Midstream agrees 1 mtpa LNG deal with Centrica over 15 years
Description: US LNG project developer Delfin Midstream has signed a deal valued at about $8 billion to supply 1 mtpa of LNG over 15 years on a free-on-board basis to British energy firm Centrica from its proposed Delfin LNG project in the Gulf of Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: Hong Kong LNG terminal awaits its second commercial cargo after vessel diversions
Description: The 4 mtpa Hong Kong offshore LNG receiving terminal is expected to receive its next commercial cargo on Jul. 14, after the vessel that was due to deliver its third cargo, or second post-commissioning cargo, diverted from Hong Kong to China’s 6.8 mtpa Dapeng LNG receiving terminal in China yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks up to 1.2 mtpa of LNG for 2024-2027
Description: Thailand’s state-owned utility the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand, or EGAT, has issued a tender to buy up to 1.2 mtpa of LNG for delivery to Map Ta Phut in southern Thailand between 2024 and 2027. The tender closes on Aug. 10.
Author: CK

Title: Hong Kong’s offshore LNG terminal enters service; sendout of first commercial cargo underway
Description: The 4 mtpa Hong Kong offshore LNG terminal has started operations, with the sendout of its first commercial cargo underway.
Author: CK

Title: Both trains offline at Ichthys LNG due to output issues, restart expected soon
Description: The Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory is offline possibly due to production issues, which have led the operator to request deferrals of term cargoes by a few days.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy expects to supply 40% of new LNG supplies by 2029
Description: QatarEnergy expects its LNG output to account for  40% of the new LNG supplies that will reach the market by 2029 when all its projects are online.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade greenlights Rio Grande LNG project Phase 1; construction to begin
Description: US LNG project developer NextDecade has taken a positive final investment decision on the first phase of its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas, and plans to begin construction of the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Matched gas volumes in second EU joint gas purchase tender surpass first round
Description: The second round of joint gas purchases under the European Union’s AggregateEU demand aggregation platform has resulted in bids and offers matched for about 11.98 billion m3 of gas, outstripping the volumes matched in the first tender by about 1 billion m3.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG exports poised to resume this weekend; restart of trains expected today
Description: The Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory is poised to resume exports on Jul. 16, after shipments stopped on Jul. 6 due to production issues that caused its two trains to stop operations.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan LNG receives offers for its Jan-Feb LNG tender
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has secured one offer each for two of three January-February LNG cargoes it sought through a tender that closed on Jul. 14, ending a streak of no offers since July last year.
Author: CK

Title: Indian Oil seeks 12 LNG cargoes for delivery to Dhamra in 2024
Description: State-owned oil refiner Indian Oil seeks 12 cargoes for delivery to the 5 mtpa Dhamra LNG terminal in India’s state of Odisha next year through a tender that closes on Aug. 8. One cargo a month is to be delivered to the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: US June LNG exports to Asia rise to highest levels since November 2021
Description: LNG exports from the US continued to slip for a second consecutive month in June after hitting a peak in April, but shipments to Asia rose to their highest levels in 19 months as LNG prices continued to stay at a premium for deliveries to Asia compared to Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Poland plans to increase LNG import capacity with two FSRU at proposed Gdansk project
Description: Poland plans to increase its LNG import capacity by adding another floating storage and regasification unit at its proposed LNG receiving terminal in Gdansk, with this also seen enhancing the supply security of neighbouring countries in the region and facilitating their move away from Russian gas.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand sees LNG demand rising to 26 mtpa by 2037 as domestic, regional demand increase
Description: Thailand sees LNG demand rising to 26 mtpa by 2037 as domestic and regional demand rises.
Author: CK

Title: Indian Oil signs 14-year deal with Abu Dhabi’s ADNOC Gas for 1.2 mtpa of LNG
Description: State-owned oil refiner Indian Oil has signed a deal to buy 1.2 mtpa of LNG for delivery to India over 14 years from Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC Gas, with the contract valued at AED 25.7 billion to AED 33 billion ($7-$9 billion).
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks six September to December LNG cargoes
Description: The Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand, or EGAT, is seeking six cargoes for delivery to the 7.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut 2 LNG terminal across September to December, adding to its issuance last week of a tender to secure 1.2 mtpa of LNG for delivery between 2024 and 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Saguaro Energia LNG gets Sonora government backing, construction start this year eyed
Description: LNG project developer Mexico Pacific has signed a collaboration agreement with the government of the Mexican state of Sonora, supporting its 14.1 mtpa Saguaro Energia LNG export facility in Sonora’s Puerta Libertad, with this seen facilitating the start of construction on the project this year.
Author: CK

Title: Thi Vai LNG import terminal is ready for commercial operations; commissioning completed
Description: State-owned gas firm PetroVietnam has completed the commissioning of Vietnam’s first LNG receiving facility, the 1.08 mtpa Thi Vai LNG import terminal, clearing the path for commercial operations to begin.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor diverts LNG tanker from Argentina due to non-payment
Description: Trading firm Gunvor diverted the 173,400 m3  Flex Artemis LNG tanker this week from Argentina because of the inability of state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, to pay for the cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Australia’s July LNG exports may be its second-highest for the year to date despite outages
Description: Australia’s LNG exports in July could reach their second-highest level for the year to date, despite outages at a few of its 10 export facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s RPGCL seeks one September LNG cargo
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned gas firm Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. Ltd. has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to Moheskhali on Sep. 11-12. The tender closes on Jul. 30, with offers expected to remain valid until Aug. 3.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas, Pertamina acquire Shell’s stake in Indonesia’s Masela gas block
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas and Indonesia’s Pertamina Hulu Energi have jointly acquired Shell’s 35% stake in the production sharing contract of the Masela gas block in east Indonesia, for about $650 million, with the move seen advancing the long-delayed Abadi LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan secures one-year LNG supply from Azerbaijan’s Socar Trading
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has signed a framework agreement with the marketing and trading unit of the State Oil Company of the Republic of Azerbaijan, or Socar Trading, to secure the supply of LNG for one year, with this expected to contribute towards alleviating Pakistan’s severe gas shortages.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two August-September LNG cargoes to add to previous purchases
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy two cargoes for delivery in August and September to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong, bolstering supplies for the period.
Author: CK

Title: Eni takes over Chevron’s stake and operations in Indonesian gas blocks
Description: Eni has agreed to acquire Chevron’s interests and take over the operations of gas blocks in the Kutei Basin offshore East Kalimantan, strengthening its operations in Indonesia and accelerating the development of the stalled Indonesia Deepwater Development project.
Author: CK

Title: Halted shipments from Egypt, Abu Dhabi contribute to reduced LNG supplies for Asia
Description: A halt in shipments from Egypt and Abu Dhabi has trimmed LNG availability from the Middle East and North African regions, reducing supplies for Asia amid maintenance at several liquefaction plants in the Pacific basin.
Author: CK

Title: Panama Canal daily transit capacity limited to 32 ships from Jul. 30 as drought persists
Description: The Panama Canal Authority plans to allow only 32 ships to transit the canal daily from Jul. 30,  with the move aimed at reducing the possibility of additional draught restrictions in the coming weeks due to an extended dry season.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Guangdong Energy seeks four LNG cargoes a year over two to five years
Description: Chinese utility Guangdong Energy has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes a year for delivery to Guangdong over a period of two to five years starting in January. The tender closes on Aug. 8.
Author: CK

Title: Cove Point’s weekly LNG exports seen halved due to partial pipeline closure
Description: LNG exports from the Berkshire Hathaway-operated 5.25 mtpa Cove Point plant in Maryland are poised to halve this week against week-earlier levels, thanks to a drop in feed gas flows to the plant following the shutdown of a portion of the Columbia Gas transmission pipeline on Jul. 25.
Author: CK

Title: OMV agrees 10-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from BP, starting from 2026
Description: Austrian integrated oil and gas firm OMV has agreed a deal to buy 1 mtpa of LNG over 10 years from BP as part of a move to diversify its gas supply sources and ensure supply security for its customers in Europe, including Austria. Supplies will come from BP’s global portfolio and will be delivered from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Shell signs up for medium and long-term use of PipeChina’s LNG import terminals
Description: Shell has signed an agreement with national pipeline operator China National Petroleum Pipeline Network Co., or PipeChina, for medium and long-term use of its LNG receiving terminals, making it the first international energy firm to do so.
Author: CK

Title: CP2 LNG gets FERC environmental approval, targets construction start later this year
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global is targeting the start of construction of its proposed CP2 LNG project in Louisiana later this year following the issuance of a positive final environmental impact statement from the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin LNG’s July exports halve due to planned maintenance
Description: LNG exports in July from the 10.8 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port in Aniva Bay have fallen against month- and year-earlier levels due to planned maintenance on the plant’s liquefaction trains.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P’s Philippines LNG kicks off commercial operations with arrival of a second cargo
Description: The AG&P-operated 5 mtpa Philippines LNG terminal has received its first post-commissioning cargo about three months after the arrival of its commissioning cargo, indicating that commercial operations at the terminal have begun.
Author: CK

Title: Transgas Force FSRU arrives at Bremerhaven ahead of installation at Stade LNG terminal
Description: The 174,000 m3 Transgas Force floating storage regasification unit has arrived at Bremerhaven in Germany’s northern state of Lower Saxony, ahead of its installation at the Hanseatic Energy Hub-operated Stade LNG receiving terminal later this year.
Author: CK

Title: Production halt at ADNOC’s Das Island LNG plant sparks spot supply concerns
Description: The ADNOC-operated 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG export facility in Abu Dhabi has not shipped a cargo in the last two weeks, raising concerns that an extended outage could tighten supplies if Asian demand picks up further.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks fall to their lowest level this year amid high temperatures
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities fell to their lowest level for the year as high temperatures across the country likely boosted consumption of LNG for cooling and power generation purposes.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC’s Das Island LNG plant ships first cargo after recent output halt
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC’s 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG plant has shipped its first cargo after halting production and shipments on Jul. 18 due to unplanned maintenance.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor, Tellurian scrap deal for LNG offtake from proposed Driftwood project
Description: Gunvor and US project developer Tellurian have scrapped a deal for 3 mtpa of LNG over 10 years from the proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG project in Louisiana, marking the end of the US project developer’s last offtake deal after Shell and Vitol exited their agreements in September last year.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina could receive almost all its LNG cargo purchases this year
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, is likely to take almost all the LNG cargoes it purchased through tenders earlier this year, with a few vessels signalling their arrival at the 6.1 mtpa Escobar and 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminals in the coming days.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Wenzhou LNG receives a commissioning cargo from Bontang
Description: The 3 mtpa Wenzhou LNG receiving terminal in China’s Zhejiang province has received a commissioning cargo from the 11.5 mtpa Bontang LNG export terminal in Indonesia, kicking off testing and preparations for the start of commercial operations at the facility.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Japan takes a 10% stake in Woodside’s Scarborough gas project for $880 million
Description: The LNG Japan consortium has taken a 10% participating stake in Australian independent firm Woodside’s Scarborough gas project as part of a broader strategic relationship between the two firms that will also encompass a potential 10-year deal for LNG sales offtake from Scarborough and collaboration on new energy opportunities globally
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy expects to sell first LNG cargo from Altamira FLNG in October
Description: New Fortress Energy expects to start commercial operations at its 1.4 mtpa Fast LNG 1 project in Altamira, Mexico, in September and sell its first LNG cargo in October, making Altamira the first liquefaction project to come online in Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: Long-term regasification capacity at Mukran LNG terminal fully booked: Deutsche Regas
Description: German private terminal operator Deutsche Regas has fully allocated the regasification capacity it offered on a long-term basis at its planned Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal at Mukran in Germany’s northern state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside, Chevron hope to forestall any industrial-action-led disruptions at their LNG projects
Description: Woodside Energy and Chevron face the prospect of industrial action by employees at their offshore and downstream LNG facilities in Western Australia but hope to avoid any potential disruption to their businesses through continuing engagement and discussions with their workforce and unions.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s Wheatstone and Gorgon LNG workforce to vote on industrial action
Description: Chevron’s employees at its Wheatstone and Gorgon LNG downstream facilities will be able to vote on taking protected industrial action as a means to further their demands for higher salaries and better working conditions, following the Fair Work Commission's approval of protected action ballot orders. The voting is expected to close on Aug. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria LNG's January to July exports weaken on-year on continued feed gas shortages
Description: LNG exports from Nigeria’s 22.2 mtpa Bonny Island LNG plant fell in the first seven months of this year against levels a year earlier as upstream gas supply shortages continue to impact the facility, forcing operator Nigeria LNG to keep its force majeure on upstream gas supplies in place.
Author: CK

Title: Guangzhou Gas’ Nansha LNG terminal to begin commissioning with receipt of first cargo
Description: Chinese gas supplier Guangzhou Gas is set to begin commissioning its 1 mtpa Nansha LNG terminal in Guangzhou City following the receipt of its first cargo, making the terminal the third in mainland China to begin operations this year.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT,  EGAT seek a total of five October-December LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT and state-owned utility the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand have issued tenders seeking a total of five cargoes for delivery to the Map Ta Phut terminals in Rayong between October and December.
Author: CK

Title: Another LNG ship diverts from Argentina's Bahia Blanca terminal  to Europe
Description: Another LNG tanker that was scheduled to call at Argentina’s 3.7 mtpa Bahia Blanca LNG receiving terminal has changed course for Europe, even as its other LNG receiving terminal, Escobar, is poised to receive all its purchased cargoes this winter.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG secures funds for development from Kimmeridge
Description: US LNG project developer Commonwealth LNG has secured the funds needed to develop its 9.3 mtpa LNG export plant in Cameron, Louisiana and take a final investment decision on the project, thanks to investment capital from alternative asset management firm Kimmeridge Energy Management.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG signs four-year deal with SEFE to supply 0.4 mtpa of LNG
Description: State-owned Oman LNG has signed an agreement with Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE) to supply 0.4 mtpa of LNG over four years from 2026, with the volumes seen enhancing Germany’s energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s offshore Wheatstone LNG workers to vote on industrial action by Aug. 28
Description: Employees at Chevron’s offshore Wheatstone platform will vote by Aug. 28 on whether to take industrial action to reach an enterprise agreement with Chevron, with market participants eyeing the outcome closely for any impact on LNG exports.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside’s offshore workforce expected to decide on taking industrial action by Friday
Description: The offshore workforce at Woodside Energy’s North Rankin complex and Goodwyn-Alpha and Angel platforms is expected to make a decision by Friday on whether to continue negotiations with Woodside or initiate protected industrial action, providing some clarity on whether operations at these platforms and exports from Australia’s largest LNG plant, the 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf LNG export facility, may be disrupted.
Author: CK

Title: Compressor maintenance next week could pare feed gas flows to Corpus Christi
Description: Maintenance over two days at the Sinton compressor station in San Patricio country, Texas, next week could pare feed gas flows to US LNG exporter Cheniere’s 15 mtpa Corpus Christi LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Tangguh Train 3 to produce first LNG from September: upstream regulator
Description: The third 3.8 mtpa train of the BP-operated Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s west Papua province will begin LNG production from September, according to the chairman of Indonesia’s upstream regulator SKKMigas, Dwi Soetjipto.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC Gas agrees 5-year LNG supply deal with Japan’s Japex
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC Gas has agreed to supply LNG to Japan Petroleum Exploration (Japex) over five years in a deal valued between AED 1.65 billion ($450 million) and AED 2 billion.
Author: CK

Title: Asian LNG buyers have mixed reactions to threat of Australian LNG plant strikes
Description: The threat of strikes that have the potential to disrupt LNG exports at Woodside Energy’s 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf and Chevron’s 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plants in Australia has created mixed reactions among Asian LNG buyers amid a recent rise in European gas and Asian LNG prices.
Author: CK

Title: Trade union urges Chevron’s workers to vote in favour of industrial action as ballot opens
Description: The Offshore Alliance trade union has urged employees at Chevron’s 15.6 mtpa Gorgon and 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plants and its offshore Wheatstone platform in Australia to vote in favour of industrial action as ballots for protected industrial action open from today.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside’s offshore workers could take protected industrial action by Sep. 2: trade union
Description: The employees at three of Woodside Energy’s offshore facilities in Western Australia could initiate strikes by Sep. 2 if a meeting with Woodside this week yields an unsatisfactory outcome, according to the Offshore Alliance trade union.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ second LNG terminal poised to receive first cargo
Description: The First Gen-owned 5 mtpa Batangas LNG receiving terminal at Santa Rita in the Philippines’ province of Batangas, Luzon, looks poised to receive its first LNG cargo, with its floating storage regasification unit the 162,400 m3 BW Batangas positioned in Subic Bay to receive a commissioning cargo for the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Darwin LNG to issue tender tomorrow for one early September cargo
Description: Darwin LNG plans to invite bids from tomorrow for a cargo that will load in the first week of September at its 3.7 mtpa LNG receiving terminal in Australia’s Northern Territory. The tender will close on Aug. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex, TotalEnergies acquire PTTEP’s 100% interest in the Cash, Maple gas, condensate fields
Description: TotalEnergies and Inpex have signed an agreement to acquire PTTEP’s 100% participating interest in the AC/RL7 block offshore Western Australia that comprises the Cash and Maple gas and condensate fields.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG targets financial close for project in first-quarter 2024
Description: US project developer Commonwealth LNG expects to achieve a financial close of its proposed 9.3 mtpa project in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, in the first quarter of 2024, indicating a pushback from its earlier target of the fourth quarter of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Portovaya LNG to deliver first cargo to China through the Northern Sea Route
Description: The Gazprom-operated 1.5 mtpa Portovaya LNG plant near the Russia-Finland border has shipped its first cargo to Asia through the Northern Sea Route since starting up last year, with the cargo expected to arrive in China next month.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh eyes FSRU contract start by year-end at Australia’s first LNG import project
Description: Maritime energy infrastructure firm Hoegh LNG continues to expect a long-term charter agreement with Australian Industrial Energy to begin in the fourth quarter of this year for a floating storage regasification unit that will be deployed at Australia’s first LNG import project at Port Kembla in New South Wales.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere signs LNG term deal with Germany’s BASF for Sabine Pass supplies
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has signed a deal with German chemicals manufacturer BASF to supply up to 0.8 mtpa of LNG from mid-2026 until 2043, making it the latest German firm to sign up for long-term LNG deliveries since the massive withdrawal of Russian piped gas deliveries to Europe last year.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron proposes offer to LNG workforce ahead of close of ballot on strikes
Description: Chevron has proposed an enterprise agreement to employees at its Gorgon and Wheatstone LNG facilities in Australia, with this aimed at avoiding any industrial activity that may affect operations at the two LNG plants ahead of the close of protected action ballots tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Batangas LNG FSRU to deliver the terminal’s first cargo following ship-to-ship transfer
Description:
The 162,400 mw BW Batangas floating storage regasification unit is scheduled to dock at 
Philippines power utility First Gen’s 5 mtpa Batangas LNG receiving terminal in Batangas, Luzon, today, delivering the terminal’s first cargo after a ship-to-ship cargo transfer.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside and its offshore workforce reach in-principle agreement, averting a strike
Description: Woodside Energy has reached an in-principle enterprise agreement with union representatives of its offshore workforce following a meeting yesterday, with Woodside’s offer averting industrial action.
Author: CK

Title: Uncertainty over strike action by Chevron workers may provide price upside for gas, LNG
Description: Uncertainty over whether employees at Chevron’s Wheatstone and Gorgon downstream gas facilities in Western Australia will agree to Chevron’s proposed enterprise agreement could provide upside for gas and LNG prices over the coming week even after Dutch TTF gas hub prices tumbled yesterday on hopes that negotiations between Woodside Energy and its employees at its offshore platform in the northwest of Western Australia would avert strike action.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone LNG employees vote for industrial action
Description: The onshore workforce at Chevron’s downstream gas facilities in Western Australia have voted in favour of industrial action to progress their bargaining claims through a protected action ballot that closed today, a move that could potentially suspend operations at its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon and 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plants and lift gas and LNG prices.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside’s offshore workers back proposed enterprise agreement, ending strike threat
Description: Woodside Energy’s employees at its three offshore platforms in Western Australia have endorsed a proposed in-principle enterprise agreement by Woodside, removing the prospect of a strike that threatened to disrupt production and exports from the 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s offshore Wheatstone workers also vote for strike action
Description: Employees at Chevron’s offshore Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have voted to take strike action in a protected action ballot that closed today, raising the possibility of supply disruptions from the 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plant as a result.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks up to four LNG cargoes for delivery in October to December
Description: Thaland’s state-owned energy firm PTT seeks up to four LNG cargoes for delivery to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong province through a tender closing on Aug. 31.
Author: CK

Title: Strike action to start on Sep. 7 at Chevron's Gorgon, Wheatstone facilities
Description: Australian labour union the Offshore Alliance has served notices of protected industrial action at Chevron’s Gorgon and Wheatstone onshore facilities and its offshore Wheatstone platform, following votes in favour of taking strike action by the oil and gas firm’s employees at these facilities on Aug. 24 and today. The action will begin on Sep. 7 and is expected to curb production and exports from the 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plants.
Author: CK

Title: LNG buyers take cautious stance on planned strike action at Gorgon, Wheatstone
Description: Plans to initiate strike action on Sep. 7 by employees at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone and offshore Wheatstone facilities that include work bans and stoppages have drawn concern among LNG buyers about LNG export cuts but not enough to induce any panic buying.
Author: CK

Title: China’s August LNG imports seen rising to their highest level yet for 2023
Description: China’s LNG imports could rise to their highest levels yet for 2023 this month, outpacing year-earlier levels due to hotter weather this summer and the start of new LNG receiving terminals in the country.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s weekly LNG stocks edge higher after a five-week decline
Description: Japan’s power utilities’ weekly stocks of LNG have risen after heatwave-induced higher consumption pushed them below the average for the past five years since the end of July.
Author: CK

Title: Oman LNG inks term deals with Shell and OQ Trading totalling around 1.55 mtpa
Description: Oman LNG has signed deals to supply LNG to Shell over 10 years and to Oman's international commodity trading firm, OQ Trading, over four years, totalling 1.55 mtpa of LNG. The deals add to agreements signed since December last year for LNG deliveries beginning in 2025, following the expiration of its existing term supply contracts.
Author: CK

Title: Onshore Gorgon, Wheatstone employees reject Chevron’s enterprise agreement offer
Description: Onshore workers at Chevron’s Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities in Western Australia have voted against an enterprise agreement proposed by Chevron, with the negative voting result likely ensuring their plan to initiate strike action at the affected facilities on Sep. 7 remains in place.
Author: CK

Title: Growth in US LNG supply alone unlikely to meet higher Asian, European demand in 2024: Kpler
Description: Kpler Insight expects the US to lead global LNG exports for the second consecutive year in 2024, but the anticipated increase in US LNG supplies is unlikely to meet the combined growth in demand from Europe and Asia.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG, MET Group agree initial deal for 1 mtpa of LNG over 20 years
Description: US project developer Commonwealth LNG has signed an initial agreement with Swiss energy firm, MET Group, to supply 1 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 9.3 mtpa facility in Cameron, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron workers extend strike action until Sep. 29; complete work stoppage for 14 days
Description: Employees at the onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have escalated their pay dispute with Chevron, extending the duration of their planned strike action at the facilities by two weeks to Sep. 29 with work stoppages of up to 24 hours a day that would halt exports from the 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Shell says Venture Global’s actions damage trust in long-term LNG contracts
Description: Shell has called out US project developer Venture Global for the much-delayed start to commercial operations at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass project, saying such a move damages trust in long-term contracts and potentially hampers the signing of new term contracts and the growth of the LNG industry.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone employees offer to work during upcoming strike amid domestic gas plant trip
