Description: Employees at Chevron’s downstream Wheatstone facility in Western Australia have offered to work during the upcoming notified period of protected industrial action in response to a shutdown at the facility's domestic gas plant.
Author: CK

Title: BP commits to taking all of Woodfibre LNG’s output with a third offtake deal
Description: BP has signed a third offtake agreement with Canada’s Woodfibre LNG, giving it offtake rights to all the LNG output from the 2.1 mtpa project in British Columbia.
Author: CK

Title: Europe is exposed to LNG market volatility without more long-term contracts: Kpler
Description: The vacuum left by Russia’s curtailment of pipeline gas supplies to Europe has presented opportunities for long-term LNG contracting that have become prominent, especially with buyers having secured a higher number of longer-duration contracts in 2022 compared to 2021, lead gas and LNG analyst at Kpler, Eleni Papadopoulou, said during the Gastech conference in Singapore today.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG project reaches 50% completion, four trains onsite
Description: US project developer Venture Global has reached the halfway mark on the construction of its second LNG project the 20 mtpa Plaquemines plant in Louisiana that is expected to begin production in 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Restart activities underway at Wheatstone domestic gas plant following production outage
Description: Chevron Australia is working on resuming production at its Wheatstone domestic gas plant near Onslow in Western Australia following a halt to production due to a pump fault discovered yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Strike action at Chevron’s Western Australian facilities postponed until early Friday
Description: Employees at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have postponed strike action at the three facilities until early tomorrow morning due to progress made in pay dispute talks with Chevron.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG expects to close deals for 2 mtpa by year-end, supporting 1Q 2024 FID
Description: US project developer Commonwealth LNG expects to sign long-term contracts totalling 2 mtpa by the end of this year, which will take its total contracted volume to the 8 mtpa mark that it requires to take a financial investment decision on its proposed 9.3 mtpa project near Cameron, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Europe’s underground gas stocks will cover only a third of winter demand: Galp
Description: The European Union may have surpassed its 90% gas storage refilling target well ahead of its deadline, but the region could still be at risk of a potential shortage this winter as underground gas stocks are sufficient to cover only a third of the region’s winter demand, according to an official at Portugal’s Galp.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron employees at Gorgon, Wheatstone delay strike action further by a few hours
Description: Chevron employees at the onshore Wheatstone and Gorgon facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have pushed back the start of protected industrial action at those facilities by a few hours to 1 pm Australian Western Standard Time tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Strike action at Chevron’s Western Australian facilities commences as bargaining breaks down
Description: Employees at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform have initiated protected industrial action at these facilities as of 1 pm Australian Western Standard Time today, following a breakdown in bargaining discussions between Chevron and the employees’ union representatives.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone, Gorgon LNG plants continue shipments amid strike action
Description: The Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plants in Western Australia have continued to ship LNG cargoes despite the start of strike action at the onshore Wheatstone and Gorgon facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform since Sep. 8.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Unipec seeks 24 November 2023 to December 2024 LNG cargoes
Description: China’s state-owned Unipec has issued a tender to buy 24 LNG cargoes for delivery to China from October 2023 to December 2024. The tender closes on Sep. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks three October to December LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand state-owned energy firm PTT seeks three cargoes for delivery between October and December to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Government intervention eyed as Gorgon, Wheatstone strikes are poised to escalate, halting exports
Description: As protected industrial action at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone and offshore Wheatstone facilities in Western Australia enters its fifth day, market participants are hoping for government intervention that may halt the strike action before work stoppages escalate from Sep. 14, halting LNG exports at the 8.9 mtpa and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plants.
Author: CK

Title: First LNG reload from CNOOC’s Ningbo import terminal heads to Japan’s Himeji
Description: China has re-exported its first LNG cargo from the CNOOC-operated 6 mtpa Ningbo LNG terminal in the country’s eastern Zhejiang province, with it scheduled to arrive next week at Japan’s 15 mtpa Himeji LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports slide to a 22-month low in September on high gas storage levels
Description: Europe’s LNG imports in September posted their sharpest decline since November 2021 and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine three months later as high underground gas stocks across the region crimped demand and encouraged the diversion of some cargoes intended for Europe to other regions.
Author: CK

Title: EU buyers seek more gas through third joint-purchase tender
Description: Buyers in the European Union have sought more gas through the bloc’s third round of joint gas purchases under the AggregateEU demand aggregation platform compared to the first and second tendering rounds that closed in May and July, respectively.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan attracts three offers  in its tender for two December LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has received three offers in its LNG tender that closed today to buy a total of two cargoes for delivery to Port Qasim in Karachi on Dec. 7-8 and 13-14.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy breaks ground on North Field LNG expansion project
Description: QatarEnergy has broken ground on its North Field LNG expansion project, kicking off the work that will lift Qatar’s LNG production capacity by about 44% to 126 mtpa by 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Minimal impact likely on Taiwan’s LNG delivery schedule from Typhoon Koinu
Description: The category 3 storm, Typhoon Koinu, has forced the closure of several of Taiwan’s air and shipping routes ahead of its anticipated landfall in the south of the country tomorrow, but its impact on LNG deliveries to the 10.5 mtpa Yung An LNG receiving terminal located in the southern city of Kaohsiung is expected to be minimal.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt to resume LNG exports at Idku this week after a three-month hiatus
Description: Egypt is poised to restart LNG exports at its 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG plant near Alexandria this week, after suspending shipments from the terminal since July due to seasonally higher domestic gas demand.
Author: CK

Title: Tianjin Nangang LNG import terminal receives second cargo as commissioning continues
Description: China’s newest LNG import facility, the Beijing Gas-operated 5 mtpa Tianjin Nangang LNG receiving terminal in Tianjin province, has received its second LNG cargo as commissioning operations at the terminal continue.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron workers may strike again at Wheatstone, Gorgon facilities
Description: Employees at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform may take strike action at these facilities in response to their unions’ claims that Chevron has omitted key agreed bargaining terms from draft enterprise agreements.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan’s LNG term deal with Azerbaijan’s Socar seen starting in December
Description:
Pakistan’s June deal with Azerbaijan’s state-owned Socar for 12 cargoes to be delivered over
a one-year period is expected to start in December, with the contracted volume and a spot
deal done this week seen lifting the country’s LNG receipts during the last month of this
year.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron workers to take strike action again at Gorgon, Wheatstone facilities from Oct. 18
Description: The unions representing Chevron’s employees at the onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and the offshore Wheatstone platform will serve notices of protected industrial action to Chevron on Monday, with strikes at the facilities to begin from Oct. 18 for two weeks.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG seeks approval to begin commissioning Train 1 systems by Nov. 20
Description: US LNG project developer Golden Pass LNG has sought regulatory approval to introduce hazardous fluids to the first liquefaction train of its 18.1 mtpa project in Jefferson County, Texas, by Nov. 20 in order to begin the commissioning of its fuel gas and refrigerant systems.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s gas supply stable despite suspected leak at Baltic Interconnector: Gasgrid
Description: Finland’s gas supply is stable despite a sharp drop in pressure in the Baltic Interconnector pipeline likely due to a leak, according to the country’s gas transmission system operator Gasgrid Finland.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron Australia confirms Gorgon, Wheatstone employees to take strike action from Oct. 19
Description: The unions representing Chevron’s workforce at its Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform in Australia have served notices of intention to take protected industrial action to Chevron, with work stoppages and partial work bans beginning from Oct. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Gasgrid to halt spot LNG import capacity reservation at Inkoo until next week
Description: The spot LNG import capacity reservation process at Finland’s 1.6 mtpa LNG receiving terminal has been suspended until at least the end of the week, pending an investigation into the cause of an unusually sharp drop in gas pressure of the bi-directional Baltic interconnector pipeline, Balticconnector, that has halted operations since Sunday.
Author: JS

Title: First LNG cargo loading at Idku after summer hiatus delayed; Tamar field shutdown impact eyed
Description: The 79,760 m3 Dapeng Princess LNG tanker’s recent signalling of a port call at the 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG export terminal in Egypt three days ago created expectations of a resumption in LNG exports from the facility this month after a five-month hiatus.
Author: CK

Title: Restart of Mozambique LNG construction still depends on an improved security situation: TotalEnergies
Description: TotalEnergies said today that the restart of construction of its stalled 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG export project remains contingent on an improvement in the security situation in the northern Cabo Delgado province, which remains unstable due to ongoing insurgency.
Author: JS

Title: Komipo seeks long-term LNG supplies for up to 2041
Description: Korea’s power generation firm Korea Midland Power (Komipo) has issued a two-bidding-round tender to procure long-term LNG supplies to meet the anticipated demand of its power plants from 2027 for a period of 15 years. The deadline for bid submissions is Nov. 8.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt continues to receive Israeli gas, with flows rerouted through Jordan
Description: Egypt is still receiving gas from Israel’s 12 billion m3 a year Leviathan gas field following attacks on Israel over the past weekend that have forced the closure of its 10.2 billion m3 a year Tamar gas field.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy signs two 27-year LNG supply deals for 3.5 mtpa with TotalEnergies for France
Description: QatarEnergy has agreed two 27-year deals with TotalEnergies for the supply of up to 3.5 mtpa of LNG to France from Qatar’s North Field East and North Field South LNG projects that are scheduled to come online in 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Korea’s Komipo aims to seek more long-term LNG supplies next year
Description: Korean state-owned power generation firm Korea Midland Power, or Komipo, has plans to secure more long-term LNG supplies next year, adding to the cargoes it is already seeking through a tender to meet the anticipated demand of its power plants from 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt ships two LNG cargoes from Idku, while Damietta remains offline
Description: Egypt has shipped two cargoes from its 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG export facility so far this month, ending a three-month export hiatus during which feed gas supplies meant for the plant were diverted for domestic consumption.
Author: CK

Title: Balticconnector leak raises security concerns for regional gas infrastructure
Description: The focus on measures to boost the security of crucial gas and LNG infrastructure is back on the radar of their owners and operators after the news of possible sabotage causing a leak to the Balticconnector pipeline shook the market.
Author: JS

Title: Geopolitical risks due to Israel conflict might dampen the country's gas and LNG plans
Description: The scale of damage that the geopolitical tensions caused by the Israel-Hamas war could inflict on the LNG market in the region will depend on the duration of the conflict although the near-term impact may, for now, be limited.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche Regas offers short-term LNG import capacity at Mukran for next year
Description: German private terminal operator Deutsche Regas is offering short-term import capacity for next year at its planned Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal at Mukran in Germany’s northern state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern to help ensure price stability and supply security.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s Gorgon, Wheatstone workers to proceed with strike action this week
Description: Workers at Chevron’s onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform have again endorsed a plan to resume protected industrial action on Oct. 19, potentially disrupting operations at those facilities less than a month after halting strike action.
Author: CK

Title: Darwin LNG offers one LNG cargo loading from end-October to early November
Description: The Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory is offering one cargo that will load between Oct. 25 and Nov. 2 through a tender that closes on Oct. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Marathon Oil inks five-year LNG deal with Glencore, supplies from Equatorial Guinea
Description: US-headquartered Marathon Oil has signed a five-year LNG sales agreement for a portion of its equity natural gas produced from the Alba Field in Equatorial Guinea (EG), where it has a 64% working interest.
Author: JS

Title: Strike action at Wheatstone, Gorgon averted; union urges support of draft pay deal
Description: Workers at Chevron’s onshore Wheatstone and Gorgon facilities and the offshore Wheatstone Platform in Western Australia have called off the plan for protected industrial action, averting any disruptions to operations at the facilities ahead of the start of the planned strike action tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside’s Pluto Train 2 project is 46% complete, target for first LNG cargo in 2026 remains
Description: Woodside’s Scarborough and Pluto Train 2 project was 46% complete at the end of September and the target for production of the first LNG cargo in 2026 is still unchanged, the firm said in its third-quarter 2023 report today.
Author: CK

Title: Qatarenergy, Shell agree 27-year deals for up to 3.5 mtpa of LNG supply to the Netherlands
Description: QatarEnergy has agreed two 27-year deals with Shell for the supply of up to 3.5 mtpa of LNG to the 11.8 mtpa Gate LNG terminal in the Netherlands from the planned North Field East and North Field South LNG expansion projects in Qatar.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgarian tax on transit of Russian pipeline gas unlikely to cut flows to Hungary and Serbia
Description: Bulgaria’s new bill to impose a tax on Russian gas transiting the country will increase the cost of that gas for its customers but may not have the intended outcome of penalising Russia by cutting its revenues through a reduction in the flow and consumption of Russian gas.
Author: JS

Title: Petrobras extends Sequoia FSRU charter with Excelerate Energy by 10 years
Description: US-based LNG solutions company Excelerate Energy announced on Tuesday that it has signed a charter agreement with Brazil’s state-owned Petrobras for its 5.6 mtpa Sequoia FSRU, which will extend the vessel’s stay in Brazil’s Bahia LNG terminal by 10 years.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC Gas signs $500-$700 million multi-year LNG deal with Jera for LNG supplies from UAE
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC Gas agreed to supply LNG from its Das Island project to Jera Global Markets’ global supply portfolio, with the deal valued at AED 1.8 billion to AED 2.5 billion ($500 million to $700 million).
Author: CK

Title: BP’s Tangguh Train 3 starts operations, ships first cargo to Indonesian utility PLN
Description: The BP-operated Tangguh LNG project in Indonesia’s west Papua province has shipped the first cargo from its third train, marking the start of commercial operations at the train. The new train boosts capacity at the project to 11.4 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche ReGas to charter out Trangas Power as LNG tanker before its dispatch as an FSRU
Description: German private terminal operator Deutsche ReGas said that it will charter out the 174,000 m3 Transgas Power as an LNG tanker before its deployment as a floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) at the port of Mukran on Germany’s Ruegen island this winter.
Author: JS

Title: Next loading at Idku LNG terminal eyed as Israel conflict creates supply security concerns
Description: Egypt’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG terminal is scheduled to load a cargo in the coming week and market participants will be eyeing the terminal’s activities closely amid rising domestic energy supply security concerns in Israel and Egypt as the Israel-Hamas war worsens.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore to create gas buying entity in 2024 to centralize purchases, ensure stable power prices
Description: Singapore plans to create a single gas buying entity, or gasco, sometime next year to aggregate demand and centralize procurement for the power sector to avoid gas supply shortfalls and volatility in electricity prices.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy, Eni agree 27-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from North Field for Italy
Description: QatarEnergy has signed a long-term agreement to supply Eni with 1 mtpa of LNG over 27 years for Italy, making it the fifth deal the state-owned firm has signed to supply Europe from its planned North Field East LNG expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: FLNG, FSU vessels to set sail for Congo LNG to meet targeted December start
Description: The 16,100 m3 Tango Floating LNG and 138,200 m3 Excalibur floating storage unit vessels are poised to set sail soon for the Republic of Congo to meet the anticipated start of the first phase of operations at the Eni-led Congo LNG project in December.
Author: CK

Title: Korea’s Kogas sees no LNG demand-supply issues this winter despite Middle East conflict
Description: Korea’s state-owned gas firm Kogas does not expect to face gas supply disruptions this winter even if the conflict in the Middle East worsens as it is preparing a response strategy that includes pre-emptive purchases, inventory status monitoring and the stable management of its production and supply facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore plans to bring a second LNG import terminal online by 2030
Description: Singapore plans to develop a second LNG import terminal by 2030, with the additional capacity expected to help the country achieve energy supply security, meet its growing power needs,  cater to growing LNG demand in the region and enhance its position as a key LNG trading and bunkering hub.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen seeks second LNG cargo for Batangas, delivery in November-December
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon between Nov. 25 and Dec. 25, making it the second cargo the firm intends to buy after its purchase of a  commissioning cargo in July. The tender closes on Nov. 15.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies completes commissioning of Le Havre FSRU, sendout begins
Description: TotalEnergies has completed the commissioning of the 145,000 m3 Cape Ann floating storage and regasification unit, with this marking the start of import operations at the 3.63 mtpa Le Havre LNG terminal in northern France where the vessel is installed.
Author: JS

Title: Eni signs up for three-year LNG supplies from Indonesia starting 2024, boosts supply portfolio
Description: Eni has agreed with the Merakes LNG Sellers to take 0.8 billion m3 a year of LNG from the Merakes gas field offshore East Kalimantan over three years starting from January 2024, expanding its LNG supply portfolio and adding to its existing contracted LNG supplies from Indonesia.
Author: CK

Title: Origin Energy inks exclusive capacity use deal with Venice Energy, underpinning South Australian LNG import project
Description: Australian energy provider Origin Energy has booked the entire regasification capacity at Venice Energy’s proposed 3.8 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import facility in Port Adelaide, Southern Australia for 10 years, underpinning the commercial viability of the project.
Author: JS

Title: Reliance, BP offer domestic gas supplies, possibly paring India’s spot LNG demand
Description: Reliance Industries and BP have invited bids for about 4 million m3 of gas a day from the KG D6 block in the Krishna Godavari gas basin in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh that it is offering for delivery over three to five years, starting from Dec. 16. The gas will be offered through an auction on Nov. 7, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG gets FERC nod to commission second dock, eyes full restart of second phase
Description: US LNG project operator Freeport LNG has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to commission the second dock and other facilities at its 15 mtpa plant in Texas as part of a second phase of operations aimed at returning it to full commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor, RWE sign five-year deal for gas supply until 2028
Description: Norway’s Equinor has agreed to supply Germany’s RWE with 10-15 terrawatt hours (TWh), or around 1-1.5 billion m3 of gas a year for five years starting this month until 2028. The contract is based on market price and deliveries will be to Germany’s virtual trading hub the Trading Hub Europe.
Author: CK

Title: PTT seeks LNG cargoes to fill three December-January import slots
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm has issued a tender to buy LNG cargoes to fill three import slots across December and January at its Map Ta Phut LNG LNG receiving terminal in southern Thailand. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt ships two LNG cargoes in October; further LNG exports uncertain amid gas import halt
Description: Egypt has shipped just two LNG cargoes this month, forcing several ships that were due to call at its two LNG export terminals to cancel their port calls and suggesting that the export restart after a summer hiatus may be short-lived especially amid a halt in gas imports from Israel and increased power outages across Egypt.
Author: CK

Title: Petronet hopes to conclude Qatar LNG contract renewal by year-end, no plans to increase offtake
Description: India’s state-owned Petronet hopes to complete contract renewal negotiations with QatarEnergy by year-end for long-term LNG supplies to India but has no plans to increase the contracted quantity.
Author: CK

Title: Panama Canal transit capacity restricted further as drought continues
Description: The Panama Canal Authority has further reduced daily transit capacity for ships using the Canal because of a continued drought that has reduced water levels in Gatun Lake, the key water source that operates the Canal’s locks.
Author: CK

Title: BP expects Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG ship to leave Singapore by year-end
Description: BP expects the 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG vessel to leave Singapore by the end of the year,  with the timeline hopefully meeting the first quarter of 2024 start-up target for the first phase of the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project in Senegal and Mauritania.
Author: CK

Title: Chesapeake Energy to supply Vitol with 1 mtpa of LNG under initial deal
Description: US upstream firm Chesapeake Energy and Vitol have signed a Heads of Agreement (HoA) for the supply  1 mtpa of LNG  over 15 years to be delivered from one of the liquefaction plants in the US, starting from 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Spot LNG freight rates rally for a second time in the run-up to winter, vessel availability tight
Description: LNG freight rates are rallying for the second time ahead of the coming winter season, supported by a recent increase in LNG prices, as well as Panama Canal transit capacity restrictions and a closed arbitrage for US shipments to Asia that have tightened vessel availability.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere eyes first LNG from Corpus Christi Stage 3 project by end-2024
Description: US LNG producer Cheniere expects to produce the first LNG from its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 project by end of 2024, about a year ahead of schedule.
Author: JS

Title: Foran Energy and Cheniere agree second 20-year LNG deal
Description: Chinese gas distributor Foran Energy has agreed to buy 0.9 mtpa of LNG from US LNG producer Cheniere over 20 years, making it the second LNG deal of that tenor between the two firms.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports rise to their highest level in October, Freeport, Calcasieu Pass ship more
Description: The pace of US LNG exports increased last month, pushing the number of shipments from the country’s seven liquefaction plants to an all-time high.
Author: CK

Title: Regulator’s queries on Altamira FLNG’s site could cause further delays
Description: The US Department of Energy (DOE) is seeking clarification from U.S. project developer New Fortress Energy on the site of its 1.4 mtpa Altamira floating LNG project in New Mexico, which could further delay the project’s start.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s Mitsui will take “appropriate measures” following US sanctions on Arctic LNG 2
Description: Japan’s Mitsui said today that it will take appropriate measures in relation to the sanctions imposed by the US Department of State yesterday on Russia’s planned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project that aim to constrain the planned project’s production and export capacity.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies’ Arctic LNG 2 contractual commitments under review
Description: TotalEnergies told Kpler today that it is assessing the consequences of its commitments to the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia following sanctions imposed on the operator by the U.S. Department of State yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG start up could slip to 2Q 2024: Kosmos
Description: US upstream firm Kosmos Energy warned today that the anticipated start of the BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project in the first quarter of next year could be delayed to the second quarter.
Author: JS

Title: France’s Le Havre LNG terminal to receive first commercial cargo
Description: The TotalEnergies-operated 3.6 mtpa floating LNG import terminal in France is poised to receive its first commercial LNG cargo today, after it received a cargo to commission the new terminal on Oct. 26.
Author: JS

Title: New Fortress Energy to install Santa Catarina FSRU in December
Description: US-based LNG developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) said on Monday it has signed a deal to sub- charter a floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) from Brazil's Petrobras for its Terminal Gas Sul (TGS) import terminal in Brazil’s Santa Catarina state, installing the vessel in December.
Author: JS

Title: European LNG imports rebound in October, but recede against year-earlier levels
Description: Europe’s monthly LNG imports in October rebounded from a 22-month low in September even as underground storage facilities were almost completely full, but they slipped against year-earlier levels.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt receives a partial LNG cargo from Bontang amid gas import and export halt
Description: Egypt received its first LNG cargo over the weekend after an import hiatus of five years, with this following a recent halt to gas imports from Israel and a brief resumption in LNG exports at one of its two LNG export terminals.
Author: CK

Title: Sinopec, QatarEnergy ink North Field South LNG supply, partnership deal
Description: China’s state-owned China Petrochemical Corporation, or Sinopec, has signed an agreement with QatarEnergy to take 3 mtpa of LNG over 27 years from its planned 16 mtpa North Field South project, making Sinopec the first firm to sign up for more 27-year LNG supplies from Qatar’s LNG expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: Japan is keen to ensure stable supplies as sanctions target Arctic LNG 2
Description: Japan expects that US sanctions will have a certain degree of impact on Russia’s soon-to-start 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in which it participates, but it is looking to take appropriate measures to ensure stable LNG supplies to the country.
Author: CK

Title: Global LNG supply in balance this winter, but risks linger: EIA
Description: Global LNG demand and supply are likely to be balanced this winter but increased east Asian demand, cold snaps and unplanned plant outages might affect this balance, the US Energy Information Agency (EIA) said in its latest LNG outlook report.
Author: JS

Title: Everett LNG shutdown could threaten energy reliability: US regulators
Description: US regulatory agencies have warned that plans to mothball the 5.1 mtpa Everett LNG import terminal on the US east coast could potentially jeopardise energy supply during extreme winter conditions.
Author: JS

Title: PGN declares force majeure on its LNG supply deal with Gunvor
Description: Indonesia’s state-owned energy firm Pertamina Gas Negara has declared force majeure on its LNG supply deal with Swiss trader Gunvor, anticipating that the FM period will last no less than several months next year.
Author: JS

Title: Darwin LNG continues to produce; offers an LNG parcel loading in November
Description: The Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant has issued a tender to sell one parcel of LNG that will load at its export facility in Australia’s Northern Territory on Nov. 10-13, with its continued output defying expectations. The tender closes on Nov. 10.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate inks 15-year LNG supply deal with Petrobangla
Description: Excelerate Energy has signed a long-term LNG sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with Bangladesh’s state-owned oil and gas firm Petrobangla to supply LNG over 15 years, beginning January 2026.
Author: JS

Title: G7 to accelerate consultations on limiting Russia’s revenues from energy
Description: The Group of Seven nations said they will “accelerate consultations” on limiting Russia’s revenues from energy, among other things, with this coming less than a week after the US slapped sanctions on the consortium operating the proposed 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in Russia.
Author: JS

Title: New Fortress Energy delays Altamira LNG launch to December
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) said during its third-quarter earnings call today that it has pushed back commercial operations at its 1.4 mtpa Altamira floating LNG facility to December.
Author: JS

Title: China’s earlier heating season start may not fuel incremental demand for spot LNG
Description: Heavy snow storms in China’s northeastern provinces over the last few days ushered in an earlier-than-anticipated start to the heating season, raising questions about whether the country has secured enough supplies or needs additional LNG cargoes to bolster its winter stocks.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal reloads cargo in rare move
Description: Egypt’s 5.7 mtpa Ain Sukhna floating LNG receiving terminal has reloaded an LNG cargo in an unprecedented move even as the country’s two LNG export terminals have suspended exports due to a lack of feed gas.
Author: CK

Title: Second LNG import terminal in Germany’s Wilhelmshaven prepares to start
Description: The second floating LNG receiving terminal in Wilhelmshaven in Germany’s northern state of Lower Saxony is preparing to start operations, following the impending arrival of its floating storage regasification unit, the 138,000 m3 Excelsior.
Author: CK

Title: US aims to “kill” Arctic LNG 2 through sanctions
Description: The US intends to “kill” Russia’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project through sanctions coordinated with the Group of Seven (G7) partners, US Assistant Secretary of State for Energy Resources Geoffrey Pyatt said at a national security hearing on Nov. 8.
Author: JS

Title: Gorgon LNG exports closely eyed as output on one train impacted, two cargoes cancelled
Description: Australia’s weekly LNG exports are expected to rise over the next two weeks, but market participants are keeping a close eye on output from the Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia following a few cargo cancellations.
Author: CK

Title: European Parliament calls for full ban on Russian LNG imports
Description: A week after the US imposed sanctions on the operator of the Arctic LNG 2 project, the European Parliament has called for a complete closure of the EU market to Russian LNG imports.
Author: JS

Title: Excelerate eyes investment in another FSRU; new FSRU on track for June 2024 delivery
Description: US floating storage solutions provider Excelerate Energy is eyeing the possibility of ordering a second floating storage regasification unit to boost its growth, even as its newbuild vessel is on track to be delivered in June next year.
Author: CK

Title: Texas LNG selects Baker Hughes as contractor, pushes back FID
Description: Energy project developer Glenfarne Energy Transition has selected Baker Hughes to supply equipment to its proposed 4 mtpa Texas LNG export project in the port of Brownsville, pacing the way for greater progress with the project.
Author: JS

Title: PLL may seek a spot LNG cargo for delivery in January
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG may consider buying a spot LNG cargo for delivery if Azerbaijan’s state-owned Socar is unable to deliver a cargo to the country in line with its required delivery timing.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron resumes production from Israel’s Tamar gas field
Description: Chevron has resumed production at its offshore Tamar gas field after shutting it down early last month on instruction from Israel as a precautionary move due to heightened conflict after Hamas unexpectedly attacked Israel.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade aims for an FID on Rio Grande LNG’s Train 4 in second-half 2024
Description: US project developer NextDecade has set a target to take a positive financial investment decision on the fourth train of its planned Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas, after deciding to proceed with the development of the project’s first three trains, or its first phase, in July.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG loads a second cargo after power outage and drop in feed gas flows
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, is loading a second cargo after a power outage at the plant likely led to a brief halt in exports and a drop in feed gas flows. However, market participants are still keeping a close watch on feed gas flows to the plant for an indication of the plant’s export performance.
Author: CK

Title: No gas flows to Freeport LNG through Gulf South pipeline
Description: The Gulf South Pipeline Co. will not deliver gas to the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas until further notice due to “customer’s failure to take confirmed quantities."
Author: CK

Title: Gaz-System close to chartering Poland’s first FSRU for Gdańsk LNG
Description: Poland’s gas transmission system operator Gaz-System has pre-selected Mitsui OSK Lines and BW LNG to supply its proposed 4.6 mtpa Gdańsk LNG terminal with a floating storage and regasification unit, which will take Poland’s total LNG import capacity to 14.4 billion m3 from 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Cedar LNG partners caution FID could slip to early 2024
Description: Partners in Canada’s proposed 3 mtpa Cedar floating LNG export project, the Haisla Nation and Pembina Pipeline, warned that a final investment decision on the project could slip to early 2024 because of the actions needed to secure project financing, even though it continues to target the end of 2023.
Author: JS

Title: Russia paves way for more LNG exports with amended export liberalisation bill
Description: Russia’s new bill to further liberalise LNG exports is expected to fulfil Russia’s far-reaching LNG export goals by allowing large gas reserves to be monetised and exported, even as its largest gas market, Europe, looks to eliminate purchases of Russian gas.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy more December to January LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy up to three LNG cargoes for delivery in December and January to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong.  The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron resumes Israeli gas flows to Egypt through the East Mediterranean Gas pipeline
Description: Chevron has restarted deliveries through the East Mediterranean Gas pipeline, allowing gas to flow from Israel to Egypt about five weeks after it was re-routed through the FAJR pipeline due to the armed conflict in Israel.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra is evaluating next steps after environmental permit for Port Arthur LNG is "vacated"
Description: US LNG project developer Sempra Infrastructure is reviewing its next course of action after an appeals court withdrew the emissions permit for its planned 13.5 mtpa Port Arthur LNG project in South Texas, halting the development of the project. But, the firm is continuing construction on the project in the meantime.
Author: CK

Title: Oman’s Qalhat LNG resumes loadings following “technical fault”
Description: The 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG export plant in Oman has resumed loadings today after a technical fault probably led to a halt in exports in the last two days.
Author: CK

Title: Leviathan partners to review FLNG plan due to high costs: NewMed Energy
Description: Israel’s NewMed Energy, together with its partners in the 12 billion m3/year Leviathan gas field offshore Israel, are reviewing plans for a floating LNG facility to boost production from the field due to high costs and are considering other options.
Author: JS

Title: Trafigura to deliver Batangas LNG’s second cargo through tender
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has chosen Swiss trader Trafigura to deliver one cargo to its Batangas floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU), which will be the second cargo the terminal has received since its arrival at Batangas Bay in June this year.
Author: JS

Title: Brazil’s Pecem to receive LNG ship diverted from Grain amid heatwave
Description: An LNG vessel destined for arrival at the UK’s 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG import later this month has signalled a change in direction and is heading towards Brazil’s 3.8 mtpa Pecem LNG receiving terminal in the northeast state of Ceará as temperatures have hit historical highs over the weekend as the southern hemisphere summer approaches.
Author: JS

Title: Gimi FLNG leaves Singapore shipyard for BP’s Greater Tortue Ahmeyim LNG project
Description: The Golar-owned 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG vessel has left the Seatrium shipyard in Singapore and is en route to the maritime border of Senegal and Mauritania for installation at the BP-operated Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project following the completion of conversion to an FLNG unit.
Author: JS

Title: Pakistan seeks one early January LNG cargo
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Jan. 8-9 to the Pakistan GasPort LNG terminal in Port Qasim. The tender closes on Nov. 24, with the firm expected to prepare a confirmation notice for the LNG cargo by Nov. 30.
Author: CK

Title: BP to offtake 1 mtpa from Oman LNG starting 2026
Description: Oman LNG has agreed a deal to supply of 1 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from its 10.9 mtpa Qalhat LNG plant to BP for a period of nine years, starting in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Golar expects Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project to start commercial operations in 2H 2024
Description: Marine LNG infrastructure firm Golar expects commercial operations at the planned BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG (FLNG) in Senegal and Mauritania to begin in the second half of the year, following the start of a six-month commissioning period in January.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas extends LNG deal with Algeria’s Sonatrach for three years
Description: Turkey’s state-owned energy firm has signed a deal for 4.4 billion m3 of gas with Algeria’s state-owned oil firm Sonatrach for three years, extending an existing contract that is due to expire in  2024.
Author: CK

Title: Gorgon LNG’s Train 3 has returned to full production: Chevron
Description: The third train at the Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant is back to producing at full capacity after almost three weeks of reduced output.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt set to resume LNG exports as Idku loads a cargo
Description: Egypt is set to resume exports of LNG following after a two-week hiatus, with an LNG tanker currently undergoing loading at the country’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG export facility.
Author: JS

Title: FERC greenlights Freeport LNG’s return to full operations
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG project in Texas has received regulatory approval to return its remaining facilities to service, with this aimed at allowing the plant to operate at full capacity.
Author: JS

Title: Output issues at most of Bintulu’s LNG trains could affect Dec-Jan term deliveries
Description: Production issues at the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia could result in delays or deferrals to deliveries of term cargoes in December and January.
Author: CK

Title: Hanseatic Energy Hub on track to reach FID on onshore Stade LNG terminal by year-end
Description: Hanseatic Energy Hub is on track to reach a final investment decision on its proposed 9.9 mtpa Stade onshore LNG terminal near Hamburg, Germany, by the end of the year, with Czech state-owned utility CEZ Group booking the “remaining” capacity at the proposed terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Klaipeda LNG terminal operator postpones capacity expansion plans
Description: Lithuania’s LNG terminal operator KN has decided to postpone the expansion of its 2.9 mtpa Klaipeda LNG terminal due to a lack of interest among market participants in booking regasification capacity at the terminal beyond 2033.
Author: JS

Title: Japan approves Jera as the country’s first strategic LNG buffer supplier
Description: Japan has approved its biggest LNG buyer Jera as the first supplier for its Strategic Buffer LNG framework, aimed at building a buffer stock of LNG cargoes in case of emergency during peak winter demand.
Author: JS

Title: Greece’s first FSRU sets sail for Alexandroupolis to complete final commissioning
Description: The 153,000 m3 Alexandroupoli floating storage regasification unit has set sail for Greece to complete commissioning work ahead of the planned start of commercial operations at the Alexandroupolis Independent Natural Gas System project in the first quarter of 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan awards tender to OQ Trading for one January LNG cargo
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG has awarded a tender that closed Nov. 24 to Oman’s OQ Trading for the delivery of a cargo on Jan. 8-9 to the GasPort LNG terminal in Port Qasim.
Author: JS

Title: Prelude looks poised to load first LNG cargo since August
Description: The Shell-operated 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG plant offshore Western Australia is poised to restart exports, suggesting it has either ended or is nearing the end of its scheduled maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: BW Singapore FSRU leaves Ain Sukhna ahead of deployment in Ravenna
Description: The 170,000 m3 BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit has departed from the 5.7 mtpa Ain Sukhna import terminal in Egypt, marking the end of its lease at the terminal where it served as the country’s floating import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Gunvor agrees to buy up to 1 mtpa of LNG from Delfin LNG
Description: Gunvor has signed a deal with US project developer Delfin LNG to buy between 0.5mtpa and 1 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis from the firm’s proposed floating export facility at the Delfin Deepwater Port in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tanker stuck at APLNG disrupts exports; LNG cargoes deferred
Description: An LNG tanker that loaded a cargo at the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG export plant on Curtis Island in Queensland has lost power and is stuck at the terminal, preventing cargoes from being loaded until the situation is resolved and causing two term cargoes to be deferred so far, according to the plant’s upstream operator Origin Energy.
Author: JS

Title: Congo set to receive its FLNG vessel after Excalibur FSU’s arrival
Description: The soon-to-start 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG facility is set to receive its 16,100 m3 Tango floating LNG unit, which will join the project’s 138,200 m3 Excalibur floating storage unit that arrived to Congo on Nov. 25.
Author: JS

Title: Greece expects sharp rise in import and storage capacity with Alexandroupolis, Dioriga projects
Description: The anticipated start of the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG import terminal in Greece early next year, coupled with the targeted start of the planned 4.03 mtpa Dioriga Gas terminal by 2025 are expected to boost Greece’s LNG import and storage capacity and strengthen its role as a gateway for LNG to Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Greece expects to quadruple LNG export capacity by 2027
Description: Greece expects to increase its LNG export capacity significantly by four times in the next four years, thanks to new projects that are expected to come online.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria LNG’s Train 8 plans still in place despite feed gas issues
Description: Plans to develop an eighth train at the 22.2 mtpa Nigeria LNG plant on Bonny Island are still in place despite upstream supply issues which pose a challenge to its development and continue to constrain production at the project.
Author: CK

Title: European Commission seeks extension of energy emergency measures
Description: The European Commission (EC) has proposed a 12-month extension to the energy market support measures introduced after Russia invaded Ukraine and provoked an energy crisis as the market “remains fragile” and susceptible to volatility.
Author: JS

Title: Austria’s OMV and Cheniere agree long-term deal for 0.85 mtpa of LNG from late 2029
Description: OMV Gas Marketing, the marketing and trading arm of Austrian energy company OMV has agreed to buy 0.85 mtpa of LNG, or about 12 LNG cargoes a year from US LNG exporter Cheniere, starting in late 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Alexandroupolis’ FSRU is expected to reach mooring site on Dec. 17: Gastrade
Description: Project owner Gastrade expects the 153,500 m3 Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit to arrive at Greece’s northeastern port of Alexandroupolis on Dec. 17 for final commissioning, ahead of the floating LNG project’s anticipated start in the first quarter of 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Snam expects to complete commissioning of Ravenna LNG terminal by 4Q 2024
Description: Italy’s gas transmission system and LNG terminal operator Snam expects the floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) for its planned 3.9 mtpa Ravenna terminal off of Italy’s eastern coast to complete commissioning by the end of next year before beginning commercial operations in the first quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgartransgaz eyes second investment in LNG import terminal in Greece
Description: Bulgaria’s gas transmission operator Bulgartransgaz is keen to invest in at least one more LNG import infrastructure project in Greece as it sees the need for affordable LNG supplies that can reach the market and enable the full replacement of Russian gas.
Author: CK

Title: KN Energy sees no increase in regional LNG demand, good prospects for small-scale LNG
Description: Lithuania’s LNG operator, KN Energy, sees limited regional demand growth in LNG. However, it sees good prospects for demand for small-scale LNG operations.
Author: CK

Title: Europe will continue to import LNG for the next 26 years, decarbonisation focus remains
Description: Europe will continue to import a considerable amount of LNG until 2049 to act as a buffer in the European Union’s path to decarbonisation on track to be achieved in 2050, said the head of the European Commission’s Directorate-General for Energy.
Author: CK

Title: NFE introduces first gas into Altamira; paves the way for commissioning, LNG production
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has produced first gas at its 1.4 mtpa Fast LNG 1 floating LNG facility in Altamira, Mexico, with this expected to pave the way for the commissioning of liquefaction facilities at the project and the start of LNG production.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks compensation from former Gazprom unit for non-delivery of LNG cargoes
Description: State-owned gas distributor Gail India on Friday said it has initiated legal proceedings against Singapore-based Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE), a former unit of Russia’s Gazprom, for non-delivery of LNG and that it seeks USD 1.817 billion in damages.
Author: JS

Title: Greece’s DEPA signs initial agreement to supply LNG to Moldova
Description: Moldova’s state-owned utility Energocom and Greek state-owned energy supplier DEPA have signed a memorandum of understanding to boost cooperation on gas supply, including LNG, and coordinate the use of gas storage and transport infrastructure.
Author: JS

Title: APLNG is poised to resume exports as LNG ship stuck at the terminal is moved to anchorage
Description: The 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG project in Queensland, Australia, will resume LNG production and exports having moved an LNG vessel that was stuck at its dock after it lost power several days ago.
Author: CK

Title: Cyprus and Chevron reach agreement on Aphrodite gas field development
Description: The government of Cyprus and Chevron have reached an agreement on the development plan for the 4.2 trillion ft3 Aphrodite gas field offshore Cyprus, ending years of deadlock that has delayed developing the field and bringing it online.
Author: JS

Title: Indonesia approves Inpex’s revised Abadi gas development plan
Description: The government of Indonesia has approved Japanese upstream firm Inpex’s revised development plan for the Abadi gas field project in the Masela block in eastern Indonesia, paving the way for the development of new LNG supplies from Indonesia.
Author: JS

Title: Estonia’s Elenger buys three LNG cargoes for delivery to Finland's Inkoo terminal this winter
Description: Estonian energy company Eesti Gaas, known internationally as Elenger, has bought three LNG spot cargoes from Norway for delivery to Finland's 1.6 mtpa Inkoo terminal this winter, with negotiations for a fourth one still ongoing.
Author: CK

Title: LNG traffic through Suez Canal seen little impacted by Red Sea ship attacks
Description: The recent attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea have created some concern about vessel safety, but not enough to encourage charterers to avoid the area and passage through the Suez Canal.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside Energy and Mexico Pacific agree 20-year deal for 1.3 mtpa of LNG
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside Energy has agreed to purchase 1.3 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from LNG project developer Mexico Pacific LNG’s proposed 15 mtpa Saguaro Energia export plant in Puerto Libertad, Sonora on Mexico’s Pacific coast.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside, Santos confirm potential merger discussions are ongoing
Description: Australian independent oil and gas producers Woodside Energy and Santos confirmed that they are in discussions with each other regarding a potential merger.
Author: CK

Title: NNPC, Wison sign initial deal to develop a floating LNG project
Description: Nigeria’s gas and oil producer NNPC has signed a memorandum of understanding with Chinese shipbuilder Wison Heavy Industry to develop a floating LNG export project.
Author: JS

Title: Prelude FLNG continues to work through its extended major turnaround
Description: The Shell-operated 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Broome in Western Australia remains offline as work continues on the facility following an extension to its first major turnaround that started towards the end of August.
Author: CK

Title: ExxonMobil sees Golden Pass mechanically complete in end-2024, signalling start-up delay
Description: ExxonMobil expects to achieve mechanical completion of the planned 18.1 mtpa Golden Pass LNG project at the end of 2024, signalling a delay in the start of the Texas-based project that it is jointly developing with QatarEnergy.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex seeks FERC’s timely approval of CP2 LNG, citing Japan’s energy security needs
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex is seeking the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s timely approval of the proposed 20 mtpa CP 2 LNG project in Louisiana in the hope that construction can begin early next year, citing the project’s importance for Japan’s energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Jera is second Japanese buyer to seek FERC approval for proposed US project CP2 LNG
Description: Japanese utility Jera has called on US energy regulator the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to approve the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project in Louisiana in a timely fashion, making it the project's second Japanese term offtaker to seek the agency’s help in expediting its development and ensuring that its LNG output comes online to help address Japan’s energy needs and global energy supply security concerns.
Author: CK

Title: EU Council, Parliament to allow member states to restrict Russian gas, LNG imports
Description: The EU Council and the EU Parliament have today agreed a provisional political agreement on a new gas regulation to promote renewable and low-carbon gases that includes a clause on energy security allowing member states to impose measures to restrict Russian gas and LNG imports at the national level.
Author: JS

Title: Hoegh LNG and VTTI to develop LNG terminal in the Netherlands
Description: Dutch energy storage infrastructure company VTTI and Norway-based LNG infrastructure firm Hoegh have agreed to jointly develop a floating storage regasification unit to be deployed in Vlissingen port offshore Zeeland province in Netherlands.
Author: JS

Title: China’s LNG imports rebound strongly in November to highest level this year
Description: China’s imports of LNG reached their highest level for the year in November, with its sharp increase in receipts reflecting an ample build-up of stocks for winter and keeping it on track to retain its position as the world’s largest LNG importer for the second consecutive year.
Author: CK

Title: Russian LNG exports slip in November as talks of restrictions intensify
Description: Russia’s LNG exports in November fell after three consecutive months of growth as talks of restricting flows of Russian LNG globally intensified after the US slapped sanctions on the proposed 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia in October.
Author: JS

Title: Transgas Force FSRU to serve as LNG tanker before deployment at Stade in February
Description: The 174,000 m3 Transgas Force floating storage and regasification unitwill serve as an LNG tanker for the next two months following its arrival in Rotterdam on Dec. 9 to carry out cooldown operations.
Author: JS

Title: Serbia-Bulgaria gas interconnector starts up, seen boosting regional gas supplies
Description: Serbia, Bulgaria and Azerbaijan have inaugurated a 1.8 billion m3 a year cross-border natural gas interconnector, which will provide an alternative supply route to Serbia, and beyond, from Azerbaijan via Bulgaria, further diversifying the region’s supply away from Russia.
Author: JS

Title: PTT seeks up to three Jan-Feb LNG cargoes, Oman LNG offers two cargoes for January
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy up to three LNG cargoes for delivery in January and February to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: BP asks FERC to intervene in dispute with Venture Global over Calcasieu Pass LNG start-up
Description: BP has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) for assistance in a dispute with LNG plant developer Venture Global, asking the authority to force the developer to disclose details on the force majeure (FM) that is delaying the start of commercial operations of its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana in the US.
Author: JS

Title: SEFE joins Jera, Inpex in urging FERC to fast-track CP2 LNG’s approval
Description: Germany’s state-owned energy company Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE) has become the third company to urge the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to approve the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project in Louisiana in a timely fashion, seeking the authority’s help to expedite the project’s development to ensure Germany’s energy security.
Author: JS

Title: Ust Luga LNG becomes the latest target of US sanctions
Description: The US listed three companies involved in the development of the proposed and under construction 6.5 mtpa Ust-Luga LNG plant in the Baltic Sea in its latest sanctions list on over 250 individuals and entities that continue to aid Russia in its war in Ukraine.
Author: JS

Title: FID on Germany’s proposed Stade onshore LNG terminal expected in coming weeks: HEH
Description: German LNG terminal developer Hanseatic Energy Hub expects to take a final investment decision on its proposed 9.9 mtpa onshore LNG and ammonia-ready terminal in Stade, Lower Saxony, in the coming weeks, as planned, having secured the necessary permits and completed the marketing of long-term capacity at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom, CNPC to boost gas supplies to China through Power of Siberia 1 pipeline next year
Description: Gazprom and China National Petroleum Corp. plan to increase gas supplies to China through the 38 billion m3 a year Power of Siberia gas pipeline next year, building on a recently agreed short-term increase in volumes.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s Idku is poised to ship its third LNG cargo this month as Damietta remains offline
Description: Egypt’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG plant is poised to export its third LNG cargo this month in the coming days, bringing its total number of shipments to six cargoes since it restarted exports in October after a summer hiatus.
Author: CK

Title: One LNG tanker diverts from Red Sea amid escalating attacks, shippers' moves to avoid area
Description: An LNG tanker that was heading for the Suez Canal through the Red Sea changed its course over the weekend and is now heading towards Cape Town amid an escalation in attacks by Houthi rebels since the start of the Israel-Hamas war and moves by some shipowners to avoid the Red Sea area.
Author: CK

Title: Cyprus grants Aphrodite gas project partners another extension to revise development plan
Description: The Cyprus government has granted the partners in the 4.2 trillion ft3 Aphrodite natural gas field an extension that they sought to revise a plan to develop the project, suggesting that a framework agreement it signed early this month with operator Chevron may not be final.
Author: JS

Title: Australian regulator approves Santos’ revised Barossa LNG backfill project
Description: Australian offshore petroleum regulator, the National Offshore Petroleum Safety and Environmental Management Authority (Nopsema) has approved energy firm Santos’ revised plan to develop the gas-to-LNG Barossa project that is aimed at providing feed gas for the existing 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG even as the Australian court continues to block the development of the pipeline part of the project.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor and SEFE ink 10-year gas supply deal
Description: Norway’s state-owned energy company Equinor will supply Germany’s Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE) with 111 TWh, or around 10 billion m3 per year, of natural gas for a period of 10 years with the option of a five-year extension. The deal is based on market price and the deliveries will be to Germany’s Trading Hub Europe (THE), Dutch Title Transfer Facility (TTF) and the UK’s National Balancing Point (NBP).
Author: JS

Title: BP, Equinor halt shipments through Red Sea as other LNG ship charterers reassess situation
Description: BP and Equinor have decided to suspend their shipments through the Red Sea, while other LNG ship charterers are reassessing the risks of sending their ships through the area amid continuing attacks on commercial ships by Yemen’s Houthi rebels that have heightened safety risks and pose a threat to trade flows through this vital waterway linking Europe and Asia.
Author: CK

Title: ENN emerges as the first offtaker from ADNOC’s Ruwais LNG
Description: The UAE’s state-owned energy company ADNOC has signed a 15-year heads of agreement (HoA) with China’s privately-owned ENN under which ADNOC will supply ENN with at least 1 mtpa of LNG per year starting in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: PTT seeks three spot LNG cargoes for delivery in January-February, PLL seeks cargo for January
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy three LNG cargoes for delivery in January and February to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies to deliver Batangas LNG’s third cargo
Description: Philippines’ power producer First Gen has awarded a contract to a subsidiary of French energy company TotalEnergies to supply the third cargo to its 5.3 mtpa Batangas floating storage regasification terminal (FSRU) located in the Philippines, in early February 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Barcarena LNG readies for start-up as Energos Celsius departs shipyard for Brazil
Description: The 160,000 m3 Energos Celsius has left Seatrium’s yard in Singapore and is on its way to Brazil, where it will serve as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at New Fortress Energy’s (NFE) 5.9 mtpa Barcarena LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Trinidad’s NGC, Shell granted license to develop Dragon gas field
Description: The government of Venezuela, Shell and Trinidad and Tobago’s National Gas Company (NGC) signed the license to export gas from the 4.2 trillion ft3 Dragon natural gas field in Venezuelan waters, which will allow for the natural gas to be sent to Trinidad for liquefaction and exports for a period of 30 years.
Author: JS

Title: Trinidad’s NGC, Shell granted license to develop Dragon gas field
Description: The government of Venezuela, Shell and Trinidad and Tobago’s National Gas Company (NGC) signed the license to export gas from the 4.2 trillion ft3 Dragon natural gas field in Venezuelan waters, which will allow for the natural gas to be sent to Trinidad for liquefaction and exports for a period of 30 years.
Author: JS

Title: Prelude loads first LNG cargo since August
Description: Shell-operated 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG located offshore Australia’s Northern Territory has restarted operations after a four-month turnaround, with an LNG tanker seen mooring at the facility on Dec. 26.
Author: JS

Title: German government to take over operations of the Brunsbuttel LNG terminal from RWE
Description: German energy company RWE said that it will hand over the operations of the floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) in Brunsbuttel to the state-owned Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) by the end of the week, around 10 months after it received its first LNG imports.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere Energy makes changes to Sabine Pass expansion plans
Description: US-based LNG exporter Cheniere Energy said that it would build two instead of three liquefaction trains as part of the Sabine Pass Liquefaction (SPL) expansion project in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, in order to maximise the project's scale and speed of bringing it to market.
Author: JS

Title: Eni introduces first gas into Congo FLNG, paves way to commissioning
Description: Eni has produced first gas at its 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG facility moored in Congolese waters, paving the way for the facility’s commissioning of the project’s liquefaction activities and production of LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Petronet to build new LNG terminal on India’s east coast
Description: State-owned LNG importer Petronet LNG has signed binding agreements with Gopalpur Ports Limited to develop an LNG terminal, its first on the east coast of India.
Author: JS

Title: Kremlin warns US sanctions on Arctic LNG 2 destructive to global energy security after announcement of force majeure
Description: A Russian foreign ministry official has warned that US sanctions against Novatek’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in the Yamal Peninsula threaten to “destroy global energy security” after it has emerged that several foreign partners in the project have suspended participation in the project after Novatek issued a force majeure (FM) notice on Train 1 due to sanctions.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies given option to exit its 17.5% stake in NextDecade
Description: NextDecade has allowed France’s TotalEnergies to sell a 17.5% stake in the US LNG developer over time, which is currently building the 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG plant in Texas, a little over six months after acquiring it.
Author: JS

Title: Samsung Heavy Industries bags $1.5 billion FLNG order in North America
Description: Korea’s shipbuilder Samsung Heavy Industries (SHI) has received an order to construct a floating LNG production facility for an unnamed project in North America with the contract value of around $1.5 billion and a delivery in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: European LNG imports in 2023 hit an all-time high
Description: EU’s full-year 2023 LNG imports have reached their all-time high and were up 5% year-on-year, helped by the new import capacity build-out that accelerated after Russia invaded Ukraine. However, December imports fell 7% on 2022 levels due to mild winter conditions and high gas storage.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s Damietta set to restart exports of LNG after an eight-month hiatus
Description: Egypt’s 5 mtpa Damietta LNG export plant is poised to ship its first cargo after halting shipments in May amid high temperatures in the country and strong domestic demand for gas.
Author: JS

Title: Finland’s Gasgrid invokes right to urgent LNG delivery amid cold spell
Description: Finland’s gas grid operator, Gasgrid, said today that it has invoked its right to order an extra LNG cargo to ensure market balance on a persistent cold spell which caused soaring electricity prices.
Author: JS

Title: Gail signs 10-year LNG purchase deal with Vitol starting in 2026
Description: India’s state-owned Gail and Vitol Asia have signed a long-term LNG sales and purchase agreement (SPA) whereby the trader will supply India with around 1 mtpa of LNG for a period of 10 years, commencing in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Global LNG exports rise by 3% in 2023 as the US leads for the first time
Description: Global LNG exports rose by about 3% on-year to reach 412.44 mt in 2023, thanks largely to a ramp-up in US shipments that took the country to the top LNG exporter spot for the first time, surpassing rival exporting countries Australia and Qatar.
Author: CK

Title: Gimi FLNG unit seen arriving at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim site this week
Description: The 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG unit is expected to arrive at the planned BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG export facility in Senegal and Mauritania at the end of this week, with its arrival seen kicking off the start of a six-month commissioning phase.
Author: CK

Title: Shell signs 20-year offtake deal for 2 mtpa of LNG with Canada’s Ksi Lisims LNG
Description: Shell has signed a 20-year agreement with Ksi Lisims LNG to buy 2 mtpa of LNG from the venture’s proposed 12 mtpa project in western British Columbia, Canada, marking the project’s first offtake deal.
Author: CK

Title: China reclaims global LNG import top spot as December LNG receipts surge to a two-year high
Description: China’s LNG imports surged in December to a two-year high, boosting its full-year imports and allowing the country to reclaim the title of the world’s largest LNG importer from Japan in 2023.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks one March LNG spot cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand has issued a tender to buy one spot LNG cargo for delivery on Mar. 13-16 to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender will close on Jan. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Falling Asian spot LNG prices seen encouraging more demand from China, India
Description: Spot LNG cargo purchases below the $10/mmBtu mark yesterday are expected to spur more demand from Asian buyers, particularly those from China and India if Asian LNG prices continue their retreat for deliveries in the next few months.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s Inkoo LNG terminal set to receive Gasgrid’s spot cargo purchase due to cold weather
Description: Finland’s 1.6 mtpa Inkoo LNG receiving terminal is scheduled to receive a spot cargo today purchased by the country’s gas transmission operator Gasgrid to balance supplies amid a recent cold spell that caused power prices to surge.
Author: CK

Title: Gimi FLNG heads to Tenerife as preparatory activities at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim still underway
Description: The 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG unit to be deployed at the BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility in Senegal and Mauritania is sailing towards the Canary Islands where it will moor offshore Tenerife until preparatory work at the project site is completed.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt posts largest LNG export decline globally in 2023 due to feed gas supply constraints
Description: A severe heatwave and the resultant increase in Egypt’s domestic gas consumption during the summer months, as well as reduced pipeline gas exports from Israel, took a heavy toll on feed gas receipts at Egypt’s LNG plants, resulting in a steep fall in their LNG shipments last year.
Author: CK

Title: Texas LNG agrees initial 15-year LNG tolling deal with EQT, expects project FID this year
Description: US project developer Texas LNG has signed an initial agreement with US energy firm EQT to liquefy 0.5 mtpa of LNG at the proposed 4 mtpa Texas LNG plant in Brownsville, on which it anticipates taking a final investment decision this year.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex to lift its stake in Ichthys LNG, taking over interests held by Tokyo Gas
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex plans to acquire a 1.58% participating interest held by Tokyo Gas in the 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG project in Australia, boosting its stake in the project to 67.82%.
Author: CK

Title: Qatari LNG ships headed for Red Sea, Suez Canal slow down amid recent airstrikes
Description: A few laden Qatari LNG ships that are signalling port calls in Europe via the  Suez Canal have slowed down to almost a halt amid recent air strikes, highlighting the continued risks for ships plying the area.
Author: CK

Title: Commissioning of Greece’s Alexandroupolis LNG to begin after arrival of first cargo this week
Description: The 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG terminal in Greece is poised to begin commissioning operations following the arrival of the new terminal’s first cargo this week.
Author: CK

Title: More LNG ships steer away from Red Sea, Suez Canal area amid security warnings
Description: More LNG ships have diverted away from the Red Sea and Suez Canal amid warnings for commercial ships to avoid the area after a Houthi missile hit a US-owned container ship in the Gulf of Aden yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks three LNG cargoes for delivery in February and March
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy up to three LNG cargoes for delivery in February and March to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in southern Thailand. The tender closes on Jan. 18.
Author: CK

Title: Croatia’s HEP seeks up to three LNG cargoes for delivery between April and September
Description: Croatia’s state-owned utility Hrvatska Elektropriveda (HEP) is seeking between one and three LNG cargoes for delivery to the 2.13 mt Krk LNG terminal in Omisalj between April and September through a tender closing on Jan. 26. Offers are expected to remain valid until Jan. 31.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico Pacific, ExxonMobil sign a third LNG term deal; 1.2 mtpa of LNG over 20 years
Description: LNG project developer Mexico Pacific has signed a deal with ExxonMobil to sell 1.2 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from its proposed 15 mtpa Saguaro Energia project in Puerto Libertad on Mexico’s west coast, marking the third 20-year deal between the firms for supplies from the project.
Author: CK

Title: China dominates Russia’s LNG exports in 2023; exports to Spain post largest gains on-year
Description: Russia increased its LNG exports to China last year, making the northeast Asian country its top buyer for the first time amid a year-on-year dip in its exports.
Author: CK

Title: Europe’s cold snap dents gas stock levels, but end-of-winter stocks could be above 2023 levels
Description: A recent cold snap that swept across northern Europe dented the European Union’s storage levels slightly compared to a year earlier, but they remain well above stock levels during the corresponding period in 2022.
Author: JS

Title: Greece's Alexandroupolis LNG to receive commissioning cargo from Egypt’s Damietta
Description: Greece’s new FSRU-based LNG terminal, the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis, is due to receive its commissioning cargo tomorrow, signalling the start of commissioning operations.
Author: JS

Title: Red Sea attacks force 11 LNG ships to shun the Suez Canal this week, no ships left in the area
Description: The continued attacks on ships passing through the Red Sea and warnings to avoid the area have led 11 LNG tankers to steer away from the Suez Canal this week, leaving no LNG ships in the Canal since Jan. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Congo FLNG readies for commissioning as vessel moors at facility
Description: The Eni-operated 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG unit saw the arrival of the first LNG tanker at its site over the weekend, marking the start of the first phase of operations of the facility.
Author: JS

Title: China’s Wison starts work on FLNG units for two projects in Nigeria
Description: China’s floating LNG unit builder Wison New Energies has started work on two floating LNG production projects in Nigeria.
Author: JS

Title: LNG ship diverts from Alexandroupolis LNG; commissioning cargo yet to arrive
Description: The yet-to-start 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG terminal in the Thracian Sea is still awaiting its commissioning cargo after a ship that was scheduled to call at the terminal on Jan. 20 changed its course a day earlier.
Author: CK

Title: Senegal, Mauritania expect first gas from Greater Tortue Ahmeyim in third quarter 2024
Description: Senegal and Mauritania expect that the 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project, whose straddles the maritime border between the two countries, will begin producing gas in the third quarter of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Pluto Train 2 on track to meet target of first LNG cargo in 2026: Woodside
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside continues to expect its Scarborough and Pluto Train 2 project in Western Australia to produce its first LNG cargo in 2026, with the project 55% complete at the end of last year.
Author: CK

Title: Summit FSRU to undergo drydocking, leaving Bangladesh with one operational LNG terminal
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG vessel that serves as one of Bangladesh’s two floating storage regasification units has left the Summit LNG terminal at Moheshkhali and is en route to Singapore where it is expected to undergo drydocking for about a month.
Author: CK

Title: Snam earmarks EUR 10.4 billion of investment for gas, LNG infrastructure in Italy
Description: Italy’s gas transmission operator Snam plans to invest €10.3 billion (USD 11.2 billion) over the next three years in the country’s gas and LNG infrastructure to boost regional access to gas.
Author: JS

Title: Santos pushes back start of first gas production from Barossa to third-quarter of 2025
Description: Australian energy firm Santos has pushed back the start of first gas production at its Barossa gas project to the third quarter of 2025 due to legal challenges, which held back drilling activity at the project and has inflated its costs.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy keeps LNG output stable amid Red Sea crisis; managing shipments with buyers
Description: QatarEnergy has warned that the conflict in the Red Sea which has forced LNG shippers to avoid the region, including the Suez Canal, could delay some LNG deliveries. But, it said it is managing its LNG deliveries in collaboration with its customers while keeping its LNG production stable.
Author: CK

Title: Global gas demand to rise in 2024, but supply still tight: IEA
Description: The International Energy Agency (IEA) said that it expects to see solid growth in natural gas demand in 2024, with the speed at which this demand could be met critical as supplies remain tight and could only rise substantially from 2025.
Author: JS

Title: US pauses LNG project approval issuance on climate woes
Description: US President Joe Biden has halted new decisions on LNG exports to weigh their impact on the environment and accelerate the transition from fossil fuels.
Author: JS

Title: Nigeria, Morocco look to speed up FID on gas pipeline project; alternative export route to Europe
Description: Nigeria and Morocco are in talks to accelerate the pace of taking a final investment decision on the proposed Nigeria-Morocco Gas pipeline that is expected to monetise Nigeria’s gas resources by providing an alternative gas export route to Europe and supplying other West African countries along the way.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG to shut one train for a month due to storm-induced electrical issues
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas expects to shut one of its liquefaction trains for about one month after Winter Storm Heather hit Texas last week, causing electrical issues at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy, Excelerate agree 15-year deal for supply of up to 1 mtpa of LNG to Bangladesh
