Description: QatarEnergy has agreed to supply up to 1 mtpa of LNG over 15 years to Excelerate Energy for delivery to Bangladesh from January 2026, with the supply expected to fulfill a deal that Excelerate signed with Bangladesh’s state-owned Petrobangla last year.
Author: CK

Title: Beach Energy ships first Waitsia LNG cargo from NWS; gas plant commissioning underway
Description: Australia-based energy company Beach Energy has shipped the first LNG cargo from its Waitsia gas project 16 km from Dongara, Western Australia through the Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa NWS LNG plant in Western Australia, marking the firm’s entrance into the LNG market.
Author: JS

Title: Gail and ADNOC Gas sign 10-year LNG SPA for 0.5 mtpa, commencing in 2026
Description: India’s state-owned energy company Gail has signed an agreement to convert an existing memorandum of understanding with UAE’s ADNOC Gas on cooperation in LNG into a sales and purchase agreement (SPA), with ADNOC supplying 0.5 mtpa of LNG to India for a period of 10 years, starting in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport’s month-long single train outage seen lifting prices, but gains may be modest
Description: The shutdown of a single train at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quinatan Island, Texas, for about a month is expected to give LNG prices that have been trending downwards a further lift in the near term as the market reacts to the impact on exports.
Author: CK

Title: Toscana LNG's FSRU to undergo seven-month maintenance from April
Description: Terminal operator OLT Offshore LNG Toscana will take its 5 billion m3 a year (3.7 mtpa) LNG terminal off Italy’s coast of Livorno offline from April as its FSRU Toscana will undergo “extraordinary” maintenance over the period, reducing Italy’s import capacity.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy gets US customs OK allowing Altamira LNG deliveries to US markets
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has received confirmation from the US Customs department that the use of non-US flagged vessels to ship LNG from its 1.4 mtpa floating LNG facility offshore Altamira in Mexico will not violate the Jones Act, thereby allowing the terminal to deliver LNG to markets in the US.
Author: CK

Title: Nebula Energy buys majority stake in AG&P’s LNG arm
Description: US-based investment company Nebula Energy has announced that it bought a majority 80% stake in Singapore-headquartered AG&P LNG, AG&P Group’s arm focused on the development and operation of LNG, to accelerate the rollout of its gas-to-power projects in the region.
Author: JS

Title: Sonatrach extends its LNG capacity booking at UK’s Grain by 10 years
Description: UK’s National Grid announced that Algeria’s state-owned Sonatrach has extended an existing terminal use agreement at its 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG import facility in Kent, UK, by another 10 years and increased the capacity from 2.2 mtpa to 3 mtpa.
Author: JS

Title: Bulgargaz secures one March LNG cargo from TotalEnergies for delivery to Revithoussa
Description: Bulgaria’s largest gas distribution firm Bulgargaz has secured one March LNG cargo for delivery to Greece’s 5 mtpa Revithoussa LNG receiving terminal through a tender that closed on Jan. 25.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside, Saipem working on remediation for damaged Scarborough gas project pipeline
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside is working with Italian offshore services firm Saipem to ensure safe operations and remediation work to a 430 km pipeline for the Scarborough gas project that was damaged yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Hungary, Qatar discussions for long-term LNG supply post-2026 “progressing well”
Description: Discussions between Hungary and Qatar for long-term LNG supplies to be delivered to Hungary after 2026 are “progressing well,” with a contract expected to be signed once the delivery routes and discharge ports in Europe are confirmed.
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC seeks LNG cargoes for delivery from March to May
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC is seeking an undisclosed number of LNG cargoes for delivery between March and May through a tender closing today.
Author: CK

Title: Russian LNG exports slip in January but more shipped to Europe for third straight month
Description: Russian LNG exports in January dipped against December but rose against year-earlier levels, with demand from Europe continuing to drive the country’s strong exports.
Author: JS

Title: Estonia nears completion of Paldiski LNG import infrastructure
Description: Estonia’s transmission system operator, Elering, has installed a loading dock at the LNG jetty in the port of Pakrineeme in the northwestern Estonian town of Paldiski, with the jetty to be ready this month.
Author: JS

Title: Gaz-System picks MOL to supply FSRU for Gdansk LNG
Description: Poland’s state-owned gas transmission system operator Gaz-System has selected Japanese shipping company Mitsui OSK Lines (MOL) to supply the floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) which the firm will charter out for the planned 4.6 mtpa Gdansk LNG import terminal in the Baltic Sea.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports in January dip on-month but stay close to record levels
Description: US LNG exports in January were close to record levels despite falling slightly against December after frigid weather conditions brought about by storms last month caused cargoes to be cancelled at some terminals.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global books second 3-mtpa regasification slot at Grain LNG from 2029
Description: Venture Global (VG) emerged as the second company that booked long-term regasification capacity at the 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG terminal in Kent from 2029, UK’s utility National Grid announced, making it the LNG project developer’s first investment outside of the US.
Author: JS

Title: Norway’s Troll and Nyhamna face unplanned outages until tomorrow
Description: Norway’s 129 million m3/day Troll gas field and 79.8 million m3/day Nyhamna gas plant have shut down for unplanned outages since yesterday and are expected to resume operations tomorrow,  according to Norway’s gas grid operator Gassco.
Author: JS

Title: Santos, Australia Pacific LNG to offer March-April LNG cargoes this week
Description: Australian LNG producers Santos and Australia Pacific LNG are poised to add to the spot supply pool with tenders to sell one cargo each this week.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers short-term LNG volumes from Sakhalin 2
Description: Project operator Sakhalin Energy is looking to sell about 0.7 mtpa of LNG from its Sakhalin 2 LNG export facility at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port under a three-year contract that is expected to start by 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Norway’s Troll and Nyhamna outages extended by one day
Description: Norway’s gas grid operator reported an extension of unplanned outages at the 129 million m3/day Troll gas field and the 79.8 million m3/day Nyhamna gas plant by one more day until tomorrow.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Petronet extends 7.5 mtpa LNG contract with QatarEnergy for 20 years
Description: India’s state-owned Petronet LNG has signed a contract to buy 7.5 mtpa of LNG over 20 years from Qatar’s state-owned QatarEnergy, extending an existing free-on-board contract for the same volume that expires in 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Qatar’s LNG exports rise in January despite Red Sea conflict and shipping disruptions
Description: Qatar shipped more LNG in January than it did in December and a year earlier, shrugging off the disruption to shipping caused by the ongoing conflict in the Red Sea that has led LNG shippers to avoid shipments through the Suez Canal since last month.
Author: CK

Title: Centrica agrees to buy 1 mtpa of LNG from Repsol over three years from 2025
Description: UK’s energy company Centrica has agreed to purchase 1 mtpa of LNG from Spain’s Repsol for a period of three years starting in 2025, with the volumes to be delivered to the 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG terminal in Kent.
Author: JS

Title: Russian government to invest in stalled Ust-Luga LNG project, start-up targeted for 2027
Description: The Kremlin plans to invest 900 billion rubles ($10 billion) in the proposed 13 mtpa Ust-Luga LNG plant in the Baltic Sea through the National Welfare Fund and expects the facility’s two trains to come online by 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Australian LNG producers Woodside, Santos end potential merger talks
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has ended talks about a potential merger with fellow Australian energy firm Santos, two months after confirming that the two firms had begun discussions to look into combining into a single entity.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies introduces additional feedgas supply into Nigeria’s NLNG plant
Description: French energy company TotalEnergies has started up the Akpo West tie-back project on the PML2 license offshore Nigeria, which, among other things, will provide additional feedgas for the existing 22.1 mtp Bonny LNG plant.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies eyes Mozambique LNG construction restart in mid-2024
Description: TotalEnergies to expects to restart the construction of the 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG project by mid-2024 as it sees the security situation in the country as improving, the firm’s chief executive, Patrick Pouyanne, said at the earnings call yesterday.
Author: JS

Title: Suez Canal LNG transits drop 90% on-year in January while Cape of Good Hope traffic jumps
Description: The dangers posed by continuing airstrikes in the Red Sea region have led to an avoidance of the Suez Canal by LNG carriers since Jan. 16, with transits through the Canal falling sharply in January compared to December, while the number of ships taking the alternative, and longer, route around the Cape of Good Hope has jumped over the same period.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina seeks tugboat, maritime services for Escobar, indicating upcoming LNG demand
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued one tender each to secure tugboat services and maritime agency services to support import operations at its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG terminal, indicating plans to restart LNG imports for the year. Both tenders close on Feb. 22.
Author: CK

Title: Mid-Ocean Energy buys SK’s 20% share in Peru LNG, adding to its Australian LNG interests
Description: MidOcean Energy has agreed to buy SK Earthon’s 20% share in the Peru LNG as part of its strategy to create a global, diversified LNG portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s VNG signs mid-term gas supply deal with Sonatrach
Description: German energy company VNG has signed a deal with Algeria’s state-owned Sonatrach to buy natural gas, with the company becoming the first German company to do so.
Author: JS

Title: Croatia to construct two gas pipelines to boost capacity from expanding Krk LNG
Description: The Croatian government greenlighted plans to construct two natural gas pipelines for EUR400 million ($430 million) to boost deliveries to neighbouring Hungary and Slovenia and to accommodate the capacity increase at the country’s sole LNG terminal, the 2.1 mtpa Krk terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Hanwha Ocean transfers ownership of Arc7 carrier for Arctic LNG 2 to UAE-based entity
Description: Ship registry records show that the ownership of the newly built ice-class Arc7 LNG carrier, the 172,500 m3 Pyotr Kapitsa, was transferred to a UAE-based entity instead of Russia’s Novatek, as the Russian company looks to be determined to start shipments from its 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export project heavily sanctioned by the US.
Author: JS

Title: QatarEnergy selects Nakilat to own and operate up to 25 newbuild LNG tankers
Description: QatarEnergy announced that it has selected Qatar Gas Transport Company Limited (Nakilat) to be the owner and operator of up to 25 conventional-size LNG carriers as part of the country’s second phase of a massive fleet expansion plan.
Author: JS

Title: Project partners eye FID on Mozambique’s Rovuma LNG project in 2025: Galp
Description: The ExxonMobil-led consortium developing the 18 mtpa Rovuma LNG export project in Mozambique is looking to reach a final investment decision (FID) on the project in 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two spot LNG cargoes for delivery in April
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery in April to the 11.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal through a tender closing Feb. 16.
Author: JS

Title: Elengy’s Fos LNG terminals reduce LNG sendout due to workers’ strike until Feb. 15
Description: A strike by workers at the Elengy-operated 1.2 mtpa Fos Tonkin and 8 mtpa Fos Cavaou terminals in southern France from Feb. 9 to 15 is expected to reduce sendout from the facilities, with no ships expected to call over the period.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas plans to supply LNG to industrial customers from the second quarter of 2024
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned gas distributor PV Gas plans to supply LNG to its industrial customers from the second quarter of this year, paving the way for the country's sole 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal in the Ba Ria-Vung Tai province to begin receiving commercial cargoes and increase utilization.
Author: CK

Title: National Grid asks to expedite recent LNG deal with Constellation Energy
Description: Britain-headquartered electricity and gas utility National Grid appealed to the Department of Public Utilities (DPU) to expedite the approval of the recent LNG supply deal it signed with Constellation Energy, which will allow it to keep the 5.1 mtpa Everett LNG import terminal in Massachusetts running for another six years.
Author: JS

Title: Chesapeake Energy inks LNG export deal with Gunvor, Delfin LNG
Description: Oklahoma-based exploration and production company Chesapeake Energy has signed a long-term LNG export deal with Delfin LNG and Gunvor to deliver 0.5 mtpa from the 13.3 mtpa Delfin floating LNG plant to the energy trader for a period of 20 years, starting in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: NLNG sees slight improvement in feed gas supplies but keeps force majeure in place
Description: Feed gas supplies to the 22.1 mtpa Nigeria LNG export plant on Bonny Island have increased thanks to the combined efforts of stakeholders, but the force majeure on upstream supplies to the plant remains in force despite the improvement.
Author: CK

Title: BP, ADNOC form gas-focused joint venture in Egypt
Description: BP and ADNOC have agreed to form a new joint venture (JV) in Egypt, which will combine both firms’ expertise to expand their gas portfolio in the country.
Author: JS

Title: China, Southeast Asia to drive LNG demand growth beyond 2040: Shell
Description: Shell expects LNG demand to grow by 50% by 2040, with further growth in the years ahead driven by declining domestic gas production in parts of South Asia and Southeast Asia owing to an accelerating coal-to-power switching activity.
Author: JS

Title: Greece’s Alexandroupolis LNG terminal to receive commissioning cargo tomorrow
Description: Greece’s new 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG project is scheduled to receive its first LNG cargo tomorrow, which will likely be used to commission its floating storage regasification unit and other terminal facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Venice Energy inks FSRU deal with AG&P LNG for Outer Harbor
Description: South Australia-headquartered Venice Energy has signed a commercial agreement with AG&P LNG, which guarantees the receipt of a converted floating storage regasification unit for deployment at its proposed 3.8 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import facility at Adelaide port.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim’s Gimi FLNG unit arrives at project site
Description: The 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG unit has arrived at the BP-operated Greater Tortue Ahmeyim project site on the Mauritania and Senegal maritime border after floating for a few weeks close to the hub.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy Terminal expects Stade FSRU to arrive by end-March
Description: German floating LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal expects the 174,000 m3 Energos Force LNG tanker to arrive at the 9.9 mtpa Stade floating LNG terminal in Lower Saxony at the end of March to begin its deployment as a floating storage regasification unit, following which commissioning operations will begin at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Eni expects to ship up to 10 LNG cargoes from Egypt’s Damietta before end of winter
Description: Eni expects to export eight to 10 LNG cargoes from its 5 mtpa Damietta LNG export facility before the end of the winter season, according to the firm’s senior management.
Author: JS

Title: US House of Representatives passes bill to reverse Biden's LNG export halt
Description: The US House of Representatives has passed a bill to repeal restrictions on LNG project approvals that the President Joe Biden administration introduced late last month, with the bill now facing a vote in the Senate.
Author: JS

Title: Tangguh halts LNG exports amid planned maintenance on Train 2, technical issues at Train 3
Description: The three-train BP-operated 11.4 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia has halted exports since early this month amid technical problems at its third train and planned maintenance at its second train that have led to discussions about prompt cargo deferrals with its buyers, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Congo FLNG to deliver first LNG cargo on schedule this quarter: Eni
Description: The 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG facility in the Republic of Congo is on track to deliver its first LNG cargo by March, following the introduction of gas into the facility in late December.
Author: CK

Title: EU sees no need to renew deal on Russian gas transit via Ukraine
Description: The European Union has “no interest” in renewing the tri-lateral gas transit deal with Russia and Ukraine after its expiry at the end of 2024 as it sees alternatives for member countries that still receive Russian pipeline gas.
Author: JS

Title: Gaslog Hong Kong arrives in Greece with commissioning cargo for Alexandroupolis LNG
Description: The 174,000 m3 Gaslog Hong Kong LNG tanker has arrived in Greece, where it is poised to deliver a commissioning cargo for Greece’s new 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Tellurian gets three-year FERC extension to construct Driftwood LNG
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) granted an extension to US LNG project developer Tellurian for the construction of its 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG export terminal near Lake Charles in Louisiana until 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Finland’s Gasgrid to bring Balticconnector online by late April
Description: Finland’s state-owned gas transmission operator Gasgrid plans to complete repairs by Apr. 22 on the bi-directional undersea Balticconnector gas pipeline that has been out of commission since October due to a rupture.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron, partners agree FID for Phase 2 of Tamar gas field expansion
Description: US-based energy company Chevron and its partners took a final investment decision (FID) on the second phase expansion of its 10.2 billion m3/year Tamar gas field offshore Israel, which will increase the field’s daily production by 60% from 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor to supply 0.65 mtpa of LNG to India’s Deepak Fertilisers, starting in 2026
Description: Norway’s state-owned Equinor and Indian fertiliser and petrochemicals company Deepak Fertilisers have inked a 15-year LNG supply agreement of 0.65 mtpa, commencing in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Philippines’ First Gen seeks one LNG cargo for Batangas, delivery in March
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon between Mar. 15 and Mar. 31, making it the fifth cargo the firm intends to buy after its purchase of a commissioning cargo in July. The tender closes on Mar. 6.
Author: JS

Title: Altamira LNG may be close to shipping first cargo as LNG ship circles near port
Description: An LNG tanker waiting close to the New Fortress Energy-operated 1.4 mtpa floating LNG project offshore Altamira in Mexico over the last 11 days suggests that the new export facility may be close to loading and shipping its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Indonesia’s Tangguh resumes LNG exports after a halt since early February
Description: The BP-operated 11.4 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia has resumed LNG exports, ending a 15-day export halt amid planned maintenance at its second train and technical issues at its third train.
Author: CK

Title: OLT Offshore LNG Toscana brings forward seven-month FSRU maintenance to March
Description: Terminal operator OLT Offshore LNG Toscana has brought forward the start of a seven-month-long maintenance of its floating storage regasification unit by a month to Mar. 1 from the beginning of April.
Author: CK

Title: Santos’ Barossa Gas project is 67% complete; first gas from project still targeted for 3Q 2025
Description: Australian energy firm Santos’ Barossa Gas project has reached 67% completion and the firm expects the project that will deliver a new source of feed gas to the Darwin LNG plant to begin producing first gas in the third quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Pipelay scope for Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project completed: Allseas
Description: Offshore pipelay construction firm Allseas has completed the critical offshore pipelay work for the BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim project on the maritime border between Senegal and Mauritania, almost two months after starting work on the project.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside receives first few Pluto Train 2 modules for its Scarborough Energy project
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has received the first three modules for the second train at the Pluto LNG project in Karratha, Western Australia, marking an important  milestone for the development of its Scarborough Energy project
Author: CK

Title: Tangguh Train 3 resumes operations after technical issues
Description: The 3.8 mtpa third train of the BP-operated 11.4 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia has resumed operations after shutting down due to technical issues last week.
Author: CK

Title: Energy firms challenge Venture Global’s request to extend plant commissioning of Calcasieau Pass
Description: At least three energy companies have filed motions to intervene with the Federal Energy Regulatory Committee (FERC) in the US, challenging Venture Global’s recent request to extend its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant’s already delayed commissioning for another year until 2025.
Author: JS

Title: West Australian domestic gas policy may no longer be fit for purpose: Parliamentary committee
Description: Western Australia’s domestic gas policy aimed at ensuring the state’s long-term energy needs may no longer be fit for purpose, with forecasts for gas supply shortfalls indicating that there may even be a case for government intervention, according to an interim report released by the Western Australian Parliament’s Economics and Industry Standing Committee today on its inquiry into the policy’s continued viability.
Author: CK

Title: Vitol, EOG Resources sign 10-year US gas supply deal linked to Brent pricing
Description: Global energy trader Vitol has signed a deal to buy 180,000 mmBtu of gas a day over 10 years from US oil and gas producer EOG Resources, with the bulk of the supply indexed to the Brent crude price.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere targets first LNG output from Corpus Christi Stage 3 at the end of this year
Description: US LNG project developer Cheniere expects to start producing LNG from the first of seven trains at its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi LNG Stage 3 project in Texas at the end of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside agrees to sell 15% stake in Scarborough JV, LNG supplies to Jera
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has signed a deal to sell a 15.1% stake in its Scarborough joint venture to Japan’s Jera for $1.4 billion, expanding Japan’s involvement in the Western Australian gas project that will provide a new source of feed gas supplies to support the expansion of the 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Celsius FSRU arrives at port of deployment at Brazil’s Celba LNG terminal
Description: The 160,000 m3 Energos Celsius has arrived in Barcarena, Brazil’s north-eastern Para state, where it will be deployed as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at developer New Fortress Energy’s 6 mtpa Celba import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG commissioning operations still underway
Description: Terminal operator Gastrade said that commissioning operations at the 4 mtpa Alexandrouplois LNG import terminal in Greece are still in ongoing following the delivery of a commissioning cargo to the facility last week.
Author: JS

Title: UK adds Arctic LNG 2 to its sanctions list;  marks second year of Russia’s war with Ukraine
Description: The UK has added the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia and individuals linked to the project to its sanctions list with the aim of   cutting off critical funding for Russia’s war on Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Pembina delays Cedar LNG FID to mid-2024
Description: Canadian midstream company Pembina Pipeline Corp said that it expects to take a final investment decision (FID) on its proposed 3 mtpa Cedar LNG plant in Kitimat, British Columbia by the middle of this year, which is a delay from the previous target of early 2024.
Author: JS

Title: US slaps sanctions on Russian Zvezda shipyard in latest blow to Arctic LNG 2’s start-up
Description: The US continues to target Russia’s LNG sector with sanctions, with the Zvezda shipyard constructing 15 ice-breaking LNG vessels for Novatek’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant as one of the latest targets of the US’s sanctions row against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG to ship first LNG in Q4: Kosmos Energy
Description: US upstream firm Kosmos Energy expects the BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritania to ship its first LNG cargo in the fourth quarter of this year, which is yet another blow for the project’s already delayed start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Power FSRU arrives at Mukran LNG, marking the start of commissioning operations
Description: The 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) arrived at Germany’s Mukran LNG import terminal in the Baltic Sea on Saturday, marking the start of commissioning operations of the country’s fourth LNG import facility.
Author: JS

Title: Qatar to boost the North Field field expansion by further 16 mtpa of LNG
Description: QatarEnergy is to extend its North Field expansion project by developing the 16 mtpa North Field West project, adding to the existing 49 mtpa expansion that is already underway, with the country to raise its LNG capacity to 142 mtpa by the end of the decade.
Author: JS

Title: Congo FLNG set to ship first cargo as LNG tanker arrives at facility
Description: The Eni-operated 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG plant is due to ship its first cargo as the Gaslog Savannah LNG tanker has moored at the facility and is seen loading a cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG extends Train 3 maintenance until mid-March
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas expects to extend the month-long maintenance of its third liquefaction train for another two weeks.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside Energy expects LNG demand to rise 53% in the next decade
Description: Australian energy company Woodside Energy expects LNG demand to rise by over 50% by 2033, fuelled by China and Southeast Asia, underpinning its continued focus on growing its LNG position.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside Energy signs LNG supply deal with Kogas, starting in 2026
Description: Australia’s Woodside Energy has inked a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with Korea Gas Corporation (Kogas) for the supply of 0.5 mtpa of LNG for 10.5 years, commencing in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies and Sembcorp ink 16-year LNG supply agreement, commencing in 2027
Description: TotalEnergies has signed a sale and purchase agreement (SPA) with Singapore-based Sembcorp Fuels for the supply of 0.8 mtpa of LNG for a period of 16 years starting in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Force FSRU signals arrival date at Stade in mid-March
Description: Energos Force is signalling the arrival at Germany’s Stade LNG terminal, where it will be deployed as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU), in the middle of next month, marking the start-up of the country’s fifth floating LNG import facility.
Author: JS

Title: Golar LNG signs framework deal with potential FLNG customer
Description: Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG inked a framework agreement for the potential long-term utilisation of one of its FLNG units.
Author: JS

Title: New Fortress Energy further delays maiden LNG cargo from Altamira to April
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) has delayed the start of LNG production at its 4.2 mtpa Altamira floating LNG export plant in Mexico to March and expects to ship its maiden LNG cargo in April.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports dip in February; Freeport LNG leads export losses
Description: US LNG exports fell for the second consecutive month in February, with the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas contributing most to the decline due to a one-train shutdown across the entire month.
Author: CK

Title: Potential FID for Eni’s second floating LNG project in Mozambique this year: Technip Energies
Description: French engineering company Technip Energies sees potential in making a final investment decision (FID) for Coral North, the expansion of Eni’s Coral South floating LNG project, in 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa seeks 10 LNG cargoes for delivery in April-July to Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued a tender to buy 10 LNG cargoes for delivery between April and July to the country’s 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on Mar. 12 and offers are expected to remain valid until a day later.
Author: CK

Title: Three Philippines power firms to acquire AG&P’s Philippines LNG terminal, invest in power plants
Description: Three private power companies in the Philippines will jointly invest in power plants and acquire the existing 3 mtpa Philippines LNG import terminal in the country’s Luzon region.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two March-April LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery in March and April to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes on Mar. 6.
Author: CK

Title: Gas producer EQT to cut natural gas production in March amid low prices
Description: US natural gas producer EQT Corporation made a “strategic decision” to curtail natural gas production due to low natural gas prices, resulting from warm winter and high storage levels.
Author: JS

Title: Tellurian to take FID on Driftwood LNG export project in 2024
Description: US LNG developer Tellurian expects to make a final investment decision (FID) on its proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG export project in Louisiana and issue a full notice to proceed with the construction of the first phase in this year.
Author: JS

Title: Eni’s Congo FLNG ships its first LNG cargo; delivery at Piombino expected by end of the week
Description: The Eni-operated 0.6 mtpa Congo floating LNG facility in the Republic of Congo’s Point Noire has shipped its maiden cargo, almost a week after the 154,800 m3 Gaslog Savannah LNG tanker arrived at the terminal for loading.
Author: CK

Title: Hanwha Ocean signs preliminary deal to build 12 LNG tankers for Middle Eastern client
Description: Korean shipbuilder Hanwha Ocean signed a deal for an initial order of 12 “ultra-large” LNG carriers with an unnamed company based in the Middle East, which might be linked with QatarEnergy’s continued fleet buildout.
Author: JS

Title: EU-27’s February LNG imports stay flat amid soft demand, robust gas storage levels
Description: LNG imports into the EU-27 were flat in February compared with January, as relatively mild weather, lower demand and high underground gas stocks continued to diminish the bloc’s need for LNG imports.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s power firm Hin Kong receives first LNG cargo, marking its debut as an LNG importer
Description: Licensed Thai LNG shipper Hin Kong Power has received its first LNG cargo at the PTT-operated 7.5 mtpa Map Ta Phut Terminal 2 in Thailand’s southern Rayong province, marking the firm’s debut as an LNG importer and the first LNG import into Thailand by a private firm.
Author: CK

Title: EU imports of Russian LNG dip on-month in February; Spain’s receipts more than halved
Description: The European Union’s imports of Russian LNG fell in February after reaching a four-month high in January as the bloc’s largest buyers, France and Spain, reduced their intake.
Author: CK

Title: German gas levy puts EU energy solidarity at risk: Simson
Description: EU Commissioner for Energy Kadri Simson said that Germany’s gas neutrality charge was damaging to the bloc’s energy solidarity and undermined collective efforts to diversify away from Russian natural gas imports.
Author: JS

Title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel seeks 0.5 mtpa of LNG for India over 5-10 year period
Description: Steelmaker ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel has issued a tender to buy 0.5 mtpa of LNG for delivery to India over a five- or 10-year period. The tender closes on Mar. 15.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P LNG buys 49% stake in Vietnam’s LNG import terminal, eyes start-up in Q3
Description: UAE-based AG&P LNG has acquired a 49% share in Vietnam’s 3 mtpa Hai Lihn LNG terminal in Vung Tau in South Vietnam, which is expected to start up later this year amid Vietnam’s push to expand LNG import capacity.
Author: JS

Title: Nigeria announces reforms to boost investment into oil and gas sector
Description: The Nigerian President, Bola Tinubu, signed executive orders introducing tax credits for some onshore and shallow water locations and streamlining contract approvals, improving the investment climate in the country’s oil and gas industry and filling in the gaps in the landmark petroleum law.
Author: JS

Title: Delfin Midstream requests DOE extension to complete FLNG project by 2029
Description: US-based LNG project developer Delfin Midstream is seeking an additional five years to complete its 13 mtpa Delfin floating LNG project offshore Louisiana, just 90 days before the expiration of the existing permits.
Author: JS

Title: FSRU charterers should hold onto their vessels amid tight supply over the next three years
Description: The supply of floating storage regasification units, or FSRUs, is expected to stay tight over the next three years, a situation that should encourage charterers to retain these vessels to avoid being stuck without a replacement and the ability to import when needed.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas seeks one cargo for delivery in May to Thi Vai
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery in May to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tai province. The tender closes on Mar. 14.
Author: CK

Title: YPF delays FID on large-scale LNG plant to 2025, first  phase to start in 2027
Description: Argentina’s energy company YPF said it would make a final investment decision (FID) on its giant Argentina LNG export project it is developing with Malaysia’s Petronas in mid-2025, a pushback from 2024 expected previously, and would launch a smaller-scale first phase of the project by 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Production issues at Malaysia’s MLNG 2 project at Bintulu spur LNG cargo deferrals
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export complex in Malaysia is facing production issues at one of its liquefaction trains, forcing the operator to seek the deferral of a few term cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Sonatrach announces completion of new LNG jetty at Skikda plant
Description: A large-scale LNG tanker has successfully moored the 4.5 mtpa Skikda LNG plant’s new jetty in Algeria, part of an expansion plan for the facility to accept larger LNG vessels and to expand its LNG capabilities and reach.
Author: JS

Title: Adnoc issues early EPC notice for Ruwais LNG, to take FID this year
Description: UAE’s state-owned ADNOC has issued a limited notice to proceed with early engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) activities to a joint venture led by France’s Technip Energies for its planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG plant in Al Ruwais.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade targets FID for Rio Grande LNG’s Train 4 in second-half 2024
Description: U.S. project developer NextDecade expects to greenlight the fourth liquefaction train that is part of the second phase of development of its Rio Grande LNG project in Texas in the second half of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Gate LNG terminal weighs construction of the fourth receiving jetty
Description: The Gate LNG terminal in the Netherlands is exploring market demand via a non-binding call for expressionS of interest in small-scale ship loading services for a fourth jetty at the import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Developers of proposed South African LNG terminal test market interest for capacity bookings
Description: South Africa's gas grid operator Transnet Pipelines (TPL) and Dutch energy storage operator Vopak have invited companies to submit expressions of interest (EOI) in booking storage and regasification capacity at a proposed LNG import terminal in Richards Bay, South Africa.
Author: JS

Title: BP, ADNOC put on hold talks to acquire NewMed Energy
Description: BP and ADNOC have suspended talks with Israel’s energy company NewMed Energy to acquire a 50% stake in the company due to “uncertainty created by the external environment”.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks four April and May LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery in April and May to its Map Ta Phut LNG import terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Mar. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Summit plans to bring online Bangladesh’s third FSRU by 4Q 2026
Description: Infrastructure developer and LNG terminal operator Summit Asia Pacific expects to bring Bangladesh’s third floating LNG import facility online by the fourth quarter of 2026, boosting the country’s existing LNG receiving capacity by 4.5 mtpa to about 12.1 mtpa and helping to meet the burgeoning growth in Bangladesh’s LNG demand.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside initiates cyclone response plans at northwest West Australia LNG facilities
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has initiated measures to prepare for any impact at its Western Australian LNG plants from a tropical low that could develop into a tropical cyclone this weekend.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s Stade terminal to receive Energos Force FSRU on Mar. 15
Description: The 174,000 m3 Energos Force is set to arrive at the place of its deployment as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at Stade LNG tomorrow, after which it will start commissioning operations, which are expected to last several weeks.
Author: JS

Title: Guangdong Energy may seek more LNG cargoes after recent purchases
Description: Chinese utility Guangdong Energy will likely seek more LNG cargoes on top of its recent purchases through a tender if Asian LNG prices stay below $9/mmBtu for summer and $10/mmBtu for winter.
Author: CK

Title: Texas LNG secures sufficient financing interest to move towards a final investment decision
Description: The proposed 4 mtpa Texas LNG project in Brownsville has received sufficient expressions of interest from key lenders to move to the execution phase of project financing.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor to offtake 0.5 mtpa of LNG from Texas LNG
Description: Project developer Glenfarne Energy Transition announced that its subsidiary Texas LNG Brownsville has signed a heads of agreement (HOA) with trading firm Gunvor Group for a 20-year LNG supply of 0.5 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 4 mtpa Texas LNG plant in Brownsville.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global to buy nine LNG tankers to support its expansion plans
Description: LNG project developer Venture Global announced the acquisition and construction of a nine-vessel fleet of LNG carriers, which are currently under construction in South Korea, to shore up its role as a growing global LNG player.
Author: JS

Title: SEFE emerges as the third long-term LNG offtaker from ADNOC’s Ruwais LNG plant
Description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) has inked a heads of agreement (HOA) with Germany’s state-owned energy firm Securing Energy For Europe (SEFE) for the supply of 1 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG plant in Al Ruwais, with supplies commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: YPF issues tender for FLNG unit engineering for export project
Description: Argentinean state-owned energy company YPF launched a tender for engineering work of floating LNG production units for its proposed 25 mtpa Argentina LNG project in Bahia Blanca.
Author: JS

Title: Pluto resumes LNG loadings after taking cyclone precautions
Description: The Pluto LNG plant has resumed loadings today after a halt in shipments since Mar. 14 which reflected precautions taken by operator Woodside Energy to prepare the plant for possible cyclone impact over the past weekend and early this week.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG to bring two liquefaction trains offline for maintenance until May
Description: The operator of the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas said it would shut two of its liquefaction trains for inspection until “sometime in May”, shortly after bringing online Train 3 after a month and a half of downtime due to repairs.
Author: JS

Title: NFE’s TGS terminal in Brazil receives commissioning cargo
Description: New Fortress Energy’s (NFE) 5.9 mtpa Terminal Gas Sul (TGS) LNG import facility in Santa Catarina state, Brazil, has received its commissioning cargo today, less than a month after receiving the Energos Winter floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at the port.
Author: JS

Title: Tender for Chhara LNG’s first LNG cargo import indicates commissioning will start in April
Description: India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum Corp. has issued a tender to buy a cargo for delivery on April 9-12 to commission the delayed HPCL LNG-operated 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in Gujarat. The tender, which closes on Mar. 26, indicates India’s eighth terminal will begin commissioning operations next month.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen issues fifth LNG tender for one cargo for delivery in May
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon, making it the firm’s second purchase tender this year and fifth in total since the import of its commissioning cargo in July. The tender closes on Apr.12.
Author: JS

Title: HEH takes FID on onshore Stade LNG terminal
Description: The Hanseatic Energy Hub (HEH) consortium made a final investment decision on the 9.9 mtpa onshore LNG and ammonia-ready terminal in Stade, Lower Saxony, which will become Germany’s first onshore terminal when launched in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s spot LNG demand could decrease on higher domestic gas output
Description: Gas production from the Gulf of Thailand has increased in line with state-owned upstream firm PTTEP’s plans to boost output since taking over operations of the G1/61 offshore gas block in 2019, potentially limiting the extent of spot LNG imports into Thailand.
Author: CK

Title: 16 US states file lawsuit against Biden, DOE for pause on US LNG exports
Description: Attorney generals from 16 US states including Louisiana and Texas have filed a lawsuit against a recent decision by US President Joseph Biden and the Department of Energy to freeze approvals for new LNG export projects saying the move is unlawful and needs to be overturned.
Author: CK

Title: Hanwha Ocean receives order to build 8 LNG tankers for QatarEnergy
Description: South Korean shipbuilder Hanwha Ocean has received an order to build eight LNG carriers worth KRW4.86 trillion ($1.81 billion), linked to QatarEnergy’s huge fleet buildout programme.
Author: JS

Title: SEFE to become sole owner of WIGA gas grid operator in Germany
Description: German state-owned energy firm Securing Energy For Europe (SEFE) will take full ownership of the WIGA gas transmission network in Germany, consisting of the NEL and GASCADE pipeline operators, by purchasing the Wintershall Dea's stake in joint venture.
Author: JS

Title: Enbridge and partners form JV to connect Permian gas supply to LNG export market in US Gulf Coast
Description: Canada-headquartered pipeline operator Enbridge will form a joint venture with I Squared Capital and pipeline firms WhiteWater and MPLX to ensure better connection of the Permian Basin supplies to the US Gulf Coast’s tailor to the growing LNG export demand.
Author: JS

Title: Alaska LNG targets front-end engineering in 3Q 2024, FID in 2025
Description: Project developer Alaska Gasline Development Corporation (AGDC) could begin the front-end engineering design (FEED) stage of its proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG in Nikiski in the third quarter of this year after it finalises the financing of the work.
Author: JS

Title: AG&P LNG-led group wins 20-year deal to develop LNG import terminals in Sulawesi-Maluku
Description: A consortium led by LNG terminals and infrastructure developer AG&P LNG has won a 20-year contract from Indonesia’s state-owned PLN Energi Primer Indonesia to build, own and operate seven LNG import terminals in Indonesia’s Sulawesi-Maluku area that will serve seven power plants, with these terminals expected to be commissioned in the first half of 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Saibu Gas issues tender to build third tank at Hibiki LNG import terminal
Description: Japanese utility Saibu Gas has issued a tender for the construction of a third LNG storage tank, with this aimed at increasing the capacity at its 2.4 mtpa Hibiki LNG import terminal in Japan’s southwestern island of Kyushu.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two May LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT is seeking two LNG cargoes for delivery in May to its Map Ta Phut LNG terminal in Rayong through a tender that closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG Train 4 in restart mode after shutdown, seen resuming exports soon
Description: The 3.2 mtpa fourth train at the Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export complex in Malaysia has resumed production after a shutdown earlier this month and is expected to begin contributing to exports in the coming days, according to sources close to Petronas.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT LNG seeks May and June LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm  PTT has issued a tender to buy four cargoes for delivery in May and June to the Map Ta Phut LNG import terminal in Rayong. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: VTTI, IKAV agree to acquire ExxonMobil’s stake in Adriatic LNG
Description: Dutch energy storage infrastructure provider VTTI and Germany-based asset management firm IKAV have joined forces to acquire ExxonMobil’s majority stake in Adriatic LNG, the operator of the 6.6 mtpa Rovigo LNG import terminal that is located 15 kilometres off the Veneto coastline.
Author: JS

Title: Mukran LNG receives first LNG cargo for tests before commissioning
Description: Germany’s Mukran LNG import terminal in the Baltic Sea received its first LNG tanker since the floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) Energos Power arrived at the port at the end of February.
Author: JS

Title: Slump in Damietta, Idku exports spurs anticipation for Egypt to restart LNG imports
Description: A slump in Egypt's LNG exports has ignited expectations that the country, once an LNG importer, may resume imports to meet peak gas demand during the coming summer season after a hiatus of almost six years.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy signs charter deals for 19 LNG ships as part of massive fleet expansion
Description: QatarEnergy has signed its latest long-term time charter party agreements with four international shipowners to operate 19 new conventional-size LNG ships as part of a massive fleet expansion program that takes the number of ships it charters to 104.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom resumes flows through Power of Siberia gas pipeline to China after planned maintenance
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom has restarted gas deliveries to China through the 38 billion m3 a year Power of Siberia 1 gas pipeline today, following the completion of planned maintenance on the pipeline.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports rise slightly in March despite partial shutdown at Freeport
Description: US LNG exports rose slightly in March against month- and year-earlier levels as higher output from the country’s other LNG export plants offset reduced production at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant due to a partial shutdown.
Author: CK

Title: JBIC issues loan to Trafigura to increase LNG supply to Japan
Description: The Japan Bank for International Cooperation signed a loan agreement amounting to up to $390 million (JBIC portion) with Singapore-headquartered energy trader Trafigura as part of a loan package to provide an unnamed Japanese utility firm with LNG supplies.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more June LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy three more LNG cargoes for delivery in June to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on Apr. 5.
Author: CK

Title: Asian LNG imports rebound in March on higher receipts by China, India, Taiwan and Thailand
Description: LNG imports into Asia rose in March from a two-month low a month earlier, reflecting a drop in LNG prices below the $10mmBtu support level since January that has fuelled demand among buyers mainly from China, India and Thailand.
Author: CK

Title: Seatrium, Karpowership sign FSRU conversion deal for trio of vessels
Description: Singapore-headquartered shipbuilder Seatrium has secured a series of major contracts worth a combined S$350 million ($259 million) for repairs, upgrades and conversions, including an order for three floating storage regasification units (FSRUs) with Turkey’s Karpowership.
Author: JS

Title: LNG ships turn away from Taiwan following earthquake, despite lifting of tsunami warning
Description: Two LNG ships that are scheduled to call at the 10.5 mtpa Yung An LNG receiving terminal in Taiwan today appear to have turned away from from the terminal despite the lifting of a tsunami warning following an earthquake that hit the country this morning.
Author: CK

Title: Europe’s March LNG imports hit their lowest levels in six months
Description: LNG imports into Europe in March fell for the third consecutive month as Turkey and the UK received less, and higher Norwegian pipeline gas deliveries, as well as strong underground gas storage levels, continued to diminish the region’s need for LNG imports.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche ReGas halts Lubmin LNG shuttle service ahead of Neptune FSRU relocation
Description: Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal owner Deutsche ReGas has halted the shuttle service at its 3.3 mtpa terminal in Lubmin as it prepares to relocate the Neptune floating storage regasification unit from Lubmin to its permanent location in Mukran as part of the terminal’s second phase of operations.
Author: JS

Title: China’s Huagang LNG terminal eyes startup in June-July, seeks commissioning cargo
Description: The planned 3 mtpa Huagang LNG receiving terminal in China’s eastern Zhejiang province is hoping to start commissioning operations by mid-year, with the timing dependent on it securing an LNG commissioning cargo before then.
Author: CK

Title: DET to deploy Excelsior FSRU at Wilhelmshaven in Q2 2024
Description: The German state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) expects to deploy the Excelsior floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at a separate LNG receiving facility at Wilhelmshaven port in the North Sea, in the second quarter of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Italy’s Snam lifts its stake in Adriatic LNG to 30%, while VTTI holds a 70% share
Description: Italy’s energy infrastructure firm Snam has exercised its pre-emption rights to increase its stake to 30% from 7.3% in the country’s largest LNG import facility, the Adriatic LNG terminal off the coast of Rovigo in the northeastern region of Veneto.
Author: CK

Title: Canada’s Cedar LNG issues notice to proceed on construction as offtake deals secured
Description: Canada’s Cedar LNG has issued its contractors a notice to proceed with engineering, procurement and construction on its proposed 3.3 mtpa Cedar LNG plant in Kitimat, British Columbia, having secured long-term offtake deals. These milestones allow the project to secure the funding that is required before it can make a final investment decision that is targeted for the middle of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt seeks multiple spot LNG cargoes; April cargo purchase signals the restart of imports
Description: Egypt’s state-owned natural gas firm EGAS is seeking more LNG cargoes after purchasing one cargo for delivery in April last week to avoid gas shortages and blackouts this summer. The purchase marks the impending restart of imports for the LNG exporter after it received its last LNG cargo almost six years ago.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks terminal users for its LNG import terminals
Description: South Korea's state-controlled Kogas is seeking users of its LNG terminals, giving priority to direct importers who are seeking to start imports of LNG before the end of 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Beach Energy delays start of first gas from Waitsia Stage 2 to 2025; capex costs to rise
Description: More issues identified during the pre-commissioning stage of the Waitsia Stage 2 gas project in the Perth Basin in Western Australia have forced Australian upstream oil and gas firm Beach Energy to push back the timing of first gas production from the project to early next year, with the delays seen inflating project costs.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies, partners delay FID on Papua LNG in 2025 on lack of competitive EPC offers
Description: TotalEnergies and its partners in the proposed 5.6 mtpa Papua LNG project in Papua New Guinea have pushed back the timing of a final investment decision on the project to 2025 from this year to secure more competitive offers for engineering, procurement and construction contracts for the project.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies, Sonatrach extend LNG deal, sign MoU for northeast Algeria gas exploration
Description: France’s TotalEnergies and Algeria’s state-owned Sonatrach have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to develop gas resources in Algeria’s Timimoun region and extended their existing LNG supply agreement through 2025.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Chhara LNG terminal poised to start up with receipt of commissioning cargo this week
Description: The HPCL-owned 5 mtpa Chhara LNG receiving terminal in the Gir-Somnath district of Gujarat in India is poised to receive its first LNG cargo this week, kicking off commissioning operations at what will be the fourth LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat and the eighth such facility in India when it starts up.
Author: CK

Title: India mulls full utilisation of gas-fired plants to avoid power shortages this summer
Description: India’s Power Ministry plans to hold a meeting with developers of the country’s gas-based power projects to review their utilization and operations during the coming summer season and decide whether to mandate full capacity operations as part of an effort to meet power demand.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies buys stake in Texas shale field, lifting US gas output
Description: TotalEnergies has taken a 20% stake in the Dorado field leases in the Eagle Ford shale play in Texas held by the Lewis Group, with the move seen lifting the firm’s natural gas production capacity in the US.
Author: CK

Title: PV Gas to receive its second cargo at Thi Vai terminal, supply it to EVN
Description: PetroVietnam Gas (PV Gas) has signed a deal to supply the equivalent of one 0.07 mt LNG cargo to Vietnam’s power utility EVN to support the firm during the peak dry season.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche ReGas receives permit to operate Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal
Description: German private LNG terminal developer Deutsche ReGas received a federal permit to operate its 13.5 billion m3 per year (10.5 mtpa) Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran consisting of two floating storage regasification units (FSRUs).
Author: JS

Title: Egypt to deploy the Hoegh Gallant FSRU from June to resume LNG imports after six-year hiatus
Description: Egypt has secured the 170,000 m3 Hoegh Gallant floating storage regasification unit that is deployed at New Fortress Energy’s Old Harbour LNG import terminal near Port Esquivel in Jamaica to serve at its 5.8 mtpa Ain Sukhna floating LNG import facility from June, enabling the country’s return to direct LNG imports this summer after a six-year hiatus to avoid a repeat of last year’s power supply crunch, according to sources close to the matter.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh Galleon to be installed at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna from end-June to December 2025
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon is expected to be installed at Egypt’s 5.8 mtpa Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal to serve as its floating storage regasification unit under a charter agreement that stretches from the end of June until December 2025, according to industry participants.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one more May  LNG cargo amid hotter weather
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy an additional cargo for delivery in May to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Apr. 16.
Author: CK

Title: European Parliament votes for restricting Russian gas imports as part of gas package
Description: Members of the European Parliament have voted in favour of a gas package for the European Union that will include allowing member states to limit gas imports from Russia and Belarus.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa seeks more winter LNG supplies; requires 10 cargoes for June to August
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued a tender to buy 10 LNG cargoes for delivery between June and August to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal, adding to its previous purchase of 10 April to July LNG cargoes aimed at meeting an anticipated increase in demand during the approaching winter season. The tender closes on Apr. 16.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Chhara is poised for the imminent arrival of its LNG commissioning cargo
Description: The 159,800 m3 Maran Gas Mystras LNG tanker is close to delivering the first LNG cargo to the 5 mtpa Chhara LNG import facility in the Gir-Somnath district of Gujarat, kicking off commissioning operations at India’s eighth LNG import terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Flex Volunteer is first LNG ship to cross the Suez Canal in three months amid Red Sea conflict
Description: The 174,000 m3 Flex Volunteer LNG tanker transited the Suez Canal on Apr. 12 en route to Jordan, making it the first LNG tanker to cross the canal in three months due to the ongoing conflict in the Red Sea.
Author: CK

Title: EQT, Equinor swap shale gas assets in the US
Description: Norway’s Equinor and US shale gas producer EQT Corporation have agreed to swap Equinor’s operated position in the onshore Marcellus and Utica shale formations in Ohio for a stake in EQT’s non-operated interest in the Northern Marcellus formation.
Author: JS

Title: PV Gas seeks early June LNG cargo for delivery to Thi Vai
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery in June to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tai province. The tender closes on Apr. 19.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s Jera inks deal on LNG cooperation with Singapore
Description: Japanese power and LNG trading firm Jera has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Singapore’s state-owned Energy Market Authority (EMA) to collaborate on LNG procurement and supply chains for both countries.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside Energy awards Timor’s Greater Sunrise project study to Wood
Description: Australian Woodside Energy and its partners have chosen the engineering firm Wood Australia as a contractor to conduct a concept study on the development of the Greater Sunrise gas project on the maritime border between Timor-Leste and Australia, with a focus on marketing the resource as LNG.
Author: JS

Title: NFE pics contractor to construct LNG-to-power plant at Brazil's Barcarena LNG
Description: US-based LNG developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) has finalised and executed an engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract with an international consortium to construct a 1.6 GW power plant to be built adjacent to the 6 mtpa Barcarena LNG terminal in the state of Para, Brazil.
Author: JS

Title: Kumul Petroleum sells first LNG spot cargo from PNG plant
Description: Papua New Guinea’s state-owned energy company Kumul Petroleum said it had sold its first spot LNG cargo produced at the ExxonMobil-operated 8.3 mtpa PNG LNG project in Papua New Guinea to PetroChina International.
Author: JS

Title: Flexible LNG contracts beneficial for EU’s surplus re-export: ACER
Description: LNG is expected to provide most of the required flexibility to accommodate EU gas supply and demand balance, according to the EU’s Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER), with exposure to free-on-board (FOB) contracts allowing the bloc to sell surplus cargoes on the spot market.
Author: JS

Title: US DOE to end LNG permit pause by end of Q1 2025
Description: The US Department of Energy (DOE) expects to finish its review of the potential impact of approving more LNG export capacity and end its temporary halt on issuing licenses to new infrastructure projects by the end of the first quarter of 2025, one of the agency’s top officials said.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies, Oman’s OQ take FID on Marsa LNG bunkering project
Description: France’s TotalEnergies has made a final investment decision (FID) for a 1 mtpa LNG project at Marsa in Oman, expected to run on solar power and become the first LNG bunkering hub in the Middle East.
Author: JS

Title: US Maritime Administration defers issue of key license to Delfin LNG
Description: The US Maritime Administration (MARAD) has postponed the issue of a license to own, construct and operate the 13.3 mtpa Delfin floating LNG plant to Delfin LNG until the firm submits an updated application to reflect the changes made to the project since first submittal in 2017.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies strengthens upstream position in Malaysia with SapuraOMV acquisition
Description: TotalEnergies has signed an agreement with Sapura Upstream Assets (SUA) to acquire its 50% interest in Malaysian independent gas producer and operator SapuraOMV for a consideration of $530 million, making the French company the sole owner of the company.
Author: JS

Title: Texas LNG signs additional tolling deal with EQT
Description: US natural gas producer EQT has entered into a second heads of agreement (HOA) with Glenfarne Energy Transition for liquefaction services from the planned 4 mtpa Texas LNG facility in Brownsville to produce an additional 1.5 mtpa of LNG under a 20-year tolling agreement.
Author: JS

Title: FERC approves introduction of hazardous fluids into Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has approved US project developer Venture Global’s request to introduce hazardous fluids at its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export terminal that is under development.
Author: CK

Title: Korea’s Ulsan terminal starts commercial operations following first LNG cargo receipt
Description: The Korea Energy Terminal in Ulsan has begun commercial operations, following the receipt and unloading of its first LNG cargo earlier this month.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS seeks one May LNG cargo for delivery to Jordan’s Aqaba terminal
Description: The state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company, or EGAS, is seeking one cargo for delivery on May 18-19 to Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG receiving terminal through a tender that closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Commissioning at India’s Chhara LNG seen delayed until after the monsoon season
Description: The commissioning of the HPCL-owned 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in India’s western state of Gujarat is likely to be delayed until after the the approaching monsoon season ends as infrastructure issues at the new terminal have prevented it from receiving its commissioning cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks up to three May-June LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm has issued a tender to buy up to three LNG cargoes for delivery in May and June to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Apr. 25.
Author: CK

Title: Snohvit LNG plant to restart on Friday following gas leak repairs
Description: Norway’s Equinor has shut its 4.3 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island in the Arctic near Hammerfest following a gas leak experienced yesterday during planned maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Eni sees next winter as “window of opportunity” to restart LNG exports from Egypt
Description: Italy’s Eni expects that Egypt may only be able to export LNG again this winter, with shipments over the summer unlikely as the country shifts from exporting gas to satisfying domestic gas needs due to gas supply constraints.
Author: JS

Title: Natural gas demand to grow 20% through 2040: Baker Hughes
Description: Oil field services provider Baker Hughes expects natural gas and LNG demand to grow by almost 20%, representing a 1% compound annual growth rate driven by underlying energy demand and the desire to switch towards a net-zero energy ecosystem.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina seen seeking more winter LNG cargoes for Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm, Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, received the first of 10 LNG cargoes purchased for the year at its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG this week, and is widely expected to seek around 10 more cargoes through a third tender even as it finalizes the award of its second tender for 10 LNG cargoes to be delivered from June to August.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ships idle outside Freeport following a trip at Train 3; all trains likely offline
Description: A few LNG ships that were scheduled to call at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG terminal in Texas today are idling outside the terminal waiting to load, following a trip that has kept the plant’s third train offline and led it to join Freeport’s two other trains that are shut for inspection.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG seen resuming exports after a week, following trip at Train 3
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant looks ready to resume exports after halting shipments on Apr. 24 following a trip at its third train a day earlier.
Author: CK

Title: PV Gas seeks late-May LNG cargo for delivery to Thi Vai
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery in May to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tai province. The tender closes on May 2.
Author: JS

Title: QatarEnergy orders 18 new 271,000 m3 LNG carriers
Description: State-owned QatarEnergy has ordered 18 new LNG carriers with a capacity of 271,000 m³, which are set to be the largest-ever LNG vessels, from Chinese shipbuilder Hudong-Zhonghua, as part of the country’s massive fleet expansion plan.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt is poised to export its second April LNG cargo even as it prepares to resume imports
Description: Egypt’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG plant is poised to export its second LNG cargo this month, following the arrival of the 174,000 m3 Maran Gas Ulysses LNG tanker yesterday and the loading of a cargo at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global eyes mid-year start of production at Plaquemines LNG
Description: US project developer Venture Global is targeting the start of LNG production at its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana by the middle of this year and expects to import up to three LNG cargoes to commission the terminal and re-export any of the unused LNG thereafter.
Author: CK

Title: BP to deliver 9.8 mtpa of LNG over 11 years to Kogas as part of portfolio supply deal
Description: BP has signed an agreement to supply up to 9.8 mtpa of LNG to Korea’s state-controlled Kogas for up to 9.8 million tonnes of LNG over 11 years on a delivered ex-ship basis with deliveries to start from the middle of 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz notified of delay in Alexandroupolis LNG's commercial start-up
Description: Bulgaria’s Energy and Water Regulatory Commission (DKER) said that the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG import terminal in Greece, from which state-owned energy company Bulgargaz offtakes around 0.8 mtpa of LNG, will launch commercial operations later than expected.
Author: JS

Title: EU-27 LNG imports rise in April after four months of decline
Description: Imports of LNG into the 27 European Union countries rebounded in April after four consecutive months of decline, as member states accelerated LNG purchases with the start of storage refilling season.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s April LNG imports dip on-month despite hotter weather
Description: LNG imports into Thailand dipped in April after reaching their second highest monthly level on record in March, despite higher-than-normal temperatures across the country.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh LNG confirms Hoegh Galleon FSRU deployment at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna
Description: Norway’s energy infrastructure firm Hoegh LNG will deploy the 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon at Egypt’s 5.8 mtpa Ain Sukhna LNG from June this year until the first quarter of 2026 to serve as its floating storage regasification unit (FSRU).
Author: JS

Title: Cyprus rejects revised Aphrodite gas field development plan
Description: The Cypriot government has rejected the revised plan to develop the 4.2 trillion ft3 Aphrodite natural gas field offshore Cyprus after deeming the proposal “inadequate” and requested the partners to agree within six months on specific actions to develop the asset.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron works to resume production at Gorgon LNG train after mechanical fault
Description: Chevron Australia said it was working to resume full production at its 15.6 mtpa LNG plant on Barrow Island in Western Australia after a mechanical fault caused one LNG liquefaction train to go offline, Chevron confirmed today.
Author: JS

Title: Klaipeda LNG’s Independence FSRU to undergo maintenance in Denmark
Description: Lithuanian LNG terminal operator KN Energies has announced the departure of its 170,000 m3 Independence floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to Denmark for inspection and repair ahead of the firm’s planned purchase of the vessel at the end of 2024.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports fall to a 17-month low in April, weighed down by Freeport shutdowns
Description: The US exported less LNG in April compared to a month and a year earlier, with volumes for the month falling to a 17-month low as a result of shutdowns at Freeport’s three trains and possible maintenance at other plants,
Author: CK

Title: Technical issue holds back start of commercial phase at Alexandroupolis LNG: Gastrade
Description: A technical problem has delayed the start of commercial operations at the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG facility in Greece, which was initially expected in April. And, terminal operator Gastrade plans to provide a new timeline soon.
Author: CK

Title: DET to commission Excelsior FSRU at Wilhelmshaven in H2 2024
Description: The German state-owned LNG operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) said it expects to commission the 138,000 m3 Excelsior floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) in the second half of 2024 and that the vessel’s arrival at the port of its deployment will likely be delayed from the second quarter.
Author: JS

Title: China takes less LNG from Australia in April but receipts are flat on-month
Description: China received less LNG in April from its largest supplier Australia but its total receipts for the month were flat against March, as a higher intake of LNG from countries including Qatar, Malaysia and Russia offset the decline.
Author: CK

Title: Corpus Christi Stage 3 is 55% completed; year-end first LNG output target remains
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere’s Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project was 55% completed at the end of March and the firm remains hopeful that it will be able to begin LNG production from the first of the project’s seven trains by the end of the year.
Author: CK

Title: Neptune FSRU leaves Lubmin for retrofitting ahead of permanent installation at Mukran
Description: The 145,130 m3 Neptune floating storage and regasification unit has left the Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Lubmin to undergo conversion work at a shipyard in Europe ahead of its permanent installation this summer at the new Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal site in Mukran.
Author: CK

Title: EU Commission approves state aid for Krk LNG terminal expansion
Description: The European Commission (EC) has approved the EUR25 million ($26.9 million) state aid to support the to support the expansion of the LNG terminal on the island of Krk in Croatia.
Author: JS

Title: Gorgon LNG train shutdown to last around five weeks
Description: A single train at the Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia has been offline since Apr. 30 due to a mechanical fault and is expected to remain shut for the next five weeks, according to term offtakers.
Author: CK

Title: Kosmos Energy maintains expectation for first LNG at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim in Q4
Description: US upstream firm Kosmos Energy expects the BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritania to ship its first LNG cargo in the fourth quarter of this year and achieve first gas in the third quarter of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Higher feed gas flows to Freeport LNG suggest two trains may be online
Description: Feed gas flows to the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas have risen to their highest level since March, suggesting that two of the plant’s three trains may now be online.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s second LNG terminal Cai Mep LNG begins commissioning phase
Description: The 3 mtpa Cai Mep LNG terminal in Vietnam’s southern Vung Tau district has begun commissioning operations today, with commercial operations targeted to begin in September. Cai Mep is the second LNG receiving terminal to begin operations in Vietnam after the startup of the PetroVietnam Gas-operated 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal in July last year.
Author: CK

Title: NFE delays first LNG shipment from Altamira due to pipe fracture
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) said that it expects to produce first LNG at its 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG project offshore Mexico later this month and to ship its first cargo in June, which is yet another delay for the project’s start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Hoegh Galleon FSRU signals its arrival at Egypt’s Port Said in early June
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit has signalled its arrival in Egypt's on June 3, indicating the LNG exporting country’s imminent restart of LNG imports after a six-year break to meet peak gas demand this summer.
Author: CK

Title: EnBW to offtake 0.6 mtpa for 15 years from Adnoc’s Ruwais LNG
Description: German energy company EnBW has signed an agreement with the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) to purchase 0.6 mtpa of LNG over a period of 15 years, commencing in 2028 with the commissioning of the 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG export facility.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey’s Botas, ExxonMobil agree 10-year LNG deal as part of LNG trade cooperation
Description: Turkey’s state-owned energy firm Botas has signed a cooperation agreement on LNG trade with ExxonMobil, with this involving the supply of 2.5 mtpa of LNG over 10 years.
Author: CK

Title: VTTI buys 50% of UK’s Dragon LNG import terminal
Description: Dutch energy storage infrastructure provider VTTI has agreed with UK-based infrastructure manager Ancala to acquire 50% in Dragon LNG Group, which owns the 5.6 mtpa onshore LNG import terminal in Milford Haven, Wales, UK.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks more June and July LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy more LNG cargoes for delivery in June and July to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal  amid a heatwave that has hit the country. The tender for one June and three July cargoes closes on May 13.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS issues tender for one May cargo for delivery to Jordan’s Aqaba terminal
Description: The state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company, or EGAS, issued a tender seeking one cargo for delivery on May 29-30 to Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG receiving terminal, closing May 16.
Author: JS

Title: Kogas issues tenders to buy short and long-term LNG supplies
Description: South Korea’s state-owned Kogas has issued two tenders to buy LNG, with one for delivery over a three-year term and the other, for a seven-to-15-year term. The deliveries are expected to begin in 2025 for the short-term tender and in 2027 for the long-term tender. The short-term tender closes in early June, while the long-term tender closes in mid-June, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa is due to receive its second LNG cargo later this month
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Enarsa is due to receive the second of 20 LNG cargoes it purchased for the winter season at its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal in about 10 days’ time, about a month after the delivery of its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS to receive its second LNG cargo at Jordan’s Aqaba terminal this week
Description: The 170,000 m3 Minerva Limnos LNG tanker is scheduled to call at Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG terminal this week, signalling the arrival of a second cargo purchased by Egypt’s state-owned EGAS for delivery to Jordan ahead of the arrival of its floating LNG import unit early next month.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy expands its Egypt presence via upstream acquisition
Description: QatarEnergy has signed an agreement with ExxonMobil to acquire a 40% participating interest in two exploration blocks offshore Egypt, expanding its presence in the country to a total of four exploration blocks.
Author: JS

Title: EU mulls Russian LNG ban as part of new sanctions package
Description: The EU member states have started discussions on the new sanctions package on Russia, it’s 14th after the start of the country’s invasion of Ukraine, with restrictions on the Russian LNG exports looming.
Author: JS

Title: Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG export complex in restart mode after power loss-induced shutdown
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned energy firm Petronas has initiated restart activities at its 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG complex in Malaysia after it experienced power loss on May 10.
Author: CK
