Title: Croatia’s HEP Group seeks up to six LNG cargoes for delivery between October 2024 and July 2025
Description: Croatia’s state-owned utility Hrvatska Elektropriveda (HEP) is seeking from one up to six LNG cargoes for delivery to the 2.13 mt Krk LNG terminal in Omisalj between October 2024 and July 2025 through a tender closing on May 27. Offers are expected to remain valid until May 28.
Author: JS

Title: DET to offer more regasification capacity from two of its German LNG terminals
Description: German state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) will offer new regasification capacities from its 3.7 mtpa Brunsbuttel and 5.8 mtpa Wilhelmshaven 1 LNG terminals for 2025 and beyond as part of its first-ever long-term capacity booking auctions.
Author: JS

Title: QatarEnergy to sign more long-term LNG deals this year, foresees rise in gas demand
Description: Qatar will sign more long-term LNG contracts this year as demand for the fuel is expected to rise in line with population growth, according to QatarEnergy CEO Saad Sherida Al-Kaabi.
Author: JS

Title: Neptune FSRU docks at Denmark’s Fayard shipyard ahead of Mukran installation
Description: The 145,130 m3 Neptune floating storage regasification unit has arrived at the Fayard shipyard in Odense, Denmark, where it will likely undergo some work before it is deployed at the new Deutsche Ostsee LNG receiving terminal site in Mukran, Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Increasing ship arrivals, cargo sizes point to Freeport LNG’s return to full production
Description: The number of ships scheduled to call at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas is poised to rise this week, which coupled with the plant’s recent shipments of full-size cargoes, have added to expectations that all three of its trains may now be online.
Author: CK

Title: NLNG says gas supply unaffected by explosion at gas processing plant
Description: Nigeria LNG (NLNG), which operates the 22.14 mtpa Bonny LNG plant, said that the explosion at a Shell-operated gas processing plant did not affect gas supplies to the plant.
Author: JS

Title: FERC delays issue of environmental assessment to Cheniere’s Corpus Christi expansion
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) said that it will postpone the environmental assessment (EA) and permit issue of the midscale Train 8 and 9 expansion at Cheniere’s Corpus Christi LNG plant in Texas by three months.
Author: JS

Title: Dragon LNG to offer regasification capacity from September 2029
Description: The operator of the UK's 5.6 mtpa Dragon LNG terminal is inviting expressions of interest for all of its regasification capacity available from September 2029.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Gail signs 14-yr LNG ship charter deal with CoolCo starting in 2025
Description:
India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail has signed a 14-year time charter party agreement with LNG shipowner CoolCo for a new-build LNG carrier. The charter will start in early 2025, with
CoolCo delivering the ship to Gail in the Gulf of Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: LNG exports from Bintulu seen picking up after halt in shipments last week
Description: Shipments from the Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia resumed at the end of last week following a four-day export halt after the facility lost power on May 10.  And they are expected to pick up this week.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC buys stake in NextDecade’s Rio Grande, pens 20-year LNG offtake agreement
Description: ADNOC has purchased a 11.7% equity stake in Phase 1 of NextDecade’s proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG plant in Brownsville, Texas and entered into a 20-year offtake agreement for 1.9 mtpa of LNG from the facility’s fourth train.
Author: JS

Title: Technical issue at Alexandroupolis LNG still unresolved, holds back commercial start
Description: A technical issue continues to hold back the start of commercial operations at Greece’s second LNG receiving terminal, the Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG, with it unclear when this will be resolved and when the terminal will receive its second LNG cargo.
Author: CK

Title: ICGB launches binding phase to boost capacity at Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria
Description: ICGB, the operator of the 3 billion m3 per year Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (IGC), has initiated the binding phase of market testing for expanding the pipeline's capacity to 5 billion m3 per year.
Author: JS

Title: Golden Pass LNG lead contractor Zachry starts project exit, files for bankruptcy
Description: US construction and engineering company Zachry Group has filed for bankruptcy, initiating a structured exit from the 15.6 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Texas , where it is the lead contractor, due to “financial challenges”.
Author: JS

Title: Cyprus’ president’s discussions on Vasilikos LNG aimed at implementing the project
Description: The Cyprus President is holding discussions at a diplomatic level about the planned Vasilikos LNG terminal with the sole intention of implementing the project where construction has stalled.
Author: JS

Title: Austria’s OMV warns Gazprom may halt pipeline gas flows
Description: Austrian energy company OMV said that pipeline gas supplies from Russia's Gazprom may be suspended in connection with a foreign court ruling.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC buys 10% stake in Coral South FLNG development
Description: UAE’s state-owned ADNOC purchased Portuguese Galp’s 10% interest in the Area 4 concession of the Rovuma basin offshore Mozambique, which includes the 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG export project, as the firm continues its international expansion.
Author: JS

Title: Partners committed to completing Golden Pass LNG project despite contractor exit: ExxonMobil
Description: ExxonMobil told Kpler that stakeholders will continue working on the Golden Pass 15.6 mtpa export project in Texas and are committed to completing it despite lead contractor Zachry Group's bankruptcy filing.
Author: JS

Title: Japan is expected to seek more spot LNG for summer even amid rising stock levels
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities climbed to a five-week high for the week that ended May 19, and market participants expect more stocks to be built through spot LNG purchases for July and August to cater to summer power demand with the season expected to be hotter than normal this year.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa issues its third LNG tender for the year, seeks eight cargoes
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued a tender seeking eight cargoes to be delivered between July and August to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on May 28.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh LNG sees FSRU demand remaining strong, supply tight
Description: Floating LNG infrastructure provider Hoegh LNG expects demand for floating storage regasification units to stay strong, with the prompt availability of only one FSRU in the market highlighting the strength of demand.
Author: CK

Title: National Grid to sell Grain LNG to streamline business
Description: The UK's National Grid intends to sell its wholly owned 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG import terminal to streamline its business and shift focus to networks.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas confirms a return to full operations at Bintulu LNG
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia has returned to full operations since May 19, following a power loss on May 10.
Author: CK

Title: Petronet mulls a land-based terminal for Gopalpur LNG project, eyes completion in three years
Description: India’s state-owned Petronet is contemplating developing its planned Gopalpur LNG import facility in Odisha as a land-based terminal instead of a floating one because of the tight availability of floating storage regasification units in the market. It expects the project to be completed in three years.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor and partners invest $1.13 billion to boost Troll gas output
Description: Equinor and its partners in Europe’s largest gas field, Troll, have decided to invest just over NOK 12 billion ($1.13 billion) in new infrastructure in the Troll West gas province to boost production further. The investment is expected to help maintain high export levels from Troll and the Kollsnes gas processing plant up to 2030.
Author: CK

Title: Seapeak Arwa LNG tanker is poised to deliver Egypt’s third LNG cargo at Aqaba
Description: The TotalEnergies-chartered 165,500 m3 Seapeak Arwa LNG tanker has arrived in the Gulf of Aqaba and is poised to deliver state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co.’s third LNG cargo for the year at Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba floating LNG terminal tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG restarts LNG operations after compressor-led outage
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG plant in Lumut has restarted operations after issues with a compressor caused it to shut down last week, according to term offtakers at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG restarts onshore compressor plants following outage last week
Description: Brunei LNG said today that it has returned its onshore compressor plants to operation following a shutdown on May 20. The outage caused a halt in exports from the firm’s 7.2 mtpa LNG export plant.
Author: CK

Title: PipeChina’s Zhangzhou LNG terminal starts commissioning phase with receipt of first cargo
Description: The 3 mtpa Zhangzhou LNG receiving terminal in China’s southeastern province of Fujian has begun its commissioning phase following the arrival of the 173,400 m3 Macoma LNG tanker. The terminal, once commissioned, will be the first newly built LNG import facility to be put into operation in China this year.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues a tender seeking three more July LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT is seeking three more LNG cargoes for delivery in July through a tender that closes on May 30. The delivery windows are Jul. 3-4, 11-14 and 18-19.
Author: CK

Title: Golar LNG in advanced negotiations to redeploy Hilli FLNG unit
Description: Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG is in detailed contract negotiations regarding the redeployment of its 126,227 m3 Hilli Episeyo floating LNG (FLNG) unit after the end of its current charter which runs out in July 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Santos to supply 0.4 mtpa of LNG to Hokkaido Gas over 10 years from 2027
Description: Australian energy producer Santos has agreed to supply about 0.4 mtpa of LNG to Japanese gas utility Hokkaido Gas over 10 years, starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina is seen buying more LNG to ensure adequate domestic gas supplies
Description: Argentina will buy more LNG as part of a set of measures to ensure priority gas users are well supplied and power supply in the domestic market is adequate amid expectations of lower-than-expected temperatures and already colder-than-normal weather.
Author: CK

Title: Gasum and Equinor extend LNG bunkering agreement
Description: Finland’s Gasum and Norway’s Equinor have signed a long-term contract under which Gasum will continue to supply LNG to Equinor via a trio of dual-fuel chartered fleet of vessels.
Author: JS

Title: Korea Midland Power, Vitol agree to LNG contract extension from 2025-2028
Description: Power provider Korea Midland Power has agreed with Vitol to extend an existing 10-year LNG supply deal from 2025 to 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Glenfarne asks FERC for five more years to construct Texas LNG
Description: US energy firm Glenfarne Group, developing the 4 mtpa Texas LNG export project in Brownsville, has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) for a five-year extension to build the plant, citing extenuating circumstances outside its control.
Author: JS

Title: SEFE imports its first LNG cargo into Germany through Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal
Description: Germany’s state-owned energy firm Securing Energy For Europe (SEFE) has imported its first spot LNG cargo into Germany, using an import slot it booked at the Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal last year.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen issues LNG tender for one early July cargo
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon, making it the firm’s third purchase tender this year and sixth since its commissioning cargo in July. The tender closes on Jun. 11.
Author: JS

Title: Aethon Energy to offtake 2 mtpa from Tellurian’s Driftwood LNG
Description: Tellurian and Texas-based private investment firm Aethon Energy Management signed a heads of agreement (HOA) for Aethon to purchase 2 mtpa of LNG from Tellurian’s proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG plant in Louisiana, in addition to  Aethon acquiring Tellurian’s upstream assets for $260 million.
Author: JS

Title: No cargo loadings yet at Brunei LNG despite restart of onshore compressors
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG plant at Lumut has yet to load and export any LNG cargoes since May 20, when its onshore compressor plants were forced to shut down.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips acquires Marathon Oil in $22.5 billion deal, expanding oil and LNG business
Description: ConocoPhillips has agreed to buy Marathon Oil in an all-stock deal valued at $22.5 billion, deepening its portfolio of oil and gas assets and contributing to its plan to expand its LNG business further.
Author: CK

Title: Germany to abolish gas storage levy from 2025
Description: The German federal government has decided to stop charging a levy on natural gas exiting the German grid at interconnection points on the border from 2025, according to a German economy and climate industry official.
Author: JS

Title: Moldovagaz, Greece’s Mediterranean Holding sign LNG cooperation agreement
Description: Moldova’s state-owned energy firm Moldovagaz has inked a cooperation agreement with Greece’s Mediterranean Holding (MIH), which will include an option to import LNG into Moldova.
Author: JS

Title: Gorgon LNG production at full rate with restart of one train
Description: The Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia is producing at full rates again following the restart of one of its three liquefaction trains this week after a five-week long outage.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Jera pares its interest in Freeport LNG through stake sale to Japex
Description: Japan’s largest power utility, Jera, has agreed to sell upstream firm Japex a 15% stake in its US-based unit, Gulf Coast LNG, for $380 million. This will give Japex a share in the Freeport LNG Development Co., which operates the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Upstream issues force unplanned outage at Norway’s Nyhamna gas plant
Description: Norway's 79.8 million m3 per day Nyhamna processing plant exporting natural gas to Europe has shut down for unplanned maintenance, pushing European futures prices to their highest level so far this year.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s Jera in discussions with Qatar for long-term LNG supplies
Description: Japan’s largest utility Jera is in discussions with Qatar for long-term LNG supplies, after deciding not to renew contracts totalling over 5 mtpa of LNG with state-owned QatarEnergy that expired in 2021.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen seeks long-term LNG supply deals
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen is in talks to secure supplies for delivery of LNG to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon.
Author: JS

Title: PTT seeks four July to August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT is seeking four LNG cargoes for delivery in July to August through a tender that closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: EU is “not too reliant on the US” for LNG; looks to more gas supplies from Azerbaijan
Description: The European Union’s imports of US LNG have climbed to their highest levels in two years, making it the largest LNG supplier to the region since Russia curtailed pipeline gas deliveries to the region after its invasion of Ukraine in 2022. But the bloc’s Energy Commissioner Kadri Simson says it hasn’t swapped its dependence on Russian pipeline gas for US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron’s Gorgon LNG plant resumes production after “minor fault”
Description: The Chevron-operated 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia has resumed production following an outage caused by a “minor fault.”
Author: CK

Title: EU seeks more partners for early warning gas supply security system
Description: The European Union is hoping to attract the participation of LNG-producing and consuming countries in an early warning gas mechanism it started together with Japan last year, as it continues to promote the need for continued preparedness in ensuring energy supply security amid various geopolitical tensions and Russia’s continued war with Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies signs LNG supply agreements with India’s IOCL, Korea South-East Power
Description: France’s TotalEnergies signed two short- and long-term LNG supply agreements with two firms in Asia, which it said was in line with its strategy to grow its LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: Brunei’s Lumut LNG yet to resume shipments despite its loading restart after a compressor-led outage
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG export plant in Lumut has loaded its first cargo after a 12-day hiatus  due to an outage at its onshore gas compressor plants on May 20. However, it has yet to export any cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: EU LNG imports dip in May to their lowest since September 2023
Description: Imports of LNG into the 27 European Union countries fell back in May after rebounding in April on exporters favouring Asia as a destination for LNG over Europe.
Author: JS

Title: Singapore’s EMA and Kogas sign LNG cooperation MoU
Description: Singapore’s Energy Market Authority (EMA) and South Korean energy company Kogas have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to collaborate in LNG procurement and supply chain management.
Author: JS

Title: BP’s delayed Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project receives key gas processing unit
Description: The BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritius has received its floating production storage and offloading vessel, paving the way for the much-delayed project to begin gas production.
Author: CK

Title: Taiwan's CPC secures long-term LNG offtake from Qatar's NFE expansion, buys 5% stake
Description: State-owned QatarEnergy signed definitive agreements with Taiwan’s CPC Corporation covering the long-term supply of LNG to CPC and partnership in the 32 mtpa North Field East (NFE) LNG expansion project.
Author: JS

Title: Alaska LNG inks preliminary gas sales agreement with Pantheon Resources
Description: State-owned Alaska Gasline Development Corporation (AGDC), which is developing the 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski, has signed a gas sales precedent agreement (GSPA) with a subsidiary of UK-based oil and gas company Pantheon Resources.
Author: JS

Title: Hungary’s MVM buys 5% stake in Azerbaijan’s Shah Deniz gas field
Description: Hungary’s state-owned power company MVM entered into a sale and purchase agreement (SPA) with the Azerbaijani state-owned Southern Gas Corridor to acquire a 5% stake in the production sharing agreement (PSA) for Shah Deniz offshore gas field in the Caspian Sea and a 4% stake in Azerbaijan Gas Supply Company, the firm responsible for the marketing and sale of natural gas produced from the field.
Author: JS

Title: Nyhamna gas outage to last until Friday: Gassco
Description: Norwegian gas grid operator Gassco expects the 79.8 million m3 per day Nyhamna gas processing plant to remain offline until Friday.
Author: JS

Title: Venice Energy aims to make FID on Outer Harbour LNG by August
Description: South Australia-headquartered Venice Energy aims to make a final investment decision (FID) on its proposed 3.8 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import facility at Adelaide port by August this year.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s EGAS seeks FSRU for Ain Sukhna from 2026 to replace Hoegh Galleon
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is looking to secure a floating storage regasification unit for installation at its Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal from 2026 after the temporary charter for the Hoegh Galleon FSRU ends, according to sources with knowledge of the matter.
Author: CK

Title: “Something more concrete” on possible EU sanctions on Russian LNG expected in June: Simson
Description: The European Commissioner for Energy, Kadri Simson, expects that ongoing talks on a possible ban on transshipments of Russian LNG cargoes at European ports as part of a fourteenth round of sanctions on Russia will yield “something more concrete” in June.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh’s LNG receipts hit an all-time high in May on higher temperatures, lower prices
Description: Bangladesh’s LNG imports have climbed from an 11-month low in January to an all-time high in May, with lower LNG prices and higher temperatures in recent months encouraging additional cargo purchases.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG ships its first two cargoes following gas compressor issues three weeks ago
Description: The Brunei LNG-operated 7.2 mtpa LNG plant in Lumut has shipped its first two cargoes in three weeks, following the shutdown of its onshore gas compressor plants on May 20.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh Galleon FSRU to arrive in Egypt this week; signals the restart of LNG imports
Description: The EGAS-chartered 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit will arrive at Port Said in Egypt this week. Its arrival paves the way for the resumption of LNG imports into the country as its peak demand season for gas begins.
Author: CK

Title: FERC orders Venture Global to release documents on Calcasieu Pass LNG start-up delay
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has ordered LNG project developer Venture Global to provide its term customers with documents regarding the mechanical problems which are delaying the commercial start-up of its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: NNPC, Golar aim for FID on Nigerian FLNG project this year
Description: State-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Corp (NNPC) and Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG aim to make a final investment decision (FID) on a floating LNG plant in the Niger Delta by the end of 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron shuts Wheatstone LNG plant for repairs
Description: Chevron Australia has suspended production at its 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone plant in Western Australia to repair its offshore infrastructure for an unspecified amount of time.
Author: JS

Title: Australian LNG exports dip in May, pulled lower by Gorgon’s single-train outage
Description: Australia shipped less LNG in May as a five-week-long single-train outage at the three-train Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia capped the month’s exports.
Author: CK

Title: Uniper ends Russian gas supply deals, severing long-term supply relationship with Gazprom
Description: Germany’s state-owned utility Uniper has decided to terminate its non-performing Russian gas supply contracts, severing a long-term relationship with Russia’s state-owned Gazprom Export.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC takes FID on Ruwais LNG, awards EPC contract
Description: UAE’s state-owned ADNOC has made a final investment decision on the 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in Al Ruwais and awarded an EPC contract worth $5.5 billion to build the project.
Author: JS

Title: US Treasury expands sanctions on Russia’s LNG industry
Description: The US Treasury Department has introduced more sanctions on the country’s LNG sector, including on the Chinese shipyard supplying modules for the Artic LNG 2 project and three operators of proposed LNG projects.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global to supply Ukraine’s DTEK with LNG volumes starting this year
Description: US-based LNG project developer Venture Global has penned a comprehensive heads of agreement with Ukrainian private energy company DTEK for the supply of LNG to Ukraine and Eastern Europe starting this year. The agreement also provides for long-term LNG offtake from the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG plant.
Author: JS

Title: Installation of second FSRU jetty works start at Wilhelmshaven LNG
Description: Norwegian energy equipment and solution player ECOonnect Energy said it has initiated the installation of the jettyless ready IQuay solution for LNG import to Wilhelmshaven, Germany, ahead of the Excelsior floating storage regasification unit’s deployment in the second half of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh’s Summit LNG FSRU undocks from terminal, seen heading to Seatrium in Singapore for repairs
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit has undocked from the Summit LNG terminal off the coast of Moheshkhali island in Bangladesh and is expected to sail to the Seatrium Tuas shipyard in Singapore for repairs following the damage it sustained during a storm at the end of May.
Author: CK

Title: Hoegh Galleon signals its imminent arrival at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal
Description: The 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit has signalled its imminent arrival at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG terminal where it will serve as the country’s LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG terminal undergoes more commissioning tests, further delaying commercial start
Description: Commissioning activities are still underway at the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis Independent Natural Gas System LNG terminal in Greece, about four months after the receipt of an LNG commissioning cargo as the plant’s operator, Gastrade, conducts further commissioning tests, delaying the start of commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: Saudi Aramco inks term LNG offtake agreement from NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG
Description: State-owned Saudi Aramco has inked a non-binding heads of agreement with US-based LNG project developer NextDecade to offtake 1.2 mtpa of LNG from Train 4 of the proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG plant in Brownsville, Texas for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Wheatstone Platform repairs to be completed in “coming weeks”; LNG production restart to follow
Description: Repairs on the fuel gas system of Chevron’s Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have begun and are expected to be completed in the coming weeks, with the restart of LNG and domestic gas production to follow.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt receives its first LNG cargo after six years with Hoegh Galleon FSRU’s arrival
Description: Egypt received a reloaded cargo from Spain delivered by the 170,000 m3 Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit today. The vessel’s arrival marks the break of a six-year streak of no LNG receipts in Egypt and the start of its 19-20 month deployment at the Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen awards tender for a July LNG cargo to Tokyo Gas
Description: Philippines utility First Gen has awarded a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in July to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG receiving terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt seeks 17 LNG cargoes for delivery between July and September
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian Natural gas Holding Co., or EGAS, has issued a tender to buy 17 LNG cargoes for delivery between July and September. The tender closes on June 26.
Author: CK

Title: NFE eyes first LNG shipment in July from its delayed Altamira project
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy expects to begin LNG production in the next 10 days from its delayed 1.4 mtpa first Fast LNG project offshore Altamira in Mexico, with the shipment of its first LNG cargo following in July.
Author: CK

Title: Summit LNG’s repairs to be completed by end of July: Excelerate Energy
Description: US-based LNG solutions company Excelerate Energy expects its 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit which serves Bangladesh’s 3.8 mtpa LNG import facility offshore Moheshkhali Island in the Bay of Bengal, to complete repairs and resume operations by the end of July.
Author: JS

Title: Shell signs deal to acquire Pavilion Energy, bolstering its LNG market position
Description: Shell has signed a deal to acquire Singapore-based energy firm Pavilion Energy. The move aims to bolster Shell's leading position in the LNG market by giving it access to a global LNG trading business with a contracted supply of about 6.5 mtpa, as well as shipping, gas supply, and marketing activities in Asia and Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Perenco buys 10% stake in Golar LNG
Description: Independent Anglo-French oil and gas company Perenco has bought a picked up an approximately 10% stake in Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG, according to a filing.
Author: JS

Title: Var Energi, VNG extend gas sales agreement for 12 years
Description: Norway’s energy company Var Energi has extended its gas sales agreement with Germany’s VNG for the delivery of up to 5 billion m3 per year of natural gas for another 12 years.
Author: JS

Title: First LNG tanker to cross the Red Sea and the Suez Canal since mid-January
Description: An LNG carrier is headed to the Red Sea and further to the Mediterranean Sea via the Suez Canal in the first such transit since mid-January as the escalation of attacks on commercial vessels by the Houthi militants pushed shippers to steer clear of the shipping route.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche Ostsee terminal in Mukran to start full operations on Jul. 1 after second FSRU’s arrival
Description: German terminal operator Deutsche ReGas is targeting the start of full operations of the second phase of its Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran on July 1, taking into account the arrival of its second floating storage regasification, the 145,130 m3 Neptune.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks three August LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT seeks three LNG cargoes for delivery in August through a tender that will close on June 21.
Author: CK

Title: French Senate Committee advises France to ban Russian LNG imports
Description: A French senate committee on climate action has advised France to ban imports of Russian LNG “as soon as possible”.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks edge higher after week-earlier dip
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities edged higher from a week earlier amid an increase in LNG receipts and  a forecast for hotter-than-normal weather for the 30 days up to Jul. 14.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship diverts from Argentina amid talk of a cancelled cargo for Escobar
Description: A laden LNG ship that was scheduled to call at the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal in Argentina yesterday has made an about-turn, suggesting either a deferred delivery or a cancellation of the cargo on board. The vessel diversion comes amid talk of Argentina’s state-owned firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, cancelling a cargo it purchased for the current winter season.
Author: CK

Title: Genting awards EPC contract to Wison for FLNG project in Indonesia
Description: Malaysia’s holding company Genting Berhad, via its indirect subsidiaries, awarded an USD962.8 million engineering, procurement and construction contract to China’s floating LNG unit builder Wison New Energies for a planned 1.2 mtpa floating LNG facility offshore Teluk Bintuni, West Papua, Indonesia.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies, NNPC take FID on gas project to feed NLNG
Description: TotalEnergies and the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation have made the final investment decision to develop the Ubeta gas field, which will provide additional feed gas for the 22.1 mtpa NLNG plant in Bonny Island, Nigeria.
Author: JS

Title: China’s Wison announces exit from Russian energy projects in fresh blow to Arctic LNG
Description: China-based LNG solutions company Wison New Energies has announced its exit from all Russian energy projects, which is seen as a fresh blow to Russia’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG project, which Wison is involved in.
Author: JS

Title: EU agrees on a fourteenth sanctions package against Russia, targeting LNG for the first time
Description: The European Union has agreed on a new sanctions package against Russia in response to its aggression against Ukraine, targeting its LNG exports for the first time.
Author: CK

Title: Restart activities underway at Wheatstone gas platform; LNG ship docks at terminal
Description: Restart activities are underway at the Chevron-operated offshore Wheatstone platform following a June 11 shutdown of its fuel gas system. This shutdown suspended gas flows to two LNG trains and a domestic gas plant, tightening LNG supplies and helping to underpin the recent strength in spot LNG prices.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone LNG ships two cargoes following restart and full production at gas facility
Description: The Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG plant in Western Australia has resumed exports with the restart of LNG and gas production at the Wheatstone gas facility after a shutdown of its fuel gas system on June 10.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Dhamra LNG terminal to receive its first cargo from Mozambique’s Coral South
Description: The 5 mtpa Dhamra LNG terminal on India’s east coast is poised to receive its first cargo from the 3.4 mtpa Coral South floating LNG plant in Mozambique with the arrival of the 173,400 m3 Kinisis LNG tanker.
Author: CK

Title: EU reveals 14th sanctions package on Russia, with LNG included for the first time
Description: The European Union has adopted its 14th sanctions package on Russia for its ongoing invasion of Ukraine, with LNG, the sector’s growth and some shipment circumvention loopholes included for the first time.
Author: JS

Title: EU sanctions Novatek’s FSU vessels
Description: Novatek-owned 354,000 m3 Koryak and 354,000 m3 Saam floating storage units are among the list of 27 vessels sanctioned by the European Union as part of its 14th sanctions package.
Author: JS

Title: Snohvit LNG to be back online on Monday after a weekend-long outage
Description: Equinor is on track to restart its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island near Hammerfest later today after a power outage halted production.
Author: JS

Title: Gasunie, Vopak consider options to use EemsEnergyTerminal beyond 2027
Description: Dutch gas network operator Gasunie and Rotterdam-headquartered global infrastructure provider Vopak have initiated market consultations to assess the potential of using the EemsEnergyTerminal in Netherlands’ Eemshaven beyond 2027 for LNG, as well as hydrogen and carbon dioxide.
Author: CK

Title: Finland’s Gasum will stop Russian LNG imports in July
Description: Finland’s state-owned energy firm Gasum said it would halt imports of Russian LNG from July 26, which is the date the EU’s latest sanctions package on Russia takes effect.
Author: JS

Title: LNG ship takes Arctic route from Yamal, marks opening of Northern Sea Route for voyages to Asia
Description: The 172,000 m3 Eduard Toll Arc7 ice-class LNG carrier has left Russia’s 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant in Sabetta and is in the Arctic Ocean, indicating that the Northern Sea Route (NSR) for shorter voyages to Asia has opened ahead of the official start of the NSR summer-autumn navigation season on Jul. 1.
Author: CK

Title: The Haisla Nation, Pembina greenlight Cedar LNG project in Canada
Description: The Haisla Nation and Canadian pipeline operator Pembina Pipeline Corp. have made a positive final investment decision on their 3.3 mtpa Cedar LNG project in British Columbia, Canada, and continue to expect the project to enter into service in late 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Kimmeridge acquires 90% stake in Commonwealth LNG, keeps first-half 2025 FID target
Description: New York-based investment manager Kimmeridge has taken a 90% stake in Commonwealth LNG, giving it control of the proposed LNG export project in Cameron, Louisiana. A final investment decision on the project is still targeted for the first half of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global launches the first of nine LNG ships; operations to begin in Fall 2024
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has launched the 174,000 m3 Venture Gator, the first in its fleet of nine ships being built at the Samsung Heavy Industries shipyard in Geoji-si, South Korea. The ship is expected to begin delivering LNG from the US to the firm’s customers and multiple destinations in the Fall of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Saudi Aramco to offtake 5 mtpa from Sempra’s Port Arthur, to buy equity in Phase 2
Description: Saudi Aramco has inked a non-binding heads of agreement with US-based LNG project developer Sempra for a 20-year sale and purchase agreement for LNG offtake of 5 mtpa from the proposed 13 mtpa Port Arthur LNG Phase 2 expansion project in Texas. The agreement also contemplates a 25% equity participation in the Phase 2 of the project.
Author: JS

Title: US regulator greenlights capacity increase for Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG plant
Description: The US Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration has approved LNG project developer Venture Global’s request to increase the proposed Plaquemines LNG plant’s peak liquefaction capacity from approximately 24 mtpa to 27.2 mtpa.
Author: JS

Title: FERC greenlights Venture Global’s CP2 LNG export project
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has authorised the construction of Venture Global’s proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG export project, with only one last permit left to obtain.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt awards tender for 17 LNG cargoes, seeks more cargoes
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., or EGAS, closed its largest tender in years yesterday awarding in full its requirement of 17 cargoes for delivery from July to September to at least six firms. And, EGAS may seek several more cargoes to avoid a gas supply crunch this summer.
Author: CK

Title: PTT seeks one July or August LNG cargo to add to previous purchases
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery either on Jul. 27-28 or Aug 1-2 to its Map Ta Phut terminal in southern Thailand. The tender closes on Jul. 2.
Author: CK

Title: Jera expects heavy July-September power load; no major concerns about fuel procurement
Description: Japan’s largest power utility and LNG importer Jera expects power consumption to be high during the July to September summer period but does not have major concerns about procuring fuels to meet the demand.
Author: CK

Title: HEH starts construction of onshore LNG terminal in Stade
Description: Hanseatic Energy Hub has started the construction of Germany's first land-based LNG terminal at the port of Stade, which will replace the floating storage regasification unit currently deployed at the port.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC L&S to expand LNG fleet with South Korean order
Description: ADNOC Logistics & Services, ADNOC’s energy maritime logistics arm, has awarded South Korean shipyards Samsung Heavy Industries and Hanwha Ocean up to $2.5 billion shipbuilding contracts for the construction of eight to 10 new LNG tankers.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa receives one less LNG cargo at Escobar in June than purchased
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, received seven LNG cargoes in June at the  6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG import terminal, or one less cargo than was initially scheduled for the month to meet an anticipated increase in gas consumption this winter.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s EGAS receives its second LNG cargo at Ain Sukhna
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., or EGAS, has received its second LNG cargo for the year at the country’s Ain Sukhna floating LNG import terminal, just days after closing its tender last week to buy 17 cargoes for delivery between July and September.
Author: CK

Title: Saudi Aramco awards $25 billion worth of contracts to advance gas expansion
Description: Saudi Aramco has awarded contracts worth more than $25 billion to progress its strategic gas expansion, targeting gas production growth of over 60% by 2030 compared with 2021.
Author: JS

Title: Neptune FSRU to arrive at Mukran LNG this week
Description: The 145,130 m3 Neptune floating storage regasification unit is expected to arrive at Deutsche ReGas’s LNG terminal in Mukran later this week after undergoing repairs before its permanent redeployment at Mukran.
Author: JS

Title: India’s LNG imports climb to a 44-month high in June; US overtakes Qatar as top supplier
Description: LNG imports into India surged to their highest level in June since October 2020, driven by a heatwave that escalated power requirements in the country and contributed to the incremental demand for spot LNG cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: US federal judge blocks Biden Administration’s pause on LNG export permits
Description: President Joe Biden's administration’s pause on LNG export permit issuance has suffered a fresh setback after a US federal judge blocked the Department of Energy from continuing to pause the approval.
Author: JS

Title: Neptune FSRU moors at Mukran LNG, readies for commissioning
Description: The 145,130 m3 Neptune floating storage regasification unit has moored at Deutsche ReGas’s LNG terminal in Mukran earlier today, signalling the imminent launch of Deutsche Ostsee’s second phase of operations.
Author: JS

Title: Northeast Asian LNG imports post month-on-month dip in June as prices bite
Description: Northeast Asian countries, Japan, China, South Korea and Taiwan, took less LNG in June than in May, with China leading the decline in receipts as rising LNG prices curbed the appetite for spot LNG.
Author: CK

Title: EU-27 LNG imports slip further in June on continued lower demand
Description: European LNG imports slipped for the second month in a row in June as high underground gas stock levels, ample piped gas deliveries, and a surge in LNG prices continued to suppress demand.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s power plant operator B.Grimm issues first tender for an LNG cargo
Description: Thailand-based power plant operator B.Grimm Power has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on Aug. 25-26 to the Map Ta Phut LNG terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Gastrade targets commercial start for Alexandroupolis LNG on Oct. 1
Description: Greek utility firm and LNG project developer Gastrade expects to begin commercial operations on Oct. 1 at Greece's second LNG receiving terminal, the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis, after a delay of about seven months due to technical difficulties that have extended its commissioning phase.
Author: CK

Title: GasLog Hong Kong is expected to deliver Ain Sukhna’s third LNG cargo this year
Description: The 174,000 m3 GasLog Hong Kong LNG tanker is expected to deliver an LNG cargo to Egypt’s Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal after it completes its southbound passage through the Suez Canal today. The cargo will be Ain Sukhna’s third LNG cargo this year since the Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit arrived at the terminal for installation on June 14.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Regas to start commissioning of two FSRUs at Mukran this weekend
Description: Deutsche ReGas is expected to commission the second phase of its Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran in the coming weeks to a month, after deploying the two floating storage regasification units at Mukran this weekend.
Author: JS

Title: Golar LNG signs 20-year deal to deploy Hilli FLNG in Argentina
Description: Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG has entered into definitive agreements with Pan American Energy for a 20-year deployment of its Hilli floating LNG vessel in Argentina.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG halts output ahead of Hurricane Beryl
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas shut down production over the weekend in anticipation of Hurricane Beryl which hit southeast Texas earlier today.
Author: JS

Title: Two more LNG ships take the Arctic route from Yamal as first ship awaits orders
Description: Two more Arc7 ice-class LNG carriers have left the 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant near Sabetta in Russia’s Yamal Peninsula and are heading to Asia via the Northern Sea Route. They follow the 172,000 m3 Eduard Toll, the first ice-class LNG carrier to take the shorter route from Yamal via the Arctic this year.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Jera increases power output to ensure stable supply due to higher temperatures
Description: Japanese power utility, Jera, one of the largest LNG importers globally, increased power output at eight of its power plants and restarted operations at three plants amid expectations of higher temperatures and a drop in the electricity supply-demand reserve margin.
Author: CK

Title: PGNiG to supply LNG to Slovakia’s ZSE Energia in 2025
Description: Poland’s ORLEN, through its subsidiary PGNiG Supply&Trading, has signed a sales agreement with the Slovak company ZSE Energia to supply it with around 33% of the company’s gas demand in 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Shell takes FID on Manatee gas field to backfill Atlantic LNG
Description: Shell has made a final investment decision on the Manatee gas field offshore Trinidad and Tobago which will backfill the existing 15.3 mtpa Atlantic LNG export plant as the firm looks to boost its LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: Bulgargaz starts arbitration against Gazprom over gas supplies
Description: Bulgarian state gas company Bulgargaz EAD has started arbitration proceedings against Russia's Gazprom Export, seeking compensation of EUR400 million ($432.5 million) for the suspension of contractual supplies in 2022.
Author: JS

Title: Glencore inks LNG supply deal with Shenzhen Energy
Description: China's Shenzhen Energy Group has signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement to buy LNG from with Switzerland-headquartered trader Glencore.
Author: JS

Title: Switzerland’s MET Group seals 10-year LNG deal with Shell
Description: Swiss energy firm MET Group has signed a 10-year agreement to buy LNG from Shell, with an eye to supplying its European customers with US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada’s Train 1 approaches completion ahead of targeted mid-2025 start of LNG exports
Description: The first liquefaction train of the 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has moved closer to completion ahead of the anticipated start of LNG deliveries in mid-2025 thanks to the completion of the train’s final weld by the JGC-Fluor engineering joint venture.
Author: CK

Title: Summit LNG FSRU heading back to Bangladesh after repairs at Singapore’s Seatrium shipyard
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit has left the Seatrium Tuas shipyard in Singapore and is making its way to Chittagong, Bangladesh, to resume LNG import operations by mid-month at the Summit floating LNG terminal.
Author: CK

Title: POSCO International completes construction of Gwangyang LNG, to bring second LNG terminal online in 2026
Description: POSCO International, South Korean steelmaker POSCO’s trading arm, has completed the construction of the 5.2 mtpa Gwangyang, the country’s first privately owned LNG import terminal. It said that its second facility is due to come online in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: UPDATE: Freeport LNG yet to resume exports even as ships wait to berth at the terminal
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, has yet to restart exports following a halt to operations on July 7 to prepare for any potential impact from Hurricane Beryl’s anticipated landfall in Texas on Jul. 8.
Author: CK

Title: Four energy majors buy into ADNOC’s Ruwais LNG
Description: Shell, alongside TotalEnergies, BP and Mitsui, have agreed to invest invest in the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company’s 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in Abu Dhabi by purchasing a 10% participating interest each.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global granted FERC approval to introduce hazardous liquids to Plaquemines LNG
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluids to the gas turbine generator 1 of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, signalling of the facility’s imminent start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks three September LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy three cargoes for delivery in September to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the southern province of Rayong. The tender closes on Jul. 15
Author: CK

Title: German association forecasts empty gas stocks in case of a cold winter
Description: German gas storage system operators’ association INES foresees stocks ending the upcoming winter at comfortable levels in case of a mild to normal winter and does not exclude them ending empty if the winter is cold.
Author: JS

Title: Summit LNG arrives in Bangladesh to resume LNG import operations after repairs
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit arrived in Bangladesh today after a five-day journey from Singapore and is expected to resume LNG import operations.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside agrees 10-year LNG deal with CPC until 2034; potential for a further 10-year supply
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside will supply Taiwan's state-owned CPC with 6 million tons (mt) of LNG over 10 years through a term supply agreement that begins this month.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P LNG partners BK LNG to supply LNG to China; first cargo to Huaying terminal by end-Aug
Description: LNG infrastructure developer AG&P LNG has teamed up with BK LNG Solutions to supply LNG to China, starting with the delivery of their first spot cargo to the yet-to-be-launched 6 mtpa Huaying LNG terminal in China’s southern city of Chaozhou scheduled for the end of August.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa seeks one August-September LNG cargo for Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, is seeking one cargo for delivery between August and September to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal through its fourth LNG tender this year to meet demand during the current winter season. The tender closes on Jul. 17.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt eyes additional LNG import capacity
Description: Egypt's petroleum ministry weighs the possibility of adding another floating storage regasification unit at Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal, as well as converting its two existing export facilities to LNG import terminals.
Author: JS

Title: Lake Charles LNG pressures DOE to issue export permit
Description: The developer of the 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG plant in Louisiana has sent a letter to the US Department of Energy in hopes of expediting its export permit application following a federal judge’s block on the Biden administration’s pause on pending and new LNG export licenses.
Author: JS

Title: Bulgaria requests to renegotiate LNG terminal access agreement with Turkey’s BOTAS
Description: Bulgarian state-owned natural gas supplier Bulgargaz hopes to renegotiate its existing agreement with Turkish energy company BOTAS on the access to Turkish LNG terminals and BOTAS’s gas transmission network.
Author: JS

Title: Damaged mooring line seen keeping Summit LNG offline for longer
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit is facing mooring issues, which are expected to keep the vessel offline for a little longer after just returning from three weeks of repairs in Singapore.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG remains offline one week after Hurricane Beryl; more ships signal their arrival
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG has yet to restart operations a week after Hurricane Beryl made landfall in Texas, leading some LNG ships to continue to wait outside the terminal for loading operations to resume while a few wait for orders on new loading destinations.
Author: CK

Title: Snam’s planned Ravenna floating LNG import terminal to start by first quarter 2025
Description: Italy’s gas utility Snam expects its planned mtpa Ravenna LNG import terminal in the country’s northeastern Emilia-Romagna region to start up by the first quarter of 2025, following the arrival of the 170,000 m3 BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit at the end of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG suffers damages from Hurricane Beryl, aims to restart first train this week
Description: Freeport LNG aims to bring its first train back online later this week and the remaining two trains soon after, as the plant undergoes repairs following damages from Hurricane Beryl last week.
Author: JS

Title: Asia, industry lead increase in global gas demand in H1: IEA
Description: The Asian region saw a 60% increase in global gas demand in the first half of 2024 led by China and India and a surge in use by industry, according to the International Energy Agency’s latest quarterly gas report.
Author: JS

Title: Lake Charles LNG FID on hold as key permit from DOE still pending approval
Description: Texas-based midstream company Energy Transfer said that it remains focused on making a final investment decision on its proposed 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG plant as it seeks to expedite the export permit approval process by the US Department of Energy.
Author: JS

Title: First Yamal cargo via Northern Sea Route this year delivered to China’s Fujian terminal
Description: The 172,000 m3 Eduard Toll Arc-7 ice-breaking LNG tanker has delivered its cargo from the Novatek-operated 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant in Russia to the 6.3 mtpa Fujian receiving terminal in China, marking the first LNG delivery this year from Yamal via the Northern Sea Route.
Author: CK

Title: Lithuania urges EU member states to look for measures to stop Russian LNG imports
Description: Lithuania has urged the European Union to move faster away from Russian LNG as imports of Russian natural gas, including LNG, exceeded the volumes imported from the US in May for the first time in the last two years.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt seeks more summer LNG supplies,  issues tender for two Aug-Sep cargoes
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corp. has issued a tender to buy two cargoes for delivery in August and September to meet demand during the current summer season. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Vasilikos LNG terminal’s start-up under question as engineering consortium terminates contract
Description: Chinese-led engineering consortium CPP-Metron Consortium has terminated the contract with Cypriot state-owned ETYFA on the construction of the Vasilikos LNG terminal over a series of disputes over work scope and non-payment for services.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG term offtakers receive cancellation notices for LNG deliveries up to September
Description: Offtakers at the currently shut 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant have received notices that several of their cargoes for delivery up to September have been cancelled following damages to the plant sustained from Hurricane Beryl's onslaught last week.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra Infrastructure inks EPC contract with Bechtel for Phase 2 of Port Arthur LNG
Description: US LNG project developer Sempra Infrastructure has signed an engineering, procurement and construction contract with Bechtel for the second phase of its 13 mtpa Port Arthur LNG export project in Texas.
Author: JS

Title: Altamira FLNG set to ship first cargo as LNG tanker approaches port
Description: US LNG developer New Fortress Energy might soon load its first LNG cargo from its 1.4 mtpa Altamira floating LNG export plant offshore Mexico, as a ballast LNG tanker is seen approaching the facility.
Author: JS

Title: LNG tanker North Sky arrives at Yamal instead of Arctic LNG 2
Description: An Arc4 ice-class LNG tanker, the 174,000 m3 North Sky, has arrived at the Novatek-operated 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG export facility in Russia’s Sabetta port on the Yamal peninsula, ending market speculation that it would head to the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG plant, 70 kilometres across the Ob Bay from Yamal to export its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Four LNG tankers divert from Freeport amid ongoing repairs
Description: Four LNG tankers have diverted away from the currently shut 15 mtpa Freeport LNG export facility while seven remain idle nearby, according to Kpler data.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG restarts exports after two-week shutdown due to hurricane-induced damages
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island has shipped its first cargo since shutting down on July 7 in preparation for Hurricane Beryl’s landfall, indicating a restart of LNG production at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Cypriot government determined to bring Vasilikos LNG terminal online
Description: According to a statement today by the President of Cyprus Nikos Christodoulidis, the Vasilikos LNG terminal will be implemented even with the contractor’s exit from the project.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside to acquire US project developer Tellurian and its Driftwood LNG project
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has entered into a definitive agreement with US project developer Tellurian to purchase all its shares and those of its proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG project in the US in an all-cash transaction. The deal is expected to advance the Driftwood LNG project in Lake Charles, Louisiana, towards a final investment decision and expand Woodside’s global LNG footprint.
Author: CK

Title: US Senators present legislation to speed up LNG approvals
Description: US Senators Joe Manchin and John Barrasso, on behalf of the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee, presented the Energy Permitting Reform Act of 2024, designed to accelerate the permitting process for energy infrastructure, including LNG, and to put an end to the Biden Administration’s permitting pause.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere’s Corpus Christi Stage 3 project reaches 62.4% completion
Description: Cheniere Energy’s 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project reaches 62.4% completion in June, with the start-up still slated ahead of schedule at the end of 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Golden Pass LNG works to speed up as court approves settlement
Description: Work to complete the 15.6 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Texas might speed up following a court's approval of the settlement agreement allowing the joint venture to choose a new contractor to take over the development.
Author: JS

Title: Scarborough and Pluto Train 2 project 67% completed; first LNG still on track for 2026
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy remains on track to produce the first LNG from its Scarborough energy project in Western Australia in 2026, with Scarborough and Pluto Train 2 projects 67% completed at the end of June.
Author: CK

Title: Glenfarne’s Texas LNG and EQT sign binding 20-year tolling agreement
Description: US-based energy project developer Glenfarne and natural gas producer EQT Corporation have executed a definitive 20-year tolling agreement for natural gas liquefaction services for 2 mtpa of LNG. From Glenfarne’s 4 mtpa Texas LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas,
Author: JS

Title: ConocoPhillips books long-term regasification capacity at Zeebrugge, signs LNG SPA
Description: US-based ConocoPhillips booked long-term regasification capacity at the Fluxys-run 6.6 mtpa Zeebrugge LNG terminal in Belgium and signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement to supply the Asian market.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s EGPC issues tender for five August-September LNG cargoes for delivery to Ain Sukhna, Aqaba
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corp. has issued a tender to buy five cargoes for delivery in August and September as summer demand for gas continues. The tender closes on July 29.
Author: JS

Title: NFE eyes first LNG delivery from Altamira in August, completion of second FLNG unit in 1H 2026
Description: US LNG project developer New Fortress Energy expects its first Fast LNG unit offshore Altamira in Mexico to deliver its first LNG cargo next month following the recent start of LNG production.
Author: CK

Title: EU opens investigation into Vasilikos LNG
Description: The European Public Prosecutor’s Office, or EPPO, has opened an investigation into the Vasilikos LNG import terminal in Cyprus, on suspicion of procurement fraud, misappropriation of EU funds and corruption.
Author: JS

Title: Summit hopes to close deals for long-term LNG supply, an FSRU for Bangladesh before September
Description: Summit Asia Pacific hopes to finalize negotiations for a 15-year charter of a floating storage regasification unit and 1.5 mtpa of long-term LNG supply for Bangladesh before September, when the firm hopes to make a final investment decision on the country’s third LNG receiving terminal project.
Author: CK

Title: Restart of LNG exports from Egypt “unlikely” this winter: Eni
Description: Eni said during its second-quarter results call that the possibility of Egypt restarting LNG exports is unlikely, but a few cargoes may still be exported.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG’s three trains back online, feed gas flows supportive
Description: All three liquefaction trains at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island in Texas have now come online since this weekend, following a shutdown of the plant and a two-week halt to LNG exports due to hurricane-induced damages.
Author: CK

Title: Oman to expand Qalhat LNG plant with additional capacity
Description: Oman plans to build a new liquefaction train at its Qalhat LNG plant, which is expected to be completed and operational by 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Future of Cyprus’ Vasilikos LNG terminal under question as EU demands repayment of grants
Description: The European Commission has demanded that Cyprus repay nearly €69 million in grants awarded to its state-owned project developer ETYFA for the construction of the planned 4 mtpa Vasilikos LNG terminal, further clouding the prospect of the terminal’s future.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey eyes gas production boost with new floating production unit
Description: Turkey expects its new floating production unit to double natural gas output from its Sakarya field in the Black Sea from 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Ichthys LNG’s Train 2 restarts production following week-long shutdown
Description: The second train of the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory restarted operations over the weekend after shutting down due to a leak a week earlier.
Author: CK

Title: First gas at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project expected in 3-4 months: BP
Description: BP said that it expects to introduce first gas into the 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritania in three to four months, which is signalling yet another pushback in the project’s start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt fully awards its five-cargo August-September LNG tender
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corp. has fully awarded its tender to buy five LNG cargoes for delivery in August and September, bringing its total number of purchases across its last three tenders to at least nine August and eight September cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Gail eyes start of year-round Dabhol LNG operations from 2025
Description: India's state-owned Gail plans to operate its 5 mtpa Dabhol LNG terminal in Maharashtra state on the country's west coast at full capacity from 2025, following the completion of the construction of a breakwater facility after the end of India’s monsoon season.
Author: JS

Title: OMV secures additional gas pipeline capacities until 2029
Description: Austria’s state-owned OMV has secured 51 TWh (5.2 billion m3) of additional pipeline gas capacity from 2026 until 2029, as it moves to increase the use of pipelines from Germany for gas imports while further diversifying away from its reliance on Russia.
Author: JS

Title: Chhara LNG terminal commissioning pushed to November-December
Description: State-owned Hindustan Petroleum Corp. expects to commission its 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in the Gir-Somnath district of Gujarat before the year-end, following a false start in April. Once the terminal is online, it plans to offer terminal capacity for lease.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s end-July LNG stocks dip amid hotter weather
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities dipped for the week ending Jul. 28 after rising a week earlier above the five-year average for July.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports dip in July on lower Freeport shipments due to hurricane-induced outage
Description: The US shipped less LNG in July compared to month- and year-earlier levels largely due to a two-week outage at its second-largest LNG export facility, Freeport, which cut overall export volumes.
Author: CK

Title: YPF, Petronas select location for Argentina FLNG project
Description: Argentina’s YPF and Malaysia’s Petronas will build its proposed 30 mtpa Argentina floating LNG project in Sierra Grande in the province of Río Negro, moving the location from the originally planned Bahia Blanca in Buenos Aires province, which currently hosts an LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Expanded Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal start-up in “couple of weeks”
Description: The Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Germany’s Mukran will restart imports within weeks, as Deutsche ReGas progresses through the start-up of the facility utilising two floating storage regasification unit terminal.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada more than 90% completed; commissioning and start-up activities continue
Description: The first phase of the Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, is nearly completed and is on track to ship its first LNG cargoes in the middle of next year.
Author: CK

Title: Russian July LNG exports plunge to their lowest since August 2021
Description: Russia's July LNG exports saw a month-on-month and year-on-year export decline due to significantly lower intakes by Europe, with the steep decline cushioned by higher intakes by China.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Swan Energy awaits shareholder approval of Vasant 1 FSRU sale to Turkey’s Botas
Description: India’s Swan Energy is waiting for its shareholders to approve the sale of its 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage regasification unit to Turkey’s state-owned Botas, raising questions about the future of the Indian firm’s planned 5 mtpa Jafrabad LNG terminal in Amreli, Gujarat.
Author: CK

Title: First train of Qatar’s North Field East LNG expansion 50% complete: Technip Energies
Description: Technip Energies, one of the engineering, procurement and construction contractors for QatarEnergy ‘s 32 mtpa North Field Expansion said that the first train has reached over 50% construction progress.
Author: JS

Title: NFE sets date for Altamira FLNG's commissioning, first cargo
Description: US LNG project developer New Fortress Energy, or NFE, expects to complete commissioning of its delayed 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG floating unit offshore Mexico and to ship its first partial cargo on August 9.
Author: JS

Title: Golden Pass LNG start-up slips to late-2025
Description: ExxonMobil, project partner in the 15.6 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Texas, expects the facility to delay its start-up to late 2025 from the earlier expectation of a mid-year start after lead contractor Zachry Holdings declared bankruptcy and exited the project.
Author: JS

Title: Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG plant faces output issues at Train 8, loading at terminal continues
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia is facing production issues at its eighth liquefaction train, constraining exports and possibly spurring some offtakers to seek spot LNG cargoes for replacement, according to market participants. However, ships continue to berth at the terminal to load LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Galp seals 20-year deal to buy LNG from Cheniere’s Sabine Pass expansion
Description: Portugal’s Galp has signed a sales and purchase agreement with Cheniere Marketing for access to US LNG, including a 20-year 0.5 mtpa from the proposed 20 mtpa Sabine Pass liquefaction expansion project starting in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project ships its first cargo on the Pioneer LNG tanker
Description: The Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export plant on Russia’s Gydan Peninsula has exported its first LNG cargo on the 138,000 m3 Pioneer LNG tanker, paving the way for more exports from the sanctioned plant that has suffered from a lack of ice-class ships to lift its cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim to bring cooldown cargo this month, first LNG in Q4: Kosmos Energy
Description: US upstream firm Kosmos Energy, which is developing the 1.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG export project offshore Senegal and Mauritania, said that the project will bring a cooldown cargo later this month, with the first LNG cargo expected in the fourth quarter.
Author: JS

Title: Taiwan‘s July LNG imports at all-time high amid intense heatwave; nuclear reactor closure
Description: Taiwan imported more LNG than ever in July, spurred by higher-than-normal temperatures across the country and the permanent closure of the Maanshan 1 nuclear reactor.
Author: CK

Title: US Court reverses FERC’s authorization for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG project
Description: The US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit has reversed the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s reauthorization for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG export project in Brownsville, Texas because the regulator did not issue a supplemental environmental impact statement as part of the process.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade, Bechtel sign engineering contract for construction of Rio Grande LNG’s Train 4
Description: US project developer NextDecade has executed an engineering, procurement and construction contract with Bechtel Energy to build the fourth train and related infrastructure at its Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra delays start-up of Energia Costa Azul’s Phase 1 to 2025
Description: Sempra reported that its under-construction 3.25 mtpa Energia Costa Azul LNG export plant in Mexico was 85% complete, but due to “labour issues”, the start-up has been delayed to next year.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas seeks to defer Bintulu LNG deliveries to MLNG 3 buyers amid Train 8 outage
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas has approached term offtakers to request the deferral of cargoes for delivery up to October from the eighth train at the 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export complex in Sarawak that is offline due to an unplanned outage.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada is poised to receive an LPG cargo, marks a key step towards project’s start
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in British Columbia is poised to receive a cargo of liquefied petroleum gas as it works to commission the terminal’s first phase and prepare it for start-up.
Author: CK

Title: Osaka Gas signs initial deal with ADNOC for long-term offtake from Ruwais LNG
Description: Japan’s Osaka Gas has signed a memorandum of understanding with Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC to buy up to about 0.8 mtpa of LNG on a delivered ex-ship basis from the planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports slip to a 34-month low as demand stays soft
Description: Imports of LNG into Europe have dipped to their lowest level since September 2021 as demand remains subdued and underground gas stocks are close to their targeted refill levels.
Author: JS

Title: Australia’s Venice Energy seeks investor for Outer Harbor LNG project
Description: Australian energy provider Venice Energy has begun formal negotiations to secure “a major international balance sheet partner” for its proposed 3.8 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import project in Port Adelaide, which will ensure South Australia’s energy security.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh’s LNG imports seen lower on continuing social unrest following PM’s ouster
Description: Bangladesh’s demand for LNG is expected to weaken further in the near term if social unrest in the country continues following Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation on Monday and the installation of an interim government.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P LNG expects to issue tender for Cai Mep LNG commissioning cargo by end-September
Description: LNG infrastructure developer AG&P LNG expects to issue a tender by the end of September to buy an LNG commissioning cargo for the 3 mtpa Cai Mep LNG terminal in Vietnam’s southern Vung Tau district.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s EGAT seeks one second-half October LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in the second half of October to the country’s Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in southern Thailand. The tender closes on Aug. 14.
Author: CK

Title: Earthquake hits western Japan, no impact on Sendai, Genkai and Ikata nuclear power plants
Description: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake has hit western Japan, triggering tsunami warnings for a few regions in the south and southwestern islands of Kyushu and Shikoku. However, nuclear power plants in the area have so far not been affected, while the impact on thermal power plants is still unclear.
Author: CK

Title: Corpus Christi Stage 3 will begin taking first gas in “next couple of months”: Cheniere
Description: Cheniere Energy’s 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project will start taking first gas in the “next couple of months,"  marking the start of the project’s commissioning operations, the firm’s Chief Executive Jack Fusco said in an earnings call today.
Author: JS

Title: Asya Energy becomes the second Russian LNG tanker to spoof AIS signal to circumvent Western sanctions
Description: The Asya Energy LNG tanker has become the latest vessel to spoof its Automatic Identification System, or AIS, signal, following last weekend’s discovery of similar tactics by the Pioneer LNG carrier, which subsequently loaded at Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic 2 LNG export project.
Author: JS

Title: Altamira FLNG loads first LNG cargo
Description: New Fortress Energy’s, or NFE’s, 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG floating plant offshore Mexico has loaded its first LNG cargo aboard the Energos Princess LNG tanker, with the vessel expected to depart later today for NFE’s 6 mtpa Barcarena LNG import terminal in Brazil.
Author: JS

Title: Fighting around Sudzha sparks concerns about pipeline supplies via Ukraine
Description: Increased fighting activity near Sudzha, Kursk region on the Russian border with Ukraine, which hosts the only operational gas interconnection point between the countries’ gas grids, has sparked market concerns, with prices reaching their highest since late last year.
Author: JS

Title: Excelerate Energy plans involvement in LNG terminals in Vietnam, Alaska
Description: US floating storage solutions provider Excelerate Energy is considering involvement in two new floating storage regasification unit-based terminals in Alaska and the development of an onshore LNG import facility in Vietnam.
Author: JS

Title: Satellite image confirms Asya Energy is second LNG tanker to dock at Arctic LNG 2
Description: A satellite image of the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia’s Gydan Peninsula obtained by Kpler confirms that the 137,200 m3 Asya Energy is the second LNG tanker to call at the project despite its efforts to hide its real location.
Author: CK

Title: India’s ONGC signs first framework agreements for LNG deals with Gunvor, ENOC
Description: India’s state-owned upstream firm ONGC has signed its first LNG master sale and purchase agreements with Emirates National Oil Co. and Gunvor, paving the way for the firm to begin importing LNG into India.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy Terminal moves FSRU away from berth at Stade due to dredging work
Description: Terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal has temporarily relocated the 174,000 m3 Energos Force floating storage regasification unit to Outer Elbe and away from its berth at the Stade floating LNG terminal in Elbe port to allow dredging work to take place. The FSRU is expected to return to its berth within the second half of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one spot LNG cargo for delivery in October
Description: Thailand’s state-owned has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal on Oct. 15-16. The tender closes on Aug. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Arrow Energy to expand feed gas supplies to QCLNG with Surat gas project expansion
Description: Australia-based Arrow Energy, a joint venture between Shell and PetroChina, has announced plans to develop the second phase of the Surat gas project in Queensland, which will backfill the 8.5 mtpa Queensland Curtis LNG plant, or GCLNG.
Author: JS

Title: Planned maintenance at NFE’s Altamira FLNG underway, full production to start shortly
Description: A seven-day planned maintenance is underway at New Fortress Energy’s 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG project in Mexico and is expected to end on Aug. 16, shortly after which the project is expected to begin full production.
Author: CK

Title: Asya Energy LNG tanker leaves Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 terminal
Description: The 137,200 m3 Asya Energy LNG tanker spotted by satellite docked at Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant on Aug. 10 has left the terminal. However, its location and whether it loaded any LNG are unclear as it continues to send false signals, preventing its actual location from being detected.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy Terminal continues to target Stade’s first LNG cargo receipt in second-half 2024
Description: German terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal still expects its 3.9 mtpa Stade LNG floating receiving terminal in Lower Saxony, northern Germany, to receive its first LNG cargo in the second half of this year, following the completion of work to allow for the terminal’s safe operation.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines LNG almost 80% complete, first gas this autumn
Description: US-based LNG project developer Venture Global expects its 24 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana to produce first gas “this fall” with exports to follow “soon thereafter”, which is a delay from the previously expected mid-year start.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s weekly LNG stock levels edge up from a five-month low
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities edged higher during the week ending Aug. 11 despite very high temperatures across the country, which have boosted power consumption.
Author: CK

Title: Maintenance at Montoir LNG extended once again
Description: The end of downtime at French Elengy-operated 8 mtpa Montoir LNG terminal has been extended once again for another three days and is now expected to end on August 15.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade will take all legal and regulatory actions to ensure Rio Grande LNG Phase 1’s timely start
Description: US project developer NextDecade will pursue all legal and regulatory avenues to ensure that the first phase of its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project that is under construction comes online on time and on budget. This follows a federal court’s decision earlier this month to reverse the Federal Regulatory Energy Commission’s remand authorization of the project.
Author: CK

Title: Mozambique expects ExxonMobil to take FID on Rovuma LNG by 2026
