Description: Mozambique President Filipe Nyusi expects ExxonMobil to make a final investment decision on its Rovuma Mozamqbiue LNG project by 2026, following a meeting yesterday with the energy firm’s president of upstream operations, Liam Mallon.
Author: CK

Title: Commissioning of Greece’s delayed Alexandroupolis FSRU project completed
Description: Greek utility firm Gastrade has completed the commissioning of its delayed 5.5 billion m3 a year Alexandroupolis floating LNG import terminal, its technical director said in a social media post.
Author: CK

Title: France’s Elengy pushes back restart of Montoir LNG terminal yet again
Description: LNG terminal operator Elengy has pushed back the restart of its 8 mtpa Montoir LNG terminal in France to Aug. 19, prolonging the facility's unplanned maintenance by four more days.
Author: CK

Title: Second train for Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 poised to arrive soon
Description: A second liquefaction train on a gravity-based structure to be installed at the sanctioned Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in Russia’s Gydan peninsula is close to the project and looks poised to arrive this weekend, boosting the facility's production capacity.
Author: CK

Title: NFE resumes LNG production at Altamira after planned maintenance
Description: US-based LNG project developer New Fortress Energy, or NFE, resumed production at its 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG unit offshore Mexico following scheduled maintenance after shipping its first cargo earlier this month.
Author: JS

Title: Second Arctic LNG 2 liquefaction train arrives at destination
Description: The second liquefaction train on a gravity-based structure for Novatek's sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in Russia’s Gydan peninsula arrived at its destination over the weekend, which will boost the facility's production capacity.
Author: JS

Title: PTT seeks two more August-September LNG cargoes after recent purchase for October
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery across August and September to the Map Ta Phut LNG terminal in Rayong . The tender closes on Aug. 21.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s B.Grimm seen buying more spot LNG in 2025-2027, in talks for term LNG supply
Description: Thai power producer and licensed LNG shipper B.Grimm expects to buy more LNG on a spot basis each year between 2025 and 2027 and has begun discussions to secure long-term supplies for delivery in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Elengy to resume operations at Montoir LNG following prolonged downtime
Description: French LNG terminal operator Elengy expects to resume operations at its 8 mtpa Montoir facility on Wednesday after prolonged unplanned maintenance that started in mid-June.
Author: JS

Title: Aqaba Development Company, AG&P to develop onshore LNG import facility in Aqaba
Description: Jordan’s Aqaba Development Company, Singaporean LNG developer AG&P International Holdings and its technology arm GAS Entec Co signed an agreement to develop an onshore LNG import terminal in Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah LNG port adjacent to the existing FSRU-based 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Laden LNG tanker approaches Plaquemines LNG ahead of its start-up
Description: A loaded LNG tanker is seen approaching Venture Global’s 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, which is expected to start up before the end of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas starts up Kasawari gas field to backfill Bintulu LNG
Description: Malaysian state-owned Petronas has started production at the Kasawari gas field offshore Sarawak, which will provide feed gas for the 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG plant and address the increasing domestic demand for gas.
Author: JS

Title: EU reaches gas storage refilling target ahead of schedule for second consecutive year
Description: Europe’s natural gas stocks have reached their 90% filling target more than two months ahead of schedule on Aug. 19, on par with last year, as plentiful stocks ensure a more comfortable entry into the upcoming winter season.
Author: JS

Title: Petronet to supply LNG to Sri Lanka power plant from India’s Kochi terminal
Description: India’s state-owned LNG terminal operator Petronet has signed an initial agreement with Sri Lanka’s power and engineering firm LTL Holdings to develop infrastructure for the storage, regasification and supply of LNG to the Sobadhanavi combined cycle power plant in Kerawalapitiya on Sri Lanka’s west coast.
Author: CK

Title: Project partners target an FID for Papua LNG at the end of 2025: Santos
Description: Partners in the TotalEnergies-led 5.6 mtpa Papua LNG project in Papua New Guinea plan to make a final investment decision on the proposed project at the end of 2025, pushing back the timeline by about a year.
Author: CK

Title: Tanker laden with LNG from Altamira FLNG performs ship-to-ship transfer at Jamaica’s Port Esquivel
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Princess, laden with the maiden cargo from New Fortress Energy’s 1.4 mtpa Altamira FLNG’s export project, has moored at Jamaica’s 3.6 mtpa Port Esquivel LNG to perform a ship-to-ship transfer with another LNG carrier.
Author: JS

Title: Mexico’s Amigo LNG to supply Malaysia’s E&H Energy with 3.6 mtpa of LNG
Description: Amigo LNG, a subsidiary of Singaporean LNG project developer LNG Alliance, has inked a deal to supply Malaysia-based E&H ENERGY with 3.6 mtpa of LNG for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Ichthys LNG’s Train 2 is offline due to heat exchanger trouble; repair work  to last until end-September
Description: The second train of the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory has shut down due to heat exchanger issues, with expectations that repairs could last until the end of September.
Author: CK

Title: Latest US sanctions target LNG shippers, aimed at suppressing Russia's dark fleet activity for Arctic LNG 2
Description: The U.S. has dealt yet another blow to the sanctioned Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia’s Gydan Peninsula, with its latest round of sanctions targeting LNG shippers and their seven LNG ships  including the Pioneer and Asya Energy that covertly loaded the sanctioned project’s first two cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Everest Energy is likely spoofing its AIS; could be next to call at sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project
Description: The 138,028 m3 Everest Energy LNG tanker cannot be located at its reported position in the Barents Sea, indicating that it is spoofing its AIS to call covertly at the sanctioned Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project on Russia’s Gydan Peninsula to load a cargo.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy, Kuwait’s KPC agree on a 15-year LNG supply deal for 3 mtpa
Description: QatarEnergy has agreed to supply state-owned Kuwait Petroleum Corp. with 3 mtpa of LNG over 15 years starting in January 2025 to support the country’s growing power demand.
Author: CK

Title: Newly sanctioned Pioneer LNG ship spoofs AIS again; caught by satellite in likely STS transfer
Description: The newly sanctioned 138,000 m3 Pioneer LNG tanker that lifted a cargo earlier this month from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project is once again transmitting false signals of its actual location to conceal the very high likelihood of a ship-to-ship transfer of LNG in the Mediterranean Sea with the 150,000 m3 New Energy LNG tanker.
Author: CK

Title: Power producer B.Grimm imports its first LNG cargo into Thailand from Queensland Curtis LNG
Description: Bangkok-based power producer B.Grimm received its first LNG cargo at the PTT-operated Map Ta Phut LNG terminal in Rayong yesterday, marking its debut as one of Thailand’s LNG importers.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa seeks two September-October LNG cargoes for Escobar
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery in September and October to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on Aug. 28.
Author: CK

Title: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project receives a third LNG tanker
Description: A third LNG tanker has called at Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project on the Gydan Peninsula, following the arrival of the 138,000 m3 Pioneer and 137,200 m3 Asya Energy earlier this month to load the project’s first two cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Refrigerant LPG cargo reaches LNG Canada ahead of commissioning operations
Description: A cargo of liquefied petroleum gas has moored at Shell's 14 mtpa LNG Canada plant in British Columbia ahead of its commissioning operations expected this month.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s EGAS invites bidders for the 2024  oil and gas exploration round
Description: Egypt’s Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources has announced that the Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company, or EGAS,  has launched a new international bid round for the exploration of oil and gas in 12 blocks in the Mediterranean and Nile Delta as it continues importing more LNG to alleviate the domestic gas shortage.
Author: JS

Title: Nigeria’s NNPC begins LNG shipments to Japan, China as it plans fleet acquisition
Description: Nigerian National Petroleum Company, or NNPC, has completed its first exports of LNG to China and Japan on chartered vessels amid plans to establish its own LNG fleet.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside flags interest in sale of stake in proposed Driftwood LNG project, expects FID in Q1 2025
Description: Australia-based Woodside Energy is seeking partners in its recently acquired 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG export project near Lake Charles in Louisiana as it aims to make a final investment decision on the project in the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Arctic LNG 2-linked ships seen increasing their spoofing tactics following new US sanctions
Description: LNG ships linked to Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project on the Gydan Peninsula are likely to step up their tactics to conceal their movements in the wake of new US sanctions targeting ships and shipping firms to curb support for Russia’s newest LNG project and disrupt sanction evasion activities.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG in restart mode after fire system trip causes shutdown
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas is in the process of restarting operations after a trip in the fire safety system caused a forced shutdown of operations at the facility.
Author: JS

Title: Expanded Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal receives commissioning cargo
Description: The 10.5 mtpa Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran, Germany has received its commissioning cargo since expanding operations with the deployment of a second floating storage regasification unit.
Author: JS

Title: Palau registry temporarily revokes registration of sanctioned LNG ships linked to Arctic LNG 2
Description: The Palau International Ship Registry has temporarily revoked the registrations of three Palau-flagged LNG ships Pioneer, Asya Energy and Everest Energy that have recently come under US sanctions for their support of Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project and their involvement in sanction-evading activities.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico Pacific signs 20-year LNG supply deal with Korea’s Posco for 0.7 mtpa
Description: Mexico Pacific, the developer of the 15 mtpa Saguaro Energia LNG project in Mexico, has signed a 20-year agreement to supply South Korean energy trading firm Posco International with 0.7 mtpa of LNG on a free-on-board basis.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada to start receiving gas, flaring this week
Description: The 14 mtpa LNG Canada plant in British Columbia is set to introduce gas this week for the first time shortly after receiving a refrigerant cargo ahead of its start-up operations.
Author: JS

Title: Golden Pass LNG requests a 3-year extension to construct facility by 2029
Description: Golden Pass LNG has filed a request with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, to extend its permit to complete the construction of the project in Texas due to scheduling uncertainties until 2029, signalling a longer delay to the facility’s start-up.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt is expected to buy 10-20 LNG cargoes for delivery in October-December
Description: Egypt is expected to continue importing LNG cargoes until December, after its re-entry into the spot market earlier this year broke a six-year import hiatus due to increased domestic gas consumption, lower gas production and an intense heatwave.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom plans to expand annual pipeline gas supplies to China to 48 Bcm
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom said that it plans to expand pipeline natural gas supplies to China in 2027 with the commissioning of the Far Eastern pipeline route.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker arrives at Murmansk transshipment terminal
Description: Everest Energy, one of the LNG ships which covertly loaded cargo from Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project on the Gydan Peninsula, has arrived at the Murmansk LNG transshipment terminal and might be readying for a ship-to-ship LNG transfer as the cargo continues its search for buyers.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey’s Botas signs 10-year LNG supply deal with Shell; deliveries start in 2027
Description: Turkey’s oil and gas distributor and trader Botas has signed a long-term agreement to buy up to about 4 billion m3 of gas a year from Shell’s US and global portfolio, with deliveries starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz seeks five LNG cargoes for delivery to Alexandroupolis from October to February 2025
Description: Bulgarian natural gas distributor Bulgargaz is seeking five LNG cargoes through three tenders for delivery to the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit-based LNG import terminal in Greece up to February 2025. It seeks a delivery in early October for its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker transfers Arctic LNG 2 cargo to Saam FSU
Description: Russia has achieved an LNG-sanctions-flouting trifecta in one fell swoop, with the recently sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker discharging its cargo from the sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 cargo through a ship-to-ship transfer to the 354,000 m3 Saam floating storage unit near Murmansk. This marks the first transhipment activity for the also-sanctioned Saam and the start of its involvement in Russia’s dark fleet activity.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Alliance signs initial deal to supply Oman’s OQ Trading from Amigo LNG in Mexico
Description: Singapore-based LNG project developer LNG Alliance has signed an initial agreement to supply LNG from its proposed 7.8 mtpa Amigo LNG facility in Sonora, Mexico, to the trading arm of Oman’s state-owned energy trading firm, OQ Trading.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Huaying LNG terminal to receive commissioning cargo in early September
Description: China’s new 6 mtpa 6 mtpa Huaying LNG terminal in China’s southern province of Guangdong is scheduled to receive its first LNG cargo in early September, with it expected to kick off the start of commissioning operations at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: LNG commissioning cargo yet to unload at Plaquemines; FERC seeks more information from Venture Global
Description: The 174,000 m3 Qogir LNG tanker, carrying the first LNG cargo to commission the 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, continues to wait to discharge its cargo a week after its arrival as project developer Venture Global has yet to satisfy the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's requirements.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Regas’ energy terminal in Mukran commences regular operations
Description: The Deutsche Regas-operated Deutsche Ostsee energy terminal in Germany’s port of Mukran in the Baltic Sea has begun regular operations, following the concurrent delivery of an LNG cargo to the terminal’s two interconnected floating storage regasification units last week.
Author: CK

Title: Pioneer and New Energy LNG tankers seen performing STS transfer near Port Said
Description: The sanctioned 138,000 m3 Pioneer LNG tanker which discreetly loaded the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2’s first cargo last month is still seen performing a ship-to-ship LNG transfer off the coast of Egypt in the Mediterranean Sea.
Author: JS

Title: NFE’s Altamira FLNG receives authorisation to export LNG to non-FTA countries
Description: New Fortress Energy, or NFE, has received a five-year authorisation from the US Department of Energy to export up to 1.4 mtpa of LNG from Altamira Fast LNG to countries with which the US does not have a Free Trade Agreement.
Author: JS

Title: British Sponsor looks poised to deliver LNG cooldown cargo for Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: The BP-operated 173,400 m3 British Sponsor LNG tanker idling off the coast of Senegal and Mauritania appears poised to deliver an LNG cooldown cargo to the yet-to-start BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility.
Author: CK

Title: Santos inks three-year LNG supply deal with Glencore for 0.5 mtpa
Description: Australia’s Santos has signed a three-year agreement to supply Glencore Singapore with 0.5 mtpa of LNG on a delivered ex-ship basis.
Author: JS

Title: First Gen is seeking one October LNG cargo via tender
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen is looking to buy one LNG cargo for delivery to its 5 mtpa Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon, via the firm’s fourth purchase tender this year and seventh since its commissioning cargo in July. The tender closes on Sep. 16.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctioned Asya Energy LNG tanker heads to Murmansk transshipment terminal
Description: Sanctioned and de-registered LNG tanker Asya Energy, which was the second vessel to discreetly load cargo at the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in the Gydan Peninsula, is heading to the Murmansk transshipment terminal shortly after its sister vessel Everest Energy unloaded there over the weekend.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports rise in August on recovery in Freeport shipments
Description: The US saw a month-on-month recovery in its LNG exports in August after the return to full operations at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas which boosted overall export volumes.
Author: JS

Title: Squadron Energy’s Port Kembla LNG terminal construction nears completion
Description: Australian energy company Squadron Energy said that it has nearly finished the construction of its Port Kembla LNG import terminal, which is expected to alleviate the looming gas supply crisis in Australia’s eastern and south-eastern states.
Author: JS

Title: BW LNG bags FSU conversion order for new onshore LNG terminal in Jordan
Description: Norway-headquartered floating LNG solution player BW LNG has signed a 10-year charter agreement with Jordan’s state-owned National Electric Power Company (NEPCO) for a floating storage unit to be deployed at Aqaba’s proposed new onshore LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: US introduces sanctions on two more Arctic LNG 2 linked tankers
Description: The U.S. has dealt an additional blow to the Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia’s Gydan Peninsula. Its latest round of sanctions targets two more LNG shippers and their LNG tankers, days after sanctioning the initial seven LNG carriers believed to be part of a Russian dark fleet.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s EGPC seeks 20 LNG cargoes for Q4 delivery
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation, or EGPC, has issued a tender to buy 20 LNG cargoes for delivery between October and December. The tender closes on Sep. 12.
Author: JS

Title: Everest Energy returns to Arctic LNG 2 for a second cargo loading
Description: Everest Energy, an LNG tanker which loaded the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant’s third cargo by concealing its actual position, has reached the facility once more without using discretion tactics this time.
Author: JS

Title: China’s Huaying LNG terminal receives commissioning cargo
Description: China’s new 6 mtpa Chaozhou Huaying LNG terminal in China’s southern province of Guangdong has received its first LNG cargo over the weekend, which is set to kick off the start of commissioning operations at the state-owned Sinopec-operated terminal.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC pens HoA with IndianOil for LNG supplies from Ruwais project
Description: ADNOC has signed a heads of agreement with IndianOil Corporation, or IOC, for the supply of 1 mtpa of LNG for a period of 15 years primarily sourced from ADNOC’s proposed 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in Al Ruwais.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker speeds eastwards via Northern Sea Route
Description: Everest Energy, an LNG tanker sanctioned by the US, was identified traversing the North Sea Route after loading its second cargo at the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant without concealing its position.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG prepares for tropical storm landfall later this week
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas said it is making “preparations” ahead of an expected tropical storm, which is expected to hit the Texas and Louisiana coasts later this week.
Author: JS

Title: Nigerian regulator greenlights construction of UTM Offshore’s FLNG plant
Description: The Nigerian Midstream and Downstream Petroleum Regulatory Authority, or NMDPRA, has issued a license to Nigerian independent UTM Offshore to construct Nigeria’s first floating LNG plant.
Author: JS

Title: Outlook brightens for Vasilikos LNG as ETYFA announces tender to complete terminal
Description: Cyprus’ Natural Gas Infrastructure Company, or ETYFA, has issued a tender for the provision of management services to complete the delayed Vasilikos LNG import terminal project, months after the contractor exited the project over a dispute.
Author: JS

Title: Novatek denies creating a shadow fleet, loading cargoes from Arctic LNG 2
Description: Russian independent energy company Novatek has denied creating a shadow LNG fleet and exporting LNG from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in which it holds a 60% stake.
Author: JS

Title: EU LNG imports flat in August as demand remains lukewarm
Description: August imports of LNG into Europe remained flat on July levels, when intakes reached their lowest since September 2021, as demand remains subdued and gas storage has hit its refill target.
Author: JS

Title: QatarEnergy continues fleet expansion with fresh order of six LNG carriers
Description: QatarEnergy has ordered an additional six newbuild LNG carriers from China’s state-owned shipbuilder Hudong-Zhonghua, bringing the total of vessels ordered from the shipbuilder to 24.
Author: JS

Title: Summit LNG terminal restarts operations three months after repair-related shutdown
Description: Bangladesh's 3.8 mtpa Summit LNG import terminal is ready to receive cargo as it resumes operations after being offline since late May after cyclone Remal damaged FSRU hull.
Author: JS

Title: Feed gas to Cameron, Calcasieu Pass LNG plants lower ahead of Hurricane Francine landfall
Description: Feed gas levels flowing to the 13.5 mtpa Cameron LNG and the 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plants in Louisiana declined today as the LNG industry braces for Hurricane Francine’s landfall later today.
Author: JS

Title: New Russian dark fleet vessel seen approaching Murmansk STS terminal
Description: A ballast LNG tanker believed to be part of Russia’s LNG dark fleet is seen waiting not far from the Murmansk transshipment terminal, which is believed to store two cargoes from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant offloaded there last month by two other dark fleet carriers.
Author: JS

Title: Oman LNG seals supply agreement with trading arm of Thailand’s PPT
Description: PTT International Trading signed a long-term LNG purchase agreement with Oman LNG for an undisclosed amount with a contract period between 2025 and 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Texas LNG secures key offtake agreement
Description: Texas LNG, a subsidiary of energy company Glenfarne Energy developing the 4 mtpa LNG export facility in Brownsville, announced a heads of agreement with an unnamed “highly experienced, investment-grade, global LNG player” for long-term LNG supply, which it said makes it sufficient to make a final investment decision.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada project 95% complete, on track for start-up by mid-2025
Description: The Shell-operated 14 mtpa LNG Canada export plant in British Columbia is now more than 95% complete, and the project is on track to start exports of the first cargoes by the middle of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt fully awards tender for 20 LNG cargoes for Q4
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation, or EGPC, closed its largest LNG tender yesterday, awarding its requirements in full for delivery of 20 cargoes between October and December to at least eight companies.
Author: JS

Title: Asya Energy loads its second cargo at Arctic LNG 2
Description: Asya Energy, an LNG tanker that was the second vessel to conceal its actual position to load the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant’s second cargo, has loaded at the facility once more without using Automatic Identification Signal, or AIS, signal spoofing tactics.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT signs five-year LNG term deals with Brunei, Oman, reflecting continued strong demand
Description: The trading arm of Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT, PTT International Trading, has signed a five-year agreement to buy LNG from Brunei LNG, marking the first supply and purchase deal between the two firms.
Author: CK

Title: Asya Energy takes the Northern Sea Route after loading at Arctic LNG 2
Description: The sanctioned 137,200 m3 Asya Energy LNG tanker, laden with the fifth LNG cargo from Russia’s also-sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant, has entered the waters of the Northern Sea Route, suggesting that the Saam storage facility at Murmansk is full and that the project is looking to use its so-far unused storage facility at Kamchatka.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global signs 1 mtpa LNG capacity deal with Greece’s Gastrade at Alexandroupolis
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has secured 1 mtpa of LNG regasification capacity over five years at the yet-to-start Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG terminal in Greece from 2025, enabling the firm to supply markets in Central and Eastern Europe with LNG from its terminals in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside inks long-term LNG SPA with JERA for 0.4 mtpa
Description: Australia’s Woodside Energy has signed a 10-year deal to supply Japan’s JERA with 0.4 mtpa of LNG, commencing in April 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside sets eyes on 2028 completion for Driftwood LNG
Description: Woodside is determined to complete the 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG export project that it acquired in July by 2028, CEO Meg O’Neill said at the firm’s press conference held at the Gastech conference in Houston.
Author: JS

Title: Golar LNG takes FID on new FLNG conversion, completion expected in Q4 2027
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG has taken a final investment decision, or FID, on a 3.5 mtpa MK II floating LNG unit conversion and signed an EPC contract with China’s CIMC Raffles shipyard.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche Ostsee’s Mukran terminal completes its first LNG reload
Description: The Deutsche Regas-operated Deutsche Ostee LNG import terminal in Germany’s industrial port of Mukran in the Baltic Sea has completed its first LNG reload operation, signalling an opportunity for neighbouring countries to participate in the supply from the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: MidOcean to acquire 15% interest in Peru LNG from Hunt Oil, raising its stake to 35%
Description: MidOcean Energy has agreed to buy a 15% stake in Peru LNG from Hunt Oil, increasing its existing stake to 35% from 20%. Hunt’s interest in Peru LNG will decrease to 35% from 50%, but the firm will remain Peru LNG’s operator following the transaction.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two more October LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT has issued a tender to buy two additional LNG cargoes for delivery in October, after buying one October cargo in August and awarding a tender that closed yesterday for its first November spot cargo. The tender closes on Sep. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Stade LNG terminal start-up expected in November, but further delay to 2025 possible
Description: The Stade LNG import terminal, hosting the 174,000 m3 Energos Force floating storage regasification unit, is expected to start up at the end of November after several rounds of delays, with possible slippage into January.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey’s BOTAS and TotalEnergies ink 10-year LNG supply agreement
Description: Turkey’s oil and gas distributor and trader Botas has signed a long-term agreement to buy 1.6 billion m3 of LNG from France’s TotalEnergies for a period of 10 years commencing in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s LNG stock levels dip again below the five-year average for September
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities dipped by about 10% from levels a week earlier to below their five-year average, reflecting strong gas consumption amid continued hotter weather in the country.
Author: CK

Title: Everest Energy LNG tanker idles outside Kamchatka, looks set to unload Arctic LNG 2 cargo
Description: The sanctioned 138,028 m3 Everest Energy LNG tanker carrying the fourth cargo from Russia’s also-sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant in the Gydan Peninsula is idling close to the Kamchatka LNG transhipment terminal, where it is expected to discharge its cargo.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Senton Energy signs four-year deal with Sinopec Fuel Oil for 0.57 mt of LNG
Description: Shenzhen Stock Exchange-listed LNG distributor Senton Energy has signed an agreement to buy 0.57 mt of LNG from Sinopec Fuel Oil over a four-year period, starting next year.
Author: CK

Title: China’s LNG buyers pause after recent buying; eye another price dip to continue winter restock
Description: Chinese buyers have hit the pause button on spot LNG purchases as prices have edged higher this week.
Author: CK

Title: Glencore signs 20-year deals with Commonwealth LNG, Kimmeridge
Description: Commodities trader Glencore has signed a non-binding heads of agreement to purchase 2 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 9.3 mtpa Commonwealth LNG plant in Louisiana and the same amount in natural gas supply from gas producer Kimmeridge Texas Gas, or FTG, for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies signs 5-year LNG deal extension with CNOOC for 1.25 mtpa
Description: TotalEnergies has announced a five-year extension of its existing sales and purchase agreement with China’s CNOOC, for the delivery of 1.25 mtpa of LNG to China until 2034.
Author: JS

Title: Uniper to buy 10 Bcm of pipeline gas from ConocoPhillips for 10 years
Description: German state-owned utility Uniper signed an agreement with US-based energy producer ConocoPhillips on the supply of up 10 billion m3 of natural gas via pipeline for a period of 10 years.
Author: JS

Title: Lake Charles picks a KBR, Technip Energies joint venture as EPC contractor
Description: Lake Charles LNG Export Company, a subsidiary of US midstream player Energy Transfer, has selected a joint venture of US KBR and French Technip Energies to act as the engineering contractor for its proposed 16.5 mtpa export project.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh’s Summit LNG receives its first LNG ship after months-long maintenance
Description: The Summit Group’s 3.8 mtpa Summit floating storage regasification unit-based LNG import terminal offshore Moheskhali Island in Bangladesh has received its first LNG ship following its return to operation on Sep. 11 after nearly four months of maintenance.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s first two LNG ships arrive at Calcasieu Pass; Venture Gator ships its first cargo
Description: The first of Venture Global’s nine new LNG ships, the 174,000 m3 Venture Gator, has shipped its first cargo from the firm’s 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana, while the second ship in the new fleet is currently berthed and undergoing loading at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Negotiations between Azerbaijan, Ukraine on gas transit deal still ongoing, sources say
Description: Sources with knowledge of the matter told Kpler that the reports that Azerbaijan and Ukraine have reached a deal on the Azeri gas transit via Ukraine to Europe are untrue as negotiations between the countries are still ongoing.
Author: JS

Title: Qogir stays berthed at Plaquemines; unloading of LNG cooldown cargo underway
Description: The 174,000 m3 Qogir LNG tanker is currently berthed at Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG export facility where it is unloading a commissioning cargo, almost a month after its arrival.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned Everest Energy ship undergoes STS transfer of Arctic LNG 2 cargo at Kamchatka
Description: The sanctioned 138,028 m3 Everest Energy LNG tanker has positioned itself alongside the 354,000m3 Koryak floating storage unit at Kamchatka to undergo a ship-to-ship transfer of its Arctic LNG 2 cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned Mulan is fourth ship to arrive at Arctic LNG 2; plant's sixth cargo to be loaded
Description: The recently sanctioned 79,800 m3 Mulan LNG tanker has arrived at Russia’s also-sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant, making it the fourth ship to call at the terminal since it began exports on Aug. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Qatar, Czech Republic eye energy cooperation during Doha meeting
Description: Qatar’s Minister of State for Energy Affairs, Saad Sherida Al-Kaabi, met with the Czech Republic’s Minister of Industry and Trade, Jozef Sikela, in Doha today to discuss energy relations and enhance their cooperation in this area.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG yet to receive cooldown cargo; British Sponsor still idling
Description: The yet-to-start BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility has not received its cooldown LNG cargo as the laden 173,400 m3 British Sponsor LNG tanker widely expected to deliver that cargo continues to idle off the maritime border between Mauritania and Senegal in the Northeast Atlantic Ocean.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria’s NNPC begins talks to revive Brass and Olokola LNG projects
Description: State-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Company, or NNPC, has begun discussions to revive the cancelled Brass and Olokola LNG projects in an effort to maximise the country’s gas resources and deliver economic benefits.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s second LNG ship leaves Calcasieu Pass laden and bound for Germany
Description: The 174,000 m3 Venture Bayou, the second ship in US LNG exporter Venture Global’s new fleet of nine LNG carriers to start operations, has left the 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant after loading a cargo and set sail for Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Princess returns to Altamira FLNG; first full loading eyed
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Princess LNG tanker has returned to New Fortress Energy’s 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG terminal in Mexico possibly to ship the terminal’s first full LNG cargo after lifting its first partial cargo on Aug. 10.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate Energy, PetroVietnam sign deal to study FSRU deployment for imports to Vietnam
Description: US-based floating LNG solution player Excelerate Energy and PetroVietnam Technical Services Corporation have signed a strategic partnership deal to jointly study floating storage regasification unit-based technical solutions for LNG imports into Vietnam.
Author: JS

Title: Pan American Energy to target Asia, Brazil for LNG cargoes, looks for additional partners
Description: Argentina’s Pan American Energy will target the Brazilian and Asian markets with LNG cargoes from its floating LNG plant slated to begin operations in 2027 and expects to compete with the US in the Atlantic Basin due to its location.
Author: JS

Title: More flexibility in long-term LNG deals 'desirable': Pakistan LNG
Description: State-owned Pakistan LNG (PLL) said that it would prefer more flexibility in its long-term LNG offtake contracts due to uneven demand throughout the year.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies inks 7-year LNG deal with Hyundai Chemical for 0.2 mtpa
Description: TotalEnergies has signed a heads of agreement to supply 0.2 mtpa of LNG annually to HD Hyundai Chemical for a period of seven years, starting in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: First commercial LNG cargo for Alexandroupolis is scheduled to arrive on Oct 3-4
Description: The Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupoulis floating LNG import terminal in Greece is scheduled to receive its first commercial LNG cargo on Oct. 3-4, following the confirmed start of commercial operations on Oct. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG to wrap-up debottlenecking project by year-end
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas expects to complete the debottlenecking project, which will lift the facility’s capacity to 16.5 mtpa, by the end of this year, which is a delay from the previously expected mid-year completion.
Author: JS

Title: Technip Energies, JGC awarded FEED contract for Rovuma LNG in Mozambique
Description: ExxonMobil has contracted France’s Technip Energies and Japan’s JGC Corporation to complete the Front-End Engineering Design studies for its 18 mtpa Rovuma LNG project in Mozambique.
Author: JS

Title: PVGas issues first LNG purchase tender since April
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one cargo into its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tai province. The tender closes on Sep. 27.
Author: JS

Title: Ichthys LNG exports slump further in September on repairs on Train 2, lower output from Train 1
Description: Exports from the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory have continued to fall sharply in September amid ongoing repairs at the plant’s second train due to issues with its heat exchanger and reduced production at its first train.
Author: CK

Title: Laden Pioneer LNG tanker enters Suez Canal, headed southward
Description: Kpler's data science team confirmed on satellite image that the sanctioned 138,000 m3 Pioneer LNG tanker entered the Suez Canal yesterday, travelling southbound, around a month after completing an alleged ship-to-ship transfer with the 150,000 m3 New Energy LNG tanker.
Author: JS

Title: UK slaps sanctions on five ships linked to Arctic LNG 2
Description: The UK has slapped sanctions on five LNG tankers and two associated entities involved in the shipping of LNG from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG plant in Russia, tightening the ring of sanctions on the project.
Author: JS

Title: Vasant 1 FSRU still disconnected from Turkey’s Saros LNG terminal; sale to Botas approved
Description: Shareholders of India’s Swan Energy recently voted to approve the sale of its 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage regasification unit to Turkey’s state-owned energy firm Botas, suggesting that the FSRU could soon be reinstalled at the Botas-operated Saros LNG terminal after idling in Saros Bay for months.
Author: CK

Title: Harbour Energy issues its first LNG tender, offers one Snohvit cargo
Description: London-based oil and gas firm Harbour Energy has issued its first LNG tender and is offering one cargo that will load at the Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Norway’s  Melkoya Island from Nov. 15-18. The tender closes on Oct. 3.
Author: CK

Title: Russian dark fleet vessel moors at Saam FSU
Description: The sanctioned 150,000 m3 Nova Energy LNG tanker, which recently changed its name from New Energy, has moored at the Murmansk transshipment terminal about three weeks after another dark fleet vessel discharged cargo from the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: Seapeak Magellan to deliver Alexandroupolis’ first commercial LNG cargo
Description: The 165,500 m3 Seapeak Magellan LNG tanker is poised to deliver the first commercial cargo to Greece’s 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG receiving terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Mitsubishi boosts stake in Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG plant
Description: Japanese trading house Mitsubishi Corp to expand its ownership in the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG plant in Malaysia by acquiring 10% stakes in the Dua and Tiga units of the plant.
Author: JS

Title: Chhara LNG terminal commissioning date could slip as it awaits fender equipment arrival
Description: State-owned Hindustan Petroleum Corp.’s plan to commission its 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in November-December could slip to early next year if its order for equipment to replace fenders damaged earlier this year doesn’t arrive on time, according to sources close to the firm.
Author: CK

Title: Northern Sea Route transit for non-ice class ships to close on Oct. 15 due to early ice onset
Description: The early onset of ice formation has prompted the Northern Sea Route General Administration to close the summer-autumn eastbound passage through the Northern Sea Route earlier than expected for non-ice-class ships on Oct. 15 and ice-class ships between Oct. 20 and 31.
Author: CK

Title: Van Oord completes jetty for second FSRU at Wilhelmshaven
Description: Netherlands-based maritime contractor Van Oord has wrapped up the construction of the LNG jetty, which will accommodate the second floating storage regasification unit at the Wilhelmshaven terminal LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Princess set to leave Altamira FLNG after loading the first full cargo
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Princess LNG tanker is expected to leave New Fortress Energy’s 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG terminal in Mexico sometime later today after it completes the loading of the terminal’s first full LNG cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG undergoes ship-to-ship LNG transfer with British Sponsor
Description: The 126,277 m3 Gimi floating LNG unit at the yet-to-start 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project on the maritime border of Senegal and Mauritania is undergoing a ship-to-ship transfer of LNG with the 173,400 m3 British Sponsor LNG tanker, with the LNG expected to be used to commission the floating’s plant’s tanks and other facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt receives six LNG cargoes at Ain Sukhna, one at Aqaba in September
Description: Egypt has imported seven LNG cargoes this month, with six of these cargoes received at its 5.7 mtpa Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal in the Gulf of Suez and one at Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG receiving terminal on the Red Sea coast. These cargoes lift its total LNG receipts at the two terminals to 25 for the third quarter of this year and 30 since its re-entry into the market as an LNG buyer in April after a six-year absence.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Princess to deliver Altamira FLNG’s first full LNG cargo to Europe
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Princess LNG tanker has loaded the first full LNG cargo from the 2.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG project in Mexico and will deliver it to Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Golar LNG issues notice to proceed to Black & Veatch, CIMC Raffles on new FLNG conversion
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG has issued a full notice to proceed for its MK II floating LNG conversion project to engineering firm Black & Veatch working as a sub-contractor to Yantai CIMC Offshore shipyard.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports stay flat in September versus August, shrugging off planned maintenance
Description: US LNG exports held steady in September against August but rose against year-earlier levels despite a precautionary halt in feed gas flows to a few plants ahead of Hurricane Francine’s landfall early in the month and scheduled maintenance at a few others.
Author: CK

Title: Switzerland’s MET Group partners Celsius to build one LNG ship for delivery in 2027
Description: Switzerland-based energy trader MET Group has signed a partnership deal with LNG shipowner and operator Celsius to build the Group’s first LNG vessel, with its delivery scheduled for 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Gastrade begins commercial operations of Alexandroupolis LNG
Description: Gastrade has started commercial operations of the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG terminal, Greece’s second LNG import facility, which is expected to boost the energy security of Southeast and South Europe.
Author: JS

Title: Toscana LNG’s FSRU completes seven-month maintenance, to receive cargo in late-November
Description: Italy’s terminal operator OLT Offshore LNG Toscana expects its 2.8 mtpa Toscana LNG terminal to resume operations and receive the first LNG cargo in late November following the completion of seven months of planned maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Nova Energy approaches Arctic LNG 2 for a possible seventh cargo lift from the sanctioned project
Description: The 150,000 m3 Nova Energy has entered the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 port area and is possibly readying for another cargo lift from the sanctioned facility, as two other dark fleet vessels laden with LNG from the project are headed toward Asia.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global gets FERC OK to reintroduce hazardous fluids into Calcasieu Pass LNG
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has received authorization from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluids into one of the heat recovery steam generators at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant, indicating that the plant may be progressing towards the start of commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: Santos signs deal to supply 0.5 mtpa of LNG to TotalEnergies from fourth-quarter 2025
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos has agreed to supply TotalEnergies Gas and Power Asia with 0.5 mtpa of LNG over a period of three years plus one quarter starting in the fourth quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport, Cheniere LNG terminals unaffected by US dockworkers’ strike
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant and the Cheniere-operated 30 mtpa Sabine Pass and 15 mtpa Corpus Christi LNG terminals in the US have not been impacted by the strike undertaken by dockworkers at ports on the East and Gulf coasts of the US.
Author: CK

Title: Seapeak Magellan arrives close to Alexandroupolis for first LNG commercial cargo delivery
Description: The 165,500 m3 Seapeak Magellan LNG tanker has arrived close to the Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit-based LNG import terminal in the Thracian Sea and is poised to deliver the facility’s first LNG commercial cargo after it began commercial operations on Oct. 1.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies is working on “last piece” to restart Mozambique LNG by the end of this year
Description: TotalEnergies plans to bring the planned 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG project online in 2029, with this hingeing on it finalizing the project financing by the end of this year, Chairman and Chief Executive Patrick Pouyanne said during an investor briefing in New York yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports slip further in September to three-year low as demand slump continues
Description: European LNG imports in September have slipped to their lowest this year and were at their lowest since November 2021, as demand on the continent continues lacking.
Author: JS

Title: Arctic LNG 2 helps lift Russian LNG exports in January-September
Description: Russian LNG exports in the first nine months of 2024 increased compared with last year, driven by the addition of exports from a new Russian LNG plant, Arctic LNG 2.
Author: JS

Title: Nova Energy loads Arctic LNG 2’s seventh cargo
Description: The 150,000 m3 Nova Energy has loaded a cargo from the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant, becoming the seventh cargo lift from the plant since August.
Author: JS

Title: Asian buyers eye recent deals to support lower price targets for long-term LNG supply
Description: Asian buyers are increasingly looking to recent contracts as benchmarks to support their price targets for long-term LNG supplies, aiming for prices below 12% of Brent crude for supplies starting from  2027.
Author: CK

Title: IEA warns of fragile global gas demand and supply balance, sees clear risks of future volatility
Description: The International Energy Agency sees global gas demand rising by more than 2.5% in 2024, mainly driven by fast-growing Asian markets and supported by a rebound in European industrial demand. But, it warned of a fragile gas demand-supply balance with “clear risks” of future volatility.
Author: CK

Title: Snam extends Ravenna FSRU start-up timeline to first half of 2025
Description: Italian gas utility Snam said it expects to commission the 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal in the country’s northeastern Emilia-Romagna region in the first half of 2025, which is an extended timeline from the previously expected start-up in first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron delays Leviathan field expansion on escalating security situation
Description: Partners in the 12 billion m3/year Leviathan gas field offshore Israel has paused the pipelay work to expand the field’s production due to an escalating security situation.
Author: JS

Title: The sanctioned Everest Energy loads Arctic LNG 2’s eighth cargo; loading pace picking up
Description: The sanctioned 138,028 m3 Everest Energy LNG tanker is docked at the also-sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia’s Gydan Peninsula, loading the project’s eighth cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Japan takes more US LNG in September, lifting LNG imports to their highest level this year
Description: Japan received more LNG in September, thanks to a significant increase in US deliveries, which pushed the country’s LNG imports to their highest level this year.
Author: CK

Title: Sinopec seeks to initiate price review for APLNG supply contract: Origin
Description: China’s state-owned Sinopec is seeking a price review of its 7.6 mtpa offtake contract from the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG project in Queensland and has notified the project’s upstream operator Origin Energy.
Author: CK

Title: Eni and Japan's Jogmec sign initial deal to boost LNG supplies, ensure energy security
Description: Italy’s Eni has signed an initial agreement with the Japan Organization for Metals and Energy Security, or Jogmec, to collaborate on ensuring energy supply security by boosting LNG supplies and supply sources.
Author: CK

Title: Summit LNG urges Bangladesh government to reverse decision to terminate third FSRU project
Description: Summit LNG Terminal II, a unit of Summit Group, has urged the government of Bangladesh to reverse its decision to terminate the project to bring a third floating storage regasification unit to the country.
Author: JS

Title: Elba Island LNG activates hurricane response plans but expects no impact from Hurricane Milton
Description: The Kinder Morgan-operated 2.5 mtpa Elba Island LNG terminal near Savannah in Georgia, is making safety preparations ahead of Hurricane Milton’s anticipated landfall in Florida tomorrow, although it does not expect its operations to be impacted.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s  September LNG imports rise on-month on higher Southeast Asian receipts
Description: Thailand’s LNG imports rose slightly in September compared to August as the country took more LNG from its Southeast Asian neighbours. But, its receipts were steady compared to a year earlier.
Author: CK

Title: Brazilian LNG imports in September surge on reduced hydro generation
Description: September imports of LNG into Brazil surged as reduced power generation from hydro increased the need for more natural gas imports.
Author: JS

Title: Eni, Avenir LNG sign a multi-year charter deal for the Avenir Aspiration LNG bunker vessel
Description: Italy’s Eni has signed a multi-year agreement with LNG bunkering vessel provider Avenir LNG to charter its 7,500 m3 Avenir Aspiration LNG bunker vessel from 2025, supporting its expansion into the LNG bunkering market.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside completes acquisition of Tellurian, Driftwood LNG
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has completed the acquisition of US project developer Tellurian and its proposed 27.6 mtpa Driftwood LNG project in Louisiana almost three months after announcing a definitive agreement to purchase all the shares in Tellurian and Driftwood in an all-cash deal for $900 million,
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Kansai Electric signs four-year contract with Oman LNG for 0.4 mtpa of LNG
Description: Japanese utility Kansai Electric has agreed to buy 0.4 mtpa of LNG from Oman LNG over four years starting in 2026, marking the start of a new supply relationship between the two firms.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC Gas cancels Das Island LNG expansion to focus on other "exciting" opportunities
Description: The UAE’s state-owned ADNOC Gas has decided to cancel its plans to increase the capacity at its 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG project, choosing instead to deploy its capital to explore other opportunities especially with parent firm ADNOC already developing the planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in Abu Dhabi’s Al Ruwais industrial city.
Author: CK

Title: Europe to end winter with gas stocks 48% full: Kpler Insight
Description: Plentiful gas in storage in Europe is expected to act as a safety cushion to the potential end of the Russian gas transit via Ukraine, resulting in a slightly higher pull from stocks than last year in a scenario of a colder 2024-2025 winter than last year, Kpler Insight forecasts.
Author: JS

Title: Italy’s LNG regasification capacity to rise from first-quarter 2025 with Ravenna’s anticipated start
Description: Italy is expected to see a greater diversification in its LNG supplies when its LNG import capacity rises from the first quarter of next year, with the anticipated start of Snam’s planned 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Hungary’s MVM, Gazprom sign MoU on increasing Russian gas supplies
Description: Hungary’s state-owned power company MVM has signed an additional agreement with Russia's Gazprom for gas supply, allowing the firm to start negotiations on increasing Russian gas supplies to Hungary.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron expects no impact from strike affecting Wheatstone, Gorgon facilities
Description: Chevron expects zero impact from the strike action launched today by employees at industrial and maintenance services provider Altrad, servicing its 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plants in Western Australia.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy two November-December LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery in November and December to its Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s Hin Kong Power seeks one December LNG spot cargo
Description: Thailand’s private power producer Hin Kong Power has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on Dec. 4 to the Map Ta Phut 2 LNG terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Dec. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Scarborough Energy trunkline installation completed, supports Woodside’s 2026 target for first LNG cargo
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside Energy has completed the installation of a key 433-kilometre pipeline for its Scarborough Energy project, supporting the firm’s target of the first LNG cargo from the project in 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Kansai Electric to shut Mihama-3 nuclear reactor for inspection, could lift winter LNG demand
Description: Japanese power utility Kansai Electric plans to manually shut down the 826 MW third unit of its Mihama nuclear power plant in the Fukui prefecture for investigations after detecting salt deposits and a tiny hole in the main pipe of its primary water cooler.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global expects to ship first cargo from Plaquemines LNG before end of 2024
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global said it expects to ship its first LNG cargo from its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana before the end of 2024 as it continues to work towards starting commercial operations.
Author: JS

Title: Weekly exports from Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG plant dip suggesting possible ongoing output issues
Description: Exports from the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export plant in Sarawak, Malaysia, have dipped this week, suggesting that production issues may still be ongoing at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Four Russian dark fleet vessels loaded with Arctic LNG 2 cargo still out at sea
Description: A total of four Russian LNG dark fleet vessels, currently laden with volumes from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant, are seen traversing the sea without signalling a destination as the market continues to anticipate a potential delivery to an end-user.
Author: JS

Title: Cooldown-cargo-laden British Sponsor berths again at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: The 173,400 m3 BP-chartered British Sponsor LNG tanker has moored again next to the 126,277m3 Gimi floating LNG unit that serves the yet-to-start 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility on the maritime border of Mauritania and Senegal after pulling alongside Gimi on several previous occasions without discharging the LNG cooldown cargo it’s carrying.
Author: CK

Title: EGAS, Greece’s Copezoulos form LNG-focused JV
Description: Egyptian Natural Gas Holding, or EGAS, and Greek energy infrastructure firm Copelouzos Group have signed an agreement to establish a joint venture in Greece.
Author: JS

Title: Altamira FLNG’s first full LNG cargo to be delivered to Rotterdam’s Gate terminal
Description: The first full cargo from the New Fortress Energy-operated Altamira Fast LNG project in Mexico is poised to be delivered to the 9.9 mtpa Gate LNG receiving terminal in Rotterdam.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s B.Grimm seeks its third LNG spot cargo, delivery expected in mid-December
Description: Thailand’s private energy producer B.Grimm has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in mid-December to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in the country’s southern Rayong province, making it the third cargo the firm is seeking since making its debut as an LNG importer in December. The tender closes on Oct. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG to operate at full rate by mid-November when Train 1 restarts
Description: Operations at the Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Darwin, in Australia’s Northern Territory, are expected to reach their full rate by mid-November when production at the plant’s first train reaches its full capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Edison becomes latest firm to take Venture Global to court over Calcasieu Pass deliveries
Description: Italian utility Edison launched arbitration against LNG project developer Venture Global after it said it would start LNG contract cargo deliveries from its Louisiana-based 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in April 2025, or three years after shipping the first cargo from the project.
Author: JS

Title: Increase in LNG liquefaction capacity to outpace demand growth to 2030: IEA
Description: The increase in global liquefaction capacity is forecast to outpace projected demand by 2030, which will depress global gas prices and increase competition between suppliers, the International Energy Agency, or IEA, said in its annual World Energy Outlook report.
Author: JS

Title: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project takes a break from LNG loadings to load condensate
Description: Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in the Gydan Peninsula has taken a short break from loading LNG and is in the process of loading its second condensate cargo. However, based on the interval between loadings since last month, another LNG loading could occur soon.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Kansai Electric shuts down Mihama-3 nuclear unit, no restart date given
Description: Japan’s power utility Kansai Electric has shut down the 826 MW third unit of its Mihama nuclear plant in the Fukui prefecture as anticipated after finding a tiny hole in a pipe earlier this month. However, the firm has not provided a timeline for restarting the unit.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside’s Scarborough and Pluto Train 2 LNG project 73% completed at end-September
Description: Woodside Energy’s Scarborough Energy and Pluto Train 2 project reached 73% completion at the end of September, underpinning its unchanged target for the production of a first LNG cargo in 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Weekly LNG exports pick up from Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG plant
Description: Weekly LNG exports from Malaysia’s 29.3 mt Bintulu LNG plant have recovered and stabilised at levels that were last higher at the end of June, indicating that recent concerns about production issues at Trains 7 and 8  may be unfounded.
Author: CK

Title: UK sanctions four more Russian LNG tankers, developer of Ust-Luga LNG
Description: The UK government has released its latest package of sanctions on Russia, targeting four more LNG tankers believed to be part of Russia’s shadow fleet of vessels used to circumvent and RusGazDobycha, developing the 13 mtpa Ust-Luga LNG plant on the Baltic Sea coast.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global receives FERC green light to commission fourth liquefaction block
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, granted LNG developer Venture Global the authorisation to commission the liquefaction train system block 4 with nitrogen gas of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, which outs the firm one step closer to commissioning the project.
Author: JS

Title: Santos’ Barossa Gas project is over 82% complete, still on track for 3Q 2025 gas production
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos’ offshore Barossa Gas project that will provide backfill for the existing 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant is now over 82% complete and remains on track to begin gas production in the third quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Kansai Electric secures approval to operate Takahama-1 reactor beyond 50 years
Description: Japanese utility Kansai Electric has received government approval to operate its 826 MW Takahama-1 nuclear reactor beyond fifty years, making the 50-year-old unit the first to be granted such an extension.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt plans to install a second FSRU in 2025; Energos Eskimo eyed as likely candidate
Description: Egypt is set to install a second floating storage regasification unit early next year, signalling its continued robust demand for LNG imports amid declining gas production, a suspension in LNG exports and higher temperatures that have led to its return to the market after six years.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore LNG proceeds with plans for a 5 mtpa FSRU-based LNG import terminal
Description: LNG terminal operator Singapore LNG Corp., or SLNG, is proceeding with plans to develop a 5 mtpa floating storage regasification unit-based LNG import terminal at Singapore’s Jurong Port. This new terminal will supplement the existing 11 mtpa onshore SLNG terminal on Jurong Island and is aimed at meeting growing domestic gas demand and enhancing energy security.
Author: CK

Title: A second FSRU in Egypt won't lift LNG import capacity despite expected increase in imports
Description: The 160,000 m3 Energos Eskimo floating storage and regasification unit at Jordan’s sole 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG import terminal is widely expected to relocate to Egypt early next year when its charter contract concludes, enabling Egypt to receive LNG directly at its own terminals instead of also relying on Aqaba.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt seen issuing tender to buy 20 LNG cargoes for delivery in first-quarter 2025
Description: Egypt is expected to launch a tender to secure up to 20 cargoes for delivery between January and March next year, reflecting the country’s undiminished demand for LNG after resuming imports in April following a six-year break.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore to set up state-owned gas aggregator by end-March 2025
Description: Singapore expects to set up a fully state-owned gas aggregator by the end of the current fiscal year, which will safeguard Singapore’s energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s B.Grimm to seek short-term LNG strip in 2025-2026, long-term supplies from 2027-2028
Description: Thailand’s new LNG market entrant private power producer B. Grimm expects to buy five to seven LNG cargoes a year on a strip basis in 2025 and 2026, after buying its first three cargoes this year on a spot basis. The firm hopes to seek supplies on a long-term basis from 2027 or 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s state-owned gas buyer to begin procurement from 2026
Description: A new state-owned gas aggregator that Singapore plans to set up by the end of March next year is expected to begin gas procurement from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Summit Group hopeful decision to terminate Bangladesh FSRU import project will be overturned
Description: Bangladesh’s Summit Group is hopeful that a decision by state-owned energy firm Petrobangla to terminate a 4.5 mtpa floating storage regasification unit import project that its subsidiary Summit LNG was developing on Moheshkhali Island will be overturned.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips, SEFE agree 10-year natural gas supply deal
Description: US energy firm ConocoPhillips has agreed to supply Germany’s state-owned Securing Energy for Europe, or SEFE, with 9 billion m3 of gas over 10 years from its European supply portfolio. The gas is to be delivered to various hubs across Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore LNG inks deals with Jurong Port, MOL and Wood for second LNG terminal
Description: Terminal operator Singapore LNG Corp. has signed agreements with Singapore’s Jurong Port, engineering firm Wood and Japanese shipowner Mitsui- OSK Lines to develop its second LNG import terminal, which is slated to be operational by 2030.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P LNG acquires Outer Harbor LNG project developer Venice Energy
Description: Singapore-based downstream LNG infrastructure firm AG&P LNG has agreed to acquire Australian energy infrastructure firm Venice Energy, the developer of the proposed 2 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import terminal in Port Adelaide, South Australia, and is targeting to bring the project online in the first quarter of 2027. The value of the deal was not disclosed.
Author: CK

Title: US regulator grants Golden Pass LNG a three-year extension to complete construction
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has granted Golden Pass LNG’s request for a three-year extension to complete the construction of its 15.6 mtpa LNG export project in Sabine Pass, Texas, pushing its construction deadline to Nov. 30, 2029, and delaying the project’s start.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen’s BW Batangas FSRU leaves LNG terminal to idle after returning from repairs
Description: The 162,400 m3 BW Batangas floating storage regasification unit is currently idling off the west coast of the Philippines island of Mindoro days after returning to the First Gen-operated 5.3 mtpa LNG terminal in Batangas in the Philippines following repairs at the Subic Shipyard since mid-August.
Author: CK

Title: Cameron LNG receives less feed gas due to scheduled maintenance on Train 3
Description: Feed gas flows to the 13.5 mtpa Cameron LNG plant in Louisiana have dropped in recent days, reflecting a week-long scheduled maintenance at its third train this week, according to firms with offtake from the plant.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips agrees 10-year gas supply deal with EDF Trading
Description: US energy firm ConocoPhillips has signed a deal to supply natural gas over 10 years to EDF Trading.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks two more LNG cargoes for delivery in December
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two more LNG cargoes for delivery in December to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Oct. 29.
Author: CK

Title: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant has shut down: sources
Description: Novatek’s first 6.6 mtpa train at Russia’s Arctic LNG 2 plant shutdown on 11 October, according to sources.

Title: First Gen’s Batangas FSRU returns to berth following Tropical Storm Trami
Description: The 162,400 m³ BW Batangas floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) has returned to the First Gen-operated LNG import terminal in the Batangas province on Luzon island in the Philippines, after temporarily relocating to avoid Tropical Storm Trami's path while remaining idle at a safe distance.
Author: CK

Title: India’s LNG import capacity to rise by end-March 2025 with Dahej expansion, Chhara startup
Description: India's LNG import capacity is poised to rise by 21% to 57.5 mtpa by the end of March next year when the 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal is expected to begin operations, and the 5 mtpa expansion phase of the 17.5 mtpa Dahej LNG terminal is completed.
Author: CK

Title: India’s HPCL plans to secure a commissioning cargo soon for delivery in December, January
Description: India’s state-owned Hindustan Petroleum Corp. intends to secure an LNG cargo soon for delivery in December or January to commission its delayed 5 mtpa Chhara LNG regasification terminal in Gujarat which it hopes to start before the end of the current financial year and
Author: CK

Title: Arctic LNG 2’s shutdown seen as temporary; Train 1 to recover to full capacity post-winter
Description: Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant has suspended operations since Oct. 11 due to storage at its first liquefaction train reaching its maximum capacity. However, according to sources with knowledge of the matter, the shutdown is expected to last only for the duration of the winter season.
Author: CK

Title: Eni expects to restore production at Egypt's Zohr gas field early next year
Description: Italy's Eni anticipates restoring production at the giant Zohr gas field offshore Egypt early next year as declining output has coincided with rising domestic gas consumption, prompting the country to resume LNG imports this year.
Author: CK

Title: Altamira FLNG output reaches full capacity with its third shipment as commissioning continues
Description: The 1.4 mtpa New Fortress Energy-operated Altamira Fast LNG plant off the coast of Tamaulipas in Mexico has reached full production less than three months after shipping its first cargo in early August while still undergoing commissioning.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico’s Amigo LNG signs initial LNG supply deal with Sahara Group
Description: Amigo LNG, a unit of Singapore-based LNG project developer LNG Alliance, has signed a heads-of-agreement with energy and infrastructure firm Sahara Group to supply LNG from its proposed 7.8 mtpa export facility in Sonoro, Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: BP makes “good progress” on Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG's start-up
Description: BP said that has continued to make “good progress” on its 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project on the maritime border of Senegal and Mauritania, as the project start-up is still slated for the fourth quarter of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Malaysia’s Genting awards contracts for its floating LNG project in Indonesia’s West Papua
Description: Malaysia’s Genting Group has awarded a contract to Indonesia-based construction firm PT China Construction Yangtze River Indonesia for the construction, installation and commissioning of the midstream infrastructure for its 1.2 mtpa Genting floating LNG project to be developed in Indonesia’s West Papua province. The contract is valued at IDR 2.053 trillion (about $132.2 million).
Author: CK

Title: India’s BPCL eyes lifting of force majeure on Mozambique LNG in January-February
Description: India’s state-owned refiner Bharat Petroleum Corp. expects the force majeure declared on the 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG project to be lifted in January or February next year, allowing the project which has been in limbo due to the volatile security situation in the Cabo Delgado province to progress.
Author: CK

Title: Work underway to retire North West Shelf LNG’s Train 2 this quarter: Woodside
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has begun work to take offline the second of its five LNG trains at the 16.9 mtpa North West Shelf LNG plant in Western Australia during this quarter to manage costs and emissions amid declining production from its original gas fields.
Author: CK

Title: Vienna-headquartered MS Galleon Group seeks natural gas supply for three years, starting in 2026
Description: Vienna-headquartered international holding company MS Galleon Group is looking to procure its entire annual natural gas requirement for a three-year period starting from Jan. 1, 2026, until Dec. 31, 2028, and has issued a request for information on supply options.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor to acquire all of EQT’s non-working interest in North Marcellus gas assets in the US
Description: Norway’s state-owned energy firm Equinior has agreed to acquire all of the remaining non-operated interest in the US Northern Marcellus formation held by US natural gas producer EQT for $1.25 billion,  increasing its average working interest in the Northern Marcellus asset from 25.7% to 40.7% and strengthening its gas portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: UK’s Centrica signs gas deals with US’s Coterra for 10 years
Description: British utility Centrica and US gas producer Coterra Energy have signed two gas sales and purchase agreements, which will reduce market risk in Centrica's LNG portfolio.
Author: JS

Title: MOL considers sale of three Arc7 LNG vessels meant for Arctic LNG 2 amid sanctions
Description: Japanese shipping company Mitsui OSK Lines, or MOL, is seeking to sell three of the Arc7 ice-class LNG vessels built for the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant over the tightening ring of sanctions on the project.
Author: JS

Title: Corpus Christi Stage 3 project is 67.8% complete, first LNG by year-end: Cheniere
Description: Cheniere has maintained its expectation of the 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project’s start-up by the end of 2024. The project is now almost 68% complete.
Author: JS

Title: US hits Arctic LNG 2 with fresh shipping sanctions
Description: In its new sanctions round, the US State Department designated five more LNG carrier operators, believed to be operating several of Russia’s so-called “shadow fleet” vessels associated with the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: Coterra Energy and Vitol pen 11-year gas supply agreement
Description: US gas producer Coterra Energy and international energy trader Vitol have inked an 11-year sales and purchase agreement, whereby Coterra will supply Vitol with the equivalent of 0.7 mtpa of natural gas.
Author: JS

Title: Japan’s LNG imports slump in October after a three-month high in September
Description: Japan’s LNG receipts fell sharply in October after reaching a three-month high in September as a slight easing in temperatures probably led the country’s utility firms to rely more on their contracted long-term supplies to meet demand.
Author: CK

Title: VTTI aims for Zeeland Energy Terminal FID in first-half 2027, startup in second-half 2028
Description: Netherlands-based energy storage provider VTTI aims to make a final investment decision on its Zeeland Energy Terminal project in the port of Vlissingen in the Netherlands’ southwestern province of Zeeland in the first half of 2027, with commercial operations expected to begin in the second half of 2028. If approved, the proposed terminal would be the country’s third LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Shell maintains expectation of first LNG cargo from LNG Canada by mid-2025
Description: Shell still expects to ship first LNG cargo from the 14 mtpa LNG Canada export project in British Columbia by the middle of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies reaffirms expectation for next LNG supply wave starting in 2027
Description: TotalEnergies continues to anticipate that the next wave of LNG supplies will commence in 2027, or potentially in the second half of 2026, due to various project delays.
Author: CK

Title: Mozambique LNG project on 'right track' as G7 funding approvals awaited: TotalEnergies
Description: TotalEnergies is awaiting funding approval from credit agencies in the Group of Seven industrialized nations as one of several key steps before restarting its stalled 13.1 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Afungi in northern Mozambique’s Cabo Delgado province. The firm maintains that the project is on the right track.
Author: CK

Title: First LNG from Greater Tortue Ahmeyim at the end of Q4 2024: Kosmos Energy
Description: US upstream firm Kosmos Energy, which, together with BP, is developing the 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG export plant offshore Senegal and Mauritania, said that the project’s first LNG is expected around the end of the fourth quarter of 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Market participants cautious of "breakthrough" on Ukrainian gas transit extension talks with Azerbaijan
Description: As the trilateral natural gas transit deal between the EU, Ukraine and Russia nears expiry, the markets kept second guessing whether an alternative deal to transit Azerbaijani gas via Ukraine is indeed nearing completion.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks third December LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT is seeking a third LNG cargo for December, with delivery targeted for Dec. 10-11 to its Map Ta Phut terminal in Rayong.
Author: CK

Title: First LNG from Golden Pass expected in late 2025, could slip into early 2026: ExxonMobil
Description: ExxonMobil, a partner in the Golden Pass LNG project, anticipates the first LNG production from the 18 mtpa LNG export facility in Sabine Pass, Texas, by late 2025, although the timeline could slip into early 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Tohoku Electric shuts down Onagawa-2 reactor for inspection days after restart
Description: Japanese utility Tohoku Electric has taken its 825 MW Onagawa-2 nuclear reactor in Miyagi prefecture offline for inspection, just days after its restart following a 13-year shutdown.
Author: CK

Title: Sinopec agrees to buy 2 mtpa of LNG from TotalEnergies for 15 years
Description: China's state-owned Sinopec Corp has signed a heads of agreement to buy 2 mtpa of LNG from TotalEnergies for a period of 15 years, commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports climb to their second-highest level in October
Description: US LNG exports reached their second-highest level of the year in October, despite a slight decline from the same period last year due to maintenance at several export facilities.
Author: CK

Title: China’s ENN monitors sanctions risks ahead of Arctic LNG 2 contract start in 4Q 2025
Description: China’s private energy firm ENN’s long-term LNG contract from Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant is set to begin in the fourth quarter of 2025, with the firm staying close to the 'relevant bodies' to monitor the situation and assess delivery options.
Author: CK

Title: Australia’s LNG exports rebound in October after hitting the year’s low in September
Description: Australia's LNG exports increased in October as output at the country’s nine LNG export plants ramped up following both planned and unplanned maintenance last month.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports in October higher on US cargo diversions from Asia
Description: European LNG imports increased for the first time this year, as weak LNG demand in Asia favoured Europe as a destination for US cargoes.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Gail looks to add 5-6 mtpa of term LNG contracts by 2030
Description: India's state-owned Gail expects to add around 5.5 mtpa of LNG purchased under term contracts by 2030.
Author: JS
