Title: Taipower’s gas-fired power plant expansion secures Taiwan government approval
Description: Taiwan’s state-owned utility firm Taipower has received approval from the Environmental Impact Assessment Review Committee to proceed with its plan to bring two gas-fired power plant units online in 2025 and 2026 at its Taichung Power Plant in central Taiwan.
Author: CK

Title: European Commission approves joint acquisition of Italy’s Adriatic LNG by Snam, VTTI
Description: The European Commission has approved the joint acquisition of Italy’s largest LNG receiving terminal, the 6.6 mtpa Adriatic LNG in Rovigo, by Italy’s gas transmission operator Snam and Netherlands-based energy storage provider VTTI.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC and SEFE sign binding 15-year deal for 1 mtpa of LNG from Ruwais LNG
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC and Germany’s Securing Energy For Europe, or SEFE, have signed a binding agreement for 1 mtpa of LNG to be delivered to SEFE over 15 years from the 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project starting from 2028.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy expects to start-up Nicaragua LNG terminal in Q1 2025
Description: New Fortress Energy, or NFE, expects to put its 5 mtpa Puerto Sandino LNG import terminal in Nicaragua in the first quarter of 2025, as it floats interest in sale of its assets.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global gets approval to introduce gas into fuel gas and flare systems at Plaquemines LNG
Description: US project developer Venture Global has secured authorization from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluid into the high-pressure and low-pressure fuel gas and warm flare systems of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, taking it one step closer to LNG production.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra targets commercial operations start for Energia Costa Azul’s Phase 1 in Spring 2026
Description: US LNG project developer Sempra Infrastructure is targeting the start of commercial operations at the 3.25 mtpa first phase of its Energia Costa Azul plant in Baja Californa, Mexico in the spring of 2026, with the Gasoducto Rosarito expansion pipeline that will deliver feed gas to the project expected to reach commercial operations during this quarter.
Author: CK

Title: Trump’s election win could alleviate challenges for Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project
Description: Russia's 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project which suspended operations on Oct. 11 due to escalating Western sanctions, could find some relief when President-elect Donald Trump assumes the US presidency in January next year.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas lifts force majeure on gas supply to MLNG Dua at Bintulu
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas has lifted the force majeure notice on gas supply to the MLNG Dua project which is part of the 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export complex in Sarawak, after almost two years.
Author: JS

Title: Panama registry to revoke registration of four sanctioned LNG ships connected with Arctic LNG 2
Description: The Panama Maritime Authority, or PMA, has started the process of cancelling the Panamanian registration of four LNG tankers North Air, North Mountain, North Way and North Sky that have recently come under sanctions for their support of Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project and their involvement in sanction-evading activity.
Author: JS

Title: Singapore’s market regulator signs LNG supply partnership with PetroChina
Description: Singapore’s Energy Market Authority has signed a memorandum of understanding with PetroChina to collaborate on strengthening Singapore’s expertise and knowledge on LNG supply and management.
Author: JS

Title: New Fortress Energy to weigh debottlenecking at Altamira FLNG to increase capacity
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy, or NFE, to consider debottlenecking operations at its 1.4 mtpa Altamira floating LNG export project in Mexico which will allow an up to 10% increase it the facility’s nameplate liquefaction capacity.
Author: JS

Title: India's Gail seeks 60 LNG cargoes over five years through tender
Description: India’s state-owned gas distributor Gail has issued a tender to buy 60 LNG cargoes, or one cargo a month, for delivery over five years to the Dahej, Dabhol, and Hazira terminals from April 2025. The tender closes on Nov. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s Snam expects LNG to cover any shortfalls from an end to Russia-Ukraine gas transit deal
Description: Italy’s gas transmission operator, Snam, expects LNG to offset any potential gas shortfalls Europe may face if the agreement for Russian gas to transit through Ukraine, set to expire on January 1, is not extended.
Author: CK

Title: Qatar meetings with Japan utility heads hint at an imminent long-term LNG supply deal
Description: High-level meetings held earlier this week in Tokyo between Qatar’s energy minister and several Japanese utility firms underscore a strategic push by Japan’s Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry (METI) for utilities to lock in long-term supply volumes. The discussions hint that a long-term LNG offtake agreement between Qatar and Japan may be in the offing.
Author: CK

Title: EU mulls Russian LNG replacement with US LNG: President of EU Commission
Description: President of EU Commission Ursula von der Leyen floated the idea of the EU replacing Russian LNG with US LNG as a possible negotiation with the newly elected Trump administration.
Author: JS

Title: Trafigura inks natural gas supply agreement with Canada’s NuVista Energy
Description: Trafigura has signed a long-term natural gas agreement with Canada’s NuVista Energy for a period of 13 years starting in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade continues construction of Phase 1 Rio Grande LNG despite FERC's revocation of key permit
Description: US LNG project developer NextDecade continued making good progress on the first phase of its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG export project, as the firm filed a petition for a rehearing for the Federal Regulatory Energy Commission’s decision to revoke a key authorisation.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh looks to widen pool of spot LNG suppliers
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. Ltd. has issued an invitation for firms to register their interest as potential suppliers of LNG on a spot basis to Bangladesh. The deadline for submissions is Dec. 1.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC Gas to acquire 60% interest in Ruwais LNG from ADNOC in 2H 2028
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC Gas expects to acquire the 60% interest from its parent firm ADNOC holds in the 9.8 mtpa Ruwais LNG project in the Al Ruwais industrial city in the second half of 2028, enhancing its global market position and raising its processing capacity to 15.6 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz’s LNG supply tender attracts interest of 19 companies
Description: Bulgarian natural gas company Bulgargaz said its LNG tender attracted “record interest” for supply in January-February 2025 to the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG terminal in Greece, with 19 international companies expressing interest.
Author: JS

Title: Norwegian government mulls takeover of key parts of gas export network
Description: The Norwegian government has reached agreement to buy the majority of the country’s natural gas export network from private companies, which it considers an asset of national interest.
Author: JS

Title: ACCIONA, RMC to build breakwater for Ravenna LNG import terminal
Description: A consortium of Spain-based infrastructure manager Acciona and Italian contractor RMC Construzioni have secured a EUR216 million contract to build a breakwater for Snam’s planned 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal poised to start operations in the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: LNG ship signals arrival at Turkey’s Saros terminal, hints at possible Vasant 1 FSRU restart
Description: The 170,000 m3 Energy Endeavour LNG tanker has signalled its arrival at Turkey's Botas-operated Saros floating storage regasification unit terminal in the Gulf of Saros, suggesting a potential restart of operations after an almost-eight-month hiatus.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s OLT Toscana terminal set to receive first LNG cargo after multi-month maintenance
Description: Italy’s 2.8 mtpa OLT Toscana LNG terminal in Livorno is scheduled to receive its first LNG cargo today since its 135,000 m³ floating storage regasification unit returned from maintenance in early October. The FSRU Toscana had been offline for nearly six months.
Author: CK

Title: Gazprom to boost Power of Siberia gas supplies to China above contracted volumes from December
Description: Russia’s state-owned Gazprom is set to increase gas flows to China through the Power of Siberia 1 pipeline above contracted levels by the end of 2024, aiming to secure China’s energy needs during the winter heating season.
Author: CK

Title: Slovakia’s SPP signs “pilot” gas supply deal with Socar in preparation for likely end of Ukraine gas transit deal
Description: Slovakia’s state-owned energy supplier SPP has concluded a short-term pilot contract for the purchase of natural gas with Azerbaijan’s SOCAR, with a longer-term gas supply contract a possibility.
Author: JS

Title: Tangguh LNG Train 3 restarts after trip, cargo loadings set to resume
Description: LNG cargo loadings at the BP-operated 11.4 mtpa Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia’s West Papua province are expected to resume later this week, following the restart of the plant’s third train after a trip last week.
Author: CK

Title: Vasant 1 FSRU returns to Turkey’s Saros LNG to restart operations after nearly eight months offline
Description: The 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage regasification unit has returned to the Botas-operated Saros LNG receiving terminal in Turkey where it is preparing to restart import operations through a ship-to-ship LNG transfer with the Energy Endeavour LNG tanker after a hiatus of almost eight months.
Author: CK

Title: Bahia LNG reloads first partial cargo this year, signalling weak gas demand in Brazil
Description: The Petrobras-operated 5.6 mtpa Bahia floating storage regasification unit-based LNG receiving terminal in Brazil recently reloaded a partial LNG cargo after receiving a partial cargo a few weeks earlier, underscoring weak demand in the country amid Brazil’s rainy season and marking the first reload for the Excelerate Sequoia FSRU since its installation in January.
Author: CK

Title: Egyptian government awards natural gas exploration licenses in effort to plug supply gap
Description: Egypt’s Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources has awarded four energy companies with one exploration block each under the country’s 2024 oil and gas exploration round to help fill the looming domestic gas supply gap.
Author: JS

Title: OMV’s arbitral win against Gazprom might result in earlier halt of Russian gas flows to Austria
Description: Kpler Insight believes yesterday’s announcement of OMV’s court win over Gazprom Export’s irregular pipeline gas supplies to Germany before September 2022 might result in the Kremlin-owned company halting supplies to Austria one month before the Ukraine transit deal expires.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC Gas signs 10-year LNG deal with India’s Gail
Description: ADNOC Gas has signed a 10-year sales and purchase agreement with Gail India to supply up to 0.52 mtpa of LNG starting in 2026, converting an earlier preliminary agreement into a definitive one.
Author: JS

Title: OMV awarded damages over Gazprom’s irregular gas supplies to Germany
Description: The International Chamber of Commerce has awarded Austrian energy firm OMV damages amounting to EUR 230 million plus interest and costs in its claim against Russia’s Gazprom Export for the irregular supply of gas to Germany before its contract with the firm ended in September 2022.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG Train 1’s return to full production delayed until early December from mid-November
Description: Japan’s upstream firm Inpex expects the first train at its 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory to reach full production at the start of December due to ongoing inspections of the train’s heat exchangers. This marks a delay of about two weeks from its previous timeline of mid-November.
Author: CK

Title: Korea Energy Terminal in Ulsan begins commercial operations
Description: The Korea Energy Terminal in Ulsan’s Free Economic Zone, jointly owned by SK Gas and Korea National Oil Corp., has officially begun commercial operations as targeted in the second half of this year. KET is South Korea’s first import terminal capable of handling both oil and LNG imports.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tankers divert from Asia to Europe following TTF price spike on news of Gazprom halting gas flows to OMV
Description: Kpler has identified at least five potential LNG tanker diversions from Asia to Europe after today’s TTF price spike driven by OMV’s announcement that Gazprom Export will suspend pipeline gas supplies to Austria starting tomorrow.
Author: JS

Title: UPDATE: OMV says Gazprom will halt pipeline gas supplies to Austria from Nov. 16
Description: Austrian energy firm OMV has said that Gazprom Export will suspend its gas deliveries under the long-term supply agreement with OMV Gas Marketing & Trading from Nov. 16, days after the firm was awarded damages over Gazprom’s inconsistent contractual gas supplies in 2022.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche Regas steps up to secure Austria's gas supply amid Gazprom halt
Description: German terminal operator Deutsche Regas has stepped in to support Austria's energy needs after Russia’s state-owned Gazprom halted gas deliveries under a long-term contract on Nov. 16.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz awards tender for January-February LNG cargoes to BP, Venture Global
Description: Bulgaria’s state-owned gas supplier Bulgargaz has awarded its tender for two January-February 2025 LNG cargoes to BP and Venture Global, completing its autumn-winter procurement plan for five cargoes to be delivered to Greece’s 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis terminal from October to February 2025.
Author: CK

Title: The number of LNG tankers floating near Egypt seen increasing
Description: At least two tankers are seen idling offshore Egypt’s 5.7 mtpa Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal in the Red Sea, and three vessels have already diverted away from Egypt in a signal that the country possibly overestimated its demand with spot tender purchases.
Author: JS

Title: New LNG import facility proposed in Estonia
Description: Tallinn port operator Tallinna Sadam and gas supplier JetGas have agreed to build an LNG import terminal in Muuga harbour. The terminal will come online in 2030 “at the latest.”
Author: JS

Title: Egypt’s anticipated first-quarter 2025 LNG tender seen delayed due to FSRU issues
Description: Egypt’s LNG tender to secure LNG supplies for the first quarter of 2025, which was anticipated to be issued in early December, is now expected to be pushed back due to send-out issues at the Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit installed at the country’s Ain Sukhna LNG import terminal, according to industry participantsni
Author: CK

Title: Venture Bayou LNG tanker berths at Plaquemines LNG to re-export LNG received as cooldown cargo
Description: The 174,000 m3 Venture Bayou arrived at Venture Global’s 25 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana and is likely to re-export the cooldown cargo that it received to help with commissioning at the end of August.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine denies involvement in talks to extend gas transit deal with Russia, Azerbaijan
Description: Ukraine’s Ministry of Energy has denied reports that it was engaged in talks on extending the transit contract with Russia or discussions involving gas from Azerbaijan.
Author: JS

Title: Bangladesh seeks one more December spot LNG cargo
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned Rupantarita Prakritik Gas Co. has issued a tender to buy an additional LNG cargo for delivery on Dec. 30-31 through a tender that closes on Nov. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Weekly US LNG exports to Europe jump on cargo diversions from Asia to Europe
Description: The number of LNG tankers scheduled to discharge at European LNG terminals by the end of this week is expected to rise due to increased cargo diversions from Asia to Europe following a TTF price spike to its highest this year.
Author: JS

Title: Brunei LNG prepares to restart operations after fire-led operational “upset’
Description: The 7.2 mtpa Brunei LNG export facility in Lumut has begun activities to restart operations after a fire caused the plant to shut down, the plant’s term offtakers said.
Author: CK

Title: US hits Gazprombank with sanctions, complicating future gas payments
Description: The US Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control, or OFAC, sanctioned Gazprombank and more than 50 internationally connected Russian banks, which will complicate Russia’s current international clients’ payments for gas deliveries.
Author: JS

Title: Chinese LNG ship completes first STS at Murmansk as EU's Russian LNG transshipment ban approaches in March
Description: The Yamal LNG-controlled 172,410 m³ Nikolay Urvantsev LNG tanker has completed a ship-to-ship transfer of LNG with the 174,000 m³ Wen Cheng at Russia’s Murmansk Lightering Zone. This could mark the beginning of more such transfers of Russian LNG within Russian territory, ahead of the European Union’s ban on the transshipment of Russian LNG at European ports, which is set to take effect in March 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG yet to resume exports following shutdown due to fire
Description: Brunei LNG’s 7.2 mtpa plant in Lumut has not resumed exports despite preparations earlier this week to restart production after a fire at the facility forced it to shut down.
Author: CK

Title: FERC greenlights introduction of hazardous fluids into Plaquemines LNG ‘s first liquefaction block
Description: Venture Global continues advancing start-up activity as the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission approved the introduction of hazardous liquids into the first liquefaction block of its Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas to deliver first LNG cargo for Nhon Trach 3 power plant in early December
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PetroVietnam Gas will deliver the first LNG cargo to the Nhon Trach 3 power plant in the first week of December, following the signing of a supply contract with PetroVietnam Power earlier this week for the trial run of the Nhon Trach 3 and 4 power plants.
Author: CK

Title: Chiyoda, CB&I reach agreement to complete work on Golden Pass LNG Train 1
Description: Construction joint-venture partners Chiyoda International and CB&I have reached an agreement with Golden Pass LNG to amend the engineering,procurement and construction contract and associated commercial terms, paving the way for the completion of the 18 mtpa project’s first train.
Author: CK

Title: North West Shelf LNG Train 2 taken offline, awaits government approval for retirement
Description: Woodside Energy has recently taken offline the second of five trains at the 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf (NWS) LNG plant in Western Australia, in line with its plan to retire the train in the fourth quarter of this year, pending government approval.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC takes delivery of first LNG ship, five others to be delivered in 2025 and 2026
Description:
ADNOC Logistics and Services, or ADNOC L&S, has taken delivery of the 175,000 m3 Al Shelila LNG tanker from the Jiangnan Shipyard in China two months ahead of schedule.
The vessel is the first of six that ADNOC L&S ordered from the shipyard. The rest are expected to be delivered in 2025 and 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina’s YPF to join FLNG project developed by Pan American Energy, Golar LNG
Description: Argentina’s state-owned YPF will join a rival LNG export project being developed by Pan American Energy and Golar LNG, according to YPF’s president Horacio Daniel Marin.
Author: JS

Title: Pluto LNG forced to shut down; investigations underway
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has taken the 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG plant offline for unplanned maintenance today, launching an investigation into the cause of the shutdown.
Author: CK

Title: Eni launches hull for Congo FLNG phase 2; Nguya FLNG startup expected by end 2025
Description: Italy’s Eni has launched the hull of the second floating LNG unit to be deployed in the Republic of Congo, marking the second phase of the firm’s Congo's FLNG development
Author: CK

Title: One more LNG tanker set to berth at Plaquemines LNG
Description: The 174,000 m3 Amore Mio I is set to be the second LNG tanker to approach the 25 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana to load cargo amid the market’s expectations of the facility’s imminent start-up.
Author: JS

Title: BW Singapore FSRU leaves Dubai shipyard ahead of deployment as Ravenna FSRU
Description: The 170,000 m3 BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit has left the DP World Drydocks shipyard in Dubai and is signalling an arrival in Italy, ahead of its deployment at the 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal scheduled for the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Preparations underway to bring  Pluto LNG back online after Monday’s shutdown
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has begun preparations to bring its 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG plant in Western Australia online after shutting down operations on Monday.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG gas flows recover after recent shutdown
Description: Gas flows to the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant have edged higher, indicating that the plant is returning to normal operations following the recent shutdown of its second train on Nov. 22.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Saibu Gas takes final investment decision on Hibiki LNG terminal third tank
Description: Japanese utility Saibu Gas has approved a final investment decision to construct a third LNG storage tank and related facilities as part of an expansion at its 2.4 mtpa Hibiki LNG terminal on Kyushu island. The new 230,000 t tank will increase Hibiki’s total storage capacity to 590,000 t from 360,000 t currently.
Author: CK

Title: FERC greenlights introduction of first gas into Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Committee, or FERC, has approved the introduction of first gas into Cheniere Energy’s 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project, signalling the imminent start of the facility’s operations.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey’s LNG imports rebound after eight-month slump as Saros restarts imports
Description: Turkey’s LNG imports have surged this month, breaking an eight-month slump as the Saros LNG terminal resumed operations, boosting receipts.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues tender to buy one February LNG cargo, its first for 2025
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy one cargo for delivery on Feb. 24-25 to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal, marking the firm’s first spot requirement for 2025. The tender closes on Dec. 3.
Author: CK

Title: Stade floating LNG terminal start-up postponed to March 2025
Description: The start-up of operations at the 3.7 mtpa Stade floating LNG import terminal in Germany has been postponed until March 2025, a delay from the previous expectation of bringing it online by the end of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside’s Pluto LNG expected to restart operations this weekend
Description: The Woodside-operated 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG plant in Western Australia is expected to resume operations within the next two days after an unplanned shutdown on November 25 caused by control system issues.
Author: CK

Title: EU Commission extends 90% gas storage refilling measure, set intermediate targets for each member state
Description: The EU Commission has extended the mandatory underground storage gas-filling target for all 27 member states to 2025, making it the third consecutive year the measure has been implemented.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside’s Pluto LNG plant back online after unplanned shutdown last week
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy’s 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG plant in Western Australia has returned to operation following a shutdown on Nov. 25 due to control system issues.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy, Shell ink long-term LNG deal for 3 mtpa, commencing in 2025
Description: QatarEnergy and Shell have entered into a long-term sales and purchase agreement to supply 3 mtpa of LNG to Shell’s China-based customers.
Author: JS

Title: IOC issues tender for January LNG cargo to commission delayed Chhara import terminal
Description: State-owned Indian Oil Corp., or IOC, has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in January  to commission the 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in Gujarat on behalf of terminal operator, state-owned Hindustan Petroleum Corp. The tender closes on Dec. 4.
Author: CK

Title: Jordan, Egypt ink agreement for the use of Egyptian LNG infrastructure
Description: The governments of Jordan and Egypt have linked a deal for Jordan to use Egyptian LNG infrastructure. This will replace the existing deal for Egypt to import LNG via Jordan’s 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: South Korea’s S-Oil seeks six January to June LNG cargoes a year from 2027 to 2041
Description: South Korean oil refiner S-Oil seeks six LNG cargoes for delivery between January and June 2027 and 2041 to its Korea Energy Terminal in Ulsan. Its majority shareholder Aramco has issued a tender to meet the requirement, with this closing on Dec. 20. Bids are expected to remain valid until Jan. 24.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s November LNG imports fall short of tender award as Aqaba delivery missed
Description: Egypt received five LNG cargoes in November, one fewer than the six it purchased for the month through a tender in September for 20 October-December cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Harbour Energy snaps up 15% stake in proposed Argentinean FLNG project
Description: Multinational oil and gas firm Harbour Energy has signed a deal to acquire a 15% interest in Southern Energy, a joint venture led by Pan American Energy that is developing a floating FLNG export project in Argentina.
Author: JS

Title: Etyfa Prometheas FSRU to set sail from Shanghai shipyard to Cyprus “in the next few days”
Description: The 134,425 m3 Etyfa Prometheas floating storage regasification unit will set sail from COSCO’s shipyard in Shanghai “in the next few days”, said Cyprus’s energy minister Giorgos Papanastasiou, after nearly a year since its delivery ceremony.
Author: JS

Title: Pakistan government defers five contractual Qatari cargoes from 2025 to 2026
Description: Pakistan has deferred five LNG shipments under a long-term contract with Qatar for a year and will now receive volumes in 2026 instead of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Europe's LNG imports jump in November on increased cargo diversions
Description: Imports of LNG into Europe surged in November to their highest level since April this year as cargo diversions from Asia to Europe continue dominating the market.
Author: JS

Title: Ichthys LNG loads a second December cargo as Train 1 reaches full capacity
Description: The Inpex-operated 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory is poised to export its second December LNG cargo as its first liquefaction train achieves full production this week.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports edge up in November, shrugging off Freeport outages
Description: LNG exports from the US edged higher in November compared to October and a year earlier, defying outages at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant that cut production during the month.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs revised engineering deal with Bechtel for Woodside Louisiana LNG project
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has signed a revised engineering, procurement, and construction contract with Bechtel for its 16.5 mtpa Woodside Louisiana LNG project in the US, furthering the development of the three-train project
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s SembCorp agrees 10-year LNG deal with Chevron starting in 2028
Description: SembCorp Fuels, the wholly owned unit of Singapore-based energy firm SembCorp, has agreed to buy 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 10 years from Chevron, starting in 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Shell, Equinor to form offshore UK upstream joint venture
Description: Shell and Equinor have announced the formation of a joint venture combining their UK offshore oil and gas assets to form the UK’s North Sea’s biggest independent producer to sustain production and the country’s security of energy supply.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas to offtake 1 mtpa of LNG from ADNOC’s Ruwais LNG plant for 15 years
Description: ADNOC and Malaysia’s Petronas have signed a sales and purchase agreement for Petronas to buy 1 mtpa of LNG, which will primarily be sourced from ADNOC’s 9.8 mtpa Ruwais LNG plant in the UAE for a period of 15 years, commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: SEFE secures 0.5 mtpa of LNG from Angola LNG for supply in 2026
Description: Germany’s state-owned SEFE and Angola LNG have signed an agreement for the supply of 0.5 mtpa of LNG scheduled for 2026.
Author: JS

Title: EGAS signs lease deal with New Fortress Energy to install Egypt’s second FSRU
Description: State-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company, or EGAS, has signed an agreement with US-based New Fortress Energy to lease its second floating storage regasification unit, which is expected to commence operations in the second half of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Lithuania acquires Independence FSRU from Hoegh Evi
Description: Lithuania and energy terminal operator KN Energies have finalized the acquisition of the Independence floating storage and regasification unit from Hoegh Evi, bolstering the country’s energy independence strategy. The deal concludes a 10-year charter agreement signed in 2014, which included an option for Lithuania to purchase the vessel by the end of 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Wilhelmshaven FSRU to go idle in Q1 2025 on lack of capacity bookings
Description: The 5.8 mtpa Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal in Germany will be offline during the first quarter of 2025, according to a Deutsche Energy Terminal, or DET, notice to the Gas Infrastructure Europe remit data.
Author: JS

Title: Eni’s Nguya FLNG unit sets sail for Zhoushan for further pre-commissioning works
Description: The Nguya floating LNG unit purpose-built for Eni’s second phase of the Congo FLNG export project is on its way to another shipyard in China in anticipation of the unit’s deployment by the end of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Qatar Energy Minister warns EU LNG supplies at risk over sustainability rules
Description: Qatar’s Minister of State for Energy Affairs and QatarEnergy Chief Executive Saad Sherida Al-Kaabi has warned that the EU’s new corporate sustainability due diligence directive could put LNG exports to Europe at risk.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Binhai LNG terminal completes its first LNG reload; indicates weak Chinese LNG demand
Description: The CNOOC-operated 3 mtpa Binhai LNG receiving terminal on China’s eastern coast has completed its first LNG reload operation, indicating weak LNG demand during the country’s peak gas demand season.
Author: CK

Title: Energy security remains a priority for Germany and Europe
Description: Energy security remains a critical challenge for Germany and Europe, with vulnerabilities persisting despite significant progress in reducing reliance on Russian gas.
Author: CK

Title: American Gas Partners plans 7.2 mtpa US LNG project targeting Germany
Description: New US project developer American Gas Partners has unveiled plans for a 7.2 mtpa LNG export project targeting Germany’s industrial gas consumers, with a final investment decision expected by late 2025. The project is expected to cost about $7 billion and come online by 2029, four years after the targeted FID date.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria LNG expects to fully supply its trains with feed gas by end of 2025
Description: Nigeria LNG expects its 22 mtpa LNG export facility on Bonny Island to be fully supplied with feed gas by the end of 2025, relying on continued government efforts to improve pipeline transportation security.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s Damietta LNG set to export cargo as tanker moors at plant
Description: The Eni-operated 5 mtpa Damietta LNG terminal in Egypt looks set to export an LNG cargo for the first time since March, as a ballast LNG tanker has moored at the facility today.
Author: JS

Title: US DOE delays review of CP2, Commonwealth LNG export projects
Description: The US Department of Energy has delayed reviews for two proposed LNG export plants in Louisiana, pending environmental assessments by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
Author: JS

Title: Snam eyes February commissioning of Ravenna floating LNG terminal
Description: Snam, Italy’s gas storage and LNG terminal operator, plans to commission its 5 billion m³ a year Ravenna floating LNG terminal by February 2025, with commercial operations starting within the first quarter.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy awards a MOL, COSCO JV time charter party agreements for 6 newbuilt LNG vessels
Description: QatarEnergy has selected the joint venture of Japan’s Mitsui O.S.K Lines, or MOL, and China’s COSCO Shipping LNG Investment to own and operate six LNG vessels.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere reaffirms expectation of first LNG from Corpus Christi Stage 3 by year-end
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere remains on track to produce first LNG from its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project by the end of this year, with commercial operations for the first train expected by early in the second quarter of 2025, Chief Operating Officer Anatol Feygin said.
Author: CK

Title: Santos signs 12-year LNG supply deal with Japan's Shizuoka Gas
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos has signed a binding agreement to supply between 0.35 mtpa and 0.4 million mtpa of LNG to Japanese utility Shizuoka Gas over 12 years, starting in 2032.
Author: CK

Title: Taiwan’s CPC faces delays in startup of Taoyuan, its third LNG receiving terminal
Description: Taiwan’s state-owned CPC is facing delays in the construction of its third LNG terminal in Taoyuan, with completion potentially pushed to 2026, beyond the expected target of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: North West Shelf project gets state approval for extended gas, LNG operations
Description: The Woodside-operated North West Shelf project has secured environmental approval from the Western Australian government for its project extension, marking a critical step toward ensuring the long-term operations of Australia’s largest LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Squadron Energy starts commissioning at Australia’s Port Kembla Energy Terminal
Description: Australian renewable energy firm Squadron Energy has completed construction of its Port Kembla Energy Terminal and begun commissioning, advancing towards the start of operations at what is expected to be Australia’s first LNG import terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Knutsen seals charter for FSU conversion in Honduras
Description: Norway’s Knutsen Group has agreed on a charter deal with Honduran Genesis Energias for a tanker conversion to a floating storage unit for the loading, storage and discharging of LNG as part of an LNG-to-power project in Honduras.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine prepares for future without Russian gas transit
Description: With its Russian gas transit agreement set to expire, Ukraine is working to achieve non-interruptible gas flows through the Trans-Balkan pipeline by spring 2025 to ensure the region’s energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG begins production of LNG
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has begun LNG production at its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export facility in Louisiana, paving the way for the start of LNG exports at the firm’s second LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Cyprus eyes charter of Etyfa Prometheas FSRU as it sets sail for Singapore
Description: The Cypriot president said the country is in in discussion for the charter of its Etyfa Prometheas floating storage regasification unit as it sets sail from COSCO’s shipyard in Shanghai.
Author: JS

Title: Italy set to receive Russian LNG for the first time in over a year
Description: The Cool Rover LNG tanker is set to deliver a Russian LNG cargo to Italy, which will be the country’s first intake since March 2023.
Author: JS

Title: Germany’s EnBW, ADNOC finalise 0.6 mtpa LNG supply deal
Description: German energy company EnBW has signed an agreement with the Abu Dhabi National Oil Company, or ADNOC, to purchase 0.6 mtpa of LNG over a period of 15 years, commencing in 2028. Supplies will be primarily sourced from the 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG export facility.
Author: JS

Title: EU sanctions seven Russian dark fleet LNG tankers as part of its 15th sanctions package
Description: The EU Council has adopted its 15th sanctions package on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, in which it, for the first time, targets LNG tankers believed to be part of Russia’s dark fleet used to circumvent sanctions placed on the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: European Commission denies involvement in Ukraine transit deal renegotiation
Description: The European Commission has denied involvement in discussions to extend Ukraine’s gas transit deal following the latest lobbying effort led by Slovakia’s energy supplier SPP.
Author: JS

Title: US DOE urges caution on new LNG permits in long-awaited study
Description: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has released a much-anticipated study on the country’s LNG export expansion, warning that unchecked growth could harm American consumers and global climate efforts.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside Energy, Chevron swap assets in Western Australia
Description: Woodside Energy and Chevron have announced a strategic asset swap to streamline their oil and gas operations in Western Australia, resulting in Woodside’s exit from the Wheatstone LNG project while increasing its stake in other key assets.
Author: JS

Title: Wison New Energies signs FEED study for FLNG project in Nigeria
Description: China’s Wison New Energies has signed a front-end engineering design (FEED) contract with Nigeria’s Ace Gas & FLNG for a 3 mtpa floating LNG (FLNG) facility and a 230 MW power barge project in Nigeria.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron, Energy Transfer ink 20-year supply agreement for 2 mtpa of LNG
Description: US midstream firm Energy Transfer has entered into a 20-year LNG sales and purchase agreement with Chevron, for the supply of 2 mtpa from its proposed 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Shell replaces Petronas as YPF’s partner in Argentina LNG project
Description: Argentina’s state energy company YPF has announced Shell as its new primary partner in the Argentina LNG export project, replacing Malaysia’s Petronas.
Author: JS

Title: Russia’s dark LNG fleet resumes activity after months of inactivity
Description: Several LNG tankers believed to be part of Russia’s LNG dark fleet, which is associated with reviving the heavily sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant, have renewed activity in recent weeks, with at least two laden and one ballast tanker on the move.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global gets approval to export commissioning cargoes from Plaquemines LNG
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, has allowed LNG project developer Venture Global to export commissioning cargoes from its 25 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside receives final Pluto Train 2 modules
Description: Woodside Energy said it has received the final Pluto Train 2 modules at the Pluto LNG facility in Karratha, Western Australia, which advances the Scarborough energy project towards the targeted delivery of first LNG in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC Trading signs LNG supply deal with Thailand’s Gulf Energy
Description: The trading arm of Abu Dhabi’s state-owned energy firm ADNOC has signed an LNG supply deal with Thai private power producer Gulf Energy.
Author: CK

Title: FERC approves Cheniere’s request to introduce feed gas into Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, has granted approval for Cheniere to introduce feed gas and refrigerants to Train 1 – String 1 for the 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion, in line with the firm’s expectation for first LNG in 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global gets FERC approvals for Plaquemines LNG commissioning milestones
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has received approvals from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluids at its Plaquemines LNG export facility in Louisiana, marking further progress for the new plant that recently began LNG production.
Author: CK

Title: Pioneer discharges first cargo ever lifted from Arctic LNG 2 cargo into storage
Description: The LNG tanker Pioneer has discharged the first cargo lifted from the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project into the Kamchatka floating storage unit (FSU), nearly five months after the cargo was initially loaded from the sanctioned plant.
Author: JS

Title: Plaquemines LNG’s commissioning cargo headed to Germany’s Brunsbuttel LNG terminal
Description: The Venture Bayou LNG tanker, which loaded the 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG’s commissioning cargo, is signalling arrival at Germany’s 5.7 mtpa Brunsbuttel LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Snam’s FSRU commercial operations start-up delayed to April 2025
Description: Italy’s gas transmission system and LNG terminal operator Snam said it expects to start operations at its floating storage regasification unit-based LNG terminal in Ravenna in early April 2025, a one-month delay from its earlier expectations.
Author: JS

Title: Gazprom’s halt in gas supplies to Moldovagaz to raise electricity prices in Moldova
Description: Moldova is set to face significantly higher electricity prices following Gazprom’s decision to halt pipeline gas supplies. The announcement, made over the weekend, cited Moldova's alleged refusal to settle outstanding debts for gas deliveries.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere achieves first gas at Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion
Description: Cheniere Energy has produced LNG  for the first time from the first train of its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 liquefaction project, paving the way for commissioning operations expected to be completed at the end of the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: US hits LNG export high in December, retains top global exporter status in 2024
Description: LNG exports from the US rose to their highest level of the year in December, helping the country retain its position as the world’s top LNG exporter in 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines LNG loads its second cargo as Venture Gator tanker berths at terminal
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global is loading the second LNG cargo from the recently started first phase of its 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export project in Louisiana, with the shipment expected to depart today, just days after exporting its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Global LNG exports rise slightly in 2024; US remains top supplier
Description: Global LNG exports rose marginally in 2024, constrained by limited new liquefaction capacity during the year.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG prepares to ship a second cargo
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global’s 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export plant in Louisiana is preparing to ship its second LNG cargo, making it the terminal's first cargo to be shipped in the new year.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project produces gas from first well
Description: The BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG project, located on the maritime border of Mauritania and Senegal, has started producing gas from its first well, marking a critical step toward LNG exports.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine operates without Russian gas transit following transit contract expiration on Jan. 1
Description: Ukraine’s gas transmission system is operating without the transit of Russian gas as of Jan. 1, in line with the expiration of a five-year transit agreement between Ukraine’s gas transmission system operator and Russia’s state-owned Gazprom.
Author: CK

Title: Indian Oil seeks 15-20 year LNG supplies starting from 2027
Description: State-owned Indian Oil Corp. has issued a tender to secure 12 LNG cargoes a year for delivery to India over a 15-20 year period, starting from 2027 or 2028. The tender closes on Jan. 20.
Author: CK

Title: Chhara LNG awaits commissioning cargo as ship idles nearby
Description: The 5 mtpa Hindustan Petroleum Corp.-operated Chhara LNG terminal in Gujarat could begin commissioning operations soon, with a laden LNG tanker idling outside the terminal since Dec. 30, likely carrying its commissioning cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Norway’s Hammerfest LNG forced to shut down due to compressor failure
Description: Plant operator Equinor has shut down its 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island due to a compressor failure, with operations expected to resume after eight days.
Author: CK

Title: Russian LNG exports lifted by higher European intakes
Description: Russian LNG exports in 2024 increased 5% year over year, driven by larger exports from Novatek’s 17.4 mtpa Yamal plant and a 10% surge in European intakes.
Author: JS

Title: Biden bans offshore oil and gas drilling in U.S. waters
Description: President Joe Biden has enacted a sweeping ban on oil and gas drilling in significant offshore areas of the U.S. just two weeks before the conclusion of his term.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG ships second cargo; destination unclear
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global’s 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant has shipped its second cargo, 10 days after its inaugural shipment and 22 days after beginning LNG production for the plant’s first phase.
Author: CK

Title: Europe’s LNG imports surge in December, but overall receipts decline for 2024
Description: Europe’s LNG imports surged to a three-month high in December, but the increase wasn’t enough to offset earlier declines, resulting in a second consecutive year of falling LNG receipts in 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s Gulf Energy issues tender again for two February LNG cargoes
Description: Bangkok-based power producer Gulf Energy has reissued a tender seeking two LNG cargoes for delivery in February to Thailand, with submissions due by tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside schedules May-June maintenance at North West Shelf LNG
Description: Australian energy firm Woodside Energy has scheduled three maintenance periods  from May to June at its North West Shelf LNG project in Western Australia, shutting down production on one LNG train during each period.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen receives permit to operate and maintain Batangas LNG terminal
Description: Philippines-based power producer and LNG terminal operator First Gen Corp. has secured a permit from the country’s Department of Energy to operate and maintain its 5.3 mtpa FGen LNG import terminal in Batangas. The 25-year permit allows First Gen to operate the terminal for its own needs.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies lifts first cargo under its 10-year term deal with Oman LNG
Description: TotalEnergies has taken delivery of an LNG cargo from Oman LNG’s 11.4 mtpa Qalhat LNG export plant, marking the start of shipments under a 10-year contract for 0.8 mtpa agreed in January 2023.
Author: CK

Title: AGDC reaches framework agreement with partner to develop Alaska LNG
Description: Alaska Gasline Development Corporation, or ADGC, said that it reached an exclusive framework agreement with an energy company to develop its long-mooted 20 mtpa Alaska LNG export project in Nikiski.
Author: JS

Title: US blacklists China’s CNOOC and COSCO, sending strong market signal
Description: The US Department of Defense has blacklisted China’s state-owned energy giant CNOOC and shipping firm China COSCO Shipping Corp. Ltd., citing ties to the Chinese military.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks one more February LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT is seeking an additional LNG cargo for delivery in February to the Map Ta Phut LNG import terminal in Rayong, through a tender closing on Jan. 10. The cargo is slated for delivery on Feb. 12-13 and is the third spot cargo the firm has sought for February.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor extends unplanned maintenance at Hammerfest LNG by 10 days
Description: Plant operator Equinor has extended the unplanned maintenance at its 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Norway’s Melkoya Island by 10 days.
Author: JS

Title: Chart Industries signs global LNG equipment deal with ExxonMobil
Description: US-based equipment and technology firm Chart Industries has entered into a global master goods and services agreement with ExxonMobil to supply LNG equipment, technology, and services for ExxonMobil's international project portfolio.
Author: JS

Title: India’s LNG imports hit 2024 low in December, but annual imports rise on-year
Description: India’s LNG imports dropped to their lowest level in December, with higher spot prices and cooler weather weighing on demand. However, annual imports climbed from 2023 levels, boosted by strong power sector demand due to a severe summer heatwave and weaker spot prices earlier in the year.
Author: CK

Title: NFE’s La Paz FSU Energos Grand heads to Malaysia for drydocking, temporary replacement in place
Description: The New Fortress Energy-chartered 145,700 m³ Energos Grand is en route to the Malaysia Marine and Heavy Engineering shipyard in Pasir Gudang for drydocking and routine maintenance. The vessel, which serves as a floating storage unit at the 0.8 mtpa La Paz LNG import terminal in Mexico's Pichilingue port, left on Dec. 23.
Author: CK

Title: Monjasa completes UAE’s first LNG bunkering; expands operations with FSU charter
Description: Marine fuels supplier Monjasa has marked a milestone by conducting the first LNG bunkering operation in the United Arab Emirates. This comes three weeks after announcing its charter of the 5,000 m³ Green Zeebrugge LNG bunkering vessel and the launch of LNG bunkering operations in the UAE.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Bayou diverts from Brunsbuettel to Wilhelmshaven with Plaquemines' first LNG cargo
Description: The Venture Global-chartered Venture Bayou LNG tanker, which shipped the inaugural commissioning cargo from the 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG terminal in the US, has diverted from its initial destination of Germany’s Brunsbuettel LNG terminal and is now expected to arrive at the Wilhelmshaven GasPort today.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Chhara LNG terminal receives maiden cargo for commissioning phase
Description: The  5 mtpa Hindustan Petroleum Corp.-operated Chhara LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat has received its first LNG cargo, initiating commissioning operations.
Author: CK

Title: EU ends 2024 with the lowest volume of gas in storage in the past three years
Description: The 27 EU member states have experienced a higher draw from underground gas storage this winter than in the three previous winters, driven by colder-than-average conditions and below-average wind power generation.
Author: JS

Title: Glenfarne revealed as AGDC’s partner in Alaska LNG export project
Description: US energy firm Glenfarne Energy Transition was confirmed as the company which entered into an exclusive agreement with the Alaska Gasline Development for the development of the 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski.
Author: JS

Title: Bahrain’s BAPCO stages return to LNG market as it issues LNG purchase tender
Description: Bahrain’s BAPCO has issued an LNG purchase tender for supplies between 2025 and 2027, signalling the country’s return to the LNG market as an importer after a six-year hiatus.
Author: JS

Title: H-Energy seeks FSRU for Jaigarh LNG, eyes October-February 2026 delivery
Description: Mumbai-based real estate and infrastructure firm H-Energy has issued a request for quotations for a floating storage regasification unit for its delayed Jaigarh LNG import terminal in Ratnagiri in India’s western state of Maharashtra.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s DET pushes second Wilhelmshaven FSRU commissioning to Q1 2025
Description: Germany's state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) has postponed the commissioning of the Excelsior floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to the first quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: UK cold snap dents gas stocks to “concerningly low levels”: Centrica
Description: UK energy firm Centrica stated that the recent cold snap has put significant pressure on the UK’s gas storage, prompting the company to seek an exemption to proceed with expanding the capacity of its Rough storage facility.
Author: JS

Title: China’s December LNG imports rise; 2024 volumes solidify top importer status
Description: China’s LNG imports rose sharply in December, driven by stock building for the winter season. The month-on-month increase contributed to an overall rise in 2024 imports, reaffirming China’s status as the world’s largest LNG importer for the second consecutive year.
Author: CK

Title: US tightens sanctions on Russia to include Portovaya and Vysotsk LNG plants
Description: The Biden-Harris administration slapped more sanctions targeting Russian energy exports, including the small-scale Vysotsk and Portovaya LNG plants, with just over a week until President Donald Trump starts his term as president.
Author: JS

Title: Chevron plans June to July maintenance at Gorgon LNG plant
Description: Chevron has scheduled a 35-day maintenance period at its 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG facility in Western Australia, with production from "greater than one half of an LNG train but not greater than one LNG train" set to be offline from June 1 to July 5, according to a notice on its website.
Author: CK

Title: Dutch gas storage decline poses no immediate supply risk: Gasunie
Description: Gas storage levels in the Netherlands have fallen to lower-than-usual levels but do not currently threaten natural gas supply security, according to the Netherlands’ energy network operator Gasunie Transport Services.
Author: CK

Title: Kremlin accuses Ukraine of “energy terrorism” after alleged attack on TurkStream pipeline
Description: The Kremlin has accused Ukraine of "energy terrorism" after an alleged attempt to attack the TurkStream pipeline’s Russkaya compressor station near Anapa in Russia.
Author: JS

Title: HPCL confirms successful commissioning of Chhara LNG import terminal
Description: Hindustan Petroleum Corp. said that it has successfully commissioned its 5 mtpa Chhara LNG receiving terminal in Gujarat, following receipt of its first LNG cargo last week.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Croatia awards contracts for FSRU conversion, terminal expansion
Description: Terminal operator LNG Croatia has awarded contracts totaling $17 million to Croatian control system integrator SCAN and Turkish shipyard Kuzey Star to upgrade and expand the capacity of its floating storage regasification unit at the 2.1 mtpa terminal on the island of Krk.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt seeks four LNG cargoes via tender delivery in February-March
Description: Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation, or EGPC, has issued a tender to buy four LNG cargoes for delivery between February and March. The tender closes on Jan. 27.
Author: JS

Title: Botala Energy, NOVO Energy partner on LNG supply to address Southern Africa’s forecast gas shortage
Description: Australia-listed Botala Energy has signed a non-binding agreement with Southern African gas distributor NOVO Energy to develop a regional LNG supply chain to address Southern Africa's forecast gas shortage, expected by mid-2027.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine Eyes Lithuania, Greek LNG Terminals to Bolster Gas Security
Description: Ukraine’s gas transmission system operator is exploring LNG imports via Lithuania’s Klaipeda terminal and Greek terminals as part of its strategy to diversify gas supplies and bolster energy security after Russia’s gas transit deal through Ukraine expired on Jan. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Europe adapts to the end of Russian pipeline gas supply through Ukraine
Description: Since January 1, 2025, Europe has adjusted to the absence of Russian gas flows via Ukraine by increasing storage withdrawals and boosting imports from Germany.
Author: JS

Title: Plaquemines LNG gets approval to commission two more liquefaction blocks
Description: The Venture Global-operated 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to commission its seventh and eighth liquefaction blocks with nitrogen, a step towards additional liquefaction capacity coming online.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas seeks four March to May LNG cargoes
Description: Vietnam's state-owned gas distributor PV Gas is seeking four LNG cargoes for delivery across March to May to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal through a tender closing tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Eni to relocate Nguya FLNG vessel for Congo; reaffirms project start-up timing
Description: Italy’s Eni plans to relocate the Nguya floating LNG vessel, under construction for the second phase of its Congo FLNG export project, to another shipyard. The move follows the US targeting Chinese shipyard Zhoushan Wison Marine and Offshore as part of a broader sanctions package aimed at degrading Russia’s ability to generate revenue from its oil and gas exports.
Author: CK

Title: J​​apan’s MOL names fourth newbuild LNG vessel for QatarEnergy
Description: Japanese shipper Mitsui OSK Lines has named its fourth newbuild LNG carrier, Limail, as part of QatarEnergy’s LNG fleet expansion for the North Field and Golden Pass LNG projects. The naming ceremony took place at the Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding yard in China.
Author: CK

Title: Gail, SEFE settle LNG non-delivery dispute
Description: India’s Gail and and SEFE Marketing & Trading Singapore, a former unit of Gazprom, have settled their dispute over the non-delivery LNG in 2022-2023.
Author: JS

Title: Cargo diversions from Asia seen lifting U.S. LNG exports to Europe in January
Description: Europe’s imports of US LNG have gotten a shot in the arm this month, thanks to a recent surge in Dutch TTF prices incentivizing cargo diversions from Asia because of better margins.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada advises of 20-day increased flaring this month as part of commissioning
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in British Columbia expects increased flaring to begin on Jan. 20 and continue over a four-week period as part of its commissioning process ahead of first exports.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines ships fourth LNG cargo; Germany to receive first three cargoes
Description: The Venture Global-operated Plaquemines LNG plant has shipped its fourth LNG cargo since starting exports on Dec. 26, with Germany emerging as the key destination for the first three shipments.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas plans LNG storage expansion with tender for fourth tank at Marmara Ereglisi
Description: Turkey’s state-owned energy firm Botas plans to enlarge its LNG storage capacity by adding a fourth storage tank at its 4.6 mtpa Marmara Ereglisi LNG terminal. The firm’s tender for construction of the storage tank project will close on Feb. 10.
Author: CK

Title: UPDATE: Trump set to declare national energy emergency providing boost to oil, gas industry
Description: President-elect Donald Trump said that he will today declare a national energy emergency aimed at boosting U.S. oil and gas production and lowering energy costs for U.S. consumers.
Author: JS

Title: Loadings at Hammerfest LNG yet to resume following the end of unplanned maintenance
Description: The Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant in Norway has yet to restart cargo loadings, following the end of unplanned maintenance on Jan. 19. But, Kpler data indicate they are poised to resume from Jan. 22.
Author: CK

Title: Trump lifts pause on US LNG export approvals as part of energy push
Description: President Donald Trump has taken action to lift the pause on pending applications for LNG export approvals, reversing a policy implemented under the Biden administration.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG operations in focus after LNG ship idles, alters course without loading
Description: The Symphonic Breeze LNG tanker’s recent movements near the Shell-operated Prelude FLNG facility offshore Western Australia have raised concerns over potential operational disruptions, particularly as the facility has not loaded a cargo in 14 days.
Author: CK

Title: PVGas reissues tender for four March-May LNG cargoes
Description: Vietnam's state-owned gas distributor PVGas has reissued a tender from earlier this month, seeking four LNG cargoes across March to May for its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal, closing Jan. 23.
Author: JS

Title: Second FSRU at Wilhelmshaven takes priority as Stade unit commissioning delayed indefinitely
Description: German state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal (DET) has announced it has indefinitely postponed the commissioning of the 174,000 m3 Energos Force floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to prioritize the start-up of a second unit at the Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: FLNG Gimi receives first gas from the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim field
Description: Golar LNG said that its floating LNG unit Gimi received the first gas from the floating production storage and offloading (FPSO) on the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritania, marking the start of the project's full commissioning.
Author: JS

Title: Federal approval process underway for Woodside’s North West Shelf project extension
Description: The Australian federal government’s approval process for Australian independent Woodside Energy’s North West Shelf project is underway, following the Western Australian government’s environmental approval to enable the project to continue the long-term processing North West Shelf Joint Venture field resources and third-party gas resources through the Karratha Gas Plant.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada’s first phase nears completion, first cargoes on the “near horizon”
Description: The Shell-led LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia is nearing completion of its 14 mtpa first phase, a significant step for Canada’s first LNG export facility and its emergence as a global LNG exporter.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside still eyes final investment decision on Louisiana LNG from first quarter of this year
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy continues to expect it will take a final investment decision on its Louisiana LNG project from the first quarter of this year
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG forced to shut down all three trains due to power outage
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas was forced offline yesterday after a power outage tripped all its three liquefaction trains.
Author: CK

Title: Indian firms ink initial deal with YPF to export LNG from Argentina
Description: India’s ONGC, GAIL, and ONGC Videsh have signed a memorandum of understanding with Argentina’s YPF to export up to 10 mtpa of LNG from the proposed Argentina LNG project, which will primarily source gas from the Vaca Muerta shale formation.
Author: CK

Title: Pluto Train 2 project still on track to ship first LNG cargo in 2026
Description: Woodside Energy’s Pluto Train 2 project is still on track to ship its first LNG cargo in 2026, with it and the Scarborough Energy project 78% complete at the end of December.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG to remain shut until power supply stabilises
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant in Texas remains offline following a power outage that tripped all its three liquefaction trains early on Jan. 21.
Author: CK

Title: Santos, Tamboran Resources eye Darwin LNG expansion
Description: Australia-headquartered Tamboran Resources Corporation and Santos have inked a non-binding memorandum of understanding to undertake technical studies to potentially expand the 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG with a second train, utilising the resources co-owned by the firms in the Beetaloo Basin.
Author: JS

Title: Technical issue takes Alexandroupolis LNG import terminal offline
Description: LNG terminal operator Gastrade has taken its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit-based import terminal in Greece offline due to a technical issue.
Author: CK

Title: Santos’ Barossa gas project nears final stages; on track for first LNG in third-quarter 2025
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos’ Barossa gas project was 88.3% complete as of December and remains on track for first LNG production in  the third quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Snam commits about 90% of 12.4 billion euro strategic plan investment to gas, LNG projects
Description: Italy’s leading gas transport operator Snam will invest 12.4 billion euros under its 2025-2029 Strategic Plan, focusing 90% on gas and LNG infrastructure, and the rest on energy transition projects, building on initiatives launched in response to the energy crisis of the past two years and aiming to enhance energy security across Europe.
Author: CK

Title: NFE signs gas supply deal with Energiza in Puerto Rico
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has inked a 20-year gas supply agreement with Energiza to provide natural gas to a 478 MW combined-cycle power plant being developed in Puerto Rico, adjacent to NFE’s existing 1.1 mtpa San Juan LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG shutdown delays loadings; ships at anchorage waiting to load
Description: A power outage that shut down all three liquefaction trains at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant earlier this week has delayed cargo loadings, with several LNG vessels waiting at anchorage.
Author: CK

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG import terminal resumes regasification services
Description: The Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG import terminal in Greece has resumed regasification services after halting operations on Jan. 23 due to a technical issue.
Author: CK

Title: US will guarantee LNG supplies to Europe if deal is made: Trump
Description: US President Donald Trump said the United States would guarantee LNG supplies to Europe if a deal were agreed, addressing concerns about energy security amid fears that expanding LNG exports could raise domestic gas prices and lead to a pause on export projects.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport resumes LNG shipments as one ship departs, another berths
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG terminal, which halted operations early last week due to a power outage, has resumed shipments. One of three LNG vessels that had been waiting at anchorage has departed, while another is currently berthed for loading.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG prepares to load first cargo; LNG ship at GTA hub
Description: The BP-led Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG export project, offshore Mauritania and Senegal, is preparing to load its inaugural LNG cargo, with the British Sponsor LNG tanker now positioned near the Gimi FLNG unit at the GTA hub.
Author: CK

Title: ADNOC Gas and JERA Global Markets sign three-year LNG supply deal for $450 million
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned ADNOC Gas has signed a three-year LNG supply agreement with Japan’s JERA Global Markets, valued at $450 million, further solidifying their decades-long relationship.
Author: CK

Title: Bangladesh inks non-binding offtake deal from Argent LNG in Louisiana
Description: The government of Bangladesh has signed a non-binding heads of agreement (HOA) with Argent LNG, which is developing a 25 mtpa LNG export facility in Louisiana, to purchase up to 5 mtpa of LNG from the project for 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: EU faces refilling challenges as gas storage levels dip below 60%
Description: The strong pace of gas withdrawals this winter has pushed EU gas storage levels to a two-year low at under 60%, below their five-year average for this time of year.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG confirms restart of operations at all three liquefaction trains
Description: Freeport LNG has confirmed that the 15 mtpa facility restarted operations after a power outage halted liquefaction six days ago.
Author: JS

Title: Danish government greenlights Nord Stream pipeline preservation works
Description: The Danish Energy Agency has granted permission to Nord Stream 2 AG, Gazprom's Switzerland-based subsidiary, to carry out preservation work on the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline in the Baltic Sea, which was damaged by a series of explosions in September 2022.
Author: JS

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG terminal goes offline again
Description: LNG terminal operator Gastrade has taken its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG import terminal in Greece offline once again due to a technical issue, less than a week after bringing it back online.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas mulls decommissioning of the Sabah-Sarawak pipeline feeding Bintulu LNG
Description: Malaysian state-owned Petronas said that it plans to decommission the onshore 750 million ft3/day Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline (SSGP) within three years, nearly three months after lifting the two-year-long force majeure on the infrastructure.
Author: JS

Title: NFE looks ahead as Altamira FLNG exceeds nameplate LNG production
Description: US LNG project developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) has achieved a key milestone at its 1.4 mtpa Altamira floating LNG (FLNG) unit in Mexico, surpassing expectations by producing 120% of nameplate LNG production capacity, while also advancing plans to commission and start up its second unit in the first half of 2027.
Author: JS

Title: FERC approves commissioning Plaquemines LNG’s seventh block
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, has approved Venture Global’s request to introduce hazardous liquids to and commission the seventh block of its Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Operations at Bintulu LNG unaffected by flood: Petronas
Description: Malayasia’s state-owned energy company Petronas said that the operations at its 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG complex in Sarawak remain unaffected by severe flooding that started yesterday.
Author: JS

Title: FERC says Venture Global is nearing end of repairs delaying commercial start-up of Calcasieu Pass LNG
Description: A regulatory report showed that US-based LNG project developer Venture Global is nearing the end of repairs to the heat recovery steam generators (HRSGs), which have been delaying the start-up of the 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG export project in Louisiana by nearly three years.
Author: JS

Title: Exports from Russia’s small-scale Portovaya LNG plant stall, “shutdown imminent”: Kpler Insight
Description: Kpler's data shows that in January, shipments from Gazprom’s small-scale 1.5 mtpa Portovaya and 0.7 mtpa Vysotsk LNG plants on the Baltic coast stalled following the facilities’ inclusion in the US’s latest list of sanctioned entities, which Kpler Insight suggests will lead to the facilities’ permanent shutdown.
Author: JS

Title: Nigeria LNG exports climb to a six-month high in January amid ongoing gas pipeline sabotage
Description: LNG exports from the Nigeria LNG-operated 22.2 mtpa Bonny Island plant rose to a six-month high in January, but ongoing sabotage and vandalism on feed gas infrastructure kept output below year-ago levels.
Author: CK

Title: Azerbaijan’s SOCAR acquires 10% stake in Israel’s Tamar gas field
Description: Azerbaijan’s state-owned energy company SOCAR has acquired a 10% stake in the 10.2 billion m3/year Tamar gas field offshore Israel from Israel’s Union Energy, giving it a foothold in the upstream sector in the Mediterranean Sea.
Author: JS

Title: Trump Administration imposes tariffs on Canada, Mexico, China; Canadian energy exports partially spared
Description: US President Donald Trump has imposed import tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China, with a 25% levy on Canadian and Mexican imports and a 10% duty on Chinese goods, while Canadian energy imports face a reduced 10% tariff due to US reliance.
Author: JS

Title: Origin Energy lowers APLNG FY25 production outlook amid weaker field performance
Description: Origin Energy, the upstream operator of the 9 mtpa Australia Pacific LNG (APLNG) plant, has revised its FY25 production guidance for the plant to 670–690 PJ for the 2025 financial year, down from 685–710 PJ, citing weaker-than-expected well optimization at key gas fields and unplanned maintenance at non-operated assets.
Author: CK

Title: China to impose 15% tariff on US LNG and coal  in retaliatory move
Description: China has announced plans to impose a 15% tariff on US LNG and coal imports starting Feb. 10, as part of a broader package of tariffs on US imports. The move is in direct response to the US government’s recent decision to impose a 10% tariff on all Chinese exports to the US, effective Feb. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Gulf Energy, Hin Kong seek three March LNG cargoes for Thailand
Description: Thailand’s private power producers, Gulf Energy and Hin Kong, have issued tenders seeking a total of three LNG cargoes for delivery in March to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal. Both tenders are set to close on Feb. 6.
Author: CK

Title: Petrobangla floats two tenders for delivery in February-March
Description: Bangladesh’s state-owned oil and gas agency Petrobangla has floated two LNG purchase tenders for two cargoes with delivery windows in February and March. Both tenders close on Feb. 9.
Author: JS

Title: Wison New Energies breaks ground on new shipyard
Description: China’s Wison New Energies has started the construction of a new shipyard in Qidong in the Lusi Port Economic Development Zone, which will help it expand the provision of engineering, procurement, construction, installation, and commissioning (EPCIC) solutions to the LNG market.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside calls for swifter Australian government action to bring new gas supplies online
Description: Woodside Energy Chief Executive Meg O’Neill has called for swifter Australian government action to expedite new gas developments, warning that prolonged regulatory delays could undermine Australia’s energy security and weaken its competitiveness in global energy markets, including LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Australian LNG-laden tanker en route to Europe for the first time since 2022
Description: The Elisa Ardea LNG tanker is signalling an arrival at France’s Dunkerque LNG terminal after loading cargo at Australia’s Wheatstone plant, for the second time in recent years.
Author: JS

Title: Supply woes intensify as EU gas storage volumes slip below 50%
Description: European natural gas prices rose to a two-year high as colder temperatures have accelerated gas demand for heating and accelerated the depletion of the region’s storage facilities to being below 50% full.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche ReGas ends Energos Power FSRU sub-charter
Description: Deutsche ReGas has terminated its sub-charter contract with the German government for the Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at the Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project achieves first LNG output: Kosmos Energy
Description: The BP-operated 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project on the maritime border of Mauritania and Senegal has produced its first LNG, with the first cargo expected to be exported this quarter, marking both countries' entry into the global LNG market.
Author: CK

Title: First LNG ship in months crosses Bab el-Mandeb Strait as ceasefire opens Red Sea routes
Description: The Salalah LNG tanker has transited the Red Sea and is now heading toward the Suez Canal, becoming the first LNG vessel in months to cross the Bab el-Mandeb Strait following a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship diverts from Greece's Alexandroupolis LNG terminal to Turkey as regasification services stay offline
Description: The 154,800 m3 Gaslog Savannah LNG tanker, originally scheduled to arrive at the Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit import terminal in Greece, has diverted to Turkey due to ongoing technical issues that have kept regasification services offline since Jan. 23.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada begins new flaring activity as it moves towards first LNG exports
Description: A new flaring activity has begun at the Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada export project in Kitimat, British Columbia, as it continues its commissioning process and moves closer towards the start of first LNG exports.
Author: CK

Title: Baltic states integrate with European grid, ending Russian electricity ties
Description: Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia have aligned their electricity systems with the Continental European Synchronous Area, permanently disconnecting from Russia and Belarus.
Author: CK

Title: British Sponsor discharges a partial cargo at Huelva after leaving GTA FLNG
Description: The 173,400 m³ British Sponsor LNG tanker has discharged a partial cargo at Spain's Huelva LNG terminal, after departing from the yet-to-start 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility, located on the maritime border of Mauritania and Senegal.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports climb in January as US shipments dominate
Description: European LNG imports surged in January, reaching their highest levels in nearly a year, boosted by US volumes, as colder temperatures and depleting natural gas reserves drove demand for additional supplies.
Author: JS

Title: Plaquemines LNG gets regulatory nod to commission its eighth liquefaction block
Description: The Venture Global-operated Plaquemines LNG export facility in the US has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission  to introduce feed gas into its eighth liquefaction block and boil-off gas compressor, further advancing the newly started project’s commissioning process.
Author: CK

Title: Prelude FLNG goes a month without cargo loadings, raising operational concerns
Description: The Shell-operated 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG plant offshore Western Australia has not loaded an LNG cargo since Jan. 9, suggesting an ongoing operational issue at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Another sanctioned Russian tanker offloads LNG from Arctic LNG 2 into floating storage
Description: East Energy has become the next sanctioned LNG tanker to discharge LNG from the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project into the Kamchatka floating storage unit (FSU), five months after loading cargo from the sanctioned plant.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC Gas signs agreement to supply IndianOil with 1.2 mtpa of LNG commencing in 2026
Description: ADNOC Gas has announced a 14-year sales and purchase agreement with IndianOil to supply up to 1.2 mtpa of LNG.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies to supply with 0.4 mtpa of LNG to India’s GSPC from 2026
Description: France’s TotalEnergies has signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement to supply India’s state-owned Gujarat State Petroleum Corporation Limited (GSPC) with 0.4 mtpa of LNG for a 10-year period commencing in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt to deploy third FSRU at Ain Sukhna to cover LNG demand in June-November
