Description: Egypt and Turkey have signed a deal for a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to be deployed at Egypt's Ain Sukhna LNG terminal to cover peak summer demand, with the 170,000 m3 Ertugrul Gazi, currently deployed at Turkey's 4.1 mtpa Dortyol terminal, the most likely contender.
Author: JS

Title: Golar announces exit from LNG shipping market with sale of its last LNG tanker
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG has announced the exit from the LNG shipping segment with the sale of the Golar Arctic LNG tanker, as it begins its transition to an FLNG infrastructure-focused company.
Author: JS

Title: Dampier port shut ahead of Cyclone Zelia landfall, LNG loadings likely affected
Description: The Pilbara Ports Authority, operating several ports in Western Australia, has closed the Dampier ports, hosting the 4.9 mtpa Pluto and 16.4 mtpa NWS LNG plants,  from today onwards and until further notice, as the region braces for tropical cyclone Zelia due to make landfall tonight.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports reach second-highest level on record in January
Description: US LNG exports reached their second-highest level on record in January, with shipments from the newly started Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana boosting overall volumes.
Author: CK

Title: Mauritania expects GTA FLNG exports to begin by end-February
Description: The 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project, located on the maritime border between Mauritania and Senegal, is set to export its first LNG cargo by the end of this month, according to Mauritania’s minister of Energy and Petroleum Mohamed Ould Khaled.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Inpex targets Abadi LNG FID by 2027, eyes third Ichthys LNG train in first-half 2030s
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex plans to take a final investment decision by 2027 on its 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project in eastern Indonesia as part of its mid-term 2025-2027 business plan to expand its gas and LNG portfolio. It expects LNG production ito begin in the early 2030s.
Author: CK

Title: India’s BPCL signs up for long-term LNG supplies from Adnoc Trading
Description: India’s state-owned refiner Bharat Petroleum has signed a long-term agreement to buy LNG from Adnoc Trading, the trading arm of Abu Dhabi’s state-owned energy firm Adnoc.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG gets conditional non-FTA export approval; eyes FID in September
Description: The US Department of Energy has granted a conditional non-free trade agreement export authorization to the Kimmeridge Energy-backed Commonwealth LNG project in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, marking the first such approval since the Trump administration ended the Biden-Harris pause on LNG export permits.
Author: CK

Title: British Sponsor heads for GTA FLNG to load export hub's first cargo
Description: The British Sponsor LNG carrier has started to signal its arrival at the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) floating LNG export project offshore Mauritania and Senegal, which might indicate an imminent commissioning cargo loading from the facility.
Author: JS

Title: LNG tanker calls at Prelude FLNG potentially ending shipment halt
Description: The 145,000 m3 Symphonic Breeze LNG tanker has arrived at Shell’s 3.6 mtpa Prelude floating LNG facility offshore Western Australia, potentially paving the way for the first LNG shipment from the plant since early January.
Author: CK

Title: Gastrade extends Alexandroupolis FSRU outage to end-February
Description: LNG terminal operator Gastrade has extended the outage at ts 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage and regasification unit  terminal amid an ongoing technical issue preventing it from providing regasification services.
Author: CK

Title: Golar’s Fuji LNG tanker berths at Yantai for FLNG conversion
Description: Golar’s Fuji LNG tanker has berthed at the Yantai CIMC Raffles shipyard in China’s Shandong province, where it will be converted into a 3.5 mtpa MK II floating LNG unit, expanding global liquefaction capacity upon completion.
Author: CK

Title: Second LNG tanker traverses Red Sea route this month
Description: The Trader III LNG tanker has transited the Suez Canal and is now heading southward via the Red Sea. Following a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza, it will become the second LNG vessel to cross the route this month.
Author: JS

Title: Governments of Cyprus, Egypt, and Aphrodite field partners sign MoU for gas export
Description: The Cypriot government, Cyprus Hydrocarbons Company (CHC), the Egyptian government, Egyptian national gas company EGAS, and the partners in the 4.3 trillion m³ Aphrodite gas field have signed a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to advance negotiations on exporting gas from Aphrodite to Egypt, including the necessary transmission infrastructure and sales agreements.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global’s Calcasieu Pass to start commercial operations in mid-April
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has notified long-term offtakers at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana that commercial operations will begin on Apr. 15.
Author: CK

Title: Eni, TotalEnergies sign deal to bring Cypriot gas to feed Egypt’s Damietta LNG
Description: TotalEnergies and Eni, partners in Cyprus offshore Block 6, have signed a host government agreement (HGA) with the governments of Egypt and Cyprus related to the development of gas resources and their export to Egypt for liquefaction into LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Oman LNG inks 10-year deal with Mercuria to supply 0.8 mtpa of LNG
Description: Oman LNG, which operates the 11.4 mtpa Qalhat LNG plant, has announced that it signed a 10-year sales and purchase agreement  with Switzerland-based trading firm Mercuria.
Author: JS

Title: Singapore’s LNG bunker fuel sales fall sharply in January
Description: Singapore’s sales of LNG as bunker fuel fell sharply in January compared to December and a year earlier, according to data from the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore.
Author: CK

Title: Tokyo Gas takes 20% stake in Philippines terminal owner FGen LNG
Description: Tokyo Gas has acquired a 20% stake in the Philippines’ FGen LNG, the operator of the 5.3 mtpa FGen Batangas floating LNG terminal in southern Luzon. The investment marks the Japanese utility’s first equity participation in an operational LNG terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Santos’ Barossa gas project nears completion, supporting 3Q 2025 first gas target
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos has reached 91% completion on its Barossa gas project offshore Darwin, Northern Territory, reinforcing its target for first gas production in the third quarter of this year.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Seventh Energy Plan: renewables, nuclear lead 2040 targets, LNG supports stability
Description: Japan’s Cabinet has approved the Seventh Basic Energy Plan, with METI publishing revised energy mix targets through 2040 that increase the share of renewables and nuclear power, while continuing to rely on LNG for energy security and supply stability.
Author: CK

Title: EU needs more regulatory oversight on flexible gas storage targets: Kpler Insight
Description: The European Commission should introduce greater regulatory oversight on storage refilling targets, Kpler Insight suggests, following a leaked draft document indicating that the Commission is considering softer targets.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Power FSRU anchors off German coast after end of sub-charter with federal government
Description: The Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has left the 9.9 mtpa Deutsche Ostsee LNG import terminal in Mukran following Deutsche Regas's termination of its sub-charter agreement with the German federal government.
Author: JS

Title: BW Singapore heads to Spain to load cooldown cargo ahead of deployment at Ravenna as FSRU
Description: The BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has left Siciliy and is signalling arrival at Spain’s Cartagena LNG terminal to reload LNG and cool down its tanks ahead of its start-up as a floating import terminal in Ravenna.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere produces, ships first LNG cargo from Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion project
Description: Cheniere said that it achieved first LNG production at its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 liquefaction project and shipped first cargo.
Author: JS

Title: FERC greelights increase in maximum liquefaction capacity at Plaquemines LNG from 24 mtpa to 27.2 mtpa
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has granted approval to Venture Global’s request to increase the Plaquemines LNG’s maximum authorised liquefaction production capacity to 27.2 mtpa, from the previous 24 mtpa.
Author: JS

Title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel seeks 30 LNG cargoes over five years
Description: Indian steelmaker ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel is seeking 30 LNG cargoes for delivery to India’s west coast over five years starting in 2026. The tender closes on Feb. 27.
Author: CK

Title: Chhara LNG looks set to receive first commercial cargo from Qatar this month
Description: The QatarEnergy-controlled Ejnan LNG tanker is making its way to HPCL’s 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in Gujarat, India, with its arrival scheduled in  five days marking the delivery of the terminal’s first commercial cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa set to launch LNG tender to meet 2025 supply needs
Description: State-owned Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, is preparing to issue a tender soon to secure LNG cargoes for delivery to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar terminal this year, with traders expecting the tender to be launched by the end of this month and initial deliveries beginning in March. Enarsa plans to receive a total of 25 cargoes at Escobar in 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Centrica inks 15-year supply agreement with Petrobras for 0.8 mtpa of LNG
Description: UK’s Centrica has entered into a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with Brazil’s state-owned Petrobras for the supply of 0.8 of LNG for 15 years, commencing in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Tokyo Gas mulls stake sale in US shale gas project to Shizuoka Gas
Description: Japan’s largest city gas supplier, Tokyo Gas, has inked a memorandum of understanding with Shizuoka Gas to sell a 25% stake in an Eagle Ford shale gas project in south Texas for $130 million.
Author: JS

Title: British Sponsor LNG tanker arrives at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG to await first LNG load
Description: The BP-controlled British Sponsor LNG tanker has arrived at the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility on the maritime border between Mauritania and Senegal to await the loading of the new terminal’s inaugural LNG cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen seeks one April LNG cargo for its Batangas terminal
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen is seeking one LNG cargo for delivery to its  5.3 mtpa FGen Batangas LNG terminal on Apr. 7-11 through a tender closing on Mar. 5.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s private power producer Hin Kong seeks one April LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s private power producer Hin Kong has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on Apr. 19-20 to the PTT-operated Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Feb. 25.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project to export its first LNG cargo today: Mauritania
Description: The BP-operated 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal is set to export its first LNG cargo today, debuting both countries as global LNG exporters, according to Mauritania’s energy minister Mohamed Ould Khaled.
Author: CK

Title: Oman’s Sohar Port and Freezone begins dredging operations for Marsa LNG bunkering project
Description: The Sohar Port and Freezone in Oman has started dredging operations for the 1 mtpa Marsa LNG project, set to become the first LNG bunkering project in the Middle East.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand to receive first China LNG re-export of the year in February
Description: Thailand is set to receive its first LNG re-export cargo from China this year, with the Greenergy Ocean LNG tanker expected to deliver to the PTT-operated Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong on Feb. 27.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG preparing first LNG cargo for loading: Kosmos Energy
Description: The BP-controlled British Sponsor LNG tanker has moved alongside Gimi, the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG unit, signalling that the BP-operated 2.5 mtpa project is ready to load its inaugural cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG yet to load first cargo; LNG tanker idles nearby
Description: The BP-operated 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project located on the maritime border between Mauritania and Senegal has not yet shipped its first cargo, despite an announcement by Mauritania’s energy minister that this would occur on Feb. 22.
Author: CK

Title: EU to fund gas purchases for Ukraine, boosting energy resilience
Description: The European Commission has agreed to fund gas purchases for Ukraine as part of a new support package designed to stabilize the country’s energy system and integrate it into the European energy market by 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside eyes first LNG cargo from Pluto Train 2 in the second half of 2026
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside Energy expects to produce the first LNG cargo from the second train under construction at its existing Pluto LNG project in Western Australia in the second half of next year, according to Chief Executive Meg O’Neill.
Author: CK

Title: Australia extends environmental approval deadline for North West Shelf Project Extension
Description: The Australian federal government has extended the deadline to decide whether to approve Woodside Energy’s North West Shelf Project Extension under national environment law to the end of March, a critical step towards prolonging the ageing project's lifespan.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Chhara LNG terminal receives its first commercial cargo
Description: The HPCL-operated 5 mtpa Chhara LNG terminal in India has received its first commercial LNG cargo since completing commissioning operations last month.
Author: CK

Title: Shell expects global LNG demand to surge 60% by 2040
Description: Shell said in an annual report on Tuesday that global demand for LNG is estimated to rise by around 60% by 2040, driven mainly by economic growth in Asia, the impacts of artificial intelligence, and efforts to cut emissions in heavy industries and transportation.
Author: JS

Title: Sempra mulls FID on Port Arthur LNG's Phase 2 this year
Description: US energy company Sempra expects to make a final investment decision (FID) on the second phase of its Port Arthur LNG export plant in Texas this year, as regulatory challenges for Phase 1 keep diminishing.
Author: JS

Title: BP agrees deal with Iraq to redevelop oil, gas fields
Description: BP has reached an agreement with Iraq to rehabilitate and redevelop the Kirkuk oil and gas fields, with work expected to begin in 2025 pending final government approval. The project aims to boost natural gas output alongside oil production.
Author: CK

Title: Salalah LNG tanker completes second Red Sea crossing since Gaza ceasefire
Description: The Salalah LNG tanker has crossed the Red Sea and the Bab el-Mandab Strait for the second time since the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas to suspend the conflict in Gaza came into effect, making it only the second LNG vessel to navigate the area so far.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass LNG gets FERC nod to re-introduce hazardous fluids to final generator
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has secured approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to reintroduce hazardous fluids to the fifth and final heat recovery steam generator at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass LNG plant in Louisiana, moving closer to a planned mid-April start of commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: EU Commission proposes joint LNG purchasing and investment in global export projects
Description: The European Commission has unveiled the Affordable Energy Action Plan, aiming to reduce energy costs across the EU and accelerate decarbonisation by aggregating LNG demand with reliable suppliers and investing in LNG export infrastructure abroad.
Author: JS

Title: Tepco delays construction schedule for Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear units, pushing back restart
Description: Japanese utility Tokyo Electric Power Co., or Tepco, has postponed the construction schedule for power supply equipment at its idle Units 6 and 7 of the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant in Niigata Prefecture, further delaying the restart of these two units.
Author: CK

Title: Golar LNG mulls fourth FLNG unit construction
Description: Floating LNG solutions player Golar LNG said it will take a final investment decision (FID) on its fourth floating LNG unit under construction after it secures a charter agreement.
Author: JS

Title: Two sanctioned Russian LNG tankers spotted in close proximity in the Mediterranean
Description: The laden Metagas Energy and the ballast Mulan LNG tankers have been spotted next to each other in the East Mediterranean, raising questions about whether the vessels are preparing for a ship-to-ship LNG transfer of a cargo lifted from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas, Eni plan joint venture to boost regional LNG growth
Description: Malaysian state-owned Petronas and Italy’s Eni have signed an exclusive memorandum of understanding to form a joint venture holding company to manage selected upstream assets in Malaysia and Indonesia, aiming to bolster their LNG footprint in Southeast Asia.
Author: CK

Title: Osaka Gas agrees on 0.8 mtpa long-term LNG supply deal with Adnoc
Description: Japanese utility Osaka Gas has agreed to buy 0.8 mtpa of LNG from Abu Dhabi’s state-owned Adnoc, with deliveries expected to start in 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate Energy to buy an LNG ship this year for first FSRU conversion, expanding fleet
Description: Floating LNG infrastructure provider Excelerate Energy  plans to acquire an LNG carrier this year for its first floating storage regasification unit conversion, further expanding its fleet.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada to receive LNG cargo in April for commissioning
Description: LNG Canada is set to receive its first LNG cargo in early April at its terminal in Kitimat, British Columbia, as part of equipment testing ahead of its anticipated start-up and first LNG production by mid-2025.
Author: JS

Title: BW Singapore FSRU moors at Ravenna, first import cargo in March
Description: Italy’s gas transmission system and LNG terminal operator Snam said its 170,000 m3 BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has completed mooring offshore Ravenna, with the first cargo receipt expected in March.
Author: JS

Title: European LNG imports decline in February
Description: European imports of LNG were lower in February month-on-month, led by a fallback in exports from the main supplier, the US, and marginal supplier, Nigeria.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor’s Snohvit LNG plant to shut operations for four days for maintenance
Description: Norway’s Equinor said it will shut its 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG plant on Melkoya Island in Norway for planned maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Gastrade extends  Alexandroupolis FSRU outage until end-March
Description: LNG terminal operator Gastrade has extended the outage at its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit terminal in Greece by a month, pushing the anticipated restart to the end of March. The terminal’s regasification services have been offline since February 23.
Author: CK

Title: GTA FLNG loads partial cargo on British Sponsor; laden tanker idles near hub
Description: The BP-operated Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project has loaded a partial LNG cargo on the BP-controlled 173,400 m3 British Sponsor LNG tanker, marking a milestone for the new project that sits on the maritime border between Mauritania and Senegal, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines LNG ramps up exports in February as final Phase 1 trains start operations
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG export plant in Louisiana increased its shipments in February, continuing its ramp-up after exporting its first cargo in December.
Author: CK

Title: Snam completes purchase of Edison Stoccaggio, expanding its gas storage capacity
Description: Italy’s gas transport operator Snam has completed its acquisition of Edison Stoccaggio, strengthening its position in gas storage and boosting its total capacity to about 18 billion m3, including 4.5 billion m3 of strategic reserve. This represents more than 17% of European gas storage capacity, reinforcing Snam’s role in ensuring energy security for Italy and Europe.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports dip in February; shipments to Europe fall for the first time in six months
Description: US LNG exports edged lower in February, with shipments to Europe falling for the first time in six months, while exports to Asia and Latin America saw modest gains.
Author: CK

Title: China's LNG imports fall to their lowest level in almost five years
Description: China’s LNG imports fell to their lowest level in almost five years in February 2024, with this marking a second consecutive month of declining imports after December, the second-highest LNG import volume for China last year.
Author: CK

Title: Vitol agrees to supply 0.8 mtpa of LNG over 10 years to Philippines LNG
Description: Vitol has agreed to supply 0.8 mtpa of LNG to the Philippines LNG terminal in Batangas over the next 10 years, supporting the country’s growing energy needs and enhancing supply stability.
Author: CK

Title: Ireland approves development of  first LNG import terminal for emergency gas reserve
Description: Ireland has approved the development of a state-led floating storage and regasification unit to serve as a strategic gas emergency reserve, ensuring energy security as the country transitions to renewable energy. The move paves the way for the development of Ireland’s first LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine boosts gas imports amid infrastructure attacks, explores LNG as alternative supply
Description: Ukraine has ramped up gas imports in recent weeks, driven by Russian attacks on domestic infrastructure last month, which have increased the country’s reliance on supplies from neighboring European states, according to Ukraine’s Gas Transmission System Operator.
Author: CK

Title: Palu LNG delivers reloaded cargo from Alexandroupolis to Turkey’s Ereglisi
Description: The 159,760 m3 Palu LNG tanker has delivered a re-exported cargo to Turkey’s 4.6 mtpa Ereglisi terminal in Marmara from the 4 mtpa Gastrade-operated LNG receiving terminal in Greece, where regasification services have halted since Jan. 23.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Mitsui OSK. Lines completes first LNG bunkering in Canada
Description: Japanese shipper Mitsui OSK. Lines has completed its first LNG bunkering operation in Western North America, marking the first LNG bunkering for a car carrier in the region.
Author: CK

Title: US Department of Energy grants export permit extension for Golden Pass LNG
Description: The US Department of Energy has approved an LNG export permit extension for the 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG terminal, currently under construction in Sabine Pass, Texas. The extension provides additional time for the project to begin LNG exports.
Author: CK

Title: European Commission proposes extending EU gas storage regulation until 2027
Description: The European Commission has proposed extending the EU’s gas storage regulation until 2027 to ensure energy security amid geopolitical tensions and volatile global gas markets.
Author: CK

Title: Feedgas pipelines restored after sabotage, five liquefaction trains now operational: Nigeria LNG
Description: The pipelines feeding gas to the 22.2 mtpa Nigeria LNG plant on Bonny Island have been restored following recent acts of sabotage and vandalism, enabling five of the six liquefaction trains at the LNG plant to operate.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global initiates FID process for CP2 LNG’s Phase 1
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global is launching the process for taking a final investment decision on its third LNG export project in Louisiana, CP2, for which it aims to begin LNG production in mid-2027.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt receives 14 LNG cargoes in 2025, imports expected to exceed 2024 levels
Description: Egypt has received 14 LNG cargoes so far in 2025 and may import around 85 in total this year, a sharp rise from 2024, when it resumed LNG imports after a six-year hiatus, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global plans 18 mtpa expansion at Plaquemines LNG
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has announced plans to expand its Plaquemines LNG facility in Louisiana by over 18 mtpa, bringing its total expected capacity to more than 45 mtpa amid rising global LNG demand.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz, Poland’s Orlen sign initial gas cooperation deal, agree on LNG supply
Description: Ukraine’s state-owned Naftogaz and Poland’s Orlen have signed a memorandum of cooperation, marking a strategic partnership to diversify Ukraine’s gas supply routes and bolster energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine’s DTEK halts gas operations after Russian strikes, Odesa grid hit again
Description: Ukraine’s largest private gas producer DTEK has halted operations at its gas production facilities in the country’s Poltava region following attacks by Russian forces on Mar. 7.
Author: CK

Title: Delfin Energy secures US Department of Energy LNG export permit extension
Description: The US Department of Energy has granted Delfin LNG an extension on its LNG export permit, allowing it additional time to begin exports from its proposed floating LNG facility offshore Louisiana’s Delfin Deepwater Port. The approval had been delayed under the previous administration.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tanker diverts from Aqaba, raising questions about Egypt’s LNG demand
Description: An LNG tanker originally scheduled to call at Jordan’s Aqaba terminal on Mar. 10 has altered course and is now expected to head towards the Indian Ocean, leaving its intended delivery in question.
Author: CK

Title: EU Commissioner reaffirms commitment to phasing out Russian gas
Description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen reaffirmed the EU's commitment to eliminating Russian gas during a press conference on March 9 marking the first 100 days of the Commission’s 2024-2029 term.
Author: CK

Title: No US LNG arrivals in China since tariff imposition, buyers adjust strategies
Description: One month after China imposed a 15% tariff on US LNG shipments on Feb. 10, no LNG cargoes have arrived in the country—raising questions about how market players are adjusting their strategies in the wake of the new measure.
Author: CK

Title: Last cargo from Russia's sanctioned Portovaya LNG terminal remains undelivered
Description: The last LNG cargo loaded at Russia’s 1.5 mtpa Portovaya terminal in mid-February remains undelivered, underscoring the challenges sanctioned Russian LNG terminals face in securing buyers.
Author: CK

Title: ARC Resources to supply ExxonMobil with LNG from Canada’s Cedar LNG project
Description: Canadian gas producer ARC Resources has signed a long-term sale and purchase agreement with ExxonMobil LNG Asia Pacific, an affiliate of ExxonMobil, to supply LNG from the planned 3.3 mtpa Cedar LNG project in Kitimat, British Columbia.
Author: CK

Title: PV Gas to expand LNG capacity at Thi Vai this month, plans to install an FSRU at Vung Tau
Description: State-owned PetroVietnam GAS will expand regasification capacity at its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG terminal in Vietnam’s Ba Ria-Vung Tau province this month, with this aimed at bolstering power supply amid declining domestic gas production.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade and Baker Hughes enter framework agreement for Rio Grande LNG expansion
Description: US project developer NextDecade has signed a framework agreement with Baker Hughes for the  supply of advanced gas turbine and refrigerant compressor technology, as well as long-term maintenance services, for Trains 4 through 8 at its Rio Grande LNG facility in Brownsville, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT seeks an additional April LNG cargo
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to purchase an LNG cargo for delivery to its Map Ta Phut terminal in Rayong on Apr. 25-26. The tender closes on Mar. 13.
Author: CK

Title: Kpler Insight: Russia-Ukraine peace deal unlikely to revive gas flows in the near term
Description: Ukraine’s acceptance of a 30-day ceasefire proposal to halt hostilities with Russia could lay the groundwork for a broader peace deal. However, Kpler Insight expects Russian gas transit via Ukraine to remain minimal or non-existent in the short term, even if an agreement is reached.
Author: CK

Title: Australian LNG cargo seen heading to Kitimat; likely for LNG Canada cooldown
Description: The 173,400 m3 Maran Gas Roxana LNG tanker, carrying a cargo from Australia’s Queensland Curtis LNG terminal, appears to be heading to Canada’s Kitimat port, raising expectations that it is delivering an LNG cooldown cargo for the yet-to-start Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project.
Author: CK

Title: Corpus Christi LNG project gets FERC nod for its Trains 8 and 9 expansion
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has approved Cheniere’s request to construct two additional midscale liquefaction trains at its Corpus Christi LNG terminal in Texas, expanding its overall liquefaction capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Power among possible FSRU options to be deployed in Egypt this summer
Description: The 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit has emerged as one of the potential FSRUs to be deployed in Egypt this summer to meet the country’s increased demand during the peak season, with talks ongoing between Egyptian and German government officials, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria LNG exports poised to recover in March after pipeline sabotage in February
Description: LNG exports from Nigeria’s 22.2 mtpa Bonny Island plant are set to rebound in March following sabotage on feed gas pipelines that forced four of six liquefaction trains offline in February.
Author: CK

Title: Unplanned outage at South Korea’s Shin-Hanul No. 2 reactor could spur LNG demand if extended
Description: The recent unplanned shutdown of South Korea’s 1.4 GW Shin-Hanul No. 2 reactor has removed power generation capacity temporarily and could encourage additional spot LNG demand to compensate for the loss especially if the reactor faces an extended outage.
Author: CK

Title: Croatia completes pipeline to raise Krk LNG’s send-out capacity
Description: Croatian gas transmission system operator Plinacro has completed the Zlobin-Bosiljevo pipeline, which accommodates Krk LNG terminal’s increase in send-out capacity from 2.4 billion m3/year to 3.5 billion m3/year.
Author: JS

Title: Excelerate, PV Gas agree to collaborate on LNG supply for Vietnam
Description: Excelerate Energy has signed a memorandum of understanding with Vietnam’s state-owned PV Gas to collaborate on securing LNG supply from the US, with deliveries potentially starting as early as 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG nears first LNG export as British Sponsor returns to berthing area
Description: The British Sponsor LNG tanker has returned to the berthing zone of the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project, suggesting it may be preparing for a second loading that could complete the BP-led project’s first full cargo and mark its first LNG export.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor starts up production at new gas field for export to Europe
Description: Norway’s state-owned Equinor has started up production at the Halten East offshore gas field in the Norwegian Sea, which aims to meet the demand for Norwegian pipeline gas especially in Europe.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere achieves substantial completion of first train of Corpus Christi Stage 3
Description: Cheniere said that it achieved “substantial completion” of the first of seven trains of the 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 (CCL Stage 3) expansion project, less than a month after the announcement of shipping the project’s first LNG cargo.
Author: JS

Title: OLT Offshore’s FSRU in Toscana to operate until 2044 following life extension works
Description: Italy’s 135,000 m3 FSRU Toscana will operate until the end of 2044 due to life extension work carried out on the vessel last year during the seven-month maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside signs 15-year LNG supply deal with China Resources Gas
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has agreed to supply China Resources Gas International with 0.6 mtpa of LNG over 15 years, starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s Stade LNG terminal faces further delays, commissioning slips to mid-year
Description: The commissioning of Germany’s Stade LNG terminal is now expected to be delayed until mid-2025, as key infrastructure work remains unfinished, according to Deutsche Energy Terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt aims to boost energy output this summer; LNG imports still set to rise year-on-year
Description: Egypt is ramping up efforts to increase energy production as part of preparations for rising demand this summer, according to a recent social media post from the country’s Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources.
Author: CK

Title: Titan completes first LNG and bio-LNG bunkering for Japan’s MOL at Zeebrugge
Description: Netherlands-based Titan Clean Fuels has completed its first LNG and bio-LNG bunkering operation for Japan’s Mitsui OSK Lines at Belgium’s Zeebrugge port, supplying the shipping company’s LNG-fuelled vehicle carriers.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz procures additional LNG from Poland’s Orlen
Description: Ukraine’s state-owned Naftogaz procured an additional 100 million m3 of LNG from Poland’s Orlen, a little over a week after confirming the initial supply.
Author: JS

Title: US DOE issues export permit to Venture Global’s C2 project
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has received approval from the US Department of Energy to export LNG to non-FTA countries for its third project, the 20 mtpa CP2 LNG in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Eni sells 30% interest in Congo FLNG to Vitol
Description: Italy’s Eni has agreed to sell interests in its assets in Africa, including a stake in the 0.7 mtpa Congo FLNG project it operates, to Vitol for an aggregate consideration of $1.65 billion.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa floats 6-cargo LNG purchase tender covering winter demand
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Enarsa is seeking six cargoes for delivery between April and June to cover heating demand in the upcoming southern hemisphere summer season.
Author: JS

Title: CNTIC VPower Global is first small-scale LNG ship to cross the Red Sea this year
Description: The 28,000 m3 CNTIC VPower Global small-scale LNG carrier is poised to become the first small-scale LNG carrier to cross the Red Sea this year, even as larger LNG tankers continue to avoid the area since the outbreak of the Gaza war.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy expects Excelsior FSRU’s arrival at Wilhelmshaven in April, delaying startup
Description: German state-owned floating LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal now expects the 138,000 m3 Excelsior floating storage regasification unit, which will serve as its second LNG import terminal at Wilhelmshaven, to arrive in April, delaying its planned startup from the first quarter of this year.
Author: CK

Title: US Court of Appeals revises judgment on approval for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG project
Description: The US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia has revised its ruling on the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s authorization for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG project in Texas, allowing construction of the first five liquefaction trains to proceed, according to NextDecade.
Author: CK

Title: Germany expects Stade FSRU to be installed despite delays, citing energy security needs
Description: Germany remains committed to installing the 174,000 m³ Energos Force floating storage regasification unit at the planned Stade LNG terminal despite ongoing infrastructure delays.
Author: CK

Title: Maran Gas Roxana to deliver LNG Canada’s cooldown cargo
Description: The 173,400 m3 Maran Gas Roxana LNG tanker will deliver the cooldown cargo to the Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project ahead of its commissioning.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s Gulf Energy seeks two May LNG cargoes
Description: Thai power producer Gulf Energy has tendered for two May LNG cargoes for delivery to the Map Ta Phut terminal in Rayong. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s LNG bunker sales dip further in February after January slump
Description: Singapore’s LNG bunker fuel sales edged lower in February, extending January’s weakness, according to the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.
Author: CK

Title: Outlook for Stade LNG clouded by DET-HEH superstructure dispute and contract termination
Description: Germany’s planned Stade LNG terminal continues to face delays after the termination of contracts between operator Deutsche Energy Terminal and Hanseatic Energy Hub over an unresolved dispute regarding the completion of the terminal’s superstructure.
Author: CK

Title: Apollo Funds takes stake in BP’s TANAP subsidiary
Description: BP and Apollo Funds have announced reaching agreements for Apollo managed funds to purchase a 25% non-controlling stake in BP TANAP, a subsidiary focused on the 16.2 billion m3/year Trans-Anatolian Natural Gas Pipeline (TANAP) that carries natural gas from Azerbaijan across Turkey.
Author: JS

Title: Concerns grow over the prospect of extended maintenance at Alexandroupolis LNG
Description: Buyers are increasingly concerned that the outage at the Gastrade-operated 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis LNG terminal could stretch beyond March, limiting their ability to import cargoes at a facility that only began commercial operations six months ago.
Author: CK

Title: Germany yet to enter contract talks for Energos Power FSRU
Description: Germany is exploring options to sub-charter the 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit, previously used at the Deutsche Ostsee terminal in Mukran. However, formal contract negotiations have yet to begin, despite interest from a few parties.
Author: CK

Title: Taiwan’s CPC targets Alaska LNG for stable supply, potential investment
Description: Taiwan’s state-owned CPC Corp. is seeking to secure LNG from the Alaska LNG project and explore upstream investment opportunities to bolster the island’s energy security.
Author: CK

Title: Canada commits $200 million to Cedar LNG project
Description: The Canadian government has agreed to provide up to $200 million in funding to the Cedar LNG project, an Indigenous majority-owned planned floating liquefied natural gas facility in Kitimat, British Columbia.
Author: CK

Title: Trade supervisory board confirms Stade LNG superstructure is confirmed and approved
Description: The state trade supervisory office in Cuxhaven, Lower Saxony, has confirmed that the superstructure for the Stade floating LNG terminal—connecting the terminal’s floating storage regasification unit to the gas grid—is complete and approved, adding a new dimension to the ongoing dispute between project contractor Hanseatic Energy Hub and state-owned terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal.
Author: CK

Title: US Maritime Administration greenlights Delfin LNG project
Description: The US Maritime Administration has issued a license to Delfin LNG, authorizing the construction and operation of its proposed deepwater LNG export facility off the coast of Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG feed gas supplies affected following storm
Description: Natural gas supplies via a key metering station supplying the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG export plant in Texas have been cut today following a force majeure brought on by a lightning strike.
Author: JS

Title: EU Council suggests amendments to proposal for gas storage flexibility to mitigate price spikes
Description: The Council of the European Union has suggested amendments to a proposal to introduce flexibility in gas storage refilling deadlines, aiming to curb price volatility and ensure a stable supply of gas, particularly ahead of the winter season.
Author: CK

Title: Global gas demand hits record high in 2024, led by power consumption due to extreme weather: IEA
Description: Global natural gas demand surged to a record high in 2024, increasing by 2.7%, or 115 billion m3, with natural gas seeing the strongest growth among fossil fuels, the International Energy Agency said in its Global Energy Review report published today.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG ships cargo after unplanned outage; emissions reports signal possible restart
Description: The 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, has shipped an LNG cargo after an unplanned shutdown yesterday due to interrupted feed gas supplies, with emissions reports indicating that all three liquefaction trains are now back online.
Author: CK

Title: Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand seeks one May LNG cargo
Description: State-owned Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery on May 24-25 to the Map Ta Phut LNG receiving terminal in Rayong. The tender closes on Mar. 28.
Author: CK

Title: Delfin Midstream to supply Sefe with 1.5 mtpa of LNG for 15 years
Description: US-based LNG project developer Delfin Midstream has signed a head of agreement with Germany’s Sefe to supply it with 1.5 mtpa of LNG for at least 15 years, sourced from the proposed 13.2 mtpa Delfin FLNG export project offshore Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Seapeak Bahrain tanker signals arrival at Fujairah ahead of startup as Bahrain’s FSU
Description: The 174,000 m3 Seapeak Bahrain LNG tanker has started to signal an arrival at the UAE’s Fujairah port, nearly six months after idling offshore Malaysia and ahead of its start-up as a floating storage unit (FSU) at Bahrain’s LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz secures two loans from EBRD, Norway to fund gas purchases next winter
Description: Ukraine’s Naftograz has secured EUR410 million via the European Bank of Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) to support Ukraine’s natural gas procurement in the next two heating seasons.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global asks regulators to put the remainder of Calcasieu Pass's facilities into operation
Description: US LNG project developer Venture Global has sought approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to put the entire Calcasieu Pass LNG export facility in Louisiana into operation, the final step before starting commercial operations.
Author: JS

Title: India’s L&T to supply offshore units to QatarEnergy in its largest deal to date
Description: India-headquartered contractor Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has secured an “ultra mega” two offshore units contract for QatarEnergy’s North Field project, marking the company's most significant single contract ever.
Author: JS

Title: Flex Artemis to deliver Ravenna FSRU’s inaugural cargo
Description: The 173,400 m3 Flex Artemis LNG tanker is set to deliver Snam-owned 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG import terminal’s first LNG cargo, according to Kpler data.
Author: JS

Title: NFE offloads Jamaican assets, including LNG terminal, to Excelerate Energy
Description: US-based LNG project developer New Fortress Energy (NFE) has announced the sale of of its assets and operations in Jamaica to compatriot LNG player Excelerate Energy for over $1 billion.
Author: JS

Title: EU ban on Russian LNG transshipment unlikely to disrupt European gas market
Description: The European Union’s ban on the transshipment of Russian LNG at European ports, which takes effect today, is expected to have minimal impact on prices and the internal gas market, according to Kpler Insight.
Author: JS

Title: Extended maintenance at Alexandroupolis LNG may further boost importance of Turkey as gas supply route
Description: Gastrade, Greece’s LNG terminal operator, has extended the maintenance period of its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating LNG import terminal, delaying its restart to May 15. The prolonged outage could drive increased pipeline gas imports from Turkey, further reinforcing its importance as an alternative supply route.
Author: JS

Title: Glenfarne Group snaps up majority stake in Alaska LNG, becomes lead project developer
Description: Glenfarne Group’s subsidiary Glenfarne Alaska LNG  and the Alaska Gasline Development Corporation (AGDC) signed definitive agreements for Glenfarne to buy 75% of the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG in Nikiski, leading its development to construction and operations.
Author: JS

Title: Flaring activity at Arctic LNG 2 suggests first train restarted production
Description: Satellite data has revealed flaring activity at the Novatek-operated 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant, which might signal a restart in the plant’s operations over five months after production was stopped by mounting pressure from sanctions.
Author: JS

Title: FERC issues preliminary environmental approval for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) issued a preliminary decision supporting environmental approval for NextDecade's 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project in Texas.
Author: JS

Title: Little impact on Thailand LNG imports from earthquake as discharges continue
Description: The earthquake that struck Myanmar, which caused tremors in Thailand, has minimally impacted LNG imports to two of Thailand's import terminals, Kpler data show.
Author: JS

Title: Australia’s Viva Energy seeks FSRU for Geelong LNG import terminal
Description: Australian energy company is seeking a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) for its proposed LNG import terminal in Geelong, Australia.
Author: JS

Title: Tokyo Gas acquires majority stake in Chevron’s Haynesville upstream assets
Description: Tokyo Gas’s subsidiary TG Natural Resources (TGNR) has announced that it has closed on a transaction to acquire a 70% interest Chevron’s East Texas gas assets for $525 million
Author: JS

Title: Romania’s Romgaz seeks approval to establish subsidiary in Moldova for gas supply
Description: Romania’s state-owned gas company, Romgaz, is seeking shareholder approval to establish a subsidiary, Romgaz Furnizare M S.R.L., in Moldova. The proposed subsidiary aims to enhance Romgaz’s natural gas supply operations and expand its market share in the region.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG misses Q1 export target, British Sponsor LNG tanker idles nearby
Description: The BP-operated 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility, located on the Mauritania-Senegal border, has yet to ship its first cargo, missing a widely anticipated first-quarter 2025 export timeline.
Author: CK

Title: Angola LNG shuts down operations for unplanned maintenance, exports impacted
Description: The 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG export plant in Angola has shut down for essential maintenance, and at least five LNG tankers are idling nearby, unable to load.
Author: JS

Title: EU gas storage ends Q1 2025 below five-year average, above 2021 and 2022 levels
Description: Gas storage levels across the European Union stood below their five-year average at the end of March, reflecting stronger withdrawals driven by weak renewable output, lower gas supply  and several prolonged cold snaps this winter. However, inventories remained slightly higher than at the same point in 2021 and 2022.
Author: CK

Title: US DOE removes curbs to LNG export license extension policy
Description: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) has reversed a Biden Administration policy that required proposed LNG projects seeking export license extensions to prove they had begun construction and faced extenuating circumstances, which it said was “standing in the way of unleashing U.S. LNG exports”.
Author: JS

Title: BP start production at Cypre field offshore Trinidad and Tobago
Description: BP Trinidad and Tobago (BPTT) has confirmed the delivery of first gas from its offshore Cypre development, which will help the firm satisfy its existing gas supply commitments.
Author: JS

Title: LNG tanker arrives at UAE shipyard for Gabon FSU conversion
Description: LNG steam tanker LNG Bayelsa has arrived at Port Khalid in the UAE for conversion work into a floating storage unit (FSU) for a proposed 0.7 mtpa Cap Lopez LNG export facility in Gabon.
Author: JS

Title: Broad-ranging US tariffs on imports stir concern among LNG buyers
Description: US President Donald Trump’s decision to impose a baseline 10% tariff on imports to the United States, effective Apr. 5, to address a persistent trade deficit, has raised concerns among LNG buyers about policy stability and its potential to disrupt long-term investment in US LNG projects.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada receives cooldown cargo, paving way for mid-year export start
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has received its first LNG cargo to support commissioning ahead of its targeted mid-year start of exports.
Author: CK

Title: EU prepares countermeasures as US tariffs escalate trade tensions
Description: The European Commission is preparing further countermeasures in response to the sweeping US import tariffs set to take effect on Apr. 5, warning of economic disruptions and rising trade tensions. The measures apply across most sectors and come as the European Union remains the largest buyer of US LNG—possibly posing challenges to the EU’s energy security strategy, which leans heavily on US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: China’s LNG imports pick up in March, but remain below year-earlier levels
Description: China’s LNG imports rebounded in March after two consecutive months of decline, but still remained at their lowest level since June 2022, as high LNG prices relative to lower domestic prices continued to weigh on demand.
Author: CK

Title: China imposes retaliatory tariffs on the US, LNG impacted further
Description: China has retaliated against the new US tariffs announced on Apr.2 by President Donald Trump, by imposing a reciprocal 34% tariff on all imported goods originating in the US, which is expected to further discourage Chinese buyers from purchasing US LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside sells 40% stake in Louisiana LNG project to Stonepeak
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has agreed to sell a 40% stake in its proposed Louisiana LNG project to global investment firm Stonepeak, in a move that reduces its capital exposure and brings the project closer to a final investment decision.
Author: CK

Title: Excelsior tanker leaves Ferrol shipyard ahead of start-up as FSRU at Wilhelmshaven
Description: The 138,000 m3 Excelsior LNG tanker left the Ferrol shipyard in Spain one and a half years after remaining there as German state-owned LNG terminal operator DET kept postponing its deployment.
Author: JS

Title: Taiwan’s newest LNG import terminal Taoyuan receives its first cargo
Description: Taiwan’s newest LNG terminal, the 3 mtpa Taoyuan in Taoyuan city's Guantang industrial area, has received its first cargo, with the Methane Rita Andrea LNG tanker arriving at CPC’s third import facility on Apr. 1, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports hit fresh record high in March as EU deliveries surge
Description: US LNG exports hit an all-time high in March, driven by record shipments to the European Union, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship en route to Argentina looks poised to deliver Enarsa’s first cargo this year
Description: The British Partner LNG tanker is en route to Argentina and looks poised to deliver the country’s first cargo of the year, with its expected arrival in Buenos Aires later this month aligning with the delivery window for the first of six cargoes sought through a recent tender.
Author: CK

Title: Soyo LNG restarts production, and exports following maintenance
Description: The 5.2 mtpa Soyo LNG plant in Angola has restarted operations and LNG exports, following a shutdown for maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Satellite imagery reveals flaring at Arctic LNG 2’s second train, East Energy approaches Zhoushan LNG terminal
Description: Satellite imagery obtained by Kpler reveals the start of flaring at the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2’s second train over the weekend, suggesting the nearing of the start-up or a trial run of the plant’s second 6.6 mtpa train.
Author: JS

Title: Cedar LNG picks contractor to construct pipeline
Description: Cedar LNG has selected Ledcor Haisla Limited Partnership (LHLP) to construct the pipeline for its 3.3 mtpa LNG project in Kitimat, British Columbia.
Author: JS

Title: Enarsa seeks eight more LNG cargoes for Escobar, delivery in June and July
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued its second tender for the year seeking eight more LNG cargoes for delivery to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal to meet the country’s demand this winter. The tender closes on Apr. 14.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen receives first Qatari LNG cargo at Batangas terminal
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has received the first LNG cargo from Qatar at its 5.3 mtpa FGEN Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon, marking a new source of supply for the facility.
Author: CK

Title: Snam acquires stake in Vier Gas Holding, gains indirect access to German transmission firm OGE
Description: Italian gas infrastructure firm Snam has agreed to acquire a 24.99% stake in Luxembourg-based Vier Gas Holding, based in Luxembourg, from Abu Dhabi’s Infinity Investments, gaining indirect access to Open Grid Europe, Germany’s largest independent gas transmission operator. This acquisition provides Snam with a foothold in the German gas market and expands its presence along key European energy corridors.
Author: CK

Title: Japan weighs Alaska LNG investment amid escalating US tariffs
Description: Japan, the world's second-largest LNG importer, is exploring investment opportunities in the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski as part of a broader strategy to address escalating trade tensions with the United States.
Author: CK

Title: Aramco solidifies deal to offtake 1.2 mtpa from NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG Train 4
Description: Saudi Aramco and NextDecade have executed a sales and purchase agreement under which Aramco will offtake 1.2 mtpa of LNG from Train 4 of the proposed Rio Grande LNG export plant in Texas for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Gulf to develop Thailand’s third LNG import terminal
Description:
Gulf MTP LNG Terminal Company Limited (GMTP) has entered into a 35-year Public Private Partnership (PPP) contract with the Industrial Estate Authority of Thailand (IEAT) to develop the Eastern Economic Corridor, which includes the construction of a 5 mtpa LNG import terminal in Map Ta Phut.

GMT is a joint venture between Gulf Development Public Company, which holds a 70% stake, and PTT Tank Terminal Company, which holds the remaining 30%.
Author: JS

Title: Snam delays commercial operation start of Ravenna FSRU to May
Description: Italian utility Snam said that the commissioning of its BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) deployed at Ravenna LNG is “in full swing”, with the first phase of commercial operations expected in early May.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG tanker signals China arrival but likely to divert amid soaring tariffs
Description: A US LNG cargo aboard the Vivit Americas LNG tanker is signaling an arrival in China next month, according to Kpler data. But with no US LNG deliveries to China since early February, market participants expect the vessel to divert amid Beijing’s 34% tariff on US LNG and escalating retaliatory duties from Washington on Chinese goods.
Author: CK

Title: Mozambique clears Eni-led Coral North FLNG project for development
Description: The Mozambique government has approved the development plan for the Eni-led Coral North floating LNG project, paving the way for a second FLNG export facility in the country’s northern Cabo Delgado province.
Author: CK

Title: British Sponsor to berth again at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG ahead of first cargo export
Description: The 173,400 m3 British Sponsor LNG tanker is expected to berth again alongside the Gimi floating LNG vessel, Gimi, later today, according to Kpler data, potentially to complete loading for what could be the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project’s long-awaited first export.
Author: CK

Title: Russian LNG exports slip in Q1 on lower intakes by Europe
Description: LNG exports from Russia in the first quarter of the year (January-March) fell by 12% due to slower European intakes and the halving of exports from Russian small-scale LNG export facilities.
Author: JS

Title: EU could ease gas refilling mandate to 70% if market conditions worsen: Kpler Insight
Description: Kpler Insight suggests that the EU Council’s proposal for a 10% flexibility around the mandatory 90% gas storage filling target might drop to around 70% before winter, once derogations for persistently unfavourable market conditions are considered.
Author: JS

Title: EU open to negotiate US LNG imports amid Trump’s $350 billion energy demand for tariff relief
Description: The European Union has signalled a willingness to negotiate with the US after President Donald Trump demanded that the EU purchase $350 billion worth of US energy products, including LNG, to secure relief from recently imposed tariffs.
Author: CK

Title: US hikes China tariffs to 125%, eases pressure on others with 90-day pause
Description: US President Donald Trump has sharply escalated tariffs on Chinese goods to 125% in response to Beijing’s latest retaliatory hike, while temporarily easing pressure on other trading partners by pausing further tariff increases and applying a flat 10% duty for the next 90 days.
Author: CK

Title: MidOcean, Energy Transfer strike initial LNG development deal for Lake Charles project
Description: LNG firm MidOcean Energy has signed a heads of agreement with Energy Transfer LNG Export, the export arm of U.S. midstream giant Energy Transfer, to jointly develop the 16.5 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) Lake Charles LNG export project in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex launches early engineering work for Abadi LNG project in Indonesia’s Masela Block
Description: Japanese upstream company Inpex has initiated early front-end engineering and design work for the onshore facilities of its proposed 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project, located in Indonesia’s Masela Block in the Maluku province. This marks an important step in advancing the long-delayed project, keeping it on track for a final investment decision by 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Australia's first LNG shipment to India in 2025 set to arrive aboard LNG Harmony
Description: Australia’s first LNG shipment to India in 2025 is en-route to the country, with the 174,000 m3 LNG Harmony tanker carrying a cargo from the 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG plant in Western Australia.
Author: CK

Title: EU suspends retaliatory tariffs on US for 90 days
Description: The EU will move to suspend retaliatory tariffs on the US in response to the Trump Administration’s decision yesterday to pause duties on most trading partners for 90 days.
Author: JS

Title: Europe’s March LNG imports near record on supply rebound from marginal exporters
Description: European LNG imports in March have hit their second-highest monthly volume in history as the continent saw a rebound in supplied volumes from its marginal suppliers.
Author: JS

Title: Mubadala Energy takes stake in Kimmeridge’s SoTex, gaining access to US gas, LNG projects
Description: Abu Dhabi sovereign investor Mubadala Energy has signed an agreement with asset manager Kimmeridge to acquire a 24.1% interest in Kimmeridge’s SoTex HoldCo, securing access to Kimmeridge's U.S.-based gas and LNG assets.
Author: CK

Title: Santos maintains 2026 FID goal for Agogo, Moran fields to bolster PNG LNG supply
Description: Australian independent Santos is working towards making the Agogo and Moran fields ready for a final investment decision by 2026, with the associated gas from these fields expected to add at least 125 million ft3 a day to the supply of feed gas for the PNG LNG plant, the company said in an update today following its annual general meeting on Apr. 10.
Author: CK

Title: Santos' Barossa project set for first gas in third-quarter 2025 as work hits 95% completion
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos remains on track to begin gas production from its Barossa LNG project offshore Darwin in the Northern Territory in the third quarter of this year, with the project 95.2% complete at the end of March.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s port authority receives 14 bids to expand LNG and low-carbon bunker fuel supply
Description: The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore has received 14 proposals to scale up the supply of LNG as a bunker fuel as it pushes to deepen its role in the global maritime energy transition.
Author: CK

Title: EU Parliament proposes a reduction of winter gas storage target to 83%
Description: The EU Parliament has proposed a reduction in the EU gas storage target until Nov. 1 to 83% from 90% and to introduce more flexibility to the target.
Author: JS

Title: Seapeak Bahrain seen performing an STS LNG transfer of its commissioning cargo
Description: The 174,000 m3 Seapeak Bahrain is seen performing a ship-to-ship transfer of LNG offshore Fujairah, ahead of its deployment as a floating storage unit (FSU) at Bahrain LNG.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Gail renews US LNG supply and equity push amid temporary easing in US tariffs
Description: India’s state-run gas distributor Gail has issued a fresh call for long-term LNG supply from the US, along with an option to acquire an equity stake in the supplying project — signalling a continued push to increase its supplies of LNG while strengthening ties with the US.
Author: CK

Title: First GTA FLNG export looks imminent as British Sponsor returns for further loading
Description: BP’s delayed 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project appears set to export its first cargo, with the British Sponsor LNG tanker now berthed alongside the GTA FLNG vessel Gimi for what looks to be a third ship-to-ship transfer of LNG, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies to offtake 1.5 mtpa from Train 4 of Rio Grande LNG, readies for FID
Description: France’s TotalEnergies has inked a sales and purchase agreement with NextDecade to offtake 1.5 mtpa of LNG for 20 years from its proposed 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG export plant’s fourth train.
Author: JS

Title: Eni, YPF sign MoU to explore Eni’s participation in Argentina LNG
Description: Italy’s Eni and Argentina’s YPF  have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to evaluate Eni's participation in one of the phases of the proposed Argentina LNG export project.
Author: JS

Title: Heat exchanger issues on Ichthys FPSO curb LNG output; two May cargoes seen lost
Description: A fault in a heat exchanger on the Ichthys offshore floating production, storage and offloading unit has reduced LNG production at Australia’s 8.9 mtpa Ichthys facility, with at least two cargoes for May delivery likely to be lost, according to offtakers at the plant.
Author: CK

Title: Energy Transfer asks FERC to extend construction deadline for Lake Charles LNG
Description: US-based midstream firm Energy Transfer has requested the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to extend the construction deadline of the 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG export plant in Louisiana by three years.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies to supply 0.4 mtpa of LNG to Dominican Republic’s Enadom
Description: TotalEnergies has signed a heads of agreement with Energia Natural Dominicana (Enadom) to deliver 0.4 mtpa of LNG for 15 years, commencing in mid-2027.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global starts commercial operations at Calcasieu Pass LNG plant
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has announced the start of commercial operations at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass and the commencement of long-term contractual supply to its clients.
Author: JS

Title: Europe to anchor summer LNG demand rise, but market risks loom — Kpler Insight
Description: Global LNG supply is set to rise by nearly 10 mt this summer, with Europe leading demand growth as it refills gas stocks depleted by a cold winter, according to Kpler Insight’s Summer 2025 LNG Outlook released during a webinar today.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex confirms temporary production dip at Ichthys LNG
Description: The 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Australia’s Northern Territory, operated by Japanese upstream firm Inpex, is facing a drop in production after reaching a record high in January.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa fully awards eight-cargo June–July LNG tender; BP seen as likely sole winner
Description: Argentina’s state-owned Energía Argentina, or Enarsa, has fully awarded its recently closed tender for eight LNG cargoes to be delivered between June and early July to its 6.1 mtpa Escobar terminal, according to market participants. The award brings Enarsa’s total winter season purchases so far to 14 cargoes.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas seeks LNG cargoes for delivery from June 2025 to March 2026
Description: South Korea’s Kogas has issued a tender to buy an undisclosed number of LNG cargoes for delivery from June through March 2026, covering both the upcoming summer and winter seasons. The tender closes on Apr. 17.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside Energy appoints former Mexico Pacific CEO to join proposed Louisiana LNG project
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has appointed the former Chief Executive of LNG project developer Mexico Pacific, Sarah Bairstow, as Senior Vice President for its proposed Louisiana LNG development in the US.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG completes loading of first full cargo, sailaway imminent
Description: The BP-led Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal has completed loading its first full cargo, with the vessel expected to sail imminently, marking the start of LNG exports from both countries.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG seeks May cargo for Taiwan amid production drop
Description: The Inpex-led Ichthys LNG project has issued a tender for a single LNG cargo for mid-May delivery to Taiwan, in what market sources say is a move likely to cover a shortfall in output at the 8.9 mtpa facility in Australia’s Northern Territory. The tender closes today.
Author: CK

Title: Adnoc, Mitsui seal 15-year deal for 0.6 mtpa of LNG from Ruwais LNG
Description: UAE's Adnoc has signed a 15-year sales and purchase agreement with Japan’s trading house Mitsui & Co for the supply of 0.6 mtpa of LNG from Adnoc’s 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG export facility in Al Ruwais.
Author: JS

Title: Gastrade eyes earliest restart in late May for Alexandroupolis LNG terminal after months-long outage
Description: Greece’s Gastrade expects to begin gradually ramping up operations at its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU)-based LNG import terminal from late May, following a months-long shutdown due to a technical issue.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctions pressure clouds Russia’s ambitious new energy strategy: Kpler Insight
Description: Russia’s ambitious targets for expanding its natural gas and LNG production through 2050 face mounting challenges due to international sanctions, according to Kpler Insight.
Author: JS

Title: Bintulu LNG exports dip amid possible plant issues; at least one April cargo deferred
Description: LNG exports from the Petronas-operated 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG export terminal in Malaysia have declined week-on-week since late March, with industry participants citing equipment trouble at one or more liquefaction trains as a possible reason for the slowdown.
Author: CK

Title: BP confirms completion of first LNG cargo loading from Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: BP has confirmed the completion of the first LNG cargo loading from its 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal, with the cargo’s shipment set to mark the start of LNG exports from both countries and BP’s third major upstream project to come online this year.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche ReGas terminal in Mukran booked out for 2025,  two-FSRU setup by 2027 eyed
Description: All regasification capacity for 2025 at Deutsche ReGas’s Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran on Germany’s Rügen Island has been fully booked, driven by strong demand to refill gas storage sites and sustained high consumption levels.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside signs two LNG supply deals with Uniper tied to Louisiana LNG project
Description: Woodside Energy has signed two long‑term sale and purchase agreements with German utility Uniper, totaling 2 mtpa of LNG—covering 1 mtpa from its proposed Louisiana LNG project and up to 1 mtpa from its global portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: Sahara Group to offtake 0.6 mtpa from Mexico’s Amigo LNG for 20 years
Description: Energy and infrastructure firm Sahara Group has signed a 20-year sales and purchase agreement with Amigo LNG to offtake 0.6 mtpa of LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere asks FERC to start site preparation for Corpus Christi Midscale Trains 8 & 9
Description: Cheniere has filed a request with the Federal Energy Regulatory Committee (FERC) to commence site preparations for its next expansion of the Corpus Christi Liquefaction (CCL) plant, the Train 8 and 9 project, next month.
Author: JS

Title: Tanzania Launches Major Oil and Gas Licensing Round
Description: Tanzania's strategic move to open 26 exploration blocks marks a pivotal moment for its energy sector. While the country aims to expand its natural gas capabilities, its reliance on refined product imports remains a key challenge.

Title: Singapore’s LNG bunker sales rebound in March, lifting first-quarter 2025 volumes
Description: Singapore’s LNG bunker fuel sales recovered in March after two consecutive months of decline, helping to lift first-quarter 2025 volumes compared to a year earlier.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas confirms production disruption at Bintulu LNG facility, startup activities underway
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned energy company Petronas has confirmed a production disruption at its 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG complex, with rectification and start-up activities now underway.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG start expected mid-2026, US Energy Secretary says
Description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright has said the 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project, a joint venture between QatarEnergy and ExxonMobil, is expected to begin shipments in mid-2026, providing some clarity on the project’s start of exports.
Author: CK

Title: BP’s Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project ships first LNG cargo,  possibly to Asia
Description: The BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility between Mauritania and Senegal has shipped its first cargo, marking the start of LNG exports from the project and the two countries.
Author: CK

Title: Adnoc signs binding 15-year  LNG term supply deal with ENN as Chinese offtake grows
Description: Abu Dhabi’s state-owned energy firm Adnoc has signed a 15-year binding LNG supply deal with China’s ENN, finalising the preliminary agreement signed for 1 mtpa of LNG from the planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone LNG output dips due to planned maintenance on Train 1
Description: The Chevron-operated 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone LNG export plant in Western Australia is facing reduced output due to scheduled maintenance on the first of its two liquefaction trains.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s Idku ships its first LNG cargo in almost a year
Description: Egypt’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG plant has shipped its first LNG cargo in almost a year, after high domestic gas consumption and falling production forced authorities to divert feed gas away from liquefaction to meet local demand.
Author: CK

Title: Uniper to inspect delayed Stade LNG terminal amid dispute over superstructure
Description: Germany’s state-owned Uniper is set to carry out an independent inspection of the delayed Stade LNG terminal in Lower Saxony in a bid to resolve a protracted dispute over the readiness of critical infrastructure and determine whether the project can finally move toward commissioning.
Author: CK

Title: Excelsior FSRU heads to Germany, installation at second Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal expected soon
Description: The 138,000 m3 Excelsior floating storage regasification unit has left Rotterdam and is en route to Germany, where it is expected to be installed as the second LNG import terminal at Wilhelmshaven following months of delay.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas continues restoration efforts at Bintulu LNG Complex after production disruption
Description: Malaysia LNG, a Petronas subsidiary, said it is working towards achieving full operational recovery at the Bintulu LNG complex following a production disruption on Apr. 8.
Author: CK

Title: Jera, Saibu Gas agree use of Hibiki LNG’s storage tank
Description: Japan’s largest LNG buyer, Jera, and city gas provider Saibu Gas have signed an agreement for Jera to use the 2.4 mtpa Hibiki LNG terminal, operated by Saibu Gas, specifically the planned third LNG tank.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz prepares for tougher winter with gas imports, financing plans
Description: Ukraine’s Naftogaz is accelerating gas imports and seeking over EUR 1 billion in international financing to prepare for what it warns could be a more severe winter than the last, following a season that severely strained the country’s energy system.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside reports 82% completion on Scarborough-Pluto Train 2 LNG project
Description: Woodside’s Scarborough Energy Project reached 82% completion by the end of March, with construction advancing onshore at Pluto Train 2 and key offshore components preparing for integration—keeping the company on track for a first LNG cargo in the second half of 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Offshore regulator clears Santos’ Barossa environmental plan, backs third-quarter 2025 gas start
Description: Australia’s offshore regulator Nopsema has approved Santos’ environmental plan for its Barossa gas project, paving the way for first gas, which remains targeted for the third quarter of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Chinese LNG reloads, diversions underscore continued weakness in LNG demand
Description: Chinese LNG reload activity has remained steady into April, with two cargoes re-exported this month following a record four in March, as sluggish domestic demand sustains opportunities for outbound flows.
Author: CK

Title: Naftogaz inks third LNG deal with Poland’s Orlen
Description: Ukraine’s Naftogaz Group and Poland’s Orlen have signed an agreement to supply a further 100 million m3 of LNG, bringing the total volume secured from Orlen to 300 million m3.
Author: JS

Title: Cronos FID in 2025, Egyptian LNG exports still years off: Eni
Description: Eni aims to make a final investment decision (FID) on the 3 trillion ft3 Cronos gas project offshore Cyprus this year, with production expected by late 2027 or early 2028, and sees Egypt’s LNG exports gradually recovering in the years ahead.
Author: JS

Title: EU Parliament commission backs reduced national gas filling targets
Description: The Industry, Research and Energy Committee of the European Parliament has backed the Commission’s proposal to extend the gas storage scheme to the end of 2027 and to reduce the national refilling targets to 83% from the current 90%, with the parliamentary vote due in early May.
Author: JS

Title: France’s Le Havre to receive first LNG cargo in nearly a year
Description: France’s 3.6 mtpa floating import terminal in Le Havre is set to receive an LNG cargo next week—its first since June 2024— likely driven by the maintenance period at the country’s other LNG facility in the north.
Author: JS

Title: TTF forward curve turns firmly into contango as market eyes flexible EU storage rules, subdued Asian demand
Description: The price gap between the benchmark Dutch Title Transfer Facility gas contracts for delivery in the summer and winter seasons has recently shifted into clearly negative territory for the first time in months, marking a flip in the forward curve and a reflection of growing market confidence that Europe can refill gas storage without the time crunch or pricing pressure that characterized the sentiment in early 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global cleared to introduce hazardous fluids into 10th block of Plaquemines LNG Phase 1
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to introduce hazardous fluids into the tenth liquefaction block of its Plaquemines LNG project in Louisiana—the 10th block of the facility’s first phase—marking a key milestone in its commissioning.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Xi  reaffirms climate commitments, keeps pressure on fossil fuels ahead of COP30
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping reaffirmed China’s climate goals during a United Nations-convened virtual meeting of global leaders on climate, signaling that the world’s largest LNG importer remains firmly committed to a long-term energy transition away from fossil fuels.
Author: CK

Title: Axpo expands small-scale operations in Spain with a second STS transfer
Description: Swiss power producer Axpo has completed its first LNG ship-to-ship delivery in the Port of Algeciras, marking the expansion of its LNG bunkering operations to a second Spanish port.
Author: JS

Title: Wilhelmshaven LNG Terminal maintenance underway; Hoegh Esperanza FSRU idles nearby
Description: The Höegh Esperanza floating storage and regasification unit is currently anchored in Germany’s Heligoland Bight after vacating its berth at the Wilhelmshaven LNG terminal, where scheduled maintenance and dredging works are underway.
Author: CK

Title: British Achiever positions for LNG transfer at GTA FLNG, signalling second cargo load
Description: The British Achiever LNG tanker has positioned alongside the Gimi floating LNG unit at the BP-led Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal for a ship-to-ship LNG transfer, indicating preparations are underway for the project’s second cargo to be exported a week after its debut shipment.
Author: CK

Title: Morocco seeks expressions of interest for LNG terminal, pipelines, and gas-fired power plant
Description: Morocco is taking a significant step toward becoming an LNG importer with a call for expressions of interest from developers for a major gas infrastructure project, which includes an LNG import terminal, pipelines, and a 1,200 MW gas-fired power plant. The Ministry of Energy Transition and Sustainable Development is accepting submissions until Jul. 23.
Author: CK

Title: British Achiever partially loads second Greater Tortue Ahmeyim LNG cargo, awaits next loading
