Description: The BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal has taken a step toward exporting its second cargo, with the British Achiever LNG tanker recently completing the partial loading of a cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Partial Idku LNG cargo heads to South Korea amid domestic gas strain
Description: A recently exported partial cargo from Egypt’s 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG plant—its first in nearly a year—is en route to South Korea’s Incheon LNG terminal, marking a rare shipment even as the country continues to grapple with falling gas production and strong domestic demand that has triggered a return to LNG imports since April last year.
Author: CK

Title: Another US LNG tanker signals China discharge, but diversion also expected amid trade tensions
Description: Another LNG tanker carrying a US cargo is signaling discharge at PipeChina’s 6 mtpa Tianjin LNG terminal, but market expectations suggest it will divert to another destination due to the ongoing trade dispute between China and the US and China’s high tariffs on US LNG imports.
Author: CK

Title: Ravenna FSRU LNG terminal to begin commercial operations in early May
Description: The Snam-operated 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG terminal in Italy is poised to begin commercial operations in early May, following the completion of the BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit’s commissioning phase.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz secures new financing to boost gas imports ahead of winter
Description: Ukraine’s Naftogaz Group has secured EUR 410 million in new financing to accelerate gas imports and strengthen energy security ahead of the next heating season.
Author: CK

Title: Australia’s Woodside takes final investment decision on Louisiana LNG project
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has taken a final investment decision to develop the three-train, 16.5 mtpa Louisiana LNG project in the US, with first LNG production targeted for 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Excelsior FSRU arrives at Wilhelmshaven, marking impending start of Germany’s fourth LNG terminal
Description: The 138,000 m3 Excelsior floating storage regasification unit has arrived at Wilhelmshaven, where it will serve as the second LNG import facility at the port and the fourth LNG import terminal in Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Oman’s OQ Trading signs 15-Year LNG supply deal with Mexico’s Amigo LNG
Description: Oman’s state-owned energy and commodities trading firm OQ Trading has signed a 15-year agreement with Amigo LNG to purchase 0.6 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 7.8 mtpa export terminal in Guaymas, Sonora, in Mexico.
Author: CK

Title: EU phaseout plan unlikely to halt Russian spot LNG in 2025: Kpler Insight
Description: As Brussels prepares to unveil its Russian gas phaseout roadmap on May 6, Kpler Insight expects that spot flows of Russian LNG into the European Union—particularly from the 17.4 mtpa Yamal LNG plant—are likely to continue through 2025 in the absence of clear legal restrictions.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Croatia to undergo extended planned shutdown until mid-October for regasification boost
Description: The LNG Croatia terminal at Omisalj on Krk Island will shut down from Aug. 25 to mid-October to install a new regasification module that will expand its maximum send-out capacity to 6.1 billion m3 a year.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside agrees gas supply deal with BP for Louisiana LNG project
Description: Australian energy firm Woodside has signed a natural gas supply agreement with BP to support its planned 16.5 mtpa Louisiana LNG project in the US, marking the first tranche in what is expected to be a diversified feed gas portfolio for the facility.
Author: CK

Title: India’s HPCL signs first LNG trading supply deal with Adnoc Trading
Description: India’s state-owned refiner Hindustan Petroleum Corp. Ltd  has signed its first term LNG trading supply agreement with Adnoc Trading, the trading arm of Abu Dhabi’s state-owned energy firm Adnoc.
Author: CK

Title: Ineos and Covestro sign LNG-linked gas supply deal for European operations
Description: Chemical and energy group Ineos has signed a long-term deal to supply natural gas to German chemical group Covestro for up to eight years from 2027, leveraging its global LNG portfolio to ensure long-term feedstock and energy security for Covestro’s European operations.
Author: CK

Title: Senegal to receive its first LNG cargo as Maran Gas Kimolos offloads to Dakar FSRU
Description: Senegal is on the cusp of receiving its first LNG shipment, with the Maran Gas Kimolos currently engaged in a ship-to-ship transfer with the country’s floating storage and regasification unit, the 127,386 m3 Karmol LNGT Powership Africa, offshore Dakar.
Author: CK

Title: Germany lowers gas storage refilling requirements
Description: Germany’s Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Protection ((BMWK) has introduced a new regulation lowering the country’s gas storage fill requirements, following Cabinet acknowledgment of the measure.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies, Oman's OQ break ground on Marsa LNG project
Description: TotalEnergies and Oman’s OQ Exploration and Production have broken ground on the 1 mtpa Marsa LNG plant in the port of Sohar in northern Oman, initiating construction on what is expected to be the first marine LNG bunkering hub in the Middle East. LNG production at the plant is expected to begin in the first quarter of 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG signs long-term LNG supply deal with PetroChina
Description: Brunei LNG has signed a long-term LNG supply agreement with PetroChina International, the Singapore-based trading arm of China's state-owned PetroChina. The deal, announced in a social media post on May 1, provided no specific details such as contract duration, volume, and pricing.
Author: CK

Title: Southern Energy consortium takes FID on Argentina’s first LNG export project
Description: The Southern Energy consortium,—comprising Pan American Energy, YPF, Pampa Energía, Harbour Energy, and Golar LNG—has taken a final investment decision on Argentina’s first large-scale LNG export project, marking a major step toward positioning the country as a global LNG supplier.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies eyes mid-year start to Mozambique LNG
Description: TotalEnergies is targeting a mid-2024 restart of its long-delayed 13 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Afungi in Mozambique’s Cabo Delgado province, with financing largely back in place and security conditions improving in the project area.
Author: CK

Title: New US LNG cargo signals China as destination, but diversion likely amid tariff pressure
Description: A fourth US LNG tanker in recent weeks has signaled China as its destination, even though no cargo has discharged there since early February amid weak demand and steep Chinese tariffs on US gas.
Author: CK

Title: ExxonMobil reaffirms expectation that Golden Pass will produce first LNG by year-end
Description: ExxonMobil continues to expect first LNG production from the 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export facility in Sabine Pass, Texas, by the end of this year, with the potential that this could slip into early 2026, Chief Executive Darren Woods said in an earnings call on May 2.
Author: CK

Title: Croatia to complete key gas pipelines in 2026, unlocking planned LNG terminal regas capacity boost
Description: Croatia will complete three key gas pipelines in 2026, enabling full utilization of the expanded 6.1 billion m3 annual regasification capacity at its LNG terminal in Omisalj, which is scheduled to finish upgrading by October this year,  state-owned gas transmission system operator Plinacro told Kpler.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports edge up to new peak in April as Plaquemines ramps up
Description: US LNG exports edged higher to a fresh monthly peak in April, narrowly surpassing the previous record set in March as output from the new Plaquemines terminal in Louisiana continued to ramp up.
Author: CK

Title: EU Commission presents plan to phase out Russian gas, LNG imports until 2027
Description: The European Union (EU) aims to phase out the import of all energy sources from Russia, including gas and LNG, by 2027, based on a new proposal.
Author: JS

Title: Commonwealth LNG agrees 20-year supply deal with unnamed Asian buyer
Description: US LNG project developer Commonwealth LNG has signed a 20-year LNG supply agreement with a major Asian energy firm for 1 mtpa of LNG from its 9.5 mtpa LNG export project under development in Cameron, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Feed gas flows to Cameron LNG dip as one train undergoes planned maintenance
Description: Feed gas deliveries to the 13.5 mtpa, three-train Cameron LNG export facility in Hackberry, Louisiana, have declined since May 1 due to scheduled maintenance on one of the plant’s trains.
Author: CK

Title: Australia’s Woodside exits Commonwealth LNG deal after project misses key milestones
Description: Woodside Energy has terminated its LNG supply agreements with Commonwealth LNG after the US LNG project developer failed to meet key milestones for its proposed 9.5 mtpa project in Cameron, Louisiana. The move ends two deals that aimed to deliver first cargoes by mid-2026.
Author: CK

Title: Petronas said to be buyer in Commonwealth LNG’s recent 20-year deal: sources
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned energy firm Petronas is said to be the unnamed buyer in Commonwealth LNG’s long-term LNG supply agreement announced yesterday, according to sources familiar with the matter.
Author: CK

Title: Power outage temporarily reduces operating rates at Freeport LNG
Description: A power outage on May 6 forced the Freeport LNG plant in Texas to temporarily reduce its operating rates, resulting in gas flaring at the facility. However, normal operations have since been restored, according to an air emissions report filed with the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports plunge in April on lower UK, Turkey intakes
Description: Imports of LNG into Europe have dipped by 19% compared with March, driven by significantly lower imports by the UK and Turkey, while EU-27 intakes remained flat.
Author: JS

Title: Energy Transfer signs LNG offtake deals with Japanese utility, German energy company; year-end FID eyed
Description: Energy Transfer has signed two new offtake agreements for its 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG project, marking progress toward a final investment decision, which the firm is targeting by the end of the year.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG requests enlarged workforce to complete project
Description: Golden pass has filed a request with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to increase its peak workforce to 10,300 people to help facilitate the completion of the delayed project.
Author: JS

Title: Botas floats large LNG purchase tender, offers three supply options
Description: Turkish state-run Botas has floated an LNG purchase tender covering mid-term to long-term supplies, which closes on May 12 and includes three supply options.
Author: JS

Title: Singapore launches state-owned gas buyer for power sector to cut costs, boost energy security
Description: Singapore has launched Singapore GasCo, a fully state-owned entity that will centralise the procurement and supply of natural gas for the power sector—a move aimed at lowering costs, enhancing supply security, and strengthening bargaining power as the country advances its energy transition.
Author: CK

Title: Production ramps up at GTA FLNG project as second cargo is partially loaded
Description: Production at the Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility offshore Mauritania and Senegal is ramping up, following the export of its first cargo in April and the partial loading of a second. The project may exceed its nameplate capacity of 2.7 mtpa, with initial testing showing liquefaction trains performing around 10% above capacity, according to project partner Kosmos Energy.
Author: CK

Title: European Parliament adopts flexible gas storage refill targets
Description: The European Parliament has approved the European Commission’s proposal to extend the EU’s gas storage scheme until the end of 2027, to reduce the refilling target from 90% to 83%, and extend the deadline by a month.
Author: JS

Title: US–Houthi truce may spur LNG flows via Red Sea and Suez Canal; gradual recovery expected
Description: A recent ceasefire between the US and Yemen’s Houthi rebels could pave the way for a recovery in LNG shipping through the Red Sea and Suez Canal. But any rebound in flows is expected to be slow and tentative, with Houthi leaders maintaining that Israeli-linked vessels remain targets.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand advances Alaska LNG talks, eyes 3–5 mtpa long-term offtake, investment
Description: Thailand is stepping up negotiations over potential investment and long-term offtake of 3–5 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski, as part of a broader strategy to secure low-carbon fuel for its growing power demand and energy transition. The Ministry of Energy confirmed the talks following a high-level visit to Alaska on May 6.
Author: CK

Title: Germany, Egas strike deal to deploy Energos Power FSRU in Egypt; installation expected in July
Description: Germany’s Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action (BMWK) has sub-chartered the Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co. (Egas) in a move expected to help meet Egypt's growing  gas demand.
Author: CK

Title: Bahrain’s Bapco seeks the purchase of three cargoes via tender
Description: Bapco is looking to purchase three LNG cargoes in the summer via a tender closing on May 12.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere expects to commission Train 4 at Corpus Christi Stage 3 by year end
Description: Cheniere Energy expects to reach substantial completion on the first three midscale trains of its seven-train, 10 mtpa Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project by the end of 2025, with Train 4 potentially entering commissioning within the same time frame.
Author: CK

Title: Energy Transfer’s Lake Charles project gets construction deadline extension until 2031
Description: The proposed 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG project in Louisiana has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to complete construction and make the project available for service by Dec. 31, 2031, clearing the way for US LNG project developer Energy Transfer to make a final investment decision.
Author: CK

Title: Monjasa set to halt LNG bunkering in Middle East over market, pricing pressures
Description: Marine fuels supplier Monjasa is poised to suspend its LNG bunkering operations in the Middle East, just months after beginning supply in January, citing challenging market conditions and a growing price gap between LNG and conventional marine fuels.
Author: CK

Title: FERC recommends approval of CP2’s environmental review
Description: The federal Energy Regulatory Commission, or FERC, has recommended the go-ahead for the final environmental impact statement (EIS) for Venture Global’s proposed 28 mtpa CP2 expansion project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: US-China tariff truce won’t budge LNG flows: Kpler Insight
Description: The 90-day tariff reduction agreement between the United States and China is unlikely to affect LNG trade in the near term, according to Kpler Insight. Despite the recent trade deal struck in Geneva over the weekend—seen as a major de-escalation of tensions—the barriers to US LNG exports to China remain intact.
Author: JS

Title: FERC issues environmental approval for CP2
Description: The Federal Regulatory Energy Commission, or FERC, has issued Venture Global’s proposed 28 mtpa CP2 LNG export plant in Louisiana with the final environmental impact statement (EIS), putting it one step closer to starting construction.
Author: JS

Title: Hoegh Evi, EGAS sign FSRU time charter, conversion deal for Hoegh Gandria
Description: LNG infrastructure player Heegh Evi has signed a 10-year time charter agreement with Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company (EGAS) to deploy the 160,000 m3 Hoegh Gandria as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) in Egypt.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine eyes Slovak route to meet 4–5 billion m3 gas import need in 2025
Description: Ukraine plans to import 4 to 5 billion m3 of natural gas this year and is betting on the restart of gas flows from Slovakia to meet that need.
Author: JS

Title: British Achiever positions for second LNG transfer at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: The British Achiever LNG tanker is positioning itself close to the Gimi floating LNG vessel for a further ship-to-ship transfer of LNG, which could potentially complete the loading of the second export cargo from the BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal.
Author: CK

Title: China’s April LNG imports stay subdued amid soft demand, US cargoes remain absent
Description: China’s LNG imports in April remained flat against March and lower year-on-year, marking the fourth consecutive month of weaker imports following the recent December high of 7.55 mt.
Author: CK

Title: No impact to Barossa first gas timeline from regulator’s rig repair order: Santos
Description: Australian energy firm Santos said it does not expect the timeline for first gas from its Barossa gas project to be affected, despite an order from offshore regulator Nopsema instructing drilling contractor Valaris to halt drilling at the field due to safety concerns with rig equipment.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy charters out Energos Freeze FSRU for Dominican Republic
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has executed a three-year charter agreement of the 125,000 m3 Energos Freeze floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) with Energia 2000 in the Dominican Republic.
Author: JS

Title: Port Kembla Energy Terminal timeline shifts as Hoegh Galleon sub-charter extended in Egypt
Description: The extension of the Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit’s sub-charter in Egypt by up to a year, through to the end of 2026, has shifted its arrival at Squadron Energy’s Port Kembla LNG terminal in Australia accordingly,  pushing back the likely commencement of the terminal, which had previously been anticipated by market observers before next winter.
Author: CK

Title: Senegal Receives First LNG Cargo, Setting Stage to Cut Fuel Oil Use
Description: Senegal has kicked off LNG imports with a U.S.-sourced cargo delivered to a floating regasification unit near Dakar, signalling a shift in its energy mix. The move will gradually reduce dependence on fuel oil as gas begins powering major facilities like the Karadeniz powership and Bel Air plant.

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG’s first LNG cargo now bound for China
Description: The first LNG cargo from the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal is now bound for China, after initially signaling Singapore as its destination.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside, Aramco sign non-binding collaboration agreement on Louisiana LNG, ammonia
Description: Australian energy firm Woodside Energy and Saudi Arabia’s Aramco have signed a non-binding collaboration agreement to explore global energy opportunities, including Aramco’s potential equity investment in and LNG offtake from Woodside’s planned Louisiana LNG project in the US.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt to get a fourth FSRU this summer under time charter deal with Turkey’s Botas
Description: The Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., or Egas, has signed a time-charter agreement with Turkey’s energy firm Botas to use one of its floating storage regasification units this summer, bringing to four the number of FSRUs Egypt will operate during the season.
Author: CK

Title: Eni starts gas production from Merakes East field, boosting Bontang LNG feed gas
Description: Eni has started gas production from the Merakes East field offshore Indonesia, adding up to 100 million ft3 of gas a day (about 18,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day) to its output and reinforcing supply to the Bontang LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Aramco advances US LNG offtake deals with Sempra, NextDecade
Description: Saudi Arabia’s Aramco has taken further steps toward securing long-term US LNG supply, advancing a heads of agreement with Sempra Infrastructure through a new memorandum of understanding, and finalising a 20-year offtake agreement with NextDecade. Together, these deals commit Aramco to a combined LNG offtake volume of 6.2 mtpa The agreements build on previously announced deals and underscore Aramco’s strong interest in US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: New Fortress Energy eyes two more  FSRU sub-charters
Description: New Fortress Energy is preparing to sign two additional sub-charters for floating storage and regasification units as part of its strategy to monetize vessels surplus to its needs to generate additional cash flow.
Author: CK

Title: NFE plans Altamira FLNG outage in coming weeks to debottleneck and boost output
Description: New Fortress Energy plans to take its 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG terminal in Mexico offline in the coming weeks to carry out debottlenecking work aimed at significantly increasing production.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global asks FERC to expedite approval of CP2
Description: LNG project developer Venture Global has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to expedite the reauthorisation of its proposed CP2 LNG export project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt looks to secure fifth FSRU this year
Description: Egypt is seeking a long-term charter of a fifth floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to boost imports further.
Author: JS

Title: Vietnam’s PV Gas seeks one prompt June LNG cargo
Description: State-owned PetroVietnam Gas, or PV Gas, has issued a tender to buy one LNG cargo for delivery in June to its 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai LNG receiving terminal. The tender closes on May 16.
Author: CK

Title: Unplanned outage at Alexandroupolis LNG extended further; limited restart from mid-August
Description: Greece’s Alexandroupolis LNG terminal, offline since Jan. 23 due to a technical issue, will remain shut until Aug. 15, a three-month delay from the previously expected May 15 restart, and the latest in a series of extensions to the prolonged unplanned outage. Terminal services will resume at just 25% capacity until Sep. 30.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s LNG bunker sales rise to a four-month high in April
Description: Singapore’s LNG bunker sales rose for the second consecutive month to reach a four-month high in April, according to the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s Wilhelmshaven 2 LNG terminal is set to receive its commissioning cargo soon
Description: Germany’s Wilhelmshaven 2 LNG terminal is poised to receive its first LNG cargo soon, supporting ongoing commissioning operations and preparations for LNG send-out following the recent arrival of the terminal’s floating storage regasification unit, Excelsior.
Author: CK

Title: Hungary’s MVM CEEnergy continues spot imports of Russian gas as EU phase-out deadline looms
Description: MVM CEEnergy, Hungary’s state-owned gas importer, is continuing to purchase spot pipeline gas from Russia via the Southern Route due to its price advantage over alternative sources, despite the European Union’s goal of phasing out Russian gas and LNG imports by 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Oman LNG signs supply optimization deal with Vitol
Description: Oman LNG has signed an agreement with Vitol to optimize up to 0.8 mtpa of LNG from its supply portfolio starting in 2026, aiming to enhance portfolio flexibility and respond to evolving market dynamics.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada flaring to increase through July as Train 1 commissioning advances
Description: LNG Canada has warned of increased flaring activity through July as it advances commissioning work ahead of the start of LNG exports from its first liquefaction train at the Shell-led 14 mtpa facility located in Kitimat, British Columbia.
Author: CK

Title: No LNG exports from NWS amid planned maintenance, potential unplanned outage
Description: The Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf LNG plant in Australia has not shipped any cargoes since May 16, amid scheduled maintenance on a single train and a possible unplanned outage affecting multiple trains.
Author: CK

Title: Europe seeks flexible long-term LNG supply amid energy transition and market shifts
Description: Europe urgently needs to secure long-term LNG contracts that also offer the flexibility to divert cargoes to other markets as it grapples with the dual pressures of energy security and decarbonisation, according to industry stakeholders.
Author: JS

Title: Arctic LNG 2’s second train produces first LNG
Description: The second train of the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in the Russian Arctic has produced its first LNG, over a month after Kpler identified the start of flaring at the facility.
Author: JS

Title: Galveston LNG Bunker Port receives final authorisations, FID expected in mid-2025
Description: The Galveston LNG Bunker Port (GLBP) in Texas has received its final permit to operate a small-scale facility on the US Gulf Coast for fuelling ships with LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG ships second cargo as British Achiever appears headed for Asia
Description: The BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal has shipped its second cargo, about a month after launching exports.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies inks 20-year LNG offtake deal with Canada’s Ksi Lisims, takes 5% stake in project developer
Description: TotalEnergies has signed a 20-year agreement to purchase 2 mtpa of LNG from Canada’s 12 mtpa proposed Ksi Lisims LNG project and will acquire a 5% stake in Western LNG, the project’s developer and future operator.
Author: CK

Title: BP LNG tanker nears Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG to load third cargo
Description: The BP-controlled 173,400 m3 British Contributor LNG tanker is nearing the BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG facility offshore Mauritania and Senegal and looks set to load its third LNG export cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Energy Endurance delivers first LNG cargo to Germany’s Wilhelmshaven 2 terminal
Description: The 174,095 m3 Energy Endurance LNG tanker has delivered the first LNG cargo to Germany’s Wilhelmshaven 2 LNG terminal, marking the facility’s initial LNG receipt since the arrival of its floating storage regasification unit Excelsior on Apr. 28
Author: CK

Title: Turkey makes offshore gas discovery in the Black Sea
Description: Turkey has made a new natural gas discovery in the Black Sea, with estimated reserves of 75 billion m3  and a value of around $30 billion.
Author: JS

Title: US Department of Energy to resume final LNG export approvals following review completion
Description: The US Department of Energy will proceed with issuing final orders on pending applications to export US LNG to countries with which the US has no free trade agreement, following the completion of its review of public comments on the 2024 LNG Export Study.
Author: CK

Title: EU sanctions three Russian “dark” fleet LNG tankers in 17th sanction package
Description: The Council of the EU has released its 17th sanctions package targeting Russia for its ongoing invasion of Ukraine, under which it sanctioned three more LNG tankers believed to be part of the “dark” fleet of tankers.
Author: JS

Title: MSC Cruises adds two LNG-fuelled ships to World Class fleet
Description: Switzerland-headquartered MSC Cruises has ordered two additional LNG-fuelled cruise ships from French shipbuilder Chantiers de l’Atlantique, expanding its World Class series of ships to six  by 2030. The newly ordered ships, referred to as World Class 5 and 6, will be delivered in 2029 and 2030, subject to financing.
Author: CK

Title: Mukran LNG terminal to halt gas transmission from June 2–3 for pipeline maintenance
Description: LNG terminal operator Deutsche ReGas will temporarily suspend gas transmission from its Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran on June 2–3 due to scheduled pipeline maintenance by gas transmission system operator Gascade.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron shuts Leviathan gas platform for turnaround until June 3
Description: Chevron has begun a scheduled maintenance shutdown of its Leviathan gas platform offshore Israel, with the turnaround expected to last until June 3. The temporary halt affects a key gas source in the Eastern Mediterranean, including exports to Egypt amid surging demand and weak domestic output there.
Author: CK

Title: Norwegian planned maintenance dents pipeline gas supply to Europe
Description: Planned maintenance at several Norwegian gas fields today has removed a significant chunk of natural gas supply from the market, with yesterday’s Title Transfer Facility (TTF) price surging.
Author: JS

Title: Mercuria to supply LNG to Guangzhou Gas on a long-term basis
Description: Energy trader Mercuria said that its trading arm has signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement with China’s Guangzhou Gas, but it did not disclose the volume, start of supplies, or term of the deal.
Author: JS

Title: QatarEnergy targets end-2025 start for Golden Pass LNG, mid-2026 for North Field East
Description: QatarEnergy expects to boost global LNG supplies through new production coming online from the United States and Qatar over the next year, with initial output from the Golden Pass LNG project in Texas targeted for the end of 2025, and first production from the North Field East expansion in Qatar expected by mid-2026.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s DET offers short-term regasification capacity at Wilhelmshaven 2, other terminals
Description: Germany’s federally owned LNG terminal operator, Deutsche Energy Terminal, is offering short-term regasification capacity for 2025 and 2026 at the Wilhelmshaven 2 terminal currently undergoing commissioning, and the existing Wilhelmshaven 1 and Brunsbuettel LNG receiving terminals. The capacity will  be auctioned on the Prisma European capacity platform between Jun. 23 and July 2.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy targets first North Field East LNG train coming online mid next year
Description: QatarEnergy is aiming to bring the first liquefaction train of its North Field East LNG expansion project in Qatar online in mid-2026, with the remaining trains to follow thereafter.
Author: CK

Title: EU’s spot LNG key without tougher decarbonisation laws: ACER
Description: The European Union is set to deepen its reliance on spot LNG by 2030 without stronger decarbonisation goals, according to a new report from the Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER).
Author: JS

Title: FERC urged to expedite reapproval of Commonwealth LNG
Description: US Speaker of the House Mike Johnson and a Republican delegation from Congress have urged the expedited reauthorisation decision of the Commonwealth LNG project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Guangdong Pearl River Investment signs first long-term LNG deal with ConocoPhillips
Description: Chinese asset investment firm Guangdong Pearl River Investment has signed its first long-term LNG sales and purchase agreement, spanning 15 years, with US energy major ConocoPhillips, as it seeks to expand its role in the global gas value chain.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Zhejiang Energy agrees 10-year deal with BP  for up to 1 mtpa of LNG
Description: China’s Zhejiang Energy has signed a long-term agreement with BP to purchase up to 1 mtpa of LNG over 10 years, building on the companies’ previous LNG collaboration.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG gets regulatory approval to return third LNG storage tank to service
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has approved Freeport LNG’s request to return its third LNG storage tank and associated Phase 3 facilities to service, marking the final step in the 15 mtpa Texas-based terminal’s recovery from a June 2022 fire that led to an eight-month shutdown.
Author: CK

Title: North West Shelf LNG set to resume exports as Woodside Rogers loads first cargo in a week
Description: The Woodside-operated 16.3 mtpa North West Shelf LNG plant in Western Australia is set to resume exports after an almost week-long pause in shipments, driven by planned maintenance and potential upstream issues, as the 159,800 m3 Woodside Rogers LNG tanker undergoes loading at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: US tariff hike threatens EU LNG security and industrial stability: Kpler Insight
Description: Kpler Insight warns that proposed US tariffs on EU goods could severely disrupt Europe's energy security and industrial resilience, particularly putting LNG supply chains at risk.
Author: JS

Title: Bahrain LNG set to receive second cargo, signaling start of commercial operations
Description: Bahrain LNG is expected to receive its second LNG cargo this year in early June, signalling that the commissioning of its long-idle import terminal is likely complete and that commercial operations are set to begin.
Author: CK

Title: Sinopec’s APLNG 2025 long-term contract price revised lower following price review
Description: Australia Pacific LNG has agreed to lower the pricing terms of its 7.6 mtpa long-term LNG supply contract with China’s state-owned Sinopec, following a scheduled price review that resulted in a downward revision to the pricing formula.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s Cai Mep LNG terminal receives first cargo, signalling commissioning start
Description: The 3 mtpa Cai Mep LNG facility in Vietnam’s southern Vung-Tau district has received its first LNG cargo after several months of delay, signalling the start of commissioning operations at the country’s second LNG import facility.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Power FSRU arrives at Alexandria for modifications ahead of Ain Sukhna installation
Description: The 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit has arrived at Egypt’s Alexandria port to undergo modifications ahead of its deployment at the Ain Sukhna terminal, according to people familiar with the matter. This comes as part of Egypt’s broader push to expand LNG import capacity this summer.
Author: CK

Title: British Contributor set to load third GTA FLNG cargo as commercial operations begin
Description: The 173,400 m3 British Contributor LNG tanker is preparing to lift the third cargo from the BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project, with project partners and the Mauritanian and Senegalese governments giving the go-ahead for commercial operations to begin, sources close to the project said.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global plans to immediately begin on-site construction of CP2 LNG project
Description: US. LNG exporter and developer Venture Global plans to immediately begin on-site construction of its proposed CP2 LNG project in Louisiana, following a new order from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission  reaffirming the project's environmental approval.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s MOL to weigh risks in China LNG ship orders
Description: Japanese shipping group Mitsui OSK Lines said it will carefully assess future LNG carrier orders from Chinese shipyards in light of current geopolitical circumstances and US policy considerations affecting China’s shipbuilding sector.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas to choose Egypt-bound FSRU by June after compatibility study
Description: Turkey’s Botas is finalising a ship-to-shore compatibility study to determine which of its floating storage regasification units—the Ertugrul Gazi or the Saros (Vasant 1) —will be deployed to Egypt this summer under a recently agreed time charter deal, with a decision expected by early June, sources close to the matter told Kpler.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s Gulf Energy issues tender to buy two June-July LNG cargoes
Description: Thai private power producer Gulf Energy is seeking two LNG cargoes for delivery in June and July through a tender that closes tomorrow.
Author: CK

Title: Construction starts on 17 Nakilat-ordered LNG tankers
Description: Hyundai Heavy Industries’ shipyard in Ulsan, South Korea, has held a steel-cutting ceremony for 17 LNG tankers ordered by Qatar Gas Transport Co. Ltd. (Nakilat), marking the start of construction.
Author: JS

Title: Golar LNG eyes conversion of two more FLNG units
Description: Floating LNG firm Golar LNG said it is in active discussions to develop up to two additional FLNG unit conversions, as it builds momentum with negotiations for yard availability and potential charterers.
Author: JS

Title: Glenfarne taps Worley for Alaska LNG pipeline construction, issues a call for strategic partners
Description: Glenfarne Alaska LNG Group has selected Australian services firm Worley to undertake additional engineering and prepare a final cost estimate for the Alaska LNG pipeline connecting North Slope gas to the LNG export project in Nikiski.
Author: JS

Title: Germany brings fourth LNG terminal online with the commissioning of Wilhelmshaven 2
Description: Germany has completed the commissioning of its fourth floating LNG import terminal, bringing online Wilhelmshaven 2, which is also the country’s second terminal at the North Sea port and the third operated by state-owned Deutsche Energy Terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s FueLNG Bellina in drydock, may impact LNG bunker volumes in May–June
Description: Singapore’s LNG bunker supply may tighten temporarily as the FueLNG Bellina, one of the country’s three LNG bunkering vessels, has entered drydock at Sembawang Shipyard.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere inks gas supply agreement with Canadian Natural Resources
Description: Cheniere Marketing has penned a long-term integrated production marketing gas supply agreement with Canadian Natural Resources Limited to feed its proposed 20 mtpa SPL expansion project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Torrent Power seeks six-year LNG supply, prices to be linked to Henry Hub
Description: India’s Torrent Power has issued a tender for up to 14 LNG cargoes to be delivered to India over six years to help meet seasonal electricity demand.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside secures federal approval for North West Shelf Project extension
Description: Woodside Energy has secured proposed federal environmental approval for the extension of its North West Shelf Project, marking a critical milestone in its plan to prolong the life of Australia’s oldest LNG export facility.
Author: CK

Title: GTA FLNG begins loading third cargo amid commercial operations kickoff
Description: The BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore the Mauritania-Senegal maritime border has begun loading its third cargo, amid the launch of commercial operations.
Author: CK

Title: South Africa proposes LNG imports from US as part of broader trade engagement
Description: South Africa plans to import between 75 and 100 petajoules of LNG from the US over 10 years as part of a broader effort to deepen bilateral economic cooperation, according to Minister in the Presidency Khumbudzo Ntshavheni.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt secures around 20 LNG cargoes through tender, supporting summer demand
Description: Egypt has secured about 20 LNG cargoes through a limited-participation tender for deliveries between June and December, according to sources familiar with the matter.
Author: CK

Title: Kyushu Electric signs deal to offtake 1 mtpa from Lake Charles LNG
Description: Japanese utility Kyushu Electric has signed a sales and purchase agreement with Energy Transfer to offtake up to 1 mtpa of LNG for 20 years from its proposed 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG plant in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade signs SPA with Jera to buy 2 mtpa of LNG
Description: NextDecade has signed a 20-year sale and purchase agreement with Jera, which will buy 2 mtpa of LNG from Train 5 of the proposed Rio Grande LNG facility in Texas.
Author: JS

Title: Southeast Europe and Ukraine Launch New Trans-Balkan Gas Route Product
Description: A new regional gas transport initiative aims to boost Ukrainian energy security by enabling direct flows from Greece to Ukraine via Southeast Europe.
Author: JS

Title: LNG buyers watch closely as US trade court invalidates Trump's sweeping global tariffs
Description: LNG buyers are closely monitoring the potential implications of a US federal trade court’s decision to invalidate sweeping global import tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump on April 2. The tariffs, introduced via executive order, were framed as an emergency measure to address the United States' large trade deficit—but the court found the action exceeded presidential authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.
Author: CK

Title: Viva Energy secures environmental approval for proposed LNG terminal in Geelong
Description: Viva Energy has secured a key environmental approval from the Victorian Government for its proposed LNG import terminal in Geelong, clearing a major regulatory hurdle and bringing the project closer to construction.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Wenzhou Huagang LNG terminal  targets July-August for import permit
Description: The yet-to-start 3 mtpa Wenzhou Huagang LNG terminal in China’s eastern Zhejiang province expects to receive its LNG import permit between July and August, paving the way for the start of imports and operations.
Author: CK

Title: Second phase of Port Arthur LNG project gets final non-FTA export approval
Description: The second phase of the Port Arthur LNG project in Jefferson County, Texas, has received final authorisation from the US Department of Energy to export LNG to countries that do not have a free trade agreement with the US.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports in May down 4% on lower Norwegian supplies
Description: European LNG intakes slid for a second consecutive month in May as prolonged planned maintenance at Norway’s Snohvit plant led most of the decrease.
Author: JS

Title: Philippines’ First Gen sells 60% stake in gas plants, LNG terminal to Prime Infrastructure
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has agreed to sell a 60% stake in its Batangas gas-fired power portfolio and LNG receiving terminal to Prime Infrastructure Capital Inc. for PHP 50 billion ($859.9 million).
Author: CK

Title: Qatar's May LNG rebound drives Middle East gains as Oman, UAE exports dip
Description: Qatar’s LNG exports surged in May, boosting total Middle East shipments despite month-on-month declines from Oman due to planned maintenance, and a slip in shipments from Abu Dhabi’s Das Island plant for unclear reasons.
Author: CK

Title: Shell takes FID on Atlantic LNG backfill field in Trinidad and Tobago
Description: Shell Trinidad and Tobago has taken a final investment decision (FID) on the Aphrodite project, an undeveloped gas field in the East Coast Marine Area (ECMA) in Trinidad and Tobago.
Author: JS

Title: Completion of Hoegh Gandria’s FSRU conversion pegged for Q4 2026
Description: Finnish technology firm Wartsila has sealed a contract to supply a regasification module for Hoegh Evi’s conversion of the 160,000 m3 Hoegh Gandria LNG tanker, scheduled to be completed in the fourth quarter of 2026.
Author: JS

Title: BP deepens commitment in Azerbaijan with FID on Shah Deniz Phase 3
Description: BP has made a final investment decision (FID) on a $2.9 billion third-phase expansion of Azerbaijan’s Shah Deniz gas field, aiming to boost long-term gas output through a new offshore compression facility.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global begins construction of CP2 following final federal green light
Description: Venture Global has started site work at the company’s 20 mtpa CP2 LNG export facility in Louisiana, after receiving final federal approval last month.
Author: JS

Title: Italy’s Snam, Slovakia’s SPP extend initial deal on gas security and LNG access
Description: Italian gas infrastructure operator Snam has renewed its memorandum of understanding with Slovakia’s state-owned energy firm SPP company to explore cooperation on natural gas supply security.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa seeks delivery of eight cargoes via third tender of 2025
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued its third tender this year, seeking eight LNG cargoes for delivery to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal to meet the country’s demand this winter. The tender closes on June 10.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Eskimo FSRU set to leave Jordan today for Egypt
Description: The 160,000 m3 Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit is expected to leave the Aqaba LNG receiving terminal in Jordan today and sail to Egypt where it will be installed under a long-term agreement signed between state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Company and New Fortress Energy, according to sources with knowledge of the matter.
Author: CK

Title: Orlen’s first LNG-chartered ship delivers cargo to Lithuania’s Klaipeda terminal
Description: Poland’s Orlen Group has delivered its first LNG cargo to the KN Energies-operated 2.9 mtpa Klaipeda LNG terminal in Lithuania using its own chartered vessel, marking a milestone in the company’s expanding global gas portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: Glenfarne attracts strong partner interest in Alaska LNG project
Description: US LNG project developer Glenfarne has received strong global interest in its search for a strategic partner for the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project, with more than 50 companies expressing interest totaling over $115 billion in potential contracts spanning investment, customer agreements, equipment and materials supply, and services.
Author: CK

Title: India’s Dabhol LNG terminal receives first monsoon cargo after breakwater completion
Description: The Gail-operated 5 mtpa Dabhol LNG terminal in India’s Maharashtra state has received its first cargo during the monsoon season, following the completion of a breakwater that enables year-round operations for the first time since its commissioning in March 2012.
Author: CK

Title: Kyushu Electric delays Genkai Unit 3 restart after valve malfunction;  no new restart date yet
Description: Kyushu Electric has postponed the restart of its 1.18 GW Genkai Nuclear Power Plant Unit 3 in Saga Prefecture, a delay that could modestly increase Japan’s reliance on gas-fired power and raise LNG demand this summer.
Author: CK

Title: US doubles steel, aluminum tariffs, raising risks for LNG project costs and competitiveness
Description: A decision by US President Donald Trump to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium to 50% takes effect today, potentially raising construction costs for LNG projects and threatening the global competitiveness of US LNG
Author: CK

Title: Perenco plans new FLNG project in Cameroon as Hilli charter nears end
Description: Independent oil and gas company Perenco is preparing for the next phase of its liquefied natural gas (LNG) ambitions in Cameroon, with a new floating LNG (FLNG) project under consideration. This initiative follows the scheduled conclusion of operations for the existing Hilli Episeyo FLNG unit.
Author: JS

Title: New Zealand reverses exploration ban after a 27% dip in natural gas reserves
Description: A sharp 27% drop in New Zealand’s natural gas reserves has prompted the government to reverse its ban on oil and gas exploration and actively invest in future domestic projects.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctioned Russian vessel moors next to Koryak FSU
Description: The 79,800 m3 Arctic Mulan, previously known as Mulan, has moored alongside the Kamchatka floating storage unit (FSU), storing at least three cargoes worth of LNG from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG export plant, and was seen leaving earlier today, without having loaded any cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor, Centrica strike 5 Bcm gas supply deal for 10 years
Description: Norway’s Equinor and the UK’s Centrica have signed a long-term gas sales agreement for the supply of 55 TWh, or around 5 billion m3 (Bcm) of gas per year for a period of 10 years starting 1 October 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global receives green light to commission Plaquemines’ third jetty
Description: Venture Global has received approval from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to introduce hazardous fluids to the third jetty of its 25 mtpa Plaquemines LNG export terminal.
Author: JS

Title: FSRU shift from Jordan to Egypt prompts LNG tanker diversion from Aqaba
Description: The 140,000 m3 Arctic Voyager LNG tanker that had been idling off Jordan’s Aqaba terminal for two weeks has diverted to Egypt’s Ain Sukhna facility, where it is expected to arrive later today, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: Karmol LNGT Powership Antarctica deployment unclear as FSRU conversion nears completion
Description: The 127,500 m3 Karmol LNGT Powership Antarctica is nearing completion of its conversion from an LNG carrier to a floating storage and regasification unit at Seatrium’s shipyard in Singapore. The ship is expected to leave the yard within the next week, but its deployment is uncertain as it has no confirmed destination.
Author: CK

Title: Ballast LNG tanker signals arrival at LNG Canada for commissioning cargo loading
Description: The 174,000 m3 Puteri Sejinjang has started signalling arrival at the soon-to-start 14 mtpa LNG Canada export plant in Kitimat, British Columbia, likely to load the facility’s commissioning cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global receives FERC nod to begin commissioning Plaquemines LNG Block 12
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has received authorization from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to begin commissioning activities and introduce hazardous fluids to Liquefaction Block 12 at its Plaquemines LNG export facility in Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Croatia’s HEP floats six-cargo LNG tender for 2025-2026 supplies
Description: Croatian state-owned utility HEP has launched a tender seeking the supply of up to six LNG cargoes for the period between November 2025 and August 2026, which would be delivered to the country’s sole LNG import terminal, the 2.1 mtpa Krk facility in Omisalj. The tender closes on June 17.
Author: JS

Title: Malaysia’s May LNG shipments slump to lowest level since July 2012
Description: Malaysia’s LNG exports in May fell to their lowest level in nearly 13 years, as planned maintenance at the 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG facility sharply reduced volumes.
Author: CK

Title: Eni, YPF sign agreement to advance Argentina LNG project
Description: Italy’s Eni and Argentina’s YPF have signed an agreement paving the way forward for the Argentina LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Taiyo Oil Imports Sakhalin Blend Crude, Marking Japan's First Since Early 2023
Description: Taiyo Oil has imported 700 kbbl of Sakhalin Blend crude — Japan’s first Russian crude intake since January 2023.

Title: Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines the latest targets of EU’s sanctions row
Description: The European Commission has moved to further restrict the Russian energy sector by putting a transaction ban on the subsea Nord Stream 1 and Nord Stream 2 pipelines in the Baltic Sea, as part of its sweeping new 18th sanctions package on Russia.
Author: JS

Title: Adnoc Gas to expand Das Island export plant’s capacity
Description: Adnoc Gas has selected British service provider to the energy industry, Petrofac, to undertake engineering, procurement and construction of the project to expand the capacity of its 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG export facility.
Author: JS

Title: Sefe, Socar sign 10-year gas supply deal
Description: Germany’s Sefe has signed a 10-year deal to purchase 15 TWh of natural gas from Azerbaijan’s Socar, with the flows starting this year.
Author: JS

Title: Cedar LNG begins fabrication of FLNG vessel, 2028 delivery aligns with targeted project start date
Description: Cedar LNG has started fabrication of the floating LNG vessel for its 3.3 mtpa LNG facility in Kitimat, British Columbia, marking a key milestone for the Indigenous-led export project.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz awards June LNG cargo to RWE
Description: Bulgarian public gas supplier Bulgargaz has selected Germany’s RWE Supply & Trading as its LNG supplier in June 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Tepco begins fuel loading at Unit 6 of Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant
Description: Tokyo Electric Power Co. has begun loading fuel at Unit 6 of the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Nuclear Power Station in Japan’s Niigata Prefecture, marking a step toward restarting the 8.2 GW nuclear complex—but one that is unlikely to affect Japan’s near-term LNG demand.
Author: CK

Title: CLPe, CNOOC complete Hong Kong’s first LNG bunkering with simultaneous cargo handling
Description: Industrial energy solutions provider CLPe and CNOOC Guangdong Water Transport Clean Energy Co. have completed Hong Kong’s first ship-to-ship LNG bunkering conducted concurrently with cargo handling, supplying around 10,000 m3 of LNG to Hapag-Lloyd’s Hanoi Express during cargo handling at Kwai Tsing Container Terminals on June 5.
Author: CK

Title: Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG ships its third LNG cargo, initiates commercial deliveries
Description: The BP-led 2.5 mypa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal has completed loading its third LNG cargo onto the British Contributor LNG tanker, marking the first commercial shipment from the facility following earlier commissioning exports.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Jera signs long-term deals with four US LNG suppliers for up to 5.5 mtpa over 20 years
Description: Japan’s largest power utility Jera has signed a suite of agreements with four US LNG suppliers to secure up to 5.5 mtpa LNG over 20 years, boosting its US-sourced portfolio to more than 10 mtpa and further strengthening the role of US LNG in its diversified supply portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Eskimo undergoes modifications in Ain Sukhna for summer start at Sumed
Description: The Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit is undergoing modification work at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna port, ahead of its installation at Sumed port this summer.
Author: CK

Title: Snam starts commercial operations at Ravenna FSRU
Description: Italian utility Snam has started the commercial operations at its 3.9 mtpa Ravenna floating LNG terminal with the arrival of its first commercial cargo yesterday.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global drops Delta LNG project in favor of Plaquemines expansion
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global LNG has withdrawn its proposed 24.4 mtpa Delta LNG export terminal and Delta Express pipeline project from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s pre-filing review process and will instead prioritize the expansion of its Plaquemines LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Lithuania, Vietnam sign LNG-focused MoU; KN eyes terminal management opportunities
Description: Lithuania and Vietnam signed a memorandum of understanding aimed at strengthening bilateral energy ties, with a focus on LNG infrastructure and its development.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina fully awards eight-cargo June–July LNG tender
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy company, Energia Argentina, has fully awarded its latest LNG tender for eight cargoes to be delivered in June and July to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG terminal, according to market participants.
Author: CK

Title: Abu Dhabi’s Das Island LNG exports look set to recover in June after unplanned outage
Description: LNG exports in June from the Adnoc-operated 5.8 mtpa Das Island LNG plant in Abu Dhabi are set to exceed May volumes, as the facility recovers from an unplanned outage that temporarily shut one of its three liquefaction trains.
Author: CK

Title: Orlen to add sixth chartered LNG ship as Knutsen takes delivery of newbuild
Description: Poland’s Orlen Group is expanding its chartered LNG fleet with the addition of the Ignacy Jan Paderewski, the sixth vessel in a series of newbuild LNG carriers delivered to Knutsen OAS Shipping and chartered to Orlen under long-term agreements.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade eyes Rio Grande LNG Train 4 and 5 FID by mid-September as financing process begins
Description: US LNG project developer NextDecade has initiated the financing process for Trains 4 and 5 and related infrastructure of its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project and aims to take a final investment decision on both trains by mid-September, subject to securing adequate financing.
Author: CK

Title: LNG market eyes regional risk amid Israel–Iran conflict
Description: Israel’s overnight missile strike on Iran’s nuclear facilities and Iran’s retaliatory drone attacks have stoked fears of potential disruption to supplies from key regional LNG producers, as traders watch for any escalation that could threaten vessel security in the Strait of Hormuz.
Author: CK

Title: Second LNG tanker signals arrival at LNG Canada site ahead of targeted mid-2025 start
Description: A second LNG tanker is signaling its approach to Kitimat, British Columbia—home to the 14 mtpa Shell-led LNG Canada export project, which is expected to begin operations in mid-2025.
Author: CK

Title: Australian government extends North West Shelf extension approval period
Description: Woodside Energy said it has agreed to an extension of the consultation period regarding the North West Shelf project extension’s environmental approval process.
Author: JS

Title: State of emergency in Israel triggers suspension of Leviathan field output, gas exports
Description: Israel’s energy ministry has declared a state of emergency in the natural gas sector due to an escalation in the region’s security. This has led to a temporary stop in gas exports from Israel’s producing offshore fields and a shutdown in production from the Leviathan field.
Author: JS

Title: Israel to declare state of emergency in gas sector due to heightened security situation
Description: Israel’s Minister of Energy and Infrastructure is expected to declare a state of emergency in the natural gas sector today due to the recent regional security escalation following Israel’s strike on Iran and Iran’s retaliatory attacks.
Author: CK

Title: TTF rises on unplanned outage at Norway's Kollsnes gas facility
Description: Dutch Title Transfer Facility (TTF) futures saw a rise today following an announcement of unplanned maintenance at Norway’s Kollsnes gas treatment plant—Europe’s largest facility.
Author: JS

Title: Israeli Drone Strikes South Pars Gas Refinery
Description: An Israeli drone strike hits the South Pars refinery in the southern port city of Kangan.

Title: Poland, Ukraine boost cross-border firm gas transmission capacity in July
Description: Ukraine’s gas transmission system operator and Poland’s Gaz-System have agreed to nearly double firm cross-border gas transmission capacity into Ukraine from Jul. 1 to 31, with hourly capacity rising from 2,827,500 kilowatt hour per hour (kWh/h) to 5,424,000 kWh/h.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s Eni inaugurates Yasika hub to bolster Congo LNG exports
Description: Italy’s Eni has inaugurated its new Yasika logistics platform at Saipem’s yard in Pointe-Noire, Republic of the Congo, designed to underpin exports from its Congo LNG project and unlock the gas potential of the Marine XII permit.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies acquires offshore upstream assets in Malaysia
Description: TotalEnergies has acquired interests in multiple prospective blocks offshore Malaysia from Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas and inked a partnership agreement.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada begins startup phase with Train 1 cooldown; new gas flaring activity underway
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has begun the cooldown of its first liquefaction train as of June 16, paving the way for the debut of Canada’s first LNG project and the start of exports.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt's limited capacity casts doubt on Jordan's emergency gas relief
Description: Jordan’s state-owned National Electric Power Company (Nepco) has activated its emergency energy plan following the disruption of Israeli gas exports amid rising regional tensions.
Author: JS

Title: ADNOC’s XRG submits proposal to take over Australia’s Santos
Description: A consortium led by Abu Dhabi's state-owned energy firm ADNOC has made a $18.7 billion takeover bid for Australian Santos to build a leading integrated global gas and LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: EU streamlines strategy to cut Russian gas imports by 2027 with new proposal
Description: The European Commission has proposed a revised strategy for the EU’s complete phase-out of Russian gas and oil imports by the end of 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Kansai Electric to halt Takahama 4 reactor until late September; Kyushu’s Genkai 3 to restart normal operations in July
Description: Japanese power utility Kansai Electric Power will shut its 870 MW Takahama Unit 4 reactor on June 18 for a scheduled regular inspection expected to last through late September, with full operations set to resume in late October.
Author: CK

Title: Plaquemines receives first LNG carrier at third jetty following regulatory greenlight
Description: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana has received the first LNG ship at its third jetty, almost two weeks after securing regulatory approval to commission the infrastructure.
Author: CK

Title: LNG tankers idle off Oman amid rising Strait of Hormuz security risks
Description: Continued regional tensions between Israel and Iran have intensified in recent weeks, creating ripple effects that are now most visible in the Strait of Hormuz, where several LNG tankers are now idling or diverting amid growing security concerns.
Author: JS

Title: Commonwealth LNG confirms 20-year SPA with Petronas
Description: Petronas, via its subsidiary Petronas LNG, has entered an LNG sales and purchase agreement (SPA) to purchase 1 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 9.5 mtpa Commonwealth LNG export project in Cameron, Louisiana, for 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Electronic interference in Mideast Gulf disrupts LNG tracking as regional tensions escalate
Description: A surge in electronic signal jamming across the Middle East Gulf — particularly near Qatar’s Ras Laffan LNG terminal — has severely disrupted LNG tanker tracking since June 14, complicating real-time visibility  as tensions escalate between Iran and Israel.
Author: CK

Title: Bahrain LNG due to receive two more cargoes after tender award
Description: Following a purchase tender award, the newly commissioned Bahrain LNG import terminal will receive its third cargo next week and fourth next month since restarting operations earlier this year.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside, Petronas ink initial LNG supply deal for 1 mtpa of LNG to Malaysia
Description: Australia’s Woodside Energy and Malaysia’s Petronas have signed a non-binding heads of agreement (HoA) for the supply of 1 mtpa of LNG to Malaysia for a period of 15 years.
Author: JS

Title: Japan sees Sakhalin LNG supply key to portfolio diversification, supply security
Description: Japan considers its long-term supply contracts from the 10.8 mtpa Sakhalin LNG project in Russia’s Prigorodnoye port critical to maintaining a diversified LNG portfolio and ensuring energy security, even as it seeks to reduce dependence on Russian energy.
Author: CK

Title: Jera ‘likes’ Alaska LNG concept, awaits due diligence on project
Description: Japan’s Jera is awaiting the outcome of a due diligence process on the proposed Alaska LNG project, as it considers possible participation in the 20 mtpa export development in Nikiski, Alaska.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies’ Pouyanne expects construction restart at Mozambique LNG this summer
Description: TotalEnergies Chief Executive Patrick Pouyanne said today that he expects construction at the 13 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Afungi, Cabo Delgado, to resume this summer — consistent with his comments last month targeting a mid-year restart.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s candidate for short-term FSRU deployment in Egypt undocks from port
Description: Kpler data has revealed that the Saros FSRU, deployed at the Saros floating import terminal in Turkey, has undocked from the place of its deployment and is seen idling in the Saros Bay.
Author: JS

Title: Russian gas phaseout plan to reshape CEE supply routes: Kpler Insight
Description: As the EU plans to fully phase out Russian gas by 2027, Kpler Insight suggests that Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) faces a costly and uncertain energy realignment.
Author: JS

Title: GNSS Interference Intensifies Within and Beyond Middle East Gulf
Description: Initially prominent near Assaluyeh, Iran, GNSS Interference has now been observed prominent near the ports of Bashair and Haifa, indicating a rapid expansion to the Red Sea and Eastern Mediterranean.
Author: EB

Title: Commonwealth LNG receives final project approval, eyes Q3 FID
Description: Commonwealth LNG has received the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission’s (FERC) final order upholding authorisation for its 9.5 mtpa LNG export project in Cameron, Louisiana, putting it on track for reaching a final investment decision (FID) in the third quarter of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Shell flags shipping caution in Middle East; GPS jamming a concern
Description: Shell is taking a cautious approach to its shipping operations in the Middle East amid the Israel-Iran conflict and rising regional tensions, with particular concern around maritime safety and cyber threats.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex aims to work towards aligning Abadi LNG FID with Indonesia’s 2026 target
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex is working to bring forward its final investment decision on the 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project in Indonesia to 2026, in line with the Indonesian government's push to accelerate development and start production by 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Korea's SK Group  sees strong US momentum on Alaska LNG, but warns viability Is key
Description: A top executive from South Korea’s SK Group says the US government is showing strong commitment to the $45 billion Alaska LNG project, but cautions that commercial viability remains the critical test for Asian buyers.
Author: CK

Title: Shell-chartered vessel en route to load LNG Canada’s first cargo
Description: The Gaslog Glasgow is set to become the first tanker to load the 14 mtpa LNG Canada LNG export project’s commissioning cargo, surpassing the previously expected Puteri Sejinang by two weeks.
Author: JS

Title: Poland's Gaz-System to get $593 million loan for floating LNG terminal
Description: Polish gas grid operator Gaz-System has signed a deal to receive a PLN 2.2 billion ($590 million) loan from state-owned bank BGK to finance the onshore section of the Gdansk floating storage regasification unit-based (FSRU).
Author: JS

Title: Bahrain’s Bapco floats LNG purchase tender, seeking four cargoes for August-September
Description: Bahrain’s state-owned Bapco has launched its second LNG tender this year, seeking the purchase of four cargoes for August-September, with the tender closing on June 24.
Author: JS

Title: Second Wilhelmshaven FSRU starts first gas flows to grid
Description: The Excelsior floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has started flowing its first gas, after it completed commissioning operations with the receipt of the inaugural cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Long-term LNG contracts play key role in Japan’s energy security amid global uncertainties
Description: Long-term LNG contracts remain a vital tool for securing Japan’s energy supply as the country navigates growing uncertainties in the global energy market.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina see Japan as natural partner for LNG offtake, infrastructure development
Description: Argentina is looking to Japan as a strategic partner for LNG offtake and infrastructure development as it targets the start of LNG exports by 2027, driven by gas from the Vaca Muerta shale formation.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore LNG bunker sales edge up in May despite FueLNG Bellina’s planned  maintenance
Description: LNG bunker sales in Singapore continued to edge higher in May, despite a key bunkering vessel suspending operations during the second half of the month.
Author: CK

Title: Santos begins final commissioning of Barossa Gas Project with hookup of BW Opal FPSO
Description: Australian independent energy firm Santos has started final commissioning activities at its Barossa gas project following the arrival and successful hookup of the BW Opal floating production, storage and offloading vessel at the Barossa field, located approximately 285 km north of Darwin.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico Pacific files request with DOE to extend Saguaro Energia’s construction deadline
Description: Mexico Pacific has filed a request with the US Department of Energy (DOE) to extend the construction deadline for its proposed 15 mtpa Saguaro Eneria LNG export project in Puerto Libertad on Mexico’s west coast by seven years.
Author: JS

Title: Glenfarne, PTT sign cooperation deal, initial offtake of 2 mtpa of LNG from Alaska LNG
Description: Glenfarne Alaska LNG and Thailand’s PTT have signed a cooperation agreement for strategic participation in the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside signs initial LNG supply deal with Jera for winter season
Description: Woodside Energy Trading Singapore has signed a non-binding heads of agreement (HoA) with Jera for the supply of LNG during Japan’s peak winter period in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada produces first LNG
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada export project in British Columbia has produced its first LNG and maintains its goal to ship its maiden cargo mid-year.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG requests more time to finish Train 4
Description: Freeport LNG has filed a request with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to grant a 40-month extension to construct its Train 4 project, citing setbacks from the June 2022 explosion and the long recovery process as the main reasons.
Author: JS

Title: Golar LNG, Kosmos Energy confirm commercial start of Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: Floating LNG unit player Golar LNG and energy company Kosmos Energy have announced the start of commercial operations of the 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) FLNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritania, amid the project loading its fourth cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas, Jogmec sign cooperation deal to explore bilateral LNG arrangements
Description: PETRONAS LNG and Japan Organisation for Metals and Energy Security (Jogmec) have signed a memorandum of cooperation (MoC) to expand the collaboration framework in the LNG sector, through a strategic arrangement.
Author: JS

Title: Hungary, Slovakia block new sanctions package on Russia over gas ban
Description: Hungary and Slovakia have vetoed the adoption of the EU’s 18th sanctions package on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, as the countries said a complete ban on Russian energy purchases would undermine their energy security.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt races to ready Energos Power FSRU for Ain Sukhna deployment
Description: Egypt is accelerating preparations for the deployment of the 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit, fast-tracking modification works to ensure the vessel is installed at Ain Sukhna as soon as possible, amid mounting pressure to bolster gas supplies ahead of peak summer demand.
Author: CK

Title: Rebound in gas flows to Sabine Pass signals end of scheduled compressor maintenance
Description: Pipeline gas flows to the Cheniere-operated 30 mtpa Sabine Pass LNG terminal in Louisiana rebounded sharply on June 23, indicating the likely completion of planned maintenance at the Gillis Compressor Station.
Author: CK

Title: LNG ship traffic through Strait of Hormuz seen picking up after Israel-Iran ceasefire
Description: The number of LNG vessels transiting the Strait of Hormuz looks set to rise sharply today compared to recent days, potentially marking the start of a broader increase in flows through the key shipping chokepoint following the declaration of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s OLT FSRU Toscana completes testing of small-scale LNG service
Description: OLT Offshore LNG Toscana has completed the commissioning of its new small-scale LNG service at the FSRU Toscana terminal off the coast of Livorno, making it the first facility in Italy to offer LNG loading and unloading for small-scale carriers and marine bunkering operations.
Author: CK

Title: Jones Act-compliant American Energy LNG carrier delivers fourth cargo to Puerto Rico
Description: The 130,405 m3 American Energy LNG carrier, owned by US shipping and logistics firm Crowley, made its fourth US-sourced LNG delivery to the Penuelas LNG terminal in Puerto Rico on June 18, marking the continued delivery by the Jones Act-compliant ship in supporting Puerto Rico’s energy needs.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt expedites second FSRU deployment plan, installation expected by month-end
Description: Egypt is fast-tracking the installation of its second LNG import terminal, with the 160,000m3 Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit now expected to be deployed at the Sumed port in Ain Sukhna by June 30 — ahead of schedule — as the country races to meet soaring summer demand and offset a recent disruption in Israeli gas flows following the start of the Israel-Iran conflict, sources close to the project said.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere takes FID on Corpus Christi Midscale Trains 8 & 9 expansion
Description: Cheniere Energy has taken a final investment decision (FID) on the Corpus Christi Midscale Trains 8 & 9 and debottlenecking project and has issued full notice to proceed to Bechtel for construction.
Author: JS

Title: Energy Transfer, Chevron expand SPA from Lake Charles LNG
Description: Energy Transfer LNG Export has signed an incremental sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with Chevron for additional LNG supply from its proposed 16.5 mtpa Lake Charles LNG export facility in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Israel instructs restart of Leviathan and Karish fields, resumption of gas exports
Description: Israel’s energy minister Eli Cohen has instructed the restart of operations of the 12 Bcm/y Leviathan and 8 Bcm/y Karish gas fields offshore Israel, following an improvement in the regional security situation.
Author: JS

Title: Gulf Development approves $1.6 billion third LNG receiving terminal for Thailand
Description: Thai utility firm Gulf Development Public Company Limited has approved a THB 60 billion (USD 1.6 billion)investment to develop a new LNG receiving terminal and regasification facility at Map Ta Phut—Thailand’s third such facility, targeted to come online in 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Israel-Iran truce triggers fall in Asian LNG prices, signalling refocus on weak demand
Description: A steep fall in Asian LNG prices yesterday, following news of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, has eased immediate concerns over potential supply disruptions from the Middle East.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside finalizes 40% sell-down in Louisiana LNG InfraCo to Stonepeak
Description: Woodside has completed the sale of a 40% interest in Louisiana LNG Infrastructure, or InfraCo, the infrastructure arm of its planned Louisiana LNG project, to US-based investment firm Stonepeak.
Author: CK

Title: Yamal LNG’s Georgiy Ushakov marks the opening of Northern Sea Route’s summer season
Description: The Yamal LNG-controlled Georgiy Ushakov has set sail through the Northern Sea Route, marking the first passage of an LNG ship on the route this season.
Author: CK

Title: Knutsen delivers first of 10 LNG carriers to QatarEnergy for North Field expansion
Description: Knutsen LNG France, a subsidiary of Norway’s Knutsen Group, has taken delivery of the 174,000 m3 Mraikh LNG carrier from South Korean shipbuilder HD Hyundai, marking the first of 10 LNG carriers being built for long-term charter to QatarEnergy.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada set to export first cargo “in a few days”: BC Premier
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in British Columbia province is poised to export its first cargo “in the next few days,” kicking off Canada’s long-awaited entry into the global LNG export market.
Author: CK

Title: Germany’s DET postpones Brunsbuettel LNG capacity auction over jetty approval concerns
Description: Germany’s federally owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal has delayed its planned auction for 2026 short-term regasification capacity at the Brunsbüttel terminal in Schleswig-Holstein, citing unresolved questions over the approval of a new jetty at the site.
Author: CK

Title: Shell denies interest in BP takeover following media speculation
Description: Shell has denied reports suggesting it is exploring a takeover of BP, issuing a rare public clarification in response to recent media speculation.
Author: CK

Title: Russian shadow fleet vessel heads towards Arctic LNG 2
Description: The 174,000 m3 Iris LNG tanker has entered the Gulf of Ob, containing the 17.4 mtpa Yamal and the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export plants, with the ship setting course for the latter, eight and a half months after its last loading.
Author: JS

Title: EGAS inks short-term charter for Energos Force FSRU
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS has signed a short-term charter agreement for the 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) - destined initially for Germany’s Stade LNG - which will be deployed at the now vacant Aqaba port in Jordan.
Author: JS

Title: Costal Bend LNG starts development of 22.5 mtpa LNG export plant in Texas
Description: Privately held infrastructure development company Coastal Bend said it has initiated the development of a 22.5 mtpa LNG export facility on the Texas Gulf Coast.
Author: JS

Title: Short-term lease of Germany’s Energos Force FSRU to Jordan spells further delays for Stade
Description: The 174,000 m³ Energos Force FSRU, chartered by the German federal government, is being redeployed to Jordan’s Aqaba LNG terminal under a short-term lease signed on June 25, Kpler has learned — the clearest indication yet that further delays are expected at Germany’s Stade LNG terminal, where the vessel was originally slated for deployment.
Author: CK

Title: LNG traffic steady through Strait of Hormuz, but some vessels still idling offshore
Description: The flow of LNG ships transiting the Strait of Hormuz has remained steady this week following the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran, althought a few vessels are still idling near the strait and in the Gulf of Oman —possibly  indicating lingering caution in the area.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT to supply Centrica with LNG for 10 years
Description: UK’s Centrica and Thailand’s PTT have signed a heads of agreement for Centrica to supply LNG for a period of 10 years, commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Polish and Ukrainian TSOs extend increased firm gas capacity until September 2026
Description: Poland’s Gaz-System and Ukraine’s gas TSO of Ukraine (GTSOU) have agreed to extend the temporary increase of the offered firm capacity at the exit point toward Ukraine until September 2026.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies eyes LNG bunkering fleet expansion with fourth vessel in 2026
Description: TotalEnergies is eyeing the expansion of its LNG bunkering fleet, with the addition of a fourth LNG bunker vessel set to enter service in late 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor ordered to prove safety before resuming work in Hammerfest LNG’s L201 area: regulator
