Description: Norway’s offshore safety regulator has ordered Equinor to reassess and fully document the safety of operations at its 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant before resuming work in a section affected by repeated health incidents.
Author: CK

Title: Santos grants Adnoc-Led consortium six weeks of exclusive due diligence on takeover offer
Description: Santos has entered into a process and exclusivity deed with a consortium led by Abu Dhabi National Oil Company, granting the group a six-week exclusive due diligence period following a non-binding, all-cash offer of US$5.76 (A$8.89) per share to acquire the company.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada set to begin exports with arrival of Shell-controlled tanker in Kitimat
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project is poised to ship its first cargo soon, following the arrival of the Shell-controlled Gaslog Glasgow LNG carrier at the terminal in Kitimat, British Columbia, on June 28.
Author: CK

Title: BP-controlled LNG carrier on standby as Egypt prepares second FSRU for July start
Description: The BP-controlled LNG carrier Gordon Waters Knutsen is currently in the Mediterranean Sea near the entrance to the Suez Canal, on standby to deliver LNG to cool down the Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit for Egypt that is now expected to be commissioned by mid-July, according to sources with knowledge of the matter.
Author: CK

Title: European June LNG intakes slip on lower supplies from main markets
Description: European LNG imports in June were down 4% compared with May on lower supplies by the US and Qatar.
Author: JS

Title: BP and A2A sign 17-year LNG supply agreement
Description: Italian independent  A2A and BP have signed a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) for under which A2A will purchase up to 10 LNG cargoes per year, commencing in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: PTT’s long-term supply deal with Centrica signals evolving role in global LNG market
Description: Thailand’s state-owned energy firm PTT recently signed its first long-term LNG supply deal, signaling a broadening of its role in the global gas market as it begins supplying — not just importing — LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Force FSRU awaits sub-charter finalization as Berlin confirms Stade LNG terminal delay
Description: Germany’s Energos Force floating storage regasification unit is sailing to Gibraltar while a sub-charter deal with Egypt is expected to be finalized, sources close to the matter told Kpler.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada ships its inaugural LNG export cargo: Shell
Description: Shell has confirmed the first shipment of LNG from the 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, marking Canada’s long-awaited entry into the ranks of global LNG exporters.
Author: CK

Title: Vietnam’s PV Power connects Nhon Trach 4 LNG plant to the grid, boosts LNG-to-power capacity
Description: Vietnam’s state-owned PV Power has officially connected its Nhon Trach 4 LNG-fuelled power plant to the national grid, expanding Vietnam’s LNG-fueled power generation capabilities.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada’s first cargo to arrive in Incheon on July 20 aboard Gaslog Glasgow
Description: The inaugural cargo from the Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada export plant in Kitimat, British Columbia, is now expected to be delivered to South Korea’s 40 mtpa Incheon terminal on Jul. 20, after the vessel set sail from the newly commissioned terminal on Jul. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Unit 6 restart unlikely before August end as Niigata holds public hearings
Description: A restart of Unit 6 at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear plant in Japan's Niigata Prefecture looks increasingly unlikely before September, despite the reactor being technically ready, as local authorities are not expected to make a decision until after a final round of public hearings ending August 31.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz secures fourth LNG cargo from Poland’s Orlen ahead of winter
Description: Ukraine’s Naftogaz has signed a new agreement with Polish energy group Orlen for the supply of an additional 140 million m3 of LNG, marking the fourth cargo contracted between the two firms this year.
Author: CK

Title: Seatrium secures fourth FSRU conversion deal from Karpowership unit
Description: Singapore’s Seatrium has secured a contract to convert an LNG carrier into a floating storage regasification unit from Kinetics, the unit of floating power plant fleet operator Karpowership. This contract activates the previously confirmed fourth FSRU conversion option, following three LNG carrier-to-FSRU conversions awarded since April 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Karmol’s LNGT Powership Antarctica FSRU completes sea trials ahead of being laid up
Description: Karmol’s recently converted floating storage and regasification unit LNGT Powership Antarctica has completed sea and gas trials and will be laid up as it awaits an opportunity in the LNG-to-Powership business - a model that uses FSRUs to supply gas to floating power plants, often in markets with limited infrastructure.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG seeks regulatory nod to re-export cargoes from October, signaling start-up readiness
Description: Golden Pass LNG, a joint venture between ExxonMobil and QatarEnergy, is seeking US regulatory approval to re-export LNG from Oct. 1, indicating that its 18 mtpa LNG export project in Texas is moving closer to commissioning and production.
Author: CK

Title: Delfin Midstream kicks off FLNG design work, targets Fall FID after turbine deal
Description: US LNG project developer Delfin Midstream is pushing toward a final investment decision this fall for its proposed deepwater floating LNG export project off the Gulf Coast, after securing gas turbine capacity and launching early engineering work with key contractors.
Author: CK

Title: Deutsche Energy Terminal awards all Wilhelmshaven LNG slots through 2026 in latest auction
Description: Germany’s state-owned LNG terminal operator Deutsche Energy Terminal  has successfully sold all available short-term regasification slots at its Wilhelmshaven 1 and 2 terminals through 2026, concluding its latest marketing round on Jul. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt nears commissioning of two FSRUs to meet peak summer gas demand
Description: Egypt is finalising preparations to commission two floating storage and regasification units —Energos Eskimo and Energos Power—as the country moves to bolster gas supplies ahead of peak summer demand.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG’s Train 2 suffers temporary trip due to compressor issue
Description: The second of three trains at the 15 mtpa Freeport LNG plant on Quintana Island, Texas, experienced a trip yesterday due to an issue with its compressor system. However, the train has been restarted.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy Trading to buy 0.5 mtpa of LNG over two years from Santos, starting 2026
Description: QatarEnergy Trading has agreed to buy 0.5 mtpa of LNG over two years from Australian independent energy firm Santos, with the supplies from Santos’ international portfolio of assets to be delivered on an ex-ship basis from 2026.
Author: CK

Title: Global LNG exports edge higher in first-half 2025 as US volume surge offsets losses elsewhere
Description: Global LNG exports rose modestly in the first half of 2025, driven by a surge in US shipments as new liquefaction capacity ramped up. The gains helped offset declines from several traditional suppliers, keeping global supply on a slight upward trend despite unplanned outages and scheduled maintenance.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s MOL targets Morocco, sees conversions as key to fast-track FSRU supply
Description: Japanese shipper Mitsui OSK Lines is eyeing Morocco as one of the most prominent near-term opportunities for floating storage and regasification units and is banking on conversions of aging LNG carriers to deliver them faster and more cost-effectively amid tight shipyard capacity and high newbuild costs.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Force sub-charter finalised as FSRU prepares for Jordan move; cooldown in Damietta
Description: Germany’s federal economy ministry has confirmed a short-term sub-charter of the Energos Force floating storage regasification unit to Egypt’s state-owned Egas, allowing the vessel’s redeployment to Jordan while its intended installation site, the Stade LNG terminal, remains delayed.
Author: CK

Title: Cooldown LNG cargo for Energos Eskimo FSRU due at Ain Sukhna tomorrow
Description: The BP-controlled 174,000 m3 Gordon Waters Knutsen LNG tanker has signalled its arrival on Jul. 5 at Egypt’s Ain Sukhna port, where it is expected to deliver LNG to the Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit to facilitate its cooldown and commissioning ahead of its imminent start of operations.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned shadow fleet tanker en route to Murmansk FSU as earlier load frees space
Description: The Arctic Metagaz seems to be en route to the Murmansk floating storage unit (FSU) as a load from the unit last month freed up space for one more cargo discharge into storage.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas agrees 20-year deal with Venture Global for 1 mtpa of LNG from CP2
Description: Malaysia’s state-owned Petronas has agreed to buy 1 mtpa of LNG from Venture Global’s proposed CP2 project in Louisiana, building on its earlier purchase in 2022 of 1 mtpa from the LNG exporter’s Plaquemines LNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Winter charter nears finalization as Egypt prepares for installation at Damietta
Description: Egypt has yet to finalize a charter deal for the 138,000 m3 Energos Winter floating storage regasification unit at Damietta but is close to doing so, even as it advances site preparations to receive the vessel, which would lift national regasification capacity by 750 million ft3 a day, sources familiar with the matter told Kpler.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt to add third FSRU with Energos Winter at Damietta, boosting regasification capacity
Description:
Egypt will install the 138,000 m3 Energos Winter floating storage regasification unit at the United Gas Derivatives Co. berth in Damietta, making it the third FSRU to be installed in the country this summer and the fourth in operation overall,
according to a social media post by Egypt’s Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources.
Author: CK

Title: MET Group takes full control of German gas storage firm KGE
Description: MET Group has acquired full ownership of German gas storage operator KGE (Kommunale Gasspeichergesellschaft Epe mbH & Co. KG), expanding its natural gas infrastructure footprint in Germany.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Eskimo FSRU moors at Ain Sukhna for installation works
Description: The Energos Eskimo floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) has arrived at Ain Sukhna port as it is due to become the second LNG terminal in Egypt.
Author: JS

Title: Russian first-half of 2025 LNG exports down 6% on a slip due to persisting sanctions pressure
Description: Russian LNG exports continued their downward trajectory in the first half of 2025, declining under the weight of Western sanctions, which remain in place and constrain market access.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada poised for next shipment with arrival of second LNG tanker
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada export facility in Kitimat, British Columbia, is poised to export its second cargo with the arrival of another LNG carrier just days after beginning exports on July 1.
Author: CK

Title: France’s GTT partners with companies to develop new type of LNG tanker
Description: French LNG technology firm GTT has signed a joint development project with seven companies to develop a new-generation LNG carrier.
Author: JS

Title: Petronas ships LNG Canada’s second cargo; Puteri Sejinjang LNG tanker bound for Nagoya
Description: The Petronas-controlled 174,000 m3 Puteri Sejinjang LNG tanker has shipped the Shell-led LNG Canada project’s second LNG cargo,  just six days after its inaugural shipment.
Author: CK

Title: LNGT Powership Antarctica FSRU supplies LNG to bunker vessel in Singapore ahead of lay-up
Description: Karmol’s newly converted floating storage and regasification unit , LNGT Powership Antarctica, has completed its first LNG discharge, supplying the FueLNG Venosa bunkering vessel in Singapore, before preparing to be laid up while awaiting redeployment.
Author: CK

Title: EBRD loans Moldova €400 million for gas, electricity purchases in EU
Description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has lent €400 million ($468 million) to Moldova’s state-owned energy trader Energocom to boost the country’s energy security by buying gas and electricity in the EU.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Power FSRU nears Damietta for cooldown ahead of Ain Sukhna installation
Description: The 174,000 m3 Energos Power floating storage and regasification unit has left Dekheila port near Alexandria, where it underwent modifications, and is nearing the Damietta LNG plant for cooldown ahead of its installation and final commissioning at Ain Sukhna. This will pave the way for the start of operations of Egypt’s third FSRU this summer.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate Energy signs deal with Petrobras to upgrade FSRU with reliquifaction unit
Description: LNG player Excelerate Energy has signed an agreement with Petrobras to install a reliquefaction unit on the Experience floating storage regasification unit deployed as the Rio LNG terminal in Rio de Janeiro.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global to supply Sefe with 0.75 mtpa more LNG for 20 years
Description: Venturee Global has signed an agreement with Germany’s Security Energy For Europe (Sefe) to supply an additional 0.75 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 20 mtpa CP2 export project in Louisiana for 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: ExxonMobil confirms gas discovery offshore Cyprus
Description: ExxonMobil has announced a new natural gas discovery at the Pegasus-1 well in Block 10 of Cyprus’s Exclusive Economic Zone, marking the second find in the area for the consortium involved in the exploration.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa issues fourth LNG tender, could lift 2025 total to 27 cargoes
Description: Argentina’s state-run energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has launched its fourth LNG tender of the year, seeking five cargoes for delivery in August for its 6.1 mtpa Escobar terminal, according to market sources. The tender, which closes on July 15, specifies deliveries on August 9, 13, 17, 22, and 28.
Author: CK

Title: Cypriot electricity lobby rings alarm bells over Vasilikos LNG delay
Description: Cyprus-based Electricity Market Association (EMA) has expressed concern over the continued delay affecting the Vasilikos LNG import project.
Author: JS

Title: Sefe Storage allocates 3.9 TWh of storage capacity at Germany's Rehden
Description: Sefe Storage gas allocated the storage capacity of approx. 3.9 TWh for the remainder of  the storage year 2025/2026 in Rehden underground gas storage (UGS) on the PRISMA capacity platform.
Author: JS

Title: Excelerate launches newbuild FSRU Hull 3407 at HD Hyundai Heavy Industries yard
Description: Floating LNG infrastructure provider Excelerate Energy has launched its newbuild floating storage and regasification unit Hull 3407, from HD Hyundai Heavy Industries in South Korea, bringing it closer to its expected delivery in 2026.
Author: CK

Title: GTA FLNG begins third quarter with BW ENN Snow Lotus shipping the fifth LNG cargo
Description: The BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project has kicked off the third quarter with the shipment of its fifth cargo now aboard the 174,000 m3 BW ENN Snow Lotus, following two ship-to-ship transfers of LNG from the Gimi FLNG unit.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin LNG resumes exports after June maintenance, first-half exports steady year on year
Description: Russia's 10.8 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant at Prigorodnoye port has resumed exports following a scheduled maintenance shutdown in June, with production partially restarting earlier this week.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt, Azerbaijan seek greater collaboration in upstream projects, LNG trade
Description: Egypt and Azerbaijan are advancing discussions to deepen cooperation in oil and gas, including LNG trade and upstream investment, as Cairo aims to bolster energy security and diversify supply sources.
Author: CK

Title: German LNG imports reach all-time high in June
Description: Imports of LNG into Germany have surged to their highest in June since the country entered the market as an importer at the end of 2023.
Author: JS

Title: China’s LNG re-exports surge in first-half 2025, demand remains sluggish amid high Inventories
Description: China re-exported more LNG in the first half of 2025 than it did during all of 2024, as weak domestic demand, elevated inventories, and high spot prices continued to weigh on consumption.
Author: CK

Title: Italy’s Snam, Ukraine’s GTSOU sign gas cooperation memorandum
Description: Italy’s gas infrastructure player Snam and grid operator Gas Transmission System Operator of Ukraine (GTSOU) have signed a memorandum of cooperation aiming at strengthening the collaboration between the Ukrainian and Italian gas markets to enhance energy security.
Author: JS

Title: India's Petronet, Deepak Fertilisers ink LNG regasification pact
Description: India’s Petronet LNG Limited has signed a mid-term regasification agreement with a subsidiary of Deepak Fertilisers.
Author: JS

Title: Adnoc Gas, Sefe enter 3-year LNG supply agreement
Description: ADNOC Gas has entered into a three-year LNG supply agreement with Germany’s Securing Energy for Europe (SEFE), for the delivery of 0.7 mtpa with deliveries commencing this year.
Author: JS

Title: Sinopec’s Longkou LNG terminal clears final project inspection, nears commissioning
Description: China’s state-owned Sinopec has cleared a key milestone toward launching its 6.5 mtpa Longkou LNG receiving terminal in Yantai, Shandong province, with the project’s first phase having passed its final project inspection on June 30, according to the Yantai municipal government.
Author: CK

Title: Global LNG bunkering sets new record in June, led by Europe’s growth
Description: Global LNG bunkering volumes rose to an all-time high of 730,000 m3 in June, marking a 2.4% increase from May and a 28% year-on-year surge, as the pace of  marine fuel adoption continued to pick up across key regions, according to Kpler's June 2025 LNG Bunkering Report.
Author: CK

Title: Technip Energies wins contract for preliminary work on Coral North FLNG project
Description: French engineering firm Technip Energies has secured a contract from Coral FLNG SA to carry out preliminary work on the proposed Eni-led 3.6 mtpa Coral North Floating Liquefied Natural Gas project offshore Mozambique.
Author: CK

Title: Japan outpaces China in first-half 2025 LNG imports, but China leads in May and June
Description: Japan narrowly overtook China as Asia’s largest LNG importer in the first half of 2025, despite a late rebound in Chinese imports that saw it outpace Japan in May and June.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex to take Ichthys LNG offline until early October for maintenance
Description: Japan’s Inpex has confirmed that it will take its 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Darwin, Australia offline until mid-October for planned maintenance which is set to become its longest since start-up.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada’s export pace may be set to quicken as it prepares to ship third cargo
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, is loading its third cargo in about two weeks, signalling a smooth commissioning phase and an export pace an export rhythm that may be set to accelerate from Canada’s first LNG export facility.
Author: CK

Title: Cooldown completed for Egypt’s two additional FSRUs, clearing path for imminent startup
Description: Two floating storage and regasification units, the 160,000 m3 Energos Eskimo and 174,000 m3 Energos Power—have completed cooldown operations, clearing the way for their startup in Egypt as early as July 15 and 16.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgartransgaz secures financing for Vertical Gas Corridor
Description: Bulgarian gas transmission operator Bulgartransgaz has secured financing for the Vertical Gas Corridor project.
Author: JS

Title: Trump threatens secondary tariffs of 100% on Russia
Description: US President Donald Trump has threatened secondary tariffs of 100% on Russia if a ceasefire deal in Ukraine is not reached in 50 days.
Author: JS

Title: Steel-cutting for Poland’s Gdansk FSRU to begin next week, keel laying in December
Description: Steel-cutting is set to begin next week at HD Hyundai Heavy Industries for Poland’s Gdansk floating storage regasification unit, a key step in the construction of the government-backed project, according to a source involved in the project.
Author: CK

Title: Floating LNG exports rise by 16% in first-half 2025 as new capacity ramps up
Description: Global floating LNG exports rose by nearly 16% year-on-year in the first half of 2025, driven by the addition of new liquefaction capacity, with early contributions from New Fortress Energy’s 1.4 mtpa Altamira terminal in Mexico, Eni’s 0.6 mtpa Congo FLNG, and the BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim project off Mauritania and Senegal.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore LNG bunker sales rise in June for a fourth straight month
Description: LNG bunker sales in Singapore rose for a fourth consecutive month in June, reflecting steady operations in the world’s busiest bunkering hub.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global plans to boost Plaquemines Expansion with four more liquefaction blocks
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has significantly expanded the scope of its proposed Plaquemines Expansion LNG project, increasing proposed capacity to approximately 24.8 mtpa by adding four more liquefaction blocks to the design for a total of 16 liquefaction blocks, according to a Jul. 14 filing with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.
Author: CK

Title: Norway’s Snohvit plant maintenance gets 10-day extension
Description: Norway's 4.2 mtpa Snohvit LNG export plant has extended its ongoing planned maintenance by 10 days and is now expected to return to operations on July 29.
Author: JS

Title: Senegal set to receive second LNG cargo at Dakar FSRU
Description: Senegal is set to receive its second LNG cargo this week, as the BW Brussels signals arrival at Dakar’s floating import terminal later this week, advancing the country’s shift away from fuel oil in power generation.
Author: CK

Title: India’s HPCL issues tender for 10 LNG cargoes to Chhara from 2026–2027
Description: India’s Hindustan Petroleum Corp. has issued a tender seeking 10 LNG cargoes for delivery to its 5 mtpa Chhara terminal in Gujarat on a delivered ex-ship basis, with shipments scheduled between March 2026 and December 2027, according to market sources.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Eskimo kicks off LNG receipts at Egypt's newly installed FSRUs
Description: Egypt has started receiving LNG at the first of two additional floating storage and regasification units recently installed at its Ain Sukhna port as part of  a strategy to bolster its gas imports amid soaring electricity demand this summer.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada to ship fourth cargo as export pace ramps up
Description: A fourth LNG tanker is set to moor at the Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada to load cargo, owing to a speedy ramp-up in LNG production.
Author: JS

Title: Eni to buy 2 mtpa of LNG from Venture Global’s CP2 project
Description: US-based LNG developer Venture Global and Italian energy company Eni have signed a sales and purchase agreement, under which Eni will buy 2 mtpa of LNG from Venutre Global’s proposed 20 mtpa CP2 LNG project in Louisiana for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Egas, NFE agree five-year charter for Energos Winter FSRU at Egypt’s Damietta port
Description: New Fortress Energy has signed a five-year deal with Egypt’s state gas company, Egas, to deploy the Energos Winter floating storage and regasification unit  in Egypt as early as August, marking the fourth floating import terminal to be installed in the country as it ramps up efforts to boost gas supply amid peak summer electricity demand.
Author: CK

Title: Gail seeks up to 110 LNG cargoes for delivery to India from 2027
Description: India’s state-controlled gas distributor Gail has launched a two-stage tender seeking up to 110 LNG cargoes for delivery over a five-to-10-year period starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Elba Island feed gas volumes dip as facility starts planned maintenance
Description: The feed gas supplies to the 2.5 mtpa Elba Island LNG export plant in Georgia, US have bottomed out due planned maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: Barossa project 97% complete: Santos
Description: Australian independent Santos has reached an approximately 97% completion rate for its Barossa project, which it expects to commence production in the third quarter of this year.
Author: JS

Title: Freeport LNG shuts Train 2 again after compressor issue; eighth outage since May
Description: Freeport LNG temporarily shut down the second liquefaction train at its 15 mtpa Texas plant earlier this week after a compressor malfunction caused the unit to trip and triggered nearly 12 hours of gas flaring.
Author: CK

Title: Second LNG tanker lifts LNG from sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 this year
Description: An LNG carrier blacklisted by the US has become the second vessel to dock and load at Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: FERC clears introduction of hazardous liquids to Phase 2 of Plaquemines LNG
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) has approved the introduction of hazardous fluids into Block 14 of the Phase 2 of Plaquemines LNG as exports peak in June.
Author: JS

Title: BASF to purchase 2 Bcm of gas from Equinor for 10 years
Description: German chemicals manufacturer BASF and Norway’s Equinor have signed a 10-year strategic agreement under which BASF will buy up to 23 TWh, or around 2 billion m3, of natural gas.
Author: JS

Title: Nigerian LNG exports on the rise as July exports set to peak
Description: Exports of LNG from Nigeria have risen in recent months, with July exports set to reach their highest since early 2022.
Author: JS

Title: EU targets Nord Stream pipelines as it adopts 18th sanctions package against Russia
Description: The European Commission has adopted a new sanctions package on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, its 18th since February 2022, with Nord Stream subsea gas pipelines as the main targets.
Author: JS

Title: Sabah’s SMJ Energy to take 25% stake in Petronas’ PFLNG 3 project
Description: Sabah state-owned energy firm SMJ Energy has signed a heads of agreement with Malaysia’s Petronas for a 25% equity stake in the proposed PFLNG 3 project — a 2 mtpa nearshore floating LNG facility under development at the Sipitang Oil & Gas Industrial Park in Sabah.
Author: CK

Title: Arctic LNG 2 fills Saam floating storage unit, raises questions over continuing output and outlets
Description: The transfer of an LNG cargo aboard the 138,028 m3 Arctic Metagas LNG tanker from Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant to the Murmansk transshipment terminal is again filling the 354,000 m3 Saam floating storage unit to capacity — raising fresh questions about ongoing production and available outlets, especially as shipments have recently resumed.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Croatia now expects Krk terminal to restart in late October, extending maintenance period
Description: The 2.1 mtpa LNG terminal in Krk, Croatia, is now expected to remain offline until late October—two weeks longer than initially planned—as part of a scheduled maintenance and upgrade project aimed at expanding the facility’s regasification capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina’s Enarsa awards BP all five August LNG cargoes in fourth 2025 tender: sources
Description: Argentina’s state-run energy company Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has awarded BP all five cargoes in its fourth LNG tender of the year, which closed on July 15, according to market sources. The deliveries are scheduled for Aug. 9, 13, 17, 22, and 28 at the 6.1 mtpa Escobar terminal.
Author: CK

Title: South American LNG imports hit two-year high in July, driven by Brazil’s surge
Description: Imports of LNG to South America have increased, as Argentina’s persisting demand and a shoot up in intakes to Brazil are set to boost July volumes to their highest in the last two years.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s Map Ta Phut 2 halts LNG imports after jetty accident: sources
Description: Thailand’s 7.5 mtpa Nong Fab LNG terminal, also known as Map Ta Phut 2, has halted imports since July 13, with traders attributing the pause to an accident at the terminal that has led the operator to declare force majeure and request deferment of cargoes, according to sources familiar with the matter.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt’s third FSRU receives first LNG cargo after installation via ship-to-ship transfer
Description: The recently installed Energos Power floating storage and regasification unit at Egypt’s Sonker terminal in Ain Sukhna has received its first LNG cargo through a ship-to-ship transfer with the SM Kestrel LNG tanker, marking the start of operations for the country’s third FSRU.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s JGC secures preliminary contract for FLNG project in Africa
Description: Japanese engineering firm JGC, as part of a joint venture, has been awarded a $550 million preliminary engineering contract for a floating LNG project in Africa, widely understood to be the Coral North floating LNG development offshore Mozambique.
Author: CK

Title: EU lifts sanctions from trio of MOL’s LNG tankers
Description: The EU has lifted sanctions against three ice-class LNG  tankers operated by Japan's shipping firm MOL, which were purpose-built serve Novatek's LNG projects in the Russian Arctic, due to “firm commitments” that these tankers will no longer serve the facilities.
Author: JS

Title: Romanian regulator approves construction of pipelines from Neptun Deep field
Description: The Romanian Energy Regulatory Authority (ANRE) has granted authorisation to develop upstream supply pipelines associated with natural gas production in the offshore 8 billion m3/year Neptun Deep gas field in the Black Sea.
Author: JS

Title: Gulfstream LNG cleared to proceed with FERC application for its Louisiana LNG export project
Description: US LNG project developer Gulfstream LNG has cleared a key regulatory milestone after the US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission formally accepted its application to develop a 4 mtpa onshore LNG export facility in Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Hanwha Ocean to co-build US-flagged LNG carrier at Hanwha Philly Shipyard
Description: Hanwha Shipping has placed a 348 billion won (about $250 million) order for a US-flagged LNG carrier that will be co-built by South Korea’s Hanwha Ocean and its US-based affiliate, Hanwha Philly Shipyard.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside permanently retires second train at North West Shelf, reducing overall LNG plant capacity
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has permanently retired Train 2 at the Karratha Gas Plant, lowering the North West Shelf project’s nameplate liquefaction capacity from 16.9 mtpa to 14.3 mtpa, according to its second-quarter results for the period ending June 30.
Author: CK

Title: FERC approves Golden Pass LNG to introduce fuel gas into flares, advancing commissioning
Description: The US. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has authorized the 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG to introduce hazardous fluids into its fuel gas system and two ground flares, marking a significant step in the commissioning and pre-startup process for the yet-to-start export terminal in Sabine Pass, Texas.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies, CMA CGM form LNG bunkering JV to boost maritime decarbonization
Description: TotalEnergies and CMA CGM have announced a 50/50 joint venture to develop and operate LNG bunkering logistics in the Amsterdam-Rotterdam-Antwerp region, marking the first collaboration between a shipping line and an energy provider to jointly manage LNG bunkering facilities
Author: CK

Title: Hammerfest LNG, Kollsnes outages weigh on Equinor’s second-quarter gas output
Description: Planned maintenance at Equinor’s 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG terminal and the Kollsnes gas processing plant weighed on the Norwegian firm’s gas production in the second quarter, it said in results published Wednesday, although total oil and gas output still rose year-on-year.
Author: CK

Title: Trump hints at a US-Japan LNG joint venture in Alaska
Description: US President Donald Trump has said that the United States and Japan are in talks to conclude a deal to form a joint venture for LNG in Alaska.
Author: JS

Title: Saipem, Subsea 7 sign merger to create Saipem 7
Description: Italian oilfield services firm Saipem and UK’s offshore project contractor Subsea 7 have announced a merger agreement, creating a global leader in energy services.
Author: JS

Title: Damage detected at Japan's Takahama 4 nuclear reactor, restart timing uncertain
Description: Japanese power utility Kansai Electric has discovered wall thinning and possible cracking in steam generator tubes at its 870 MW Takahama Unit 4 nuclear reactor during scheduled maintenance, raising questions about its planned late October restart.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG gets partial in-service authorization for pipeline interconnect facility ahead of startup
Description: The 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG project in Sabine Pass, Texas, has received federal approval to place its pipeline interconnect facility into partial service, connecting the terminal to the Natural Gas Pipeline Company of America system and marking further progress in commissioning ahead of the project’s anticipated startup by year-end.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies sees mid-2026 start for Qatar’s North Field East LNG project
Description: TotalEnergies expects the first train at Qatar’s North Field East LNG expansion project to come online in mid-2026, as planned, with subsequent trains following at six-month intervals, Chief Executive Patrick Pouyanne said during the company’s second-quarter earnings call yesterday.
Author: CK

Title: Asian LNG demand to stay soft through October as ample stocks dampen spot demand: Kpler
Description: Asian LNG demand is set to remain subdued from July through October, with imports across major buyers—China, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, India, and Thailand—expected to total around 79 mt, down 5 mt year on year, according to an outlook presented by Kpler Insight during a webinar today.
Author: CK

Title: Kansai Electric expects delay in restart of Takahama Unit 4 nuclear reactor
Description: Japanese power utility Kansai Electric expects a delay in the restart of its 870 MW Takahama Unit 4 nuclear reactor, originally targeted for late September 2025, as it conducts detailed inspections of steam generator tubes following the discovery of wall thinning and possible cracking.
Author: CK

Title: Corinth Pipeworks awarded contract for Greece-North Macedonia gas interconnector
Description: Greek steel pipe manufacturer Corinth Pipeworks has been awarded a contract to construct the Greece-North Macedonia natural gas interconnector which will boost the regional energy security.
Author: JS

Title: Eni eyes FID for Argentina LNG in first quarter of 2026
Description: Italian energy firm Eni has said it expects to make a final investment decision (FID), together with partner, Argentina’s YPF, in the first quarter of 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG gets new gas supply deal
Description: Venture Global’s 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana has signed a new gas sales and purchase agreement with US’s independent gas marketer Tenaska Marketing Ventures.
Author: JS

Title: Japanese utilities remain wary of investing in Alaska LNG despite US optimism
Description: Japanese utilities remain cautious about investing in the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project, even as President Donald Trump recently highlighted  the prospect of a joint venture between the two countries.
Author: CK

Title: Saipem reiterates restart of works on Mozambique LNG “within summer”
Description: The engineering contractor of the idled 18 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Cabo Delgado province has confirmed the expectation of restart of works on the project this summer.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies’ Pouyanne tempers expectations for an imminent restart of Mozambique LNG
Description: TotalEnergies Chief Executive Patrick Pouyanne said the company is still working to secure "strong alignment" on various fronts before restarting the long-delayed 13 mtpa Mozambique LNG project, tempering expectations for an imminent restart.
Author: CK

Title: US-EU $750 billion energy trade deal faces reality check as LNG capacity falls short
Description: The US and EU have announced a new trade agreement targeting $750 billion in energy purchases over three years, but Kpler Insight suggests the goal is overly ambitious and cannot be met, especially with LNG alone.
Author: JS

Title: Equinor delays Hammerfest LNG restart to early August
Description: Norway’s Equinor has again pushed back the restart of the 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on the country’s Melkoya Island from planned maintenance, this time by a few days to Aug. 3, according to an update on Gassco’s Remit transparency platform.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTTEP finalizes deal for 50% interest in Malaysia–Thailand gas block
Description: Thailand’s state-owned upstream firm PTTEP has acquired a 50% participating interest in Block A-18 of the Malaysia–Thailand Joint Development Area, strengthening its upstream gas portfolio and reinforcing Thailand’s energy security as the country continues to rely on LNG imports.
Author: CK

Title: Ukraine signs gas deal with Azerbaijan for the first time
Description: Ukraine’s Naftogaz has signed its first agreement with Azerbaijan’s Socar for the purchase of gas from Azerbaijan.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global makes FID on Phase 1 of CP2 LNG export plant
Description: Venture Global has announced a final investment decision (FID) and successful closing of the $15.1 billion project financing for Phase 1 of the company’s third project, the 24 mtpa CP2 LNG, together with the associated CP Express Pipeline.
Author: JS

Title: Eni sees CP2 LNG as ‘competitive' supply source despite Venture Global arbitration issues
Description: Eni sees its planned LNG offtake from Venture Global’s CP2 LNG in Louisiana as a competitive addition to its global portfolio despite ongoing arbitration proceedings between the US LNG project developer and several  LNG offtakers, an executive said during the company’s recent second-quarter earnings call.
Author: CK

Title: Slower loadings, idle tankers point to commissioning issues at LNG Canada
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project has not shipped a cargo since Jul. 24, suggesting the possibility of commissioning-related issues at the newly launched export terminal in Kitimat.
Author: CK

Title: Petronet LNG switches Gopalpur LNG plan from FSRU to land-based facility
Description: Indian LNG importer Petronet LNG has switched ita plans for a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at Gopalpur LNG in Odisha to a land-based facility due to a shortage of floating units.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Dahej July LNG imports rebound on-month; expansion completion timeline slips again
Description: LNG imports at India’s largest terminal, the 17.5 mtpa Dahej export facility in Gujarat, are expected to rise month-on-month in July, although volumes remain below year-ago levels.
Author: CK

Title: Demand rises for Trans-Balkan gas capacity to Ukraine
Description: Booking of firm bundled capacity along the Trans-Balkan corridor rose by 2.6 times in the latest auction, underscoring growing interest in routing LNG and other gas volumes from Greece to Ukraine via Southeast Europe’s integrated transport network.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside to take over operatorship of Bass Strait oil and gas assets from ExxonMobil
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has agreed to take over  operatorship of the Bass Strait oil and gas assets from ExxonMobil Australia, strengthening its position in the Australian domestic gas sector.
Author: CK

Title: Arctic LNG 2 ramps up as fourth vessel due to load cargo
Description: The activity at the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export plant in Russia has ramped up, as a fourth tanker was spotted close to the facility possibly preparing to load cargo.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctioned cargo from Russia on its way to Asia after floating for over five months
Description: A cargo lifted from the sanctioned 1.5 mtpa Portovaya LNG plant in Russia appears to be en route to Asia, over five months after loading and idling floating storage due to sanctions.
Author: JS

Title: Baker Hughes to acquire Chart Industries
Description: US cryogenic equipment maker Chart Industries and compatriot energy technology giant Bake Hughes have entered into a definitive agreement under which Baker Hughes will acquire Chart for a total enterprise value of $13.6 billion.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada faces technical issues; more delays, diversions possible
Description: The 14 mtpa LNG Canada export plant in Kitimat has been experiencing technical issues with its start-up operations, as the noticed recent delays in loading operations at the facility.
Author: JS

Title: Worley receives full notice to proceed with works on CP2 LNG
Description: Australian engineering contractor Worley has received a Full Notice to Proceed from Venture Global under its reimbursable engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract for the Phase 1 of CP2 LNG export project facility located in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Sakhalin, Japan, Taiwan LNG terminals on tsunami alert after major Kamchatka quake
Description: A powerful magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck off the east coast of Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula early Wednesday, triggering tsunami warnings for regions along the Pacific coast, including Russia Japan and Taiwan, leading to concerns over LNG supply disruptions with these  countries home to critical LNG export and import terminals.
Author: CK

Title: LNG deliveries to China face delays amid typhoon and tsunami threats to eastern ports
Description: China’s eastern LNG terminals are bracing for potential disruption as twin natural hazards—Typhoon Co-May and a tsunami triggered by a major earthquake off Kamchatka today—threaten coastal areas, where a few of China’s LNG import terminals are located.
Author: CK

Title: Knutsen takes delivery of second LNG carrier for QatarEnergy projects
Description: Norwegian shipping firm Knutsen Group has taken delivery of the 174,000 m3 LNG carrier Mesaieed from South Korea’s HD Hyundai,  the second in a series of ten vessels being built for long-term charter to QatarEnergy.
Author: CK

Title: Canada’s Tourmaline Oil to supply Uniper with feed gas for 8 years
Description: German energy company Uniper and Canadian gas producer Tourmaline Oil have finalised an eight-year physical gas agreement for 80,000 mmBtu per day beginning in November 2028, or the equivalent of 6.6 billion m3 during the deal’s lifetime.
Author: JS

Title: Adriatic LNG to go offline for maintenance, regasification capacity increase
Description: The 6.6 mtpa Adriatic LNG terminal in Rovigo has announced a one-month maintenance period, during which it will shut regasification operations and increase the terminal’s capacity.
Author: JS

Title: Jera to offtake 1.5 mtpa of LNG from Sempra’s Port Arthur LNG’s Phase 2
Description: Sempra Infrastructure and Jera have announced a 20-year sales and purchase agreement for the supply of 1.5 mtpa of LNG offtake from the Phase 2 of the 26 mtpa Port Arthur LNG project in Jefferson County, Texas.
Author: JS

Title: Europe’s July LNG imports dip despite strong year-on-year growth
Description: European imports in July slipped 10% compared with June’s volumes, as seasonality and maintenance across multiple receiving terminals on the continent weighs on intakes.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade expects September 2025 FID for Train 5 of Rio Grande LNG
Description: US-based LNG project developer NextDecade has confirmed that it still expects to make a final investment decision (FID) on its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project’s Train 4 in mid-September, as well as Train 5 which it did not set a timeline for before.
Author: JS

Title: Fluor, JGC awarded FEED contract for Phase 2 of LNG Canada
Description: US engineering firm Fluor Corporation has announced that its joint venture (JV) with Japan’s JGC Corporation was awarded the contract to update the Front-End Engineering and Design (FEED) for a proposed Phase 2 expansion of the LNG Canada facility in Kitimat, British Columbia.
Author: JS

Title: Glenfarne expects to make FID on Texas LNG by year-end
Description: US LNG project developer Glenfarne said that it expects to make a final investment decision (FID) on its 4 mtpa Texas LNG export project in Brownsville by the end of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada ships fifth cargo after prolonged loading and vessel arrival gaps
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia,has shipped its fifth LNG cargo since launching exports on Jul. 1, with the latest departure following an extended gap in vessel arrivals and slower loading operations for the previous shipment.
Author: CK

Title: Jordan receives Energos Force FSRU at Aqaba, LNG imports poised to resume
Description: The Energos Force floating storage and regasification unit has arrived at Jordan’s Aqaba terminal, setting the stage for a resumption of LNG imports after a pause of over two months.
Author: CK

Title: Spain LNG reload heads to Port Said for first time in a year, likely bound for Egypt or Jordan
Description: An LNG cargo reloaded at Spain’s 12.6 mtpa Barcelona LNG receiving terminal appears to be heading toward the East Mediterranean, potentially marking the first such re-export to the region since July 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Adnoc Gas to supply 0.5 mtpa of LNG to India’s HPCL
Description: Adnoc Gas has signed a heads of agreement with Hindustan Petroleum Corp. Ltd. to supply 0.5 mtpa of LNG for 10 years.
Author: JS

Title: Kosmos Energy targets 20 LNG cargoes from GTA FLNG in 2025 as output ramps up
Description: Kosmos Energy expects the BP-led Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal to produce around 20 LNG cargoes this year as the project ramps up toward its nameplate capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor’s Hammerfest LNG poised to resume operations following extended maintenance
Description: Equinor’s Hammerfest LNG plant has wrapped up its extended maintenance as planned on Aug 3, with the outage no longer listed on Norway’s Gassco Remit platform as of that day. However, no vessels are currently scheduled to load before Aug 5.
Author: CK

Title: Inpex launches front-end engineering work for Indonesia’s 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project
Description: Japanese upstream firm Inpex has kicked off ront-end engineering and design work for its long-delayed 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG project in Indonesia’s Masela Block, marking a key step forward in the development of the major greenfield export facility.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG reaffirms second-half 2025 FID target with EPC contract award to Technip
Description: US LNG project developer Commonwealth LNG has reaffirmed its target to take a  final investment decision on its 9.5 mtpa LNG project in the second half of 2025, with the award of an engineering, procurement and construction contract for the planned export facility in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, to Technip.
Author: CK

Title: Calcasieu Pass gets regulatory green light for more LNG exports to non-FTA markets
Description: The US Department of Energy has issued final authorization for US LNG exporter Venture Global to export an additional 20 billion ft3 of natural gas per year as LNG from its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass terminal in Louisiana to countries with which the US has no free trade agreement.
Author: CK

Title: US LNG exports reach all-time high in July as output rebounds, Europe demand strengthens
Description: US LNG exports hit a new record in July, driven by a rebound in output from several export terminals following scheduled maintenance in June, and strengthening European demand.
Author: CK

Title: Jordan’s newly installed FSRU at Aqaba poised to receive its first LNG cargo
Description: The newly installed 174,000 m3 Energos Force floating storage regasification unit at Jordan’s Aqaba LNG terminal is poised to receive its first LNG cargo today, marking the resumption of import operations at the terminal since the end of May.
Author: CK

Title: Adnoc Gas advances Ruwais LNG project amid record second-quarter 2025 earnings
Description: Adnoc Gas is progressing its planned 9.6 mtpa Ruwais LNG project to capture an increasing share of the global LNG market, describing LNG as a “valuable and growing part” of its product portfolio.
Author: CK

Title: Trump’s tariff ultimatum to Russia puts gas flows in market crosshairs
Description: Trump’s ultimatum to Russia to end the war in Ukraine by August 8 has sparked market speculation over the shape of looming secondary tariffs, with particular concern over their potential reach into energy commodities.
Author: JS

Title: NewMed Energy signs gas supply deal underpinning Leviathan field expansion
Description: Israel’s upstream operator NewMed Energy has signed a gas supply deal with Egypt’s Blue Ocean Energy (BOE), paving the way for the 12 billion m3/year Leviathan field offshore the Israeli portion of the Mediterranean Sea.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere, Jera sign 20-year SPA for 1 mtpa of LNG
Description: Cheniere Energy and JERA have signed a long-term 20-year LNG sales and purchase agreement (SPA) for 1 mtpa, commencing in 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere’s Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project hits 87% completion as Train 2 goes online
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere  has achieved substantial completion of Train 2 at its 10 mtpa Stage 3 LNG expansion at the Corpus Christi LNG plant, with first LNG produced from the train in June, the company said in its second-quarter earnings release today.
Author: CK

Title: India’s IOC to buy 2.5 mt of LNG from Trafigura
Description: India’s Indian Oil Corp (IOC) and Trafigura has signed a five-year binding supply deal, under which IOC will buy 2.5 mt of LNG throughout the whole period.
Author: JS

Title: Southern Energy greenlights second FLNG unit for first phase of Argentina LNG export project
Description: Southern Energy has taken a final investment decision on a 20-year charter for Golar LNG’s 3.5 mtpa MKII floating LNG unit, securing the second vessel for the first phase of the planned 30 mtpa Argentina LNG export project.
Author: CK

Title: China’s LNG imports rise for third straight month, but remain below year-ago levels
Description: China’s LNG imports in July posted month-on-month gains for the third consecutive month, but remained below volumes from a year earlier.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips books regasification capacity at Dunkerque LNG
Description: ConocoPhilips said that it has booked 1.5 mtpa of regasification capacity at France’s 9.6 mtpa Dunkerque LNG import terminal, with the terminal use agreement starting in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere targets 75 mtpa of LNG output by early 2030s, eyes 100 mtpa with phased brownfield expansions
Description: Cheniere Energy is targeting LNG production capacity of approximately 75 mtpa by the early 2030s, with potential to exceed 100 mtpa over the next decade, as it advances a phased, brownfield-led growth strategy.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Zhoushan LNG terminal adds four more storage tanks, increases import capacity
Description: The ENN-operated Zhoushan LNG terminal in China’s Zhejiang province has commissioned four new 220,000 m3 LNG storage tanks as part of its third expansion phase, increasing the facility’s storage capacity to 1.52 million m3 and boosting its import capacity to 10 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada receives second LNG ship this month amid loading pace scrutiny
Description: The Shell-led 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has received its sixth LNG tanker, the 174,000 m3 Puteri Mayang, eight days after the previous ship’s arrival, marking the terminal’s second shipment this month amid growing market attention on its loading schedule following recent longer loading times and extended intervals between tanker arrivals.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Canada flags delay to Phase 2, seeks higher annual export volume
Description: The Shell-led LNG Canada project has signalled a significant delay to the start-up of its proposed second phase, now expected in the early 2030s—some six to seven years after Phase 1—while simultaneously applying to the Canada Energy Regulator to increase its maximum annual LNG export volume.
Author: CK

Title: Greece-Bulgaria interconnector receives construction permit to expand capacity
Description: Gas Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (ICGB) has obtained a construction permit for Lot 1 of its planned capacity expansion project from 3 billion m3 per year to 5 billion m3/year.
Author: JS

Title: TotalEnergies supplies LNG for PIL’s first simultaneous bunkering, cargo operations in Singapore
Description: TotalEnergies has supplied 4,000 m3 of LNG to Pacific International Lines’ 8,200 TEU dual-fuel containership Kota Ocean in Singapore, marking the carrier’s first simultaneous cargo and LNG bunkering operation in the port.
Author: CK

Title: Gastrade resumes operations at Alexandroupolis LNG
Description: Greek terminal operator Gastrade has announced the restart of unloading and regasification at its 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) following prolonged unplanned outage.
Author: JS

Title: Egypt breaks LNG import record with boost from new terminals
Description: Egypt set a new record for LNG imports in July as soaring summer demand coincided with expanded import capacity and plentiful global supply.
Author: JS

Title: Santos extends exclusivity period with Adnoc’s XRG-led consortium amid takeover bid
Description: Australian independent Santos has extended by two weeks an exclusivity period with a consortium led by XRG, a unit of Abu Dhabi’s state-owned Adnoc, as the group moves closer to a potential $5.76 per share acquisition of the Australian gas producer. The consortium also includes Abu Dhabi Development Holding Company and Carlyle.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s Saibu Gas awards Chiyoda engineering contract for third Hibiki LNG storage tank
Description: Japanese utility firm Saibu Gas has awarded Chiyoda Corp. an engineering, procurement and construction contract to build a third LNG storage tank at its 2.4 mtpa Hibiki LNG terminal in Kitakyushu, with completion targeted for the first half of fiscal year 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Amigo LNG awards marine facilities engineering contract to Mexico’s Comsa Marine
Description: Amigo LNG, the Mexican joint venture of Texas-based Epcilon LNG and Singapore-based LNG Alliance, has awarded the engineering, procurement and construction contract for marine facilities at its proposed 7.8 mtpa LNG export terminal in Guaymas, Sonora, to Mexico-based Constructora Manzanillo, or Comsa Marine.
Author: CK

Title: Excelerate Energy buys LNG ship, eyes Caribbean growth opportunities
Description: Excelerate Energy is reinforcing its long-term growth strategy with the acquisition of an LNG carrier, Excelerate Shenandoah, marking the company’s first owned vessel slated for conversion into a floating storage and regasification unit.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra eyes FID for Phase 2 of Port Arthur LNG this year
Description: Sempra said that, as the project gains momentum, it expects to make a final investment decision (FID) on Phase 2 of Port Arthur LNG in Texas before the end of 2025.
Author: JS

Title: Russian-sanctioned tanker loads at Arctic LNG 2, fourth this year
Description: An LNG tanker sanctioned by the EU and US has loaded cargo at Russia's 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG export plant, making it the fourth loading this year.
Author: JS

Title: Venice Energy sells Outer Harbor LNG project in South Australia to AG&P LNG
Description: Australian energy infrastructure developer Venice Energy has sold its Outer Harbor LNG import terminal project in South Australia to AG&P LNG, following the signing of a sales agreement.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade secures equity commitments from TotalEnergies, GIP for Rio Grande LNG Train 4
Description: US LNG project developer NextDecade has secured up to $1.8 billion in equity commitments from TotalEnergies and Global Infrastructure Partners  to finance the fourth liquefaction train at its Rio Grande LNG project in Texas.
Author: CK

Title: EBRD lends Ukraine’s Naftogaz €500 million for emergency gas purchases
Description: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has allocated a loan of €500 million ($586 million) to Ukraine’s Naftogaz to finance emergency gas purchases. This is the bank’s largest single loan facility in Ukraine.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada warns of flaring following Train 1 restart
Description: LNG Canada said it will carry out flaring at its 14 mtpa export facility in Kitimat, British Columbia, between Aug. 11 and Aug. 13 as part of restarting Train 1.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global's 2025 cargo guidance largely unchanged as Plaquemines ramps up
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global has kept its 2025 cargo export guidance largely unchanged in its second-quarter results, with a slight adjustment reflecting the ongoing ramp-up at its Plaquemines LNG export facility.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global wins arbitration with Shell over delayed Calcasieu Pass contracted LNG deliveries
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global said a tribunal has ruled in its favor in an arbitration case filed by Shell, which challenged Venture Global’s treatment of commissioning cargoes from its Calcasieu Pass terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Seaspan, Anew Climate to supply first renewable LNG for bunkering on North American West Coast
Description: LNG bunker provider Seaspan Energy and climate solutions firm Anew Climate have agreed to supply renewable LNG  to shipowners along the North American West Coast, marking the region’s first renewable LNG bunkering offering.
Author: CK

Title: No cargoes set to arrive in near term for Alexandroupolis LNG despite partial restart
Description: No LNG cargoes are currently scheduled to arrive at Greece’s Alexandroupolis terminal, despite the facility resuming operations at 25% of its nominal capacity, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG seeks approval to start initial site preparation
Description: Kimmeridge’s Commonwealth LNG has submitted a request to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to start initial site preparation for its project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Venture Global to take delivery of five more LNG ships by end-2026 amid export ramp-up
Description: US LNG exporter Venture Global will take delivery of the final five vessels in its planned nine-carrier fleet between this month and the fourth quarter of 2026, boosting its shipping capacity as production from its Calcasieu Pass and Plaquemines LNG terminals in Louisiana increases.
Author: CK

Title: Gas Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria to launch two new routes benefitting Ukraine
Description: ICGB, the operator of the natural gas interconnector Greece-Bulgaria has announced that it is ready to launch two new cross-border capacity routes to expand direct gas transmission access from Greece to Ukraine.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada targets one export cargo every two days with start of Train 2
Description: LNG Canada is targeting a pace of one export cargo every two days as its recently started two-train 14 mn t/yr project in Kitimat, British Columbia, ramps up output from Train 1 and prepares to start Train 2.
Author: CK

Title: Centrica, Energy Capital Partners buy UK’s Grain LNG import terminal
Description: Centrica, in partnership with Energy Capital Partners (ECP), has acquired the 14.3 mtpa Grain LNG terminal on the Isle of Grain from National Grid for an enterprise value of £1.5 billion ($2 billion).
Author: JS

Title: Centrica to purchase gas from Devon Energy in the US
Description: Centrica has announced that its trading arm, Centrica Energy, has entered into a natural gas sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with US-based Devon Energy.
Author: JS

Title: LNG imports into Bangladesh hit new high in July amid firm spot demand
Description: Bangladesh’s LNG imports reached a new high in July, edging above the previous peak in January as the country’s demand for spot cargoes increased.
Author: CK

Title: LNG bunker sales in Singapore slip in July amid typical mid-year slowdown
Description: LNG bunker sales in Singapore fell in July, following four consecutive months of growth, reflecting a broader seasonal slowdown across Asia’s LNG bunkering markets.
Author: CK

Title: Karpowership, Seatrium team up on next-generation powership integrations, FSRU conversions
Description: Singapore’s marine engineering firm Seatrium and Turkey’s floating power plant operator Karpowership have signed a letter of intent to expand their strategic partnership on floating power, covering the integration of new-generation floating power plants and the conversion of LNG carriers into floating storage and regasification units.
Author: CK

Title: Putin decree unlikely to lure Western firms back to Russian energy projects
Description: Despite the latest Russian presidential decree, Kpler Insight suggests that Western companies are unlikely to seize the opportunity to reclaim stakes in Russian oil and gas projects.
Author: JS

Title: Several Arctic LNG 2 cargoes seen traversing the North Sea Route
Description: At least four sanctioned LNG tankers laden with LNG from the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 export plant are seen traversing the North Sea Route (NSR).
Author: JS

Title: Finland’s Exemplar FSRU en-route to Denmark for scheduled drydocking
Description: Finland’s Exemplar floating storage regasification unit has left the Inkoo LNG terminal for scheduled dry-docking, temporarily halting operations at the 4.8 mtpa import facility until October.
Author: CK

Title: Mexico’s Altamira terminal set to receive first LNG cargo since December
Description: A Shell-controlled LNG carrier is scheduled to arrive at Mexico’s Altamira import terminal on Aug. 27, marking the first cargo delivery to the facility since Dec. 30, 2024.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Winter FSRU expected in first half of September at Egypt's Damietta terminal
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Winter floating storage and regasification unit is expected to arrive at Egypt’s Damietta terminal in early September for installation after undergoing modifications at Turkey’s Besiktas Shipyard, according to sources familiar with the plans. Its arrival will add a fourth unit to the floating LNG import fleet in Egypt.
Author: CK

Title: Tohoku Electric’s Onagawa Unit 2 to shut down for preventive maintenance
Description: Japanese utility Tohoku Electric Power’s 825 MW Onagawa Nuclear Power Station Unit 2 is scheduled to shut down for 10 days from Aug. 21 for preventive maintenance, including the replacement of four hydrogen concentration detectors.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor to offtake 0.85 mtpa of LNG from Amigo LNG
Description: Mexico-based LNG project developed Amigo LNG has signed a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with global energy trader Gunvor for it to offtake 0.85 mtpa of LNG for 20 years, commencing in the second half of 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Santos takeover talks continue as Adnoc unit-led consortium delays binding agreement
Description: Discussions over a non-binding $18.7 billion takeover of Australian gas producer Santos by a consortium led by Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.’s subsidiary XRG are ongoing, but the parties are unlikely to meet the current Aug. 22 exclusivity deadline for a binding agreement.
Author: CK

Title: NWS Project Extension consultations continue as Karratha Gas Plant ullage rises
Description: Woodside and its North West Shelf joint venture partners are continuing consultations with the Australian Government on proposed conditions for the NWS Project Extension, which will support long-term operations and processing of future third-party gas at Australia's oldest and largest LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s NYK delivers third LNG ship to QatarEnergy as part of  fleet expansion programme
Description: Japanese shipper NYK has delivered the 174,000 m3 Al Zuwair LNG tanker to QatarEnergy, marking another step in the state-owned company’s massive newbuilding program to support its North Field LNG expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: Nikkiso to provide regasification equipment for LNG-to-power project in the Bahamas
Description: Japanese cryogenic solutions player Nikkiso Clean Energy & Industrial Gases Group has announced that it was contracted by Shell-FOCOL joint venture NPG to provide LNG regasification and cryogenic equipment for the New Providence Gas Project in Nassau, the Bahamas.
Author: JS

Title: Hammerfest LNG faces six-day shipment gap following brief unplanned outage
Description: Norway’s 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Melkoya Island faces a six-day gap in exports, following an unplanned three-day outage and the departure of its most recent cargo on Aug. 18.
Author: CK

Title: Shanghai LNG terminal’s first expansion phase set to start up by year-end
Description: The first expansion phase of the 6 mtpa Shanghai LNG terminal at Yangshan Port in China is expected to be commissioned by the end of 2025, bolstering Shanghai’s role as a major LNG hub and supporting the city’s growing LNG bunkering and ship-fueling businesses.
Author: CK

Title: Ichthys LNG Train 1 under repair during maintenance after unplanned outage
Description: Train 1 at the two-train, 8.9 mtpa Ichthys LNG plant in Darwin, Australia, is undergoing repairs during scheduled maintenance after an unexpected shutdown last week that likely cost the plant at least one cargo, term offtakers said.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s LNG stocks edge higher for a third consecutive week amid hotter weather
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities rose for a third consecutive week, climbing just above 2 mt to surpass end-of-August 2024 levels but remaining below the five-year August average.
Author: CK

Title: ConocoPhillips to offtake 4 mtpa of LNG from Sempra’s Port Arthur Phase 2
Description: US energy firm ConocoPhillips has signed a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with Sempra Infrastructure to offtake 4 mtpa of LNG from Phase 2 of its 26 mtpa Port Arthur LNG export project in Jefferson County, Texas, for a 20-year term.
Author: JS

Title: Europe’s gas storage climbs at slower pace but stays on track
Description: European gas storage is climbing at a slower pace that mirrors 2022 rather than the record highs of recent years, shaped by more flexible EU rules, steady Norwegian flows and limited competition for LNG, which together reduce the urgency of refilling.
Author: JS

Title: China’s Guoxin LNG terminal in Jiangsu 80% complete, slated for year-end finish
Description: Construction of the 6.5 mtpa Guoxin LNG terminal at Yangkou port in Rudong, Jiangsu province, is approaching completion, with around 80% of the project finished as of Aug. 18 and full completion slated for year-end, according to the Nantong Maritime Administration.
Author: CK

Title: Cameron LNG feed gas flows dip amid scheduled maintenance
Description: Cameron LNG has begun planned maintenance, reducing feedgas flows to its 13.5 mtpa export terminal in Louisiana since Aug. 18, although cargo loadings are not expected to be affected.
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC sells September LNG cargo via Shanghai gas exchange
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC sold one September LNG cargo today through the first of two auctions on the Shanghai Petroleum and Natural Gas Exchange  for September–October LNG supply.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside clears final environmental hurdle for Scarborough Energy Project, paving way for startup
Description: Australian independent Woodside has welcomed a Federal Court decision upholding the offshore regulator’s acceptance of its Scarborough operations environment plan, clearing the final approval needed to connect, commission and operate the project’s offshore facilities.
Author: CK

Title: Seaside LNG conducts first LNG bunkering on world’s largest cruise ship
Description: US LNG bunker supplier Seaside LNG completed the first LNG bunkering of Royal Caribbean International’s Star of the Seas, the world’s largest cruise ship, at Port Canaveral earlier this month, ahead of the vessel’s maiden voyage.
Author: CK

Title: Karpowership signs deal to supply two floating power vessels to Iraq
Description: Karpowership affiliate BKPS has signed a contract with Iraq’s Ministry of Electricity and the General Company for Electric Energy Production / Southern to deploy two floating power plants, or Powerships, with a combined capacity of 590 MW in Basra.
Author: CK

Title: Texas LNG secures five-year FERC extension to 2029 to construct and start operations
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has granted Texas LNG a five-year extension to construct and bring online its proposed 4 mtpa LNG export terminal in Brownsville, Texas, extending the deadline to Nov. 22, 2029.
Author: CK

Title: Kogas lifts first LNG cargo from Shell-led LNG Canada as project ramps up
Description: South Korea’s Kogas has lifted its first LNG cargo from the Shell-operated 14 mtpa LNG Canada project, marking the eighth cargo exported since the terminal began operations on Jul. 1.
Author: CK

Title: Santos expects first gas from Barossa Gas Project imminently as Darwin LNG nears startup
Description: Australian gas producer Santos expects to produce first gas at its Barossa Gas Project “imminently”, with production flowing to the mothballed Santos-operated 3.7 mtpa Darwin LNG plant, which has been shut since e late 2023 and is has now reached ready-for-startup  status.
Author: CK

Title: Nigeria LNG signs 20-year gas supply agreements for Bonny Island LNG plant
Description: Nigeria LNG has signed multiple 20-year gas supply agreements with the Nigerian National Petroleum Co. and several upstream gas suppliers for the delivery of 1.29 billion ft3 per day, or 13.3 billion m3, of feed gas for its 22.2 mtpa LNG plant on Bonny Island.
Author: CK

Title: Santos gives XRG-led consortium more time for proposed takeover
Description: Australian gas producer Santos Limited has given a consortium led by XRG, a subsidiary of ADNOC, additional time under the terms of their exclusivity agreement to complete due diligence, finalise acceptable deal terms, and obtain the necessary approvals for a proposed acquisition of the company before signing a binding agreement.The parties have agreed to extend negotiations to Sep. 19.
Author: CK

Title: Macquarie signs deal to offtake 0.6 mtpa of LNG from Amigo LNG for 15 years
Description: Global trading and financial services firm Macquarie Group has signed a 15-year long-term sales and purchase agreement (SP) with Amigo LNG to purchase 0.6 mtpa of LNG from the 7.8 mtpa floating export plant.
Author: JS

Title: Trafigura signs long-term LNG supply deal with South Korea’s Kogas
Description: Trafigura has signed a long-term agreement to supply LNG to South Korea’s state-owned gas utility and one of the world’s largest LNG importers, Kogas.
Author: CK

Title: Taiwan's vote against restarting Maanshan nuclear plant reinforces LNG's role
Description: Taiwan’s recent referendum on reopening the Maanshan nuclear power plant failed to meet the required threshold, leaving the its nuclear generation at zero and cementing its reliance on LNG amid tighter coal restrictions and increased gas capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Eni’s Nguya FLNG ready to sail from China, set to lift Congo LNG capacity to 3 mtpa
Description: Eni’s Nguya floating liquefied natural gas unit is ready to depart from China for the Republic of Congo, representing a major step toward the startup of the second phase of the Congo LNG project and the expansion of its overall export capacity to 3 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: CNOOC sells one October LNG cargo through auction on Shanghai gas exchange
Description: China’s state-owned CNOOC has sold one LNG cargo for delivery in October through an auction today on the Shanghai Petroleum and Natural Gas Exchange, concluding the second of two planned September–October LNG auctions.
Author: CK

Title: Amigo LNG awards FLNG engineering contract to Drydocks World for Guaymas terminal
Description: Amigo LNG, the Mexican joint venture of Texas-based Epcilon LNG and Singapore-based LNG Alliance has awarded an engineering, procurement, and construction contract for a floating LNG facility and related floating storage unit infrastructure to Dubai shipyard Drydocks World.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Croatia FSRU heads to Turkey shipyard for regasification upgrade
Description: The 138,830 m3 LNG Croatia floating storage regasification unit has left the Krk terminal and is likely headed for the Kuzey Star shipyard in Istanbul, where it will undergo maintenance and receive an additional regasification module to boost its capacity.
Author: CK

Title: EQT, Sempra sign a 2 mtpa long-term supply agreement from Port Arthur Phase 2
Description: Sempra and EQT Corporation have announced a 20-year definitive sales and purchase agreement (SPA) for the supply of 2 mtpa from Phase 2 of the 26 mtpa Port Arthur LNG export project in Texas
Author: JS

Title: Vietnam’s PVGas seeks 5-year LNG supply deal via tender
Description: Vietnam's state-owned gas distributor PVGas has issued a short- to mid-term LNG purchase tender for 20.7 million mmBtu per year to be delivered to the 1.1 mtpa Thi Vai terminal starting in 2027. The tender closes on Sep. 24.
Author: JS

Title: Netherlands’ proposed Zeeland Energy Terminal moves to next permitting stage
Description: VTTI and Hoegh Evi have completed the first stage of permitting for the proposed Zeeland Energy Terminal, a floating LNG import facility in the southwestern Netherlands, which, if approved, would become the country's third LNG import terminal.
Author: CK

Title: Golar LNG, Seatrium sign deal to upgrade FLNG Hilli ahead of Argentina deployment
Description: Singapore’s shipyard, Seatrium, has signed a deal with FLNG player Golar LNG to upgrade its Hilli Episeyo floating LNG unit to upgrade its work ahead of its deployment under a 20-year contract in Argentina.
Author: JS

Title: Hanwha announces $5 billion expansion of Philly Shipyard to boost US shipbuilding
Description: South Korea’s Hanwha Group announced today a $5 billion infrastructure plan for Hanwha Philly Shipyard as part of South Korea’s $150 billion investment in the US shipbuilding industry, aimed at expanding production capacity and supporting the construction of LNG carriers in the US.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned LNG tanker carrying Arctic LNG 2 cargo berths at China’s Beihai, poised for first project delivery
Description: The sanctioned 79,800 m3 Arctic Mulan LNG tanker, carrying a cargo from Russia’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant in the Gydan Peninsula, has berthed at the 6 mtpa PipeChina Beihai LNG terminal in Guangxi province, marking what could be the first delivery from the also-sanctioned project since it started LNG loadings on Aug. 1, 2024.
Author: CK

Title: China’s ENN signs second long-term LNG supply deal with Chevron
Description: China’s ENN Energy has signed a second long-term LNG sales and purchase agreement with Chevron for multiple cargoes a year to be delivered over a 10-year period starting in 2028.
Author: CK

Title: Sempra files request to start construction on Phase 2 of Port Arthur LNG
Description: Sempra has asked the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to approve its authorisation to construct (ATC) its Phase 2 of 26 mtpa Port Arthur LNG project.
Author: JS

Title: Technip Energies awarded FEED contract on Abadi LNG
Description: Japan’s Inpex has awarded two front-end engineering and design (FEED) contracts to France’s Technip Energies, in consortium with Japan’s JGC, for the long-delayed 9.5 mtpa Abadi LNG export project in Indonesia’s Masela Block.
Author: JS

Title: Germany’s Wilhelmshaven 2 LNG terminal to start commercial operations tomorrow
Description: Deutsche Energy Terminal will officially commence commercial operations at its second LNG terminal at Germany's Wilhelmshaven port on Aug. 29, roughly  three months after its official launch.
Author: CK

Title: Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG gets regulatory approval to commission its Block 18
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission  has granted Venture Global’s Plaquemines LNG project approval to commission and introduce hazardous fluids to its eighteenth liquefaction block and its Phase 2 pretreatment Train B at its Plaquemines LNG terminal in Louisiana,  signalling progress toward the company’s plan to reach a 27.2 mtpa peak production rate by the end of 2025.
Author: CK

Title: Arctic Mulan discharges Arctic LNG 2 cargo into China’s Beihai LNG
Description: Kpler data shows that the sanctioned Arctic Mulan LNG tanker has unloaded cargo into the China-based 6 mtpa Beihai LNG terminal, marking the first delivery of cargo from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant.
Author: JS

Title: Knutsen Group receives third LNG carrier for QatarEnergy charter
Description: Norwegian shipping firm Knutsen Group has taken delivery of the 174,000 m3 LNG carrier Wadi Al Sail from South Korea’s HD Hyundai Heavy Industries, the third vessel in a 10-ship series being built for long-term charter to QatarEnergy as it expands its global LNG export capacity.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore’s SLNG breaks ground on new truck loading facility at terminal
Description: Terminal operator Singapore LNG Corp. has broken ground on a new truck loading facility at its 11 mtpa terminal on Singapore’s Jurong Island, with this aimed at expanding its LNG distribution capabilities and supporting its energy transition goals.
Author: CK

Title: FERC remands Rio Grande LNG after court ruling
Description: A US federal appeals court has sent the controversial Rio Grande LNG export project in South Texas back to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) after finding flaws in the government’s environmental review.
Author: JS

Title: Russian LNG export reach their lowest in over a year
Description: Russia exported the least LNG this year in August, fuelled by continued lower volumes coming out of its flagship Yamal facility.
Author: JS

Title: Cheniere asks for more time to construct Corpus Christi pipeline
Description: Cheniere has requested the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to extend the deadline to construct the 1.5 billion ft3 per day CCPL pipeline and associated facilities for the Corpus Christi Stage 3 expansion until 2029.
Author: JS

Title: Poland’s Gaz-System weighs second FSRU for Gdansk
Description: Polish gas grid operator Gaz-System has issued a call for interest in deploying a second floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at Gdansk, where it is already developing a floating LNG import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Commonwealth LNG wins final US approval to export to non-FTA countries
