Description: The US Department of Energy has granted Commonwealth LNG final authorization to export LNG to countries without free trade agreements with the US, a step that clears the way for a final investment decision on the company’s proposed 9.5 export terminal in Cameron Parish, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: European LNG imports slide to nine-month low in August
Description: Europe’s LNG imports fell 14% in August to their lowest level since last November, as reduced US and Russian exports combined with maintenance outages across key terminals have extended the region’s five-month run of declining volumes.
Author: JS

Title: Gazprom, CNPC sign strategic cooperation agreement covering Power of Siberia 2 gas pipeline
Description: Gazprom and China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) have signed a Strategic Cooperation Agreement and related documents expanding collaboration between the two companies, Gazprom said in a social media post. The signing ceremony was held in Beijing in the presence of Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping.
Author: CK

Title: Little impact on operations from strike action at Dunkerque LNG
Description: Terminal operator Fluxys said that the strike action at France’s 9.6 mtpa Dunkerque LNG import terminal “currently has no impact” on regasification and ship unloading operations.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG exports hit new monthly record in August as Plaquemines ramps up
Description: US LNG exports surged to a new monthly high in August, propelled by growing output from Venture Global’s Plaquemines terminal as its liquefaction trains continue to ramp up.
Author: CK

Title: India targets 27% boost in LNG import capacity by 2030
Description: India plans to raise its LNG import capacity to 66.7 mtpa by 2030, taking the number of LNG terminals across the country from eight to 10, Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said in a social media post.
Author: CK

Title: Woodfibre LNG reaches 50% completion, start-up expected in 2027
Description: The construction of the 2.1 Woodfibre LNG export facility in Squamish, British Columbia has reached the halfway point to project completion, with the start-up expected in 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Deutsche ReGas inks terminal use agreements with BASF, Equinor
Description: German independent LNG terminal operator Deutsche ReGas has secured long-term terminal use agreements with German chemicals giant BASF and Norway’s energy major Equinor of its 3.8 mtpa Deutsche Ostsee floating LNG import facility in Mukran.
Author: JS

Title: Adriatic LNG to restart full operations in mid-September
Description: The 6.6 mtpa Adriatic LNG import terminal in Rovigo is expected to return to full operations in the middle of September, after shutting down for a month for maintenance.
Author: JS

Title: NextDecade signs 20-year supply deal with EQT for Rio Grande LNG Train 5
Description: US LNG project developer NextDecade has signed a 20-year agreement to supply US natural gas producer EQT Corp. with 1.5 mtpa of LNG from Train 5 of its Rio Grande LNG project in Texas, a deal that lifts contracted volumes for the train to 3.5 mtpa.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt LNG imports hit fresh record high as new FSRUs boost capacity
Description: Egypt’s LNG imports reached a fresh record high in August as new floating regasification capacity boosts its ability to receive cargoes, according to Kpler data.
Author: CK

Title: Early Arctic ice forces Russian LNG shadow fleet to reroute
Description: Earlier-than-expected ice formation along the Northern Sea Route (NSR) is disrupting Russia’s shadow LNG fleet, with non-ice-class tankers forced to turn back as conditions tighten.
Author: JS

Title: South American LNG imports maintain strength in August
Description: Imports of LNG into South America remained strong in August, driven by persistent demand from Brazil.
Author: JS

Title: Arctic LNG 2 could deliver second cargo to China’s Beihai terminal
Description: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project may deliver a second cargo to China, following the first delivery on Aug. 28 to the PipeChina-operated Beihai terminal in Guangxi province.
Author: CK

Title: Novatek confirms start of Arctic LNG 2 exports to China
Description: Novatek has confirmed the launch of LNG exports from its western-sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project, with the first cargo already delivered to China.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Winter FSRU’s startup at Damietta delayed to first-half October
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Winter floating storage and regasification unit, the fourth such vessel to be installed in Egypt, is now expected to start operations at the country’s Damietta LNG terminal in the first half of October, following delays to modification work.
Author: CK

Title: South Korea’s Hyundai Glovis signs LNG bunker supply deal with SK Gas unit
Description:
South Korean logistics and shipping firm Hyundai Glovis has signed an LNG marine fuel supply agreement with Eco Marine Fuel Solution, a subsidiary of SK Gas, aimed at supporting its fleet of low-carbon car carriers operating out of southeastern Korean ports.
\
Author: CK

Title: Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG faces heightened security following threat notification
Description: The Malaysian National Security Council, Majlis Keselamatan Negara (MKN), has ordered the 29.3 mtpa Bintulu LNG terminal in Sarawak to immediately tighten security measures following a notification regarding a potential threat to the country’s LNG facilities in Bintulu.
Author: CK

Title: Monkey Island LNG taps McDermott for LNG project engineering
Description: Monkey Island LNG, formed by privately held US utility and telecom provider Southern California Telephone Co., has signed a master services agreement with McDermott to support front-end engineering and planning for its proposed LNG export facility on Monkey Island in Cameron Parish, Louisiana.
Author: CK

Title: Golden Pass LNG advances commissioning with latest regulatory approvals
Description: The US Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has signed off on two further steps in the commissioning of the 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Sabine Pass, Texas, underscoring steady progress toward the facility’s startup.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project delivers second cargo to China’s Beihai terminal
Description: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project has delivered a second cargo to the PipeChina-operated 6 mtp Beihai terminal in China on the Voskhod LNG tanker, just nine days after the Arctic Mulan discharged the project’s first cargo — nearly a year after exports began with no prior deliveries reaching end-users.
Author: CK

Title: EU legal proposal to eliminate Russian gas aimed to be adopted by year-end
Description: The European Union has put forward a legal proposal to remove Russian gas from its energy system, with adoption targeted by the end of this year, EU Director General for Energy Ditte Jorgensen said at the GasTech conference on Monday in Milan.
Author: CK

Title: EU energy chief urges cooperation, says Europe remains reliable market
Description: Europe is “open for business” and seeking stronger energy partnerships, Ditte Juul Jorgensen, Director-General for Energy at the European Commission, told delegates at Gastech in Milan.
Author: JS

Title: Hungary signs record Shell LNG deal but says Russian gas still unavoidable
Description: Hungary remains unable to walk away from Russian gas even as the European Union pushes to phase out such imports in the next two years and the country signs its largest LNG deal, Foreign Affairs and Trade Minister Peter Szijjarto said at the Gastech conference in Milan today.
Author: CK

Title: Commonwealth LNG signs 1 mtpa offtake deal with EQT,  progresses toward FID this year
Description: Commonwealth LNG has agreed to supply US natural gas producer EQT Corp. with 1 mtpa of LNG from its proposed 9.5 mtpa export project in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, further advancing the project toward a final investment decision targeted for this year.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies to supply 1 mtpa of LNG to Kogas for 10 years
Description: France’s TotalEnergies has signed a heads of agreement (HoA) with South Korea’s Kogas for the supply of 1 mtpa of LNG over 10 years starting from the end of 2027.
Author: JS

Title: Developing Alaska positions US to unlock broader LNG exports to Europe and Asia
Description: The US is positioning Alaska’s LNG resources to serve Asia, which in turn frees up supplies from other US terminals for Europe, as part of a broader strategy to expand American LNG exports, Secretary of the Interior Doug Burgum said at the Gastech conference in Milan today.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade advances towards Rio Grande LNG Train 5 FID with ConocoPhillips offtake deal
Description: US LNG developer NextDecade has signed a 20-year agreement to supply ConocoPhillips with 1 mtpa of LNG from the proposed fifth train at its 27 mtpa Rio Grande LNG project in Brownsville, Texas, completing commercialisation of the train and paving the way for a final investment decision at the end of the year.
Author: CK

Title: TotalEnergies' Pouyanne signals imminent move on Mozambique LNG restart
Description: TotalEnergies Chief Executive Patrick Pouyanne said he expects the company to move “very soon” on the long-delayed 13 mtpa Mozambique LNG project in Afungi, Cabo Delgado.
Author: CK

Title: Hungary’s MVM signs 10-year gas supply deal with Shell
Description: Hungary’s state-owned gas firm MVM has signed a 10-year contract with Shell to import 2 billion m3 of gas annually starting in 2026, in what Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto described as the country’s longest and largest-ever supply deal with a Western partner.
Author: CK

Title: NextDecade takes FID on Train 4 of Rio Grande LNG project
Description: NextDecade has made a positive final investment decision (FID) on Train 4 of Rio Grande LNG, closed financial transactions to fully fund Train 4 and related infrastructure, and issued a full notice to proceed to Bechtel Energy.
Author: JS

Title: NNPC targets Train 7 LNG start-up next year, eyes expansion to Train 8
Description: Nigeria’s state oil company NNPC is preparing to bring its seventh train LNG expansion project online next year while laying the groundwork for further growth.
Author: JS

Title: CPC executive sees Alaska LNG playing key role in supply diversification
Description: The proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project being developed in NIkiski could play an important role in diversifying supplies for Asian buyers seeking secure supplies, Vice President of CPC Taiwan, Jane Liao said during the Gastech conference in Milan today.
Author: CK

Title: Edison to buy 0.7 mtpa of LNG from Shell under a 15-year deal
Description: Italian utility Edison has signed an agreement with Shell International Trading Middle East for the sale and purchase of 0.7 mtpa of LNG for 15 years, commencing in 2028.
Author: JS

Title: US LNG wave and China’s portfolio shift drive flexible flows
Description: Global LNG trade is entering a new era of flexibility, with US exports and emerging portfolio players driving a fundamental reshaping of flows worldwide.
Author: JS

Title: Turkey’s Botas secures LNG deals with BP, Shell, Eni, expands partnerships
Description: Turkey’s state-owned energy company Botas has signed LNG supply agreements totaling 8.7 billion m3 over three years with BP, Shell, and Eni, while also concluding cooperation pacts with PetroChina and Oman LNG, according to Energy Minister Alparslan Bayraktar.
Author: CK

Title: MET Group, Keppel sign initial LNG supply agreement
Description: Swiss-based energy firm MET Group has signed a heads of agreement (HOA) with Singapore-headquartered asset manager Keppel for the long-term supply of 0.5 mtpa of LNG.
Author: JS

Title: Golden Pass to produce first LNG in December, to ship first cargo in early 2026
Description: The 18 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Sabine Pass, Texas will produce the first cargo from the first train in December this year and will export first LNG in late January-early February of 2026, Kpler has heard at Gastech.
Author: JS

Title: PipeChina’s Beihai LNG terminal receives its third Arctic LNG 2 cargo
Description: The PipeChina-operated 6 mtpa Beihai LNG terminal in Guangxi province has received a third cargo from the sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 plant in Russia, carried on board the also-sanctioned 174,000 m3 Zarya LNG tanker.
Author: CK

Title: Glenfarne signs first LNG offtake HOA from Alaska LNG
Description: POSCO International, South Korean steelmaker POSCO’s trading arm, has signed an agreement to advance a strategic partnership for developing the 20 mtpa Alaska LNG export project, for the supply of steel and 1 mtpa of LNG offtake.
Author: JS

Title: Jera signs letter of intent with Glenfarne to explore Alaska LNG offtake
Description: Japan’s Jera has signed a letter of intent with New York-based energy infrastructure developer Glenfarne to explore potential LNG offtake from the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski.
Author: CK

Title: China could take 10–13 cargoes per month from sanctioned Arctic LNG 2: Vitol
Description: China could take between 10 and 13 LNG cargoes a month from Russia’s sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project, a Vitol senior said during a panel at Gastech, highlighting how the world’s biggest energy consumer is reshaping gas trade flows.
Author: JS

Title: Sanctions and tariffs cast long shadow over global LNG market
Description: European sanctions on Russia’s Arctic LNG 2 project and new US tariff policies are set to reshape global LNG trade and investment, delegates at Gastech heard today.
Author: JS

Title: YPF expects FIDs in first-quarter 2026 on Argentina LNG projects involving Shell and Eni
Description: Argentina’s state-owned YPF expects final investment decisions in the first-quarter of 2026 on two LNG export projects with Shell and Eni, part of its multi-phase Argentina LNG project to build around 30 mtpa of export capacity from Vaca Muerta shale gas.
Author: CK

Title: Woodside secures final government approval for North West Shelf project extension
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has secured the final environmental approval from the Australian government for its North West Shelf project extension, allowing the facility that includes the country’s oldest and largest LNG export facility to continue operations.
Author: CK

Title: Global LNG bunkering volumes hit new high in August on Asian rebound
Description: Global LNG bunkering volumes surged to a fresh high in August as a sharp rebound in Asia and steady gains in the Americas offset flat activity in Europe.
Author: CK

Title: Singapore's LNG bunker sales rebound sharply in August after July slump
Description: LNG bunker sales in Singapore rebounded in August following a seasonal decline in July, reflecting growing demand across Asia’s LNG bunkering markets.
Author: CK

Title: Egypt signs upstream deals to boost gas output amid rising LNG imports
Description: Egypt’s Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources is pushing to attract global partners to boost oil and gas exploration, with three upstream agreements signed between the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp. and several major international upstream companies recently. The deals involve $121.5 million in planned investments, plus $30.5 million in signing bonuses.
Author: CK

Title: Eni’s Nguya FLNG en-route from China for Congo LNG Phase 2; seen arriving end-Nov
Description: The 180,000m3 Nguya floating LNG vessel, built at China-based Wison New Energies’ shipyard in Jiangsu province, is en route to the Republic of Congo for installation in the Marine XII concession near Pointe Noire, where it will launch the second phase of Eni’s Congo FLNG project.
Author: CK

Title: Energos Winter FSRU to arrive at Damietta by end-September, first cargo scheduled
Description: The 138,000 m3 Energos Winter floating storage regasification unit is expected to depart from the Besiktas Shipyard in Turkey in the coming days and arrive before the end of the month at Egypt’s Damietta port, where it will be installed as the country’s fourth FSRU.
Author: CK

Title: Brunsbuttel LNG’s FSRU to undergo maintenance until mid-November
Description: The Hoegh Gannet floating storage regasification unit (FSRU), which serves the 5.7 mtpa Brunsbuttel LNG terminal in Germany, is to set sail for a Danish shipyard to undergo modifications, stopping regasification activities until mid-November.
Author: JS

Title: Sinopec conducts first LNG ship-to-ship bunkering in Singapore waters
Description: China’s state-owned Sinopec successfully completed its first LNG bunkering operation in Singapore on Sept. 11-12.
Author: CK

Title: Pakistan requests deferral of 177 LNG cargoes from Qatar
Description: The Pakistan government has requested a deferral of as many as 177 cargoes under its long-term sales and purchase agreements with QatarEnergy due to diminishing gas demand.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside advances Louisiana LNG project; first cargo targeted for 2029
Description: Australian independent Woodside Energy has made construction progress at its $17.5 billion Louisiana LNG project in southwest Louisiana in the US, with work on the first of three liquefaction trains now more than 22% complete.
Author: CK
